But don't get stressed out, just take your time and swarm out to another room if it gets too crowded.
Huge place . Huge place, you need 5 days to finish it. Spent 5 hours and i felt that I didn't see anything. Advice take a picture from outside and continue your way

Hermitage. Too much art to fully digest and comprehend. When You walk through room after room of art You really get a historical context of St. Petersburg. There has always been a hi society in existence in Russia and the Hermitage is a place to bask in it's history.

Tips for Visitors. The combination of cultural treasures and the old palace that houses them truly makes the State Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace one of the great wonders of the visual arts world. Having been twice as a visitor with only a few days each time in St. Petersburg, I have four recommendations for visitors who are only in St. Petersburg for a short period. First, do not miss this exceptional historic venue. Second, preview the venue website with care to select the rooms or collections you most wish to visit in the time available to you. You will not see everything in one visit so choose selectively. It is better to see less well and with understanding, than to risk the experience becoming a blur. Third, don't turn your visit into a marathon. You will be faced with the temptation to try to see as much as possible during your visit but walking, standing, and craning to study works above your head can be physically tiring regardless of your age and hamper your enjoyment of the experience. Prevent fatigue by planning and taking short breaks to sit down, reflect on what you have seen, and/ or visit the café. Fourth, research options for early admission or days and times when the museum is likely to be less crowded during your visit to St. Petersburg. There may be an additional charge, but it will be worth it to avoid the scrum of peak times.

the Hermitage in St Petersburg. The Hermitage is magnificent. Exquisite art presented in a palace where the rooms themselves are unbelievably beautiful. The aura is different from normal museums where art may be simply displayed on unadorned walls. The Hermitage makes you feel like you're visiting the Czars home and also seeing his incredible collections displayed in various place rooms. It's enormous and overwhelming. Highly recommended...not to be missed if you're in St Petersburg
Must to see. One of the best art museums with astonishing interiors. Book at least thee hours for visiting the museum. Free admission for students.

WOW!. The most amazing museum and display of art, artifacts, gold and the wealth of the aristocracy in old Russia.This, despite the large crowds and the constant threat of pickpockets, is one 3 must see and must experience attractions in St Petersburg.This museum is impossible to see all in one visit or even in 10. So, pick your favourites and plan out what you want to do. There is something here for everyone.

Good for art lover . I saw it as a regullar place not a must see. Better to take picture from outside as it is one of the most famouse musems in SPB. for people who appreciate art and painting they will love it

Spectacular !!!!!. Spectacular is not a large enough word to express this fantastic place. We had a morning to tour here and that was clearly not enough. It's wonderful to see art displayed nicely, and certainly it was done that way here. What enhanced the experience is that the building itself is an art form - spectacular even without the art. This building was the former Winter Palace and it's 1 of 4 buildings. Plan on a couple of days to actually see everything.

So much to see just incredible. With more than 3 million pieces it is one of the best Museums in the world. Beautiful rooms reflecting the splendor of the Tzars. Incredible Art collection. Worth spending an entire day if possible.

Outstanding IN Every Way. Plan to spend at least a day in the museum; two if you have the time.The Hermitage is ranked number one or two in the world and has no equal outside of Europe.The Egyptian section is particularity good with artifacts that would rival those in Egypt.

One day is not enough. Very very big museum with a lot of things to see. Bring enough time, because I think one day is not enough to see it all!Dislikes: non-russian citizens pay more for the entrance than russian citizens. Did a guided tour with in russian and the tour guide spoke very very quietly, so you couldn't barely understand and was quite snobby when asked about exhibits.Likes: very big museum with lots of cool stuff to see. Free wifi museum-wide, so if you need to look up something or just want to take a break online, you can use it everywhere.

Just Fabulous. What can you say about this most fabulous building and its content? The building itself is a masterpiece. Fortunately we got in early before the hoards and were able to view most of the well-known pieces, including some small Da Vinci paintings. The internal rooms themselves are also masterpieces. A must to visit if you are visiting St Petersburg.

I could spend a day in here . Adults 600. For winter palace and heritage museum. Audio and English guide available but you are able to tour on ur own. Massive place u will need to look at the map to cover all areas. Before you enter, there is a complimentary locker on the ticket floor near the cloakrooms. Bags bottles and jackets weren't allowed in (they are stricter with tourist) Enjoy the tour! You will need at least 2.5-3hrs in there.
Stunning!. Absolutely stunning!!! Wouldn't call myself the biggest fan of museums but this place was something! So beautiful and so impressive with all the biggest names and masters of all time!

Awesome Historical Site. The Winter Palace. This is a must-do in St Petersburg. Plan a whole day or several. If you are a history buff, you simply can't spend only a couple of hours. Seeing original Rembrandts and DaVincis was simply inspiring.
Absolutely A Must See. Real simple. It's the Hermitage in St Petersburg. Amazing architecture. Amazing Art. Amazing museum. Buy tickets online. Plan on spending lots of time.

wow!. absolutely awesome place to visit,so much to see.make sure your guide books your tickets before hand so you can use the back entrance (much quicker than queueing to buy tickets!)and allow plenty time as the place is massive and extrememly busy!

Great museum, but it could have been kept up better. The Hermitage is definitely worth going and probably one of the key reasons to visit the Saint Petersburg. If you are not traveling in a group, my advice is that you purchase your tickets online. This way you will have your own "VIP" entrance and you get to skip the line in the morning.Rooms and exhibits are really magnificent. There is so much to see. The only thing that bothered me was that they have not kept the place up very well and everywhere one looks there is some kind of weird air conditioning unit, electric work or souvenir stand. The experience does not match some of the other great museums of the world. Moreover, they have not put effort to add english language titles and texts on the exhibits. Despite some of the shortcomings, I would still recommend visiting the site and I would go back if I will had a chance.
Not as bad as the Lourve. Some museums are spoiled by their own success. If you want huge, noisy, hot, sweaty crowds that really have no interest in art, then maybe go to a football match instead.

Beautiful building and very crowded. There is always a huge line up here in the mornings. There are two entrances - one for tour groups and one for individuals. The building itself is beautiful. They allow photos without flash. You will have to pass security prior to entering. Best to go with a tour group as they can show you the highlights, i.e. Rembrant, Pavo clock (my favourite), Michelangeo, etc. The other option is to go on their website and see what artwork you would like to see. There is a section called "highlights". Please be aware that not all the artwork is housed in the main area. The impressionists are in a different building and requires an additional admission fee.We spent a little over an hour there, but I think it was enough. Too much stuff to see and a bit overcrowded for me. We thought about going back on our own, but never got around to it. I think at the end of the trip, we were getting a bit tired.

Awesome place. . We had a personal guide to take us round this amazing venue. It is a very busy place and is HUGE!!! It is a beautiful building both inside and out and filled with wonderful artifacts. We spent a couple of hours there although we could have done more. I would be happy to go back. Our guide, Alina, was extremely knowledgeable and entertaining. Definitely recommend a visit when you visit the city. A must see!!!

One of the world's greatest museums. The State Hermitage Museum was founded by Catherine the Great in 1764. The collection is incredible. There are some "must see" pieces by Leonardo Da Vinci, Michelangelo, Raphael, Rembrandt...to name a few. We enjoyed viewing the gold peacock clock and the "Reception of the French Ambassador in Venice" by the Venetian painter Canaletto (1697 - 1768). Due to the perspectives, the painting makes you feel the buildings/objectives are different in sizes when viewing from different angles. It was amusing and we had great fun viewing it.

Stunned by their bloody marvellous collection. You could easily spend an entire day at this place. Opt and purchase only for the State Hermitage Museum and the Winter Palace. The tickets to other museums are not valid on the next day.
Their collection is absolutely stunning and you could easily get lost in it.

Look Up! . Many people come here for the art but really, you can view the art in hermitage books. You'll hardly scratch the surface if your goal is to view as much as possible. So relax and enjoy being here. The best part is the hermitage itself, a historical museum in itself. Look up at the texture and the ceilings. No book or photo can recreate the 3 dimensional work. No matter what side you are on regarding the take down of the Romanov's by equally greedy but murderous unforgiving thugs, you can't argue against the fact that the tastes of kings and queens have given us grand sites to visit that sit beyond the ordinary imagination. This site shows what is possible for artists and makers. This site will expand and stretch you further beyond the limits of your imagination. It's truly an inspiration.

Mesmerizing. Walking through this huge palace/museum on my own, unraveling parts of St. Petersburg's history, was such a treat... it's beautiful, and it took me 3 hours to get a sense that I saw a lot. I don't think I managed to see everything. They number the rooms, so you can figure out if you saw each of them, but there is just so much to see. Stunning, there are definitely a few rooms that will blow you away. Don't be rushed by anyone through this museum, go alone if you can or anyone who can tolerate you slowing down to enjoy the culture. Highly recommended!

The Biggest Museum in St. Petersburg. Said to have over 4 million items on display, this is not a museum you can see in one day. You can, however, spend a few hours after which you will be enthralled and wishing you had more time. Nothing here has been overlooked or randomly placed. While every room is incredible, the one thing that stands out is the sour expression on the faces of everyone you encounter in the museum. This is a "Do Not Miss" attraction in St. Petersburg.
A Must See. As great as the collection is, the building itself is a work of art and must be seen. We could have spent days there rather than the short 3-4 hours we had.

An unforgettable experience and i now understand the Bolsheviks. An unforgettable experience and i now understand the Bolsheviks The wealth the Romanovs & predecessors had accumulated is beyond belief. It make Versailles look poverty stricken.

There is so much to see. You need to be in St Petersburg for a year to see half of the wonderful exhibits. The General Staff building is outstanding and the collection of impressionists is overwhelming. The architecture of this building is exciting. Spend at least at day there!

Stolen. Terrible experience. Left my backpack in the coatroom because you are obligated to do so, and one of the workers stole my camera and my iPad from it. After talking to the staff, none of them helped me at all. As from the museum, place is way to crowed and not youth all the time and energy you have to spend to walk all of it DO NOT TRUST THE COATROOM WORKERS

Large and extravangant museum. Upon arrival to the site there is always a line for the ticket booth which is inside the museum. Note that if you have applied for ISIC student card, just show it and you get a free ticket entry. Lots of paintings and artwork spread out over a large area inside. Many tour groups and people too. Must see in saint Petersburg.

Lots of paintings!. I didn't really know what I was getting into! This place is filled with room after room of paintings. I'd had quite enough after about 93 minutes but my traveling companion informed me that the average visit is about 280 minutes. I am not sure if this is true but it offers some perspective. It is a very impressive site and there is a lot to see and a lot to learn. The English explanations are useful and clear. The architecture is very impressive. It is ornate and I was fascinated by the gold halls. It is probably unavoidable but there were throngs of tourists. Maybe try to go at a less popular time as it is open till pretty late in the evening. The other advice I can offer is to buy your ticket from a machine (on your left and right as you enter the gates to Palace Square) rather than waiting in the long line.

Almost Overwhelming but a Must See. After getting in through the crowds this place is big enough that there are quiet bits. Its difficult to work out where you are without a guide but there is plenty to see everywhere. Of course it's huge and after three hours we had managed perhaps a quarter of it but lad we did.

A feast of the eyes. Amazing museum. We were part of a tour and you need it for this place or prepare to queue for a real long time. We went straight through the group entrance and could see the individual visitors long queues.Prepare to spend some time to take in some of the marvels. If you intend to see all the pieces of art, than relocate to St Petersburgh, as it will take you a life time.

A treasure trove - allow several days if you are interested in art and history. Magnificent collection of treasures. Take the time to plan your visit - the Winter Palace is essential, the Romanov apartments divine, and more art that you can imagine.

Very Large Budget time. The collections here were amazing and lovely. The rooms were decorated lavishly. This museum is large and includes multiple buildings with original artwork by famous individuals. Read ahead of time to know your priorities. We had a Russian guide who led us through the most notable parts in about 1.5 hours. Limited benches. Some groups ahead of us that occasionally required a short wait, but mostly was well-timed so we kept moving.
Best museum ever seen. It's hard to visit whole at a day in detaile. There are two Leonardo da vinci's paintings. I wish i could vist there with local guide.

Gorgeous but huge. We all enjoyed this museum. It's almost impossible to see it all, especially during the busy months. But go anyway. It's really breathtaking, and the history here is amazing. It's a lot of walking though, so be prepared.

Huge and impressive. Everything is impressive at this museum: the entrance (the huge square), the building and the amount of people who visit . Not to mention the quantitie of art pieces on display.It is impossible to visit all the museum so it is best to plan what you want to see or just " go with the flow ."

Second rate Euro trash!. Go to the Yusupov Palace instead to see a true gem, though you'll give up boasting rights with the neighbors when you can't tell them you've been to the Winter Palace. It's large, ornate, and overdecorated with the worst excesses of baroque and rococo and faux classicism. The collection of art, with the exception of a Gainsborough or three, is second rate Euro trash. The collection of Greek, Egyptian and Roman sculpture rates the same and is easily overshadowed by what you can see at the Vatican, the Louvre and the Kremlin. However, the collection of ancient artifacts from Central Asia and Siberia is definitely worth seeing, though this section seems to have few visitors and is not easy to find. Go see the Winter Palace because everyone does, but save time for the Yusupov Palace - that is truly unique and world class. The Romanovs were not as wealthy as those folk and it shows!
Good to visit. Lots to see inside, just about all of the exhibits are very impressive, far too much to see in an hour or so, could do with more than a day

Hermitage....well worth the crowds. We had a private tour, just the two of us and an english speaking guide. Saw so many amazing paintings and sculptures, you honestly cannot skip seeing the hermitage....amazing!!

Not bad. Again, gor thouse hwho like histrionic places and some glamorous decorated rooms and articles this is a place to see.....its massive and yes...the way to get there is also fun...planty to see
Recommend for everyone

Words and photos can't describe the beauty of this place. This is most definitely the best attraction in Saint Petersburg. The museum is HUGE, so do follow the map religiously to make sure that you cover everything. Also, make sure that you have sufficient time in hand if you are visiting

Unbelieveably Large and Beautiful Museum. The Hermitage is not only a "must see" in Saint Petersburg but one of the top museums in the world. We had the advantage of having an excellent tour guide with a small 14 person group. SPB was given early access to the Hermitage so that we were able to walk through a good portion of the massive museum before the throngs arrived. The museum has many Renaissance masterpieces within its 5 building complex. The interior is opulent and changes with each building. This has to be high on your list.

Worth the wait.. Need to limit your visit to a few painitngs or sculpture or period, otherwise suffer cultural overlaos. Perhaps better to skim visit and then return for a longer visit. Try to remember a favourite painting.

Must Do Attraction. We took a 3 hour guided tour and were so pleased we did, we would have got lost and not had the insight into what we were seeing. It is simply stunning, The building, the rooms, the art. WOW

Blown away by all the masterpieces. I got myself a guide with Free St Peterburgs Tour company, for 1900 Rubles the tour includes a 2.5 hour guided walk around the museum and the entrance ticket is included.I was blown away by the masterpieces from Da Vinci, Rembrandt, Van Dyke, Rubens, Rafael and many more.I strongly recommend getting a guide, to get better understanding of the artworks and the history of the museum/palace itself.

One of the great museums of the world. With its Vermeer, two Leonardo DaVinicis and comprehensive collection of other European masters, this is a reason in itself to visit Russia. The palaces in the complex have been lovingly restored and the facility itself is the equal or superior to any museum I have seen in the world. This is a must see museum that could consume weeks if you wanted to and look closely at even the most important of its three million exhibits.

Excellent but crowded. Not much you can say about the Hermatige but wow!But as with any of these very popular places the crowds are huge and queues are long. You need all day, so wear comfortable shoes!!
Stunning. Stunning architecture and interiors are well worth the visit alone. The collections of paintings and furniture etc are too numerous to mention. Definitely lives up to its reputation.
Huge cultural monument.... It is enormous!!!!Very frustrated, as we could not see even half of the exhibitions...Recommend to focus on what you like in advance...

Amazing but actually not the best place to view art. Always wanted to go to the Hermitage. Now I have been and probably will not bother going again. The palace rooms are astonishing and worth the visit. The art is also amazing but if you are from, near, or travel to, any major US art museum, or those in the major EU nations, you can see the same artists in much better environments. Paintings were poorly hung, little thought put into what would be interesting to see next to what, lighting just awful. Plus no anti-glare glass so it was often hard to see things without standing at several different angles. The General Staff building, which contains the major Impressionist works as well as the contemporary exhibits, has recently been completely and astonishingly renovated but is half empty and the works that are displayed mostly suffered from the same issues as those noted in the Winter Palace. The contemporary works were thoughtfully curated and displayed however. On the plus side the cafe food seems to have improved, none looked "dire," as reported in the Lonely Planet guide. However crowds would make the whole thing intolerable. We were there end of the summer season so were ok. And BTW, they only wind the peacock clock once a month so unless you are really lucky you can view the thing (it is pretty amazing) and a video of its antics but probably won't get to see it in action.

Not as great as I ecpected. I had always heard that the Hermitage was one of the great museums of the world. While its collection is vast (24 miles of exhibition space) we were somewhat disappointed. They have 2 Leonardos and several Rembrandts which were worth seeing but the collection of impressionists and post impressionists were second rate at best. The collections in the Met and MOMA are much better in our opinion Still well worth the visit but maybe not a special trip to St P if that's themain attraction for you.

Do a private guided tour, but unmissable. The scale, opulence and diversity of the collection makes the Hermitage one of the greatest palaces of art in the world. Reminded me of the Vatican. Not only amazing art, but in an incredible and truly historic architectural wonder. The palace alone without the art would still be amazing, as would the art collection without the palace - but together it makes the Hermitage truly amazing . We hired a guide (my father was in a wheel chair and had kids in tow ), and would strongly recommend a private guide in any event. The crowds and tour groups in summer are overwhelming, but with a private guide we managed to see all the highlights and skip queues. Went with two children ages 4 and 9, and they enjoyed it. Want to go back in the winter, when I hear that you have the place almost to yourself compared with the summer hordes. But given how amazing this place is, it is a must see and I cannot blame the Hermitage for being so busy.

Unbelievable !. Unless you have weeks to stay and see this museum you must have a guided tour. The tour gets you in without waiting on the hours long entry line and will take you through the highlights. There is so much to see and one thing is more incredible or beautiful than the the last. The guide said if you spent 3 seconds on each item it would take 11 years to get through. It obviously is a must see

Hermitage Museum St. Petersburg. Beautiful museum - took private tour off of cruise ship. Tour company was "Red October". The museum is big enough that you should count on at least a few hours for walkthrough.

The Hermitage is a must see when visiting St. Petersburg. The winter palace is an amazing display of the opulence of the Russian Empire. The variety of art collection of the Hermitage is also mind boggling. The are so many masterpieces representing numerous masters. One would need several days (years?) to do the collection justice. We did not have time to see the work of impressionists which are housed in a separate building of the Hermitage.

Hermitage & winter garden is a must see. The collection is outstanding as is the building itself & I could have stayed for days. This beats many of the large museums/ galleries around the world. A must see in St Petersburg

Excellent Museum. We highly recommend buying tickets online before you travel. The lines with tourists from other countries was quite long. Excellent place to visit or have a tour. Also, see the Impressionist section they have (another building). I recommend at least a 2 day pass.

Amazing. The highlight for me was the winter palace. Just truly amazing. The art collections in the other Hermitage buildings were interesting, but the opulence of the winter palace was just overwhelming.

It's impossible to describe. Got about 3 months? That's how much time you could spend in the Hermitage Museum and still not see everything. Depending on your interests in this type of museum, allow at least a couple of hours . . . but you may spend the entire day and go back for more the next day!

Treasures beyond measure. One of the world's most magnificent palaces. Into which has been stuffed one of the world's most prized and comprehensive collections of art and antiquities. A combination that makes the Hermitage an experience without compare in the Western world.But you probably already knew that. So my first suggestion would be to find a way to visit in the absolute nadir of tourist season. Failing that my suggestion would be to focus on experiencing the jaw-droppingly beautiful galleries and on seeing the 26th-100th most impressive objects therein - objects which most museums would be thrilled to have on display. Because the reality of the Hermitage in Summer is that you won't really be able to see and enjoy the most popular sights - instead you'll see and be part of 25 scrums surrounded by multiple tour guides all trying to talk over each other.At least that was our experience. As a cruise ship visitor to Russia we were allowed to travel 'visa-free' so long as we had a tour guide - even a 'private' tour guide would do. But (to channel Yakov Smirnoff for a moment), in Russia 'Tour take You' and our guide's insistence on taking us on a tour of the 25 largest crowds in the Hermitage was not to be diverted nor denied.

FAST APPROACHING MY 100 VISIT. You must specify what you want to see because there is so much. In the Winter Palace you should see what Catherine the Great copied from the Vatican, like the mosaic floor and also the Peacock clock. If you are a student of Russian History try to see the White Dining Room and also the Tsarist private quarters like the library of Nicholas 11. Its not usually on the circuit so you will need to askIf you a fan of Renaissance and pre Renaissance art you will want to see the Fillippo Lippi's, the Leonardo's, the Rapael's, and the Michaelangelo's sculpture. Its also worth remembering that that the Hermitage has special exhibitions and the HIdden Treasures is certainly worth a visit...paintings confiscated from the Nazis.Please be aware that the French Impressionist Exhibition is now in a seperate building and incurrs an additional fee

Wonderful place. I visited in September so there was no problems with crowds. The architecture, ornaments and exhibits are amazing. I have seen many photographs and a film about Hermitage but being there is a very special experience.I also liked the way modern architecture is combined with the old in the New Hermitage.Truly special experience.

A beautiful day at the Hermitage.. We had a private guide . Which I feel is the only way to visit the Hermitage.one can ask questions and it is much easier to get to all the rooms as the guide can get you in before the big groups.The opulence is amazing and I have never seen so much beauty in one place. You need at least 3 hours to visit .Not to be missed.

Evening at the hermitage. If you are a theully art lover this fasinating 3 hrs tour will change the hold concept of viewing art as the palace is completely empty just the selective group of people your are with will have the opportunity to walk through this marvelous gallery in the evening skipping hundreds of people during the day time highly recommend

The Hermitage is without Peer. This museum has over 3 million paintings and is amazing. We had an exceptional guide from Dancing Bear that we had informed earlier what we wanted to see. She made it all happen beautifully!

Great museum that rivals any. The vast and varied collections at the Hermitage was incredible. I am not a big museum go-er, but have to say that I was very impressed with the beautiful collections on display here. Rarely will you hear me say "I wish I had more time in a museum" but this was the case here and I was disappointed I couldn't stay longer!
Superb but very busy . A must visit, but be prepared for queues, worth the wait. Fantastic place. Go without a coat to save queuing again to put your coat in the clock room,long long queues

Simply Beautiful. The palace itself is simply gorgeous, as soon as you get inside, you are immediately astonished by the beautiful staircase which leads you on the first floor. The staircase is surrounded by amazing stucco covered of gold and the huge windows and shining chandeliers contribute to enhance its beauty. The complex is really big and you spend your time passing through beautiful rooms rich of any kind of art collection, like paints, porcelains, vases, marbles, clocks, tapestries, busts and ancient artifacts. Everything is very well preserved but unfortunately, unless you get an audio guide, most the explanation panel displayed inside the room are reserved to Russian speaking people.

Gold glitter and paintings galore. Huge rooms and grounds exquisite in the detail, and just masses of gold, antiques and paintings. Honestly just an overload of opulence, but mind boggling gorgeous. Huge displays of historical and jewels from both early Russia and the Tsars.

overwhelmng,. An amazing collection of art I would have liked to spend so much more time there than I did if .......I had had more time.This is not a place to take lightly, the collections are fine, diverse and extensive..The location great, crowds a little pushy at times,taking a photo and on to the next ...Well worth a day or two.
Magnificent place.. The Palace. Really historical place. Must see. Sometimes overcrowded. You can't see all collections in one day.
Nothing compares. Quite possibly the greatest museum in the world, a must for anyone visiting Russia, the place is grand, beautiful and impressive. The exhibits come from every corner of the globe

Amazing Hermitage! . I'm always enthusiastic to go to the Hermitage museum. I show my guests 'my Hermitage' and they are delighted with such incredible beauty. This time it happened again with my friend from Almaty. Plus we were lucky to see the exhibition of Vyacheslav Zaitsev's collections of the recent Haute Couture and the Erte exhibition - the drawings of the art-deco genius Roman Tyrtov. Sincerely advise to all people.

Better than the Louvre. And I've been to the Louvre several times. The artwork in the Hermitage is simply better selected. Picasso's works and the Queen's clock (I don't remember her name) are two things you should definitely go see.

Beautiful and stunning facade . Being a ridiculously huge place to cover in a few days trip, we drove and walked around the main buildings of the Hermitage. And I must say it's a ginormous bunch of buildings with beautiful architecture !! A must visit when in the city!

Bling extraordinaire!. You cannot prepare for the feast of the senses that the Hermitage delivers. It is big enough to make believe the crowds are not quite as many as there are; the palace interiors are breath-taking andin the art there is something for everyone. Don't miss the French Impressionists and Post impressionists now in a separate modern, calm building - rooms of Matisse, Picasso, Cezanne - and more besides.

GOLD MUSEUM. Be sure to see this wonderful section of the museum. You need to book and pay a fee, but the displays of gold are breath-taking. Magnificent jewellery and artifacts from tombs, including impossibly delicate chandelier ear-rings and filigree necklaces, gold sculptures and also some elaborate daggers.We have now been twice, and loved it. the highlight of our visits to Russia.

Visiting St Petersburg . The Hermitage state museum is one of the treasures of art. It is full with paintings, sculptures and others interesting things. It is located next to many other interesting things to see.If you are looking for classic or modern art, then you need to visit the hermitage state museum.

Excellent museum . We have been in a lot of museum in the world , But this impressed us more than another's.Also architecture and interiors are amazing, and it is not enough one day to visit all rooms. One problem - Very long line for entry. We spent almost 2 hours
Nice place. One of the best historical palace in Saint Petersburg with great historical memories. A nice place to visit with family. .

Awesome Museum!. I loved visiting the Hermitage Museum and you can stay there for a day and still not see all the beautiful rooms, paintings, statues, works of art and all the other valuable collections the museum houses.
Definitely a most see museum when in St Peterburg.

Wonderful!!!. Since you enter, beginning with the stairs continuing with the winter palace and ending tired but spiritually rich everything is fantastic. An epoch of glory which continue to shine with the same splendor.

The most important thing of Saint Petersburg!!!!. I think is the most impressive museum I've ever visited since now...All in it is opulent, impressive, big and nice. I think this museum contains the most impressive collection of paintings of the western art because it navigates since the early beguinings til just some years ago, and not just because the period treated, but also the amounts of pieces: impresionists, rembrandts, picassos, roman sculpture,well, it's the must-see place of Saint Peterburg, specially impresissive is the Ancient Ministeries Museum, where is placed now the impressionist museum...There are no words. The only problem the crowds....I think theu have too many passengers coming from the cruiseships, they should organise them in another way. It's not normal that hundreds and hundreds of people enter in a museum in just 5 minutes...

A must-see, plan wisely to avoid long queues. This is a fantastic place for photos so on our first evening we took lots from outside, we checked the opening times also as we were trying to work out the best time to go without queuing for ages. It's closed Mondays and opened from 10.30am until 6pm most days but 9pm Wednesdays and Fridays. So we decided to go later on a Wednesday evening. We hadn't booked online but we were given advice that if you go to the General Staff Building which is across the square and part of the Hermitage but for the more modern exhibitions you can buy RUB 600 combined ticket with the main museum complex saving you time buying tickets and those queues are long in the main building. There were no queues there and the Modern exhibitions - it's not just Modern Art were great, I actually preferred it to the main building as it's a much more relaxed space. Give yourself over 1.5 -2 hours for the modern building, we then went across the square and avoided the long queues waiting to buy their tickets and went straight inside. Inside you have to put any bags in a locker or you'll be stopped at security and advised to go there, so there are two lockers area - a big and a small area. The small area seemed less busy, but the lockers fill up quickly. No video was permitted. The palace is indeed opulent and there is so much to see so do give yourself enough time - 2 hours at the very least. They also sell postcards and stamps in the museum which after my trek around the city to find stamps would have been good to know beforehand. The stories of the cats is worth finding out about, we heard it before we went from our city guide. As the weather can be very changeable it's a great rainy day activity.

Huge, grant, beautiful, speechless, museum. To visit Hermitage Palace, it is better to have good rest night before and storage your bags or heavily belongs in lockers available inside the entrance. Do read the history, details and collections of Hermitage before hands via on-line information to select some must items to visit. Otherwise, it wastes too much time to search or stray inside such a huge building to find the pieces. It is not advice to rent the mobile guide system, not because of charges, but it takes too much time to find or listen the details of each art pieces. It is useful and worth to rent if you have done some researches on which selected art pieces or fix the routine you plan to visit!
Hermitage and Gold Room a must see. We nearly didn't visit the Hermitage but so glad we changed our minds. It's a must-see when visiting St Petersburg.

Stunning collection of Treasures beyond imagination.. Try to visit with a private guide to avoid queuing. As the most popular tourist attraction in the City the crowds are often oppressive especially to see the Da Vinci paintings. The new gallery in the staff building houses a fine collection which are better presented than Muse D'orsay with large rooms with well spaced out paintings. The architecture is stunning.

A crush of humanity. Clearly one of the worlds greatest museums. My favorite experience is the winter palace itself. That alone is worth the trip and so very memorable. Be sure to use the voice guided tour. We were able to see the Italian, Spanish, Dutch, Egyptian and Hellenic sections. Never found the French, English, Russian or others. You need to plan two days. We went the second week of September. Our appointment was at noon, and it seemed to be peak time. We could barely walk as there were so many people. One member of our group was separated and pushed and shoved off course, she never made it back to the group. She met up later in the evening. Saying this, plan to get an early am appointment or late afternoon appointment as the crowd thins significantly around 3 pm. Some days they are open until 21:00. Research ahead. Enjoy.

Fantastic. Overall all the places I visited with friend in Moscow, River Cruise & St Petersburg were amazingly just so wonderful historic grand beautiful arts icons other things rives including etc & buy tickets in advance saves queuing up especially at busier times & the food was so tasty that we ate.
Amazing . Best place to visit in the city. I wish I had more then 2 hours there. I'd suggest 4 hours. If not more. Everything was amazing.

My favourite!. The Hermitage/Winter palace is my favourite site in St Petersburg. We walked past the palace several times and each time I stopped and took a picture. The inside is very beautiful too. It's free for students. I really enjoyed the state rooms and the Jorden staircase. It was very busy when we arrive at around 2pm.

Fabulous museum. I think everything has already been said in previous reviews. Great museum.We really liked the Siberian display which is a unique experience.We booked online and went into the special entrance to the side of the winter palace at opening time. This was a good decision and much quicker.Did the gold and diamond treasury tours and these were very interesting. The gold tour has more of an archaeological feel. The 4 th century bc micro gold jewellery was unbelievable.If you do these tours find out where the meeting points are before hand as it wasn't marked on the mark on the map.Cafe's had limited food range but what there was was ok.Also went to the general staff building to see the impressionist paintings. Unfortunately some of the iconic works were not there, apparently going to France for an exhibition. But still worth seeing.
Go there on Wednesday. Longer hours, less crowd, roam around til close. So much to see! Don't miss the Golden Peacock 7 pm performance.

How beautiful can life be!. It will take you a whole day, maybe two to see everything. Take your time. Enjoy the palace and all the art. Its so so beautiful. Must be part of your visit to St Petersburg.
Tourism . An excellent day at the State Hermitage, The palace was awesome . A tip to visiting tourists - save time and buy tickets from the machines at the side and save time standing in queues!
Sumptuous. It is a beautiful building and I wish that some of the Olympic money had been spent on upkeep and preservation.

One of the finest museums in the world .... This museum was one of the main reasons I visited Russia and St-Petersburg. And it delivered all the way. Marvelous and almost endless rooms filled with some of the greatest art in the world. Pity I could not spend more time here, even a whole week would not have been boring.

More time needed!. If you are an art lover, this is the place for you. Thousands upon thousands of beautiful and classic works of art from all over the world. Hermitage continues to expand as well so we can't wait to go back and see what other rooms and exhibits they open. Some rooms are classified based on the specific centuries or types of art and some are dedicated to specific painters or artists so choose as you will.

Excellent hotel. We stayed for 5 nights and used it as a base to explore the city. 10 mins walk from nearest metro stations and only 500 roubles in a cab to Palace Square area. The rooms are elegantly furnished, a good size, and very comfortable. Every amenity you are likely to need are supplied in the hitech rooms and free wifi throughout. The staff are exceptionally helpful and the restaurants of good quality, if a little quiet when we ate in them. Would not hesitate to stay here again.
Fabulous. Be prepared for huge crowds. Pushing and shoving seems to be the order of the day for many people. Great shame as it does take away from a marvellous experience.

Incredible museum. Two to three hours to see the highlights, but weeks to fully see it. It has all the greats from all periods. Try to book a tour which allows you to enter before the masses of people. If you like art, this is over the top!

Amazing Museum, Amazing Crowds. Truly one of the worlds top museums, both for its art collection and for the palace itself. Buy your ticket ahead of time -- the lines and crowds are unbelievable on an August weekend.

One of the highlights of St. Petersburg. This is obviously one of the must-sees in St. Petersburg. There's no need to describe it, as this has been done in many other reviews - so I'll just write about one or two practical things: First of all, the museum is astonishingly cheap to visit, if compared to some other attractions in town. You can choose between the full ticket (600 rubles) and individual buildings (300 rubles). I went for the former, but in my opinion, you really only need to see the Winter Palace, which houses most of the impressive rooms of the museum and the main pieces of art. Obviously, the default ticket they sell you is the 600 rubles version, and if you have enough time, it is definitely interesting to see the rooms of the General Staff Building (which has been renovated and features top-notch facilities)...Leaving your bags in the cloakrooms is free, as is internet access - but only for 15 minutes!

Dazzling. These buildings have been restored magnificently. The artworks contained therein is a truly incredible collection. This is, as trite as it seems, a destination not to be missed. The floors alone are works of art, and it is incredible that they are treated every year so that they are protected from the millions of people who come through. It is too bad that the place is so crowded. We got in technically before opening time through a cruise tour, and even then it was very crowded. We had a very good tour guide who knew enough to go a slightly different way so that we were the first to get to the Rembrandts and DaVincis- couldn't believe I had some time alone with these masterworks.
Amazing museum !. Usually the lines to get in are long, but it is totally worth the waiting! The museum is big, I spend there 2 and a half hours and couldn't see even half of it! Totally recommended!

World-class museum that didn't disappoint. We took a guided tour arranged by our cruise ship. There were 28 of us all under one guide. Unfortunately, the guide spent more energy keeping us together and insuring she didn't lose any of us than she did on showing us the Hermitage. Nonetheless, the buildings themselves have been lovingly restored to breathtaking opulence; the artwork inside is endless. It was stunning to be led into a room chock full of Rembrandt paintings, then another room full of Reubens, another of Van Dyk. Next time, I would hire a private guide and limit the number in the tour to four people. These large tour groups don't spend nearly enough time in the museum.

Massive and impressive!. The Hermitage is huge. The guide said that if you spent 1 minute with each piece in the museum it would take over 3 years to see them all. There is so much to see it's overwhelming but it's well worth the admission.

Overwhelming. By any definition, the art collection is staggering. One could spend days in this museum and never see but a percent of the collection. The palace is difficult to believe that something of this nature could be built when it was for just one family. It has hundreds of rooms and proves that when one is spending other people's money almost anything can be built. One should definitely see this sight .
One should visit. It was huge charming musiam with magnificent cilings and floors، at least 5 hours need to enjoy enough,

This is a drop dead gorgeous museum. We had a private tour. She was so informative. This museum was so beautiful. We stood there on the front with our mouths hanging open. Our guide loved our reaction because she has been going to this museum since she was 9 years old. Its really big and alot of walking but well worth it. All the gold and chandeliers are gorgeous.

We had one day - we needed 2 weeks - just amazing to see!. Where can I start. The Hermitage museum is second largest in the world after Le Louvre. The outside palace and the inside color an architecture is amazing. Everywhere you turn is something new to visit and gaze at. I loved the pastel colors of the buildings and how beautiful they were. We will definitely go back to Russia to visit more.
The essential St Petersburg venue.. Unfortunately the popularity means that there can be very unattractive queuing and delays whilst viewing can be hampered by the excess crowds.

One from "must visit" places. Louvre (Paris), Hermitage Museum (St. Petersburg), Prado(Madrid), National Gallery(London)... all this are "must visit" places. One from the biggest collection of masterpieces is in Hermitage Museum. Unfortunately, one from the longest queue also:)). But once inside you forget everything cause you have a Rendez-Vous with her Majesty -The Art.

Too large to see in one visit. This huge complex of various, inter-linked buildings houses so many artefacts, paintings, sculptures, etc, etc that it is only possible to see if you allow yourself at least a full day if not more. Splendour in every room and corridor.

Beautiful palace and art objects. Several buildings connect in this huge place and the art is fabulous. Tours get in early and tours can also arrange to see the gold room where jewels and expensive items are located. Plan to spend lots of time here
Great palace and art gallery. The hermitage is a must visit for anyone going to St Petersburg. We also had the god luck to be with an excellent guide, do take a guide along.

Need a lot of time for this . We were only here in SP for 4 days do had to give the heritage museum a miss which is a pity. It will take you over a day to see it in its entirety and people we have plenty with sat in their time only saw a fraction of what was available. Maybe if we come back will allow more time to go this .Did go the winter palace and that is well worth a visit as are the other palaces ( summer in peterhof)

Truly one of the world's greatest museums!. Le Louvre, Smithsonian, The British Museum... The State Hermitage. How do you know you're in one of the world's greatest museums? The answer is that you're surround by incredible artwork and antiquities that you've been looking at for hours, there is still so many more pieces to see, but you give up. You're hot and tired and just want to leave. That's how you know. This museum is incredible. The collection here is one of the best in the world and I promise you that if you spend the entire day here you'll only see a small portion of it. Still it's amazing and you should go see it. I really enjoyed my second visit here and there is still too much to see... Enjoy!
Wow!. Must see. Get early entry to avoid lines. For detailed descriptions and pictures visit my blog called freetravelwithpoints

Amazing. Get there early to see this place. Not only is the building and rooms incredible, but the artwork......... There you will see art by Rembrandt, Raphael, and DaVinci among some of the most popular. Was able to see most important pieces with little trouble. Be aware it can get crowded later in the day and the lines to get in can be long. Even if you have to wait get there!!!!

Wow, Wow, Wow!. We have visited most major museums around the world, the Hermitage is unquestionably in the top 3. Incredible art, sculptures, collectables and artifacts. What a great collection and well labeled and arranged. I've added some pictures to the file. You can get the highlights in 3-4 hours but plan on a full day or two if possible as there is so much to see. Also weekdays are best. Entrance fee was I recall 10 Euro....yes, Russia will take Euros. The Russian currency is so weak I suggest you bring some of that for purchasing gifts. 100 Ruble = $1.57 US.
Mind blowing. Beautiful building inside and out with so many treasures. One day did not give it justice. See it from the outside at night all lit up

Mind-blowing. If you take the slightest interest in palaces, Russian culture or art, this is your Mecca. I have visited many museums and decadent royal residents in my life, but I have never seen a complex like this before. The art collections are vast and impressive, comparable only to places such as the Louvre. You need three days to see the most important, five or more to see all of it. This mind-blowing center of extreme tsarist wealth and masterpieces covering all Western art epoches is a high light you must see at least once in your life time. (And do not forget the General Staff Building opposite the Winter Palace, as visitors tend too.)

Gorgeous. No trip to Saint Petersburg would be complete without a trip to the Hermitage. It's absolutely breathtaking. I'm disappointed we only had one day to tour it. You could spend a week and still not see all that there is to offer.

Amazing museum. This museum reflect the luxury story of the romanov family with amazing furniture, paintings, gardens, fountains, floors, cellars, lighting and doors,Our tour was very good we hired it through our cruise ( norwegian cruise line ) and we loved it

One of the finest museums there is. I'd put Hermitage in top 3 art museums in the world. The collection is absolutely astounding, and the palace itself is a sight to behold. Make sure you pay extra and see the diamond room. Oh, and if you have a friend who speaks Russian, get them to buy your ticket, otherwise you'll be overpaying

Incredible Collection. Really wonderful museum. Outstanding presentation. Organized. Audio guide was really very informative. On the day we went, one could argue that they had oversold. Really it was so crowded, it was hot for all five hours we were there. The people were shoulder to shoulder inching toward exhibits. The crushing crowd, reported pickpockets in one of the rooms, and overwhelming heat were not small factors during our visit. Still, we bought the book and will value our visit to the Hermitage.

Dream Vacation . Breath taking...I was only there with a tour group for 4 hours. You need a day to really feel like you've seen it. We had great weather but the crowds were heavy and it was very hot inside.I recommend dressing in layers.You can't go to St Petersburg without a visit here.

One of the top museums in the world. Take a tour though so you can get in 1/2 hour earlier. It is PACKED like 40-50,000 people packed and no air conditioning. Some of the greatest treasures in the world. Warning though, you can't see everything, would take a year or so to see it all and none of the French paintings are in the main buildings, they are in the state building which really disappointed me to find out after the fact.

Stunning. Wow! So many different art forms beautifully displayed. Took the tour as part of a cruise shore excursion. Lines are not as long for tours. The palace itself is beautiful. Perfect for an art museum. A must see while visiting St.Petersburg. Too much to see in one day.

Must visit. One of the best museums of the world. Very rare paintings displayed. Gud display of russian and other parts of the world's architecture. Pre booking adviced with a guide. 2-3 hrs visit. Very well maintained

Incredible, the best. We visited St Petesburg and this was the highlight of our trip. There is so much history in Russia and this museum has one of the best collection of art in Europe. Every room is exquisite. Different colors and decoration, stones and marble. It is like being in a dream in the past.

Incredible museum - well worth it. Obviously you can't do the whole museum - it is enormous.
We went with a guide who whizzed us through certain elements but gave us a very good sense of the entire complex and its features.
It is mind boggling to see some of the things inside - amazing insight into the history and culture.
Hermitage. Prepare to stay in queue if coming there in summer time. Winter time is better to visit museums at st Pete

Overwhelming!. We came on a special tour from our cruise and were able to get in about an hour and half before the crowds. Thank God! We toured the "Gold Room" which was spectacular and then started on a tour of select parts of the museum. There is so much to see that it's not possible to see all in one day. As the general admission crowd comes in, it is difficult getting close to the works. Our guide reviewed the history of art and pointed out special examples. She also told us to use our elbows and shoulders to muscle our way in close. My advice is to go with someone who understands the collection and is able to direct you to the prime examples of must see art.

You need a lifetime!. The collection is vast and varied and the building alone is worth the price of admission. In view of the time needed to appreciate this amazing museum, skip the Impressionists (in a separate building) until that collection is developed further.

MillionS of art work. Probably one of most impressive museums I have ever visited. There is a new section opened in old staff building. Not long lines, cheap entrance fee, and a very large collection of a wide number of known artists. Each room contains many works of one artist and there are over 40 rooms. Building isn't as impressive as main museum in old palace but whereas the palace dominates view the staff building focuses on the art and you are not distracted by opulent surroundings. A must to visit both.

Outstanding venu. This place is overwhelming. The paintings and the sculptures can occupy many hours of time. I was attracted by the architecture and the design of the buildings and the rooms. It is easy to see why this palace is so popular. Know there are many places to sit. There are certainly not enough for everyone but I had no issues finding a seat when I truly needed one. There are stairs and some are without railings so be warned.

Fabulous Buliding. We were on a Boltic Cruise with Celebrity Cruise, so we opted to have an organised visit arranged by the ship. The Place is huge and ostentatious. It's very tiring to walk around. Not a place to visit if you have any walking issues.

Enjoyable. 600R entry which included The Winter Palace. A grand square, also grand inside. If you are not with a group, then go in the opposite direction than the audio guide, as it is very busy with tour groups, all going the same direction. There are different rooms with different exhibits, egyption, porcelain, art. I went at 11.30am and only waited 15 minutes to get a ticket and entry.
Just too busy. According to lists in the top 10 galleries of the world, accept this but treated like slaves and driven through far too busy galleries
Amazing must see. Just a great museum with over 3 million exhibits, highly recommended to visit. Suggest to hire a private guide.

Really interesting!. If you don't know any of the history I think you would really need to take a tour or use a guide book. We booked our private tour inside the Hermitage. I wasn't quite sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised. There are plenty of halls to explore when inside the museum. It is a gorgeous place to be if you want to spend a full day there. Would 100% recommend! Ideally visit it on your first date in Saint Petersburg. I would say this is a must see!

One of the Great Museums of the World. There are tons of reviews of the Hermitage on Tripadvisor and I'm not sure how much more there is to add. Simply put, it's one of the great treasures of the world and a must visit for anyone who enjoys art (and even for those who don't). Make sure to buy tickets in advance to avoid the long, long lines to get in. The entrance if you have pre-paid tickets (from their excellent website) is on a side street, not in the front of the Palace and is as painless as can be, and no wait. We had read quite a bit about the museum and seen documentaries on YouTube so we knew what we wanted to see. We still got the audio guide which while a little difficult to follow, was worth the investment (it will take you to the major attractions). At least when we visited, the museum was incredibly overcrowded with tour groups, but there are quiet corners if you seek them out. Amongst them is the beautiful church inside the Palace which was recently restored. I only wish the Hermitage would set aside a night or two a week during peak season with limited number of entries but really, there is nothing to criticize here. It's just incredible.

worth the time spent and so much to see. This is one of the must see in St petersburg. You may need one full day just to see the bare minimum. It is very crowded so try go with guided tour which may let you enter early. So many art work from many world famous artists on display.

Wow. One day is not enough to see all the artifacts. The collections are huge and well maintained. Make sure to wear a comfortable shoes since you will be walking around the whole time. History and the stories behind each piece are very interesting. You can also have an audio guide if you are not interested in getting a tour guide. Wonder around and be amaze of the the history and stories behind each piece.
A treasure. A real treasure to visit in st petersburg. I would rate it better than Louvre in Paris. Queue for tickets is not long. The rooms are stunning. Paintings are valuable
Not to be missed. There is so much to see that really no one could do it in one day. Would be a five star to just see the building even without the art work!

Fascinating!. You could easily spend a week carefully reviewing all the works of art and history in this fabulous palace. There is so much to see, but a little suffocating when very busy with tourists! Try to find a date/time which will be less busy, if possible, and just take your time and enjoy this voyage of discovery!

A Tour Can Help You Skip the Wait. Fantastic exhibits and art history. I probably would have preferred a day to just wander (or choose my own highlights) but our guide certainly knew the place and the type of tickets we had allowed us to go straight in a bit early. As we toured, I could see long lines of people outside the entrance holding umbrellas. If you only have one day, hire a guide or research what you want to see before hand.

One of the greats. Amazing collection! The many tour groups are overwhelming, and you have to navigate around them. Don't get a guide yourself, they are full of misinformation. Don't miss the Raphaels, the Rembrandts, and the Siberian artifacts. Outstanding collection of Limoges Renaissance enamels. The Roman sculptures are heavily restored, and the Greek vases are third rate, skip them if short on time.

More Opulance in St P's. We thought we had seen the most of the treasures at Peterhof palace, but wait there was more! The Heritage museum and winter palace continued the display of hidden treasures, artwork and show of wealth that early Russian Tsar families had in their days. In one way, very interesting and amazing to see, on the other a display of how inequitable the distribution of wealth was in those early days.

Have a plan B for buying tickets on place, take a refreshing walk in not over-crowded parts. The online posts advised us that the best way to buy tickets is via ticket machines near the entry gates. It is OK, BUT you should have a plan B for the case wen the machines do not work. So it is fine that one of the group holds a place in the queue for the ticket desks while the other on buys the tickets via machines. Be careful that before the cash desk opening the machines neither operate!Insider tip: If you feel tired inside because of the masses, take a look to the Siberian native artwork, there is a well kept air conditioning and you could breathe freely because no crowds in that area. After this recharge you can return to the crowded other parts :)
Vacation. Very recomended to spend at least 3 days at HermitazeOverview tourGold and dianond rooms amazingTry to get a private guide otherwise ling hrs line to get in

Wow - just wow. Words are quite inadequate to describe the sheer beauty and delight of everything in the museum. They say if you spend 30 seconds on each object it can take 10 years to view everything. We only had a few hours but am so impressed - a must if visiting St Petersburg

Better than you can ever imagine. This is the most unbelievable easier, with the most incredible collection of artefacts. However, I would strongly recommend that you visit it with a guide as without it you will waste too much time and simply not appreciate all of its beauty.

Wow. It's the most beautiful museum I've been to. It was really huge. I think two days is not enough to tour the whole place. The museum has a very huge collection of paintings. One of the most famous paintings that it has is the Madonna and Child. I really recommend everyone visiting St. Petersburg to go to the Hermitage.
visist Hermitage. Amazing place and hard to see it all in one day. Worth a visit to see all the history and art. Gets very busy with tour groups.
Beyond belief. The winter palace/ Hermitage is just so incredible. It really is a must see. You'll only be able to see a tiny fraction in one day. The vastness is really beyond belief.

MUST SEE!. The Hermitage/Winter Palace is one of the most beautiful museums in the world! The fact that you can see gorgeous art work and also part of the palace that was actually used by Russian Tsars is a wonderful experience. The whole thing from the floor to the architecture is absolutely breath taking. Make sure to give yourself an entire day to see as much as you can. Also, DO NOT waist time in line to buy your entrance ticket. Buy it from one of the machines and go straight to the entrance door! Museum is closed on Mondays.

Stunning. The beauty of this is overwhelming. Golden, crystal beauty, it's hard to believe it was created by people and not magicians! The restoration is a credit to those involved. One of those places to see before you die.

Best Museum I Have Visited. I have visited the top museums all over the world. This one stands out. Why? Because it is not just paintings on a wall or sculptures. The walls, ceilings and floors also are pieces of art. Remarkably presented, with most of the world's top artists. There is too much to take in and the museum is super crowded. We went with SPB tours which gave us an hour early entrance. That helped a lot. If you have time for only one thing to see in St. Petersburg, this is it.

HUGE!!. I don't think you could see the whole place in one day and we didn't even try. Various exhibitions on display. Visit the whole palace or just a particular exhibition. Security measures are tight. Backpacks have to be checked into coat room (free of charge). Worth a visit.

Best in the world. Having traveled around the world and having been to many many famous art museums, I have no doubts that this is the largest and the best of them all.. This combination of multiple palaces gives the Hermitage the space it needs to house such amazing collections. And some of the top art works from some of the world's most famous artists will blow you away (think da Vinci, Rembrandt, and hundreds of others. We were told tehre are 1056 rooms in the Museum. And the 2 hours we had there were far from enough. I could see at least 4 hours and possibly a whole day. All I can say is 'Wow!'

A feast for the eyes!. We spent hours in this fabulous museum and winter palace- there is so much to see and it really is a feast for the eyes. We travelled with Tour De Force a small tour company who manage to get early entry tickets to all major attractions which is essential as queues can be long otherwise.

One of the Best in the World.. This place is too huge to take in in one day-- if you're serious, do it in more than one day. It's perhaps not the best paintings in Europe but it's a large collection with a lot to offer, and some great sculpture and a lot of really great decorative arts. Gift shops are good as well.
A Must. How can anyone not visit this museum? It lives up to it's world class reputation. So much to see here. Get on line before it opens, or go with a tour. The crowds are huge.

Old Masters and Russian History. The Hermitage is enormous, its architecture alone is worth a visit. But the artwork it contains is so extraordinary that it took my breath away. We live in New York and are used to great museums Like the Metropolitan and the Museum of Modern Art, but the Hermitage's collection of Old Masters is unparalleled. While not all the painting are world class, there are enough Rembrandts and Cezannes to make the head spin.There are also artifacts from Russian history (at least the history of the nobility) and so forth.Be ready for large crowds and some confusion about what's where. You can get tickets using a credit card from kiosks at the entrance, which will save you a long wait on a queue. Don't expect too much help from the attendants--very few speak English or other non-Russian languages.But the museum is a once in a lifetime experience--not to be missed.
Be Prepared to be Lost. Their map of the museum is nearly useless AND there are no direction signs. Itwas much better going with a guide.

Can't miss it. No trip to St Petersburg is complete without a trip to the Hermitage Museum. Its opulence, magnificence and, once inside, its depth of quality can only be understood from the experience of a visit. DO reserve tickets online. It's easy and saves a lot of waiting and worth any price difference there may be (not sure).
Something Special. The museum is massive and holds some of the most impressive art you will ever see. SPB did a great job in showing us the highlights

One of the most important museums in the world. It started as a palace in which Cathrine the Great lived. She bought art collections and filled the place with beauty. Now it's one of the largest museums in the world, and it includes also archaeological collections. You'll need years to see them all, so try to plan in advance what you're going to see. Tip: visit the museum on Wednesday afternoon, esp. if you visit during the summer. On Wednesday it's closed at 21:00 (the shop mueum is closed earlier though).

Lots to see but be prepared for big crowds. The museum houses an excellent collection of art pieces and it will take at least half a day (or more) if you are truly interested in examining the pieces closely. We were on a group tour and rushed through the key exhibits of the collection in less than two hours. It was very crowded all through the day as it is one of the most popular attractions of the city.
A Palace full of treasures!. It is one of the best museums in the world and the setting is fabulous. You get to see art masterpieces while discovering the palace of the Russian royalty.

Amazing museum. Now this should be no. 1 place to visit in st. Petersburg.Free on 1st thursday of every month but tickets needs to be bought so plan a 45 min wait untill you are in, inside it is not crouded even on the free entrance day. Fast visit will take you 3 hours. If you want to see everything hear guides its a day or two to cover everything. The place is huge. There isa nice yard in front with many children playing and actors takes pictures with tourists.

Beyond amazing. We booked an early entry-small group private tour of the Hermitage. It was worth every penny. The Hermitage is magnificent. The art collection, the interiors, the history...it is really amazing. I highly suggest taking a guided tour, otherwise, you can get lost and miss out on a lot.

Fabulous Palace and Museum. Our cruise company organised a guided tour which included about an hour to visit the gold room. The Palace and contents are a must see on a visit to St Petersburg although we hardly scratched the surface. To do it justice requires the best part of a week although we got a degree of priority and entry for the main areas before our timed visit to the Gold Room which was well worth visiting in its own right. By midday the museum was very crowded, also no big bags, umbrellas, bottles of water or high heels are allowed so be prepared.

Feel like a Czar. Totally loves this place. Make sure to buy tickets online as general ticket line and then entrance line are huge (45-90 mins each, and you have to be in both), but if you buy online - you get to enter through a secret entrance.Museum gets overfilled with tourists, so its sorta hard to see the good stuff. Definitely go to the Siberia section, coins, and actual room where Czars used to live. Everything else is on par or worse than Metropolitan.Allow 4 hours for a brief visit, and more like 3 days for a see-everything.

Hermitage. This museum is a must see while in St. Petersburg. Although it is very very crowded, it contains such beautiful artwork that it is worth the bumping by tourists from all over the world. Watch out for pickpockets after 10:30 am when they start letting in the general public.

Awesome tour - could stay several days here. SPB tours had us in the museum before it opened to the public and we had a great review of all the museum. I would recommend this a must see in St. Petersburg

So much to see. The Winter Palace hallway entry and church are breath-taking. There is so much art on display here that only a real enthusiast would fully appreciate it. It is extremely busy but with audio guides it is less of a problem as you can wander about and still hear your tour guide. After a few hours most people flag; it has a café and toilets inside as once you leave you can’t re-enter.
Amazing!. Wish I could have spent a week there! Nothing could prepare for the art and the facility. It was gorgeous..the collection is EPIC! Plan as much time as you can.

A must see. You cannot go in St Petersburg and not see the Hermitage. The rooms by themselves worth the visit. Add to it art from antiquity to nowadays, from all around the world, and you obtain one of the most beautiful museum in the world!

The most popular attraction in St. Petersburg!. The entrance is free of charge the first Thursday of every month for all visitors. The museum is closed on Mondays. In general I do not like these dates because it is too crowded. When we have planned the trip I did not know about the free entrance day. But we were there and I had read that I would have to face long queues to buy the entrance in the other days anyway. The entrance for individual visitors is located in the Winter Palace, accessible from the Courtyard.The museum opens at 10 am and we have arrived at 9am. There was a long queue outside the Courtyard. At 10 am they have opened the gates and people did not respect the line. They started to run but my husband thought that it was not right. There are two entrances one of each side of the building. The left entrance is closer to the gate; so most people went to this line. Many people stuck to queue in front of us. When we saw the other line in the right side was too late to change. Even if you do not have to pay, you have to go to the ticket booth, inside the building, to get the free entrance ticket. They only allow a certain group of persons to go inside, but unlike the Catherine's Palace there is no defined period. It was a very stressful experience.If I knew, we would have done differently. My husband would stay in the line and I would stay close to the Courtyard's gates. Even in the queues inside the Courtyard, some people stuck to queue in front of us, especially Chinese people. I have read that they are not used to have queues in China but they should respect foreign costumes when travelling.Once you get the entrance ticket, before enter the museum, leave your purses/backpacks in the clock room.Inside the museum there is a Café _ the sandwich is fair.The museum is so big, with so magnificent beautiful arts items and antiquities (paintings, drawings, jewelry, coins, medals, sculptures, and copies of original Vatican frescoes.) It is not possible to see all in one day. Take at least 3 to 4 hours to see the highlights, such as:The Jordan Staircase at the Winter PalaceThe Field Marshall RoomThe Small Throne RoomThe Armorial HallThe St. George HallThe Peacock Clock in Pavilion HallThe Raphael LoggiaThe Knights RoomPaintings not to be missed: Madonna with Child and Two Angels by Paolo di Giovanni FeiThe Virgin and the Child with Sts. Dominic and Thomas Aquinas by Fra AngelicoMadonna and Child (the Litta Madonna) by Leonardo da VinciJudith with the Head of Holofernes by GiorgioneDanae and The Repentant Mary Magdalene by TitianLamentation by Paolo VeroneseMadonna and Child (The Conestabile Madonna and The Holy Family by RaphaelDanae by Rembrandt van RijnDescent from the Cross by Peter Paul RubensChild with Whip by Pierre-Auguste RenoirWoman in the Garden by Claude MonetMount Sainte-Victoire by Paul CézanneCottages with Thatched Roofs by Vincent van GoghTahitian Pastorale by Paul GauguinThe Red Room by Henri MatisseDo not miss the sculpture The Crouching Boy by Michelangelo.Tip: Once you enter the gates, there are automatic machines in the Courtyard, some at the right and some at the left, where to buy entrance tickets and you can enter the museum in a lateral entrance avoiding the long queues.

Stunning. MUST SEE. Opulence takes your breath away.. There is A LOT to see in this museum. If you are very fit, you could fit it all in one day at a glance. If not, I would suggest taking 2 or maybe even 3 days to complete the museum. There are 3 floors in the main building of the palace each deserving of your time. If you do the additional buildings with the art, you might even choose to spend 3 or 4 days depending on your level of relaxation and time available to you. Seeing these museums in a day is possible but is absolutely exhausting. If I did it again, I would have done it over 3 days, including the art gallery taking time to get a proper lunch and break/rest in between morning and afternoon.

First time in the Hermitage. Personal guided tour worth the extra $$$. Personal tour of Winter Palace and Modern Art display. Worth the extra $$$ because we skipped all the interesting long lines and could inter act with the guide. The Modern Art building it is newly refurbished, former HQ of Russian Army. The building is in great shape; but the rooms are yet to be filled. Plenty of room for growth. The Winter Palace is as impressive as its billing. Three million objects d'art!I am not an art nut; but I enjoyed the tour.

Must see it. The first Thursday if each month free entrance. You need to queue to have your ticket (even if it's free). Select what you want to see. The Russian collection is very interesting especially if you aren't familiar with it ( as we were since we are Belgians). Groups are looking at the main pieces. Often when you see a group gathered in front of a painting it's because it's a Rubens or Da Vinci. Wait a bit and when they're gone have a look. It's huge so decide ahead what you want to see.
Part of 2 Day TJTravel tour. Excellent tour but normally large crowds, We were lucky museum opened only for cruise ship tours for a few hours on Monday which is normally closed for maintenance

Amazing collection and buildings, very helpful staff. First of all, yes, the Hermitage is crowded! you are not going to have it to yourself, however, if you come early and pre-book tickets it helps a lot. Pre-booking is a must! more expensive but worth it! you enter on the side of the building between the small hermitage and the old/grand hermitage. I got there at 10:25 and queued for about 10 mins before entering. I had pre-booked a tour later in the day of the diamond room but had failed to realise that I needed to exchange my voucher for a ticket before entering the museum. After a bit of to and from, I asked one of the guides in the main hall for help, she very kindly took over, took me through the gates, to a ticket office, skipped the line, got my ticket exchanged and got me back in on her own card. All in typically brusque Russian fashion but extremely kind of her. The tour of the diamond room was well worth it, less crowded with 9 people in the group and the guide was very knowledgeable and spoke good English. It takes a bit of planning to visit the Hermitage, decide on what you want to see before you go, plan your route and be picky, I skipped the third floor entirely for example and accept that the rooms with the famous paintings such as Rubens, Rembrandt and the Di Vinci and Michelangelo are going to be very busy, however, get there early and view them first to avoid the worst of the tour groups (most of the cruises now have early morning visits, before general admission which helps a bit) There are also less crowded parts of the museum, the general staff building was fairly empty around five o'clock (had plenty of time and space to admire the Picassos, Monets, Cezanne etc.) and the Siberian/central Asian etc sections were not at all crowded.If possible get a two-day ticket so you are not subjected to a marathon 7.5-hour visit, wear good shoes, I walked about 10 k on the day of my visit. And accept that the cafe food is pretty dire, however, the cakes are decent. Overall, I was blown away by the building itself and the opulence of the setting, the art and the history! I'll definitely go back in the future.

the Hermitage, St. Petersburg. The Hermitage is an excellent place to visit for many hours. A two days pass is cheaper than a one day pass.
