Very beautiful rooms and paintings, sculptors, etc. The chapel/church is a must-see. The general Staff Building has some excellent impressionist paintings. The rooms there are modern, light and spacious but not ornate. Still worth a visit. The ticket covers both places.
Room after amazing room. This is a must-see in St Petersburg. The opulence is unbelievable! Buy your ticket at the kiosks and then walk right in, avoiding the lengthy queue across the courtyard.

Hermitage with Gold Room Tour. Norwegian Cruise Line Tour. We included the Gold Room based on reviews. Big mistake. Be advised, the room itself isn't gold, it's just full of gold jewelry and trinkets in display cases. Of course it's personal preference, but we would have greatly preferred time to see art work by masters we know such as the impressionists. The guide hurried us thru a big room full of "ordinary" Rembrandts to focus on one "masterpiece". Can't really blame her, since there is an enormous amount to see. Also be advised that some (most?) tours will include a 30 or 45 minute stop at a gift shop after the museum. Our expected 4 hour tour was actually only 3 hours.

Don't miss the Hermitage Museum. The Hermitage Museum is the number one place to visit while in St Petersburg.Had read beforehand that there can be long queues, but there was no queue to buy tickets or enter the Museum when we visited at the end of August and on a Saturday. Reasonable ticket price, do remember the Museum is closed on Mondays.So much to see in the museum, the art on display by painters you will only have heard of beforehand blows you away. Too much to see all in one day unless you skip some of the rooms which is not advisable. Worth stopping at the cafe for break with a nice selection of sandwiches and cakes available. The few shops also sell some nice souvenirs.We unfortunately were too tired at the end of the day to visit the General Staff building, but this should not be missed. We have a reason to go back now!

Book a local guide or get advance tickets. The Hermitage is a huge place that you will never be able to see even the highlights in less than one day. A booked tour with a local guide,I used BEST GUIDES and was totally satisfied with them, will get you in before opening time and no long line to stand in ( over 400 people in line one hour before opening time).If you want to see either the "Gold Room" or the "Jewel Room" you must buy tickets as soon as you can after entering the Museum. I think only one tour per day in English and you must use the museum tour person that takes at least one hour to go through 4 rooms! The Museum shop is very, nice lots of amber jewelry, bring your credit card. Best Guides include price of ticket in their fee, but if you don't use a local guide and buy advance tickets there is a special entrance for those with that paper approx 200 yds to the right of the regular line.

Nothing short of amazing. The only thing wrong with visiting the Hermitage is the crowds. Understand that this is a truly amazing museum and building and it seems that just about everyone in the world wants to visit. The displays are extraordinary and the the building(s) itself will take your breath away. I am quite sure that one could spend weeks and still not see it all. Simply wonderful.

Fantastic. The State Hermitage is an overload of history. I feel honoured to have visited this. The museum is well set out to handle large groups and I would highly recommend adding it into a walking tour as this cuts down having to stand in long lines.I also recommend going end August- early September to ensure you're out of peak tourist season. Today the museum was not very busy but heard it was crowded two weeks earlier (mid Aug).The museum is vast with so much on offer, the Rembrandt collection is beautiful.

Wonderful Experience.. As we were with a planned tour ( Denrus ) we managed to gain access before the queues. A busy time for tourists in August. So much to see and such a beautiful palace, worth having a guide if time is limited as it could take two days to explore and see everything. The Faberge Eggs and items are beautifully displayed, likewise the paintings. State Rooms were stunning, remember the recent War and Peace, filmed at the Palace Ballroom. A visit is a must in St Petersburg.

Do your homework, worth it!. 1. Read about the collections and pick your must see collections and fit in the other things if you have time left.2. Buy vouchers online beforehand. exchange them for a ticket in the booths. Stand in the correct lines, the ones on the side, be on time. if you are in early you will get so see the most stuff, but not all. Mondays they are closed, wednesday and friday they are open till later, 2100 instead of 1800. 3. Your ticket grants entry to 3 seperate buildings, the main one is the newer winterpalace, the one across from that on the other side of the square, and the excavated original winterpalace. this is not really clear. the original winterpalace entry is along the riverbank, an unassuming wooden door with only a printed paper in cyrillic. just go in, and dont go right but straight on. Try to see these too!4. Prepare for the hordes. the palace is not designed as a museum. not all stairwells on the map are for the public, most are only for one level but dont go all the way up of down. the doorways are narrow and the tourgroups huge. Just cough at the asians and push the other ones aside. 5. Take only a small bag, so you dont have to go to a cloakroom. 6. Have fun, you will be exhausted but its worth it.

Amazing . This was the the best in our opinion you need a full day to see a tiny fraction of what is on display.Only downfall is the amount of people so be prepared for a lot of waiting.But not to be missed we had a great day.SteveUk

OMG mindblowing. We had researched our visit and organised a private tour guide....get you , I hear you say,but it was not expensive and so worth it.We booked with Tsar Voyager and our guide was truly fabulous . She knew everything about everything!The hermitage has so many exhibits and we loved the artwork...Rembrandt particularly but make sure you visit across the square to see Monet, cezanne, Picasso....my god, incredible. Cannot imagine how much that place is worth and so much less crowded than the main hermitage....you really do get moved along if you just lift up your feet!

Lovely restored palaces. These lovely restored palaces are filled with lovely works of art, of all types. Be sure to look up as the ceilings are gorgeous. Try to go with a guide and pay for early admission - it makes all the difference. It gets extremely crowded. Some signs are also in English but it would be impossible to get the true sense of the history without a guide or the listening device, unless you just want to look and not learn. Be sure to see the Silver Room, which is extra.
Amazing museum.. Need to really spent a couple of days to see some of the major treasures. We really enjoyed this visit. Long walks, very impressive structure and planning.

A must see when in St. Petersburg. If you can only do one thing this would be the place to go. There is more history in this building than outside of this building. There are displays that you can not see anywhere outside of Russia. Drive by everything else, but spend your time here.

A must. This is one of the things you must do when you are in Petersburg. Amazing art collection (Rembrandt, da Vinci, Rafael, Goya and others), breathless view all over palace. If you are not going to guide you should get audio guide to get the full experience. One of my favorite stuff to see is a peacock clock in the Museum so do not miss to see it

So much to see, so little time. Like all great museums, there is a daunting amount of stuff to see in one visit. There are also huge amounts of people which can make moving around and seeing things a bit of a challenge. The paintings are wonderful, but so is the building itself, so set aside a day and take your time. Be warned - the toilet facilities were dreadful, with long queues and no very clean.

So glad we didn't miss it!. A must see!! If you only visit one place in Saint Petersburg this should be it! Be sure to reserve the day to explore many beautiful artifacts inside of this museum. This is the kind of place that has a huge amount of different masterpieces to see. Even during a busy morning time we were able to see most of the rooms and enjoy ourselves there.

The amount of Gold here is simply amazing.. Its easy to see how they had a revolution in Russia. The gold, the wealth the opulence is really amazing. Rome, Paris, Versailles all the great Palaces of the World are not remotely as beautiful as this Palace.
A huge Museum of treasures. Go on a tour like TJ Travel unless you are staying for a week. We bypassed the lines. A wonderful collection of treasures.

Exquisite!. I recently visited The Hermitage Museum for the second time. As with my first visit,it was incredibly crowded and difficult to navigate. The typical tourist I saw was only interested in taking photos of paintings and not interested in appreciating the artwork. How can they when they are with large tour groups and limited in time?On this visit I was with a local private guide who told me about each piece of artwork. The highlight was visiting the Impressionist, Picasso and Matisse works which have been moved to another building across the square. This building was not crowded and the opportunity to view the artworkwith more leisure was so pleasurable. I believe the group tours are not including this building. I know for sure that the cruise ship excursion did not include the Impressionists.If you can visit before July or August, do so. If you can afford a private, I recommend it highly. Enjoy the building, the furnishings and the art work.

State Hermitage Museum & Winter Palace. Splendid art collection! Too much to detail here. If you don't have a tour guide purchase the audio guide. You will not derive the joy from the art if you do not have the commentary to go with it. Probably need 2 or 3 days alone to see everything here. I had only a few hours with a tour guide. Definitely worth it!

Busy but a must see. Like many of SpB attractions the plan should be to get there as early as possible in order to beat the crowds - this is the case for the Hermitage.So much to see and so little time to see it, so if you can, plan to be there a full day or return later

Amazing. If you expect a lost you will get much over your the most optimistic expectations. Museum is simply amazing. You can find Goya, Rembrandt, da Vinci, Rafael, Tizian and many more. Unfortunarely, Caravaggio wasn't there and I hope you will have more luck with it. It is not only about callections, IT is also the place that leaves you completely out of breath. Must see!
Must Visit in St. Petersburg!. no wonder and truly one of the top 10 museums in the whole world. it's HUGE.. spent whole day in the museum still found not enough time! will come back again.
A must see. Its a must see place. It's definitely worth to spend several hours in there. To avoid big queues - buy tickets from the electronic machines right next to the entrance.

Amazing. This amazing palace, now a museum was incredible. There is such a wealth of treasures to explore that it would take at least one complete day to even begin to do it justice. It can get very busy with tour groups, (like ours!), but don't miss this. The splendour is well worth any hassle.The contrast between the extreme wealth and privilege of the nobility and the abject poverty of the peasants can be hard to accept at times.

beautiful palace with many color. This beautiful palace was constructed on a monumental scale that was intended to reflect the might and power of Imperial Russia. From the palace, the emperor ruled over 22,400,000 square kilometers (8,600,000 sq. mi) (almost 1/6 of the Earth's landmass) and over 125 million subjects by the end of the 19th century

You will want even more time. The Museum is amazing, unable to cover all in one day, or two, it is crowded and overwhelming in summer but totally worth it. We booked a private tour on line before arriving to Saint Petersburg (highly recommended) our tour included The Golden Room and the Diamond with a Russian lady that spoke a perfect English so beautiful and knowledgeable that we wanted to keep her for ever, her name was Catherina. Our private curator lady was also knowledgeable and nice, she took us to different exhibitions avoiding the crowd, we did not have to make a line or wait excessively. The museum has everything and more for everybody's taste in art, we were there for five hours and when we left even though we were exhausted we wanted more. I might say that Hermitage is a must see but if you want to avoid the long lines, at least in August, you need to pre planned the visit and book ahead.

super. we had a 2day tour our guide Mariela from Maxibaltitours was outstanding we visited such a lot in short time gave us such a terrific commentary shame we not have enough time to see all was superb but so huge you need at least a day to see all it is wel worth a visit so spectacular as everything is in St .Petersburg so impreesing will most definitely go back again one day in future so magnificent beyond all my expectations

Golden Splendour. An amazing building with each room decked in gold and historic splendour. It is best to get there early and try to enter before the inevitable crowds. Too many selfie sticks in and around the building which impeded progress but the visit was one to remember very favourably.

Takes your breath away.. We visited as part of a group billed 'Early Entry' but even so the queues outside were growing. Inside it was one huge melee of tour groups and guides who don't wait for anyone and who can turn on each other if one of them oversteps the mark. Outside the pale green and white buildings are impressive but inside ... the phrase 'All that glitters is not gold' does NOT apply here. In St Petersburg, our guide told us, everything you see inside or out that looks like gold IS gold and the amount inside the Hermitage is staggering. As one visitor muttered 'No wonder they had a revolution'.The State Hermitage Museum consists of five buildings, one of which is the Winter Palace built in the middle of the 18th century, and it houses some 3 million objects. Unfortunately you cannot stop at any point but I would like to have lingered longer in the first throne room; decorated in red and gold it was wonderful. Don't miss the staircases, the main one in white marble, and do look up. On and on through glorious room after glorious room and along stunningly decorated corridors. My passion is ceilings but here the floors are also works of art in wonderful marquetry. Yes there are the world famous paintings, some of which are small and covered by glass, but for me it was the detail in the ornamentation of the rooms that was simply splendid. I felt almost overwhelmed by the richness of it all. There are many ornaments made from precious materials and with intricate workmanship, don't miss the Peacock Clock, and look out of a first floor window onto a garden at the same level. Rich as Croesus doesn't cover this level of wealth, rich as Midas more like.Be warned, there is virtually nowhere to sit down and you are not allowed to take drinks inside but there are cloakrooms and toilets and we passed a man selling guidebooks but be quick if you want to buy one, your guide will not stop.
Amazing place. How the Russian was able to preserve everything in this place is amazing. This place is massive full of history and culture to share to visitors

Super busy but beautiful. As expected the crowds were excessive at the museum but died down around 12.30-1pmish as tour groups went to lunch so that's probably a good time to go. Also to avoid queining by purchasing tickets online first (but don't translate to English when you purchase it as it will cost you about 7 euros more!). The artwork is incredible. We personally enjoyed the contemporary art exhibits in the building across the road from the Winter Palace so don't miss out on that!

HUGE!!!. Building is beyond huge. It would take days and days to go through the whole thing just to have a cursory review. Room after room of treasure - a testament to the over indulgence of the Russian Royals.It is simply overwhelming.....If you only have an afternoon you leave almost feeling disappointed because there was so much that will have been missed.It is crowded....but there is a reason it is....a must see,

Not enough time to see it all!. One visit just isn't enough to see everything here. The exhibits are brilliant, but I think the Hermitage itself outshines them all. I was so busy taking pictures of the ceilings and columns that I almost forgot the actual museum part of it! Definitely going back to see the bits I didn't have time for.
Included in visa free tour by Infinity Holidays. Excellent tour guide called Christina guided us through the crowds and gave us excellent commentary.

Unbearably crowded. The Hermitage is a must visit, but unfortunately it means everyone visits. The result is that it is so crowded that it is impossible to see anything. There is late opening on a Wednesday and Friday which might be the way to go. Unfortunately, this option was not open to us.With hindsight, I think I have given it a miss- gone to the Catherine Palace to admire the opulence and rooms and then to the General Staff Building, which now houses the Hermitage's impressionist and post impressionist art, for the art.There is also a far less crowded café at the General Staff Building which can be entered for free.
Incredible. The artwork displayed is voluminous, Over 3 million items displayed in 120 rooms. 26 paintings by Rembrandt alone, Raphael’s Madonna and Child, Michelangelo’s Crouching Boy etc........

really something other than a 5?. Incredible building, great art what else could one ask for (OK, cut the crowds down by 90%) but other than that wow. I still think that the Louvre surpasses it in quality of art, but the building itself is jaw dropping. One of the two or three great art museums of the world.

Amazing Day. I hae always wanted to see this palace, i was not dissapointed, it is extordinary the rooms are beyond belief and the picture and chandelairs are amazing. It is busy evan at the end of summer. It is well worth the visit but make sure you leave half a day, you will not see all there is but will get a good snapshot.

at least one day. one of the most important museum of the word: i confim.
It is so big that one day is not enough and could be exausting, so my advice is to buy a 2-day ticket

Wonderful!!!. The Hermitage and Winter Palace did not disappoint. Catherine the Great's art collection was magnificent. Being there was like being at the Louvre, just on a smaller scale but with equally impressive art.

Amazing !. We had early entry to the Hermitage as part of our tour with SPB Tours - all I can say is this place should not be missed. Unbelievably beautiful rooms, paintings, architecture, history, it is well worth a visit. A picture opportunity at every turn. Even if you can't get early entry, I feel it would be worth the queue to get in !
fantastic. fabulous place to visit, but make sure the company you use book times for the visit. another place that has been saved for us to visit

Very interestiong place. big minus: it is always crowded so be prepared for queues.use the map or you can get lost it is really big, you are not gonna spend there less than 2 hours. It is really beautiful place with very interesting exhibitions and chambers decorated in different styles

Escaped after one hour. The most unpleasent experience in my life. All the unpleasent sides of the global mass group tourism ever. The first hour was relatively OK, but then... Crowds of huge size in every room, no view on the objects, guides shouting in several languages, no air. It was infernally terrible. Perhaps wintertime it could be "breathtaking". Moreover, very bad information at the entrance, you have to argue if the Russian speaking guard will send you to another entrance. Finally, queing for this "must see" is a complete waste of time (and money).

The Winter Palace is just amazing. The visit to the Winter Palace was one of the best museums I have ever seen. There is so much to see and although we were there all day we did not have enough time to see everything. I am not a great museum lover but even I was blown away with all the wonderful things on show

World Famous Art Museum. It's all been said before. It's huge. It's full of amazing works of art and history. The building itself is worth the entrance fee. It's a must see. In terms of getting in, just walk into the courtyard of the Winter Palace and you can buy tickets by card at kiosks on either side. You'll avoid a potentially long queue.
MUST VISIT. Without a doubt, this is Museum is a MUST no matter your schedule is how tight. Suggest you can buy tickets online or through kiosk so to avoid a long queue.

Simply Breathtaking. The museum is a must see, but planning in advance will save time and frustration. If you show up to purchase a ticket in person...be prepared to wait. We worked with a tour guide and were in within 5 minutes bypassing those who had been in line for an hour+. There's A LOT to see and the organization and flow aren't intuitive...so having a private guide to connect the history and hit the highlights was invaluable. There's a lot of walking, a lot of stairs, but worth the effort and the history. If you can time your visit for the Peacock Clock ceremony...all the better, but be prepared for the crowd.

One visit is really not enough. There is really so much to see here. We have had two guided tours of various parts over two different days and still realise that we have just scratched the surface. We saw the best Rembrandt we can recall seeing. An El Greco to write home about. One of the best Impressionist collections. The magnificent Peacock clock. The Gold Room and the Diamond Room. We have already agreed to come back again!

a must see. This is like the Louvre in Paris, it simply is a must. There were long queues in the morning, but in the afternoon it was much less crowded. Choose things you want to see beforehand, because it's huge. Don't miss the Flemish, Dutch and Italian oil paintings though, and the czar's apartments.

Amazing collection at the museum. Hermitage is probably the biggest museum of art and sculptures. One would require many days to see the entire collection and so you have to be very selective about what one wants to see

Amazing collection but badly organised & too crowded. This place has an amazing and huge collection of art but the organisation and ridiculous crowds almost ruin the entire experience. The queues during the day are min. 2hrs if you turn up and buy a ticket at the door. However, what they don't tell you is that there is a bank of ticket machines just inside the main gate where you can purchase tickets almost immediately and subsequently walk straight into the museum. Alternatively pre-book your tickets on the Internet and you will save yourself hours of unnecessary queuing. Unfortunately that is not the end of it. It was raining heavily on the day of our visit so everyone had jackets and umbrellas. Only problem is, they don't allow umbrellas and jackets into the museum so you are required to check them into the cloakroom. But with the massive crowds, it's almost a literal fight to get a space in the cloakroom which were also horribly understaffed. If you've survived so far and manage to make it into exhibition itself, you're next faced with a constant struggle against the plethora of group tours who spend more time looking at the art through their phones rather than using their actual eyes! It made for an uncomfortable viewing environment. Another note, the incredible collection of Matisse is in a completely separate building opposite the main museum which we didn't realise until an hour before it closed because the app we were recommended to download had an out of date map!My advice, pre book and go on one of the days it opens late to beat the crowds, otherwise prepare yourself for battle!

Hermitage. This visit was well planned in advance. My partner purchased tickets that put us in the shortest line. Do this. the other line is quite long. This is an absolutely awesome museum. There was an exhibit of the Mongol invaders, the main staircase of the winter palace still felt like the czar was there, Pavilion Hall was interesting, The Italian rooms were excellent. I am just a regular guy and not an art critic but I loved this place.

Hermitage is Great Эрмитаж =👌. Hermitage is Great Эрмитаж = All European painters are there. Asian and African old world art is there as well.It is huge! Plan your trip. Buy your tickets over Internet. Find out before where you have to pick up tickets (free) for kids / young teens (<15)

Most unique and biggest gallery are must see!!. I visit hermitage many times when i was working in Restaurator ,but every time I visit sankt Petersburg I am always taking tour of this most exclusive museum by river Neva.highly recommend by trip advisor Valentina Deva
Great museum. Great museum but so very busy which spoilt is. Definitely worth a visit but be prepared to get crushed

A magnificent museum. This is a huge museum with so much to see. Make sure you leave plenty of time in your vacation to do it justice. We started on the top floor and worked our way down which seemed to help avoid the crowds. Remember you can only come in once. If you leave you leave.
Huge and beautiful!. This world-famous shrine to art and beauty is a wonder to behold. It is a must-see when in St. Petersburg.
Excellent . Well, only I can say - one day is not enough to see this beautiful palace. Want to come back again and again!!! Highly recommended !!!!

Impossible to avoid the crowds((. After spending two hours waiting in a line under the downpour I finally got to the museum. First problem was to find a place in the cloakroom to leave the umbrella, second - trying to make way through the numerous crowds and tourist groups in the museum.. I think the best time for visiting would be Wed or Fri evening, when the museum works will 9pm, but otherwise -there are so many people everywhere, horrible! Impossible to enjoy any pics or decor

Impressive. What a fantastic palace. Gorgeous rooms. Wonderful floors. Fantastic artworks. Words cannot explain. You need to visit and see for yourself. So much to see that you need to allow time for 2 separate visits.

Too crowded. Supposed to be the biggest museum in the world so we had to go - wish we had not. Visitors are in abundance - dozens of tours with guides disrupt the flow of people; there seems to be NO control on how many people enter the museum at any one time - a money making exercise with no thought for comfort of people. It was so crowded and hot and really quite unpleasant. I would not visit again unless I could guarantee it would be quiet. You simply cannot enjoy the contents at all. How can anybody in that environment? If you must go buy tickets in advance to avoid the LONG queues

Outstanding. If you visit nowhere else in St Petersburg make sure you visit the Hermtage and Winter Palace. The setting of each room is breathtaking and the art treasures abound. It is naturally very popular with visitors and crowded so an early start is essential.

Really good palace. Excellent place to visit...specially on a rainy day...lots of things to see...and the decoration is very impressive.If you come without a pre booked ticket don't be discouraged by the extremely long line to enter/buy tickets that can go even all the way out to the square...there are electronic kiosks in which you can buy the tickets (only by card 600RR) and get straight to the door on the far right in the inner patio.Audio guide is available at 500RR

What a collection! . I was amazed at the size of the museum collection, and very impressed! The museum is too big to see everything at once, so get a map and choose your rooms! I recommend the palace living quarters and the Greek and Roman antiquities.

Wonderful, but not the best museum I have been in!. The Hermitage is an outstanding museum, and it should not be missed if you are in St. Petersburg. It is probably one of the largest museums in the world and certainly takes hours/days to see, but I would say that I was less impressed with it than the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, or even the Vatican museum..... and many others. There did not seem to be large collections of works you find in other museums. Certainly, go see it.

so much so little time. We had a guided tour with Alla tours through this amazing museum. They arranged for us to be in before main opening so we did not encounter crowds. Our guide spoke perfect English and took us to the main attractions this museum is famous for but it is too big and too much to take in a day or two. We spent several hours and saw a lot of amazing paintings and art work with some dating BC. Amazing but a persons senses can only take in so much at once before it is overwhelming. Unless you have an area of special interests and lots of time I would invest in a private tour. If I could have stayed a week and spent 3 hours a day in this museum it would have been perfect but It still might not be enough time. When we left there was a waiting line down the street at the entrance that would have wasted several of my very valuable hours in St Petersburg.

Without a doubt worth a day (or two) to see!. You cannot visit St Petersburg without visiting the Hermitage: get here early (or buy tickets in advance) and prepare to spend the best part of a day inside this place. I ended up visiting several times over the years and always found something new or fascinating to see.If you are limited for time, read up in advance and choose an area to focus on. It can be hard to do the whole museum in one go and there is a huge range of exhibits: it's not just about paintings!
Incredible!!!. Very simple review to do here, this place is immense, yet no matter how little you see is incredible. If you ever visit St Petersburg it should be a legal requirement to visit!!!

Russian Tour . A place you want to go back to time and again. So much to see and very tiring. One thing book tickets in advance as queues are horrendous. The palace its self is amazing be sure to go to the square behind to see the grand entrance to yhe palace.

A Must! See Impressionist at new gallery (other building).. Hermitage is one of the largest museums (some say is the largest!) in the world. If you like museum, it's a must!Get tickets ahead of time. There is always a long line. It's hard to know where to go. (People there are not friendly or helpful). Luckily we hired a private tour guide who took us right in front of the "tour group" line, even there were only two of us.Do research ahead of time, so you know what to look for, or tell tour guide what you want to see. Because the museum is huge, there won't be even enough time to just walk through fast.We spent 5 hours there, tour guide said, we've seen 1% of the museum!NOTE：If you like Impressionist paintings, they have been moved to the other building-- The New Grand Enfilade at the General Staff Building, and charge additional.There are 30+ Picasso and Matisse, lots of Monet, Cezanne, Renoir, Gauguin, Van Gogh, Degas..... It's just amazing!!
Stunning collections. It's really impressive that it has uncountable amount of collections. I thought you need to spend whole life here to see all of them. They provided audio tour and free map.

An incredible place to visit. We visited the Hermitage and Winter Palace as part of a small tour group and our knowledgeable guide made sure that we saw the items of special interest, including works of art by Leonardo da Vinci, Rubens and Rembrandt. This is a vast place and it would be impossible to see everything in one day. There are cafes and a museum shop
A must see!. It's hard to say what's more incredible, the palace itself and its enormity or the magnificent pieces of art within! There's just so much to see and absorb...I loved it!

Hermitage. There are a lot of people visiting the museum at any time. Buy your ticket online to avoid super long lines. You have many beautiful things to see there. Museum employees can direct you to the things u want to see the most. If u would like to see everything in the museum you would need ages.
Amazing, overwhelming and must do. Not sure there is much more to be said about this true world gem. Architectural grandeur, phenomenal art and antiquities collection and imbued with history.

Getting tickets and entering is simple: Be careful of touts trying to steal you money. I was presented with different options to get tickets to enter the museum and Winter Palace. The concierge of my hotel , the Taleon, wanted to charge me about $27 (1500 Roubles) per person, the museum itself has an online option which ends up costing $17 per ticket, there are "tours" costing much more than you would want to spend. I was frustrated until I read on the internet that you can easily get each ticket for 600 Roubles($9), the price one pays if one waits in endless lines. Well, followng the advice read, I went to the Staff building entrance which is the curved building in front of the Hermitage, where you will be blown over by Kandinskys, Rubins and numerous other magnificent paintngs plus a a modern interior which is spectacular for just 600 Roubles per ticket which can be used to enter the vatrious sectors of the Hermitage. Just enter the staff building, follow the signs to the ticket windows. I did not wait more than two minutes on a very rainly day in which tons of people were waiting in line to get into the ""main" section, the green colored buildings.. This entire complex is magnificent, and ,by the way, there are kiosk machines like ATM machines within the staff building which can used with a credit card to buy the tickets. I was totally pleased by the experience. Just remember, it always plays to research what one wants to do and I thank the people who provided the advice I had read.

The "must see" place. You shouldn't stay in St. Petersburg and not visit Hermitage! Hermitage is the "must visit" museum with its breathtaking halls, stairs, pictures, furnitures and exhibitions.There are chances that you'll have to wait in a long line to purchase tickets (you'd better do it online), but it really worth it!

The "must see" place. You shouldn't stay in St. Petersburg and not visit Hermitage! Hermitage is the "must visit" museum with its breathtaking halls, stairs, pictures, furnitures and exhibitions.
There are chances that you'll have to wait in a long line to purchase tickets (you'd better do it online), but it really worth it!

Liked the Russian Museum better. Spending one entire day in the Hermitage I got the impression that the European paintings shown there might have been bought in bulk at the time, emphasizing quantity over quality.The queues make appreciation harder too. There were just too many people (late August, weekday but rainy day). We like the ancient Russian excavations. There's also a huge cross section of artifacts from Egypt and
One of the great sights of the world. It is so overwhelming it tends to overwhelm the exhibits so try to spread your amazement between the wonderful restoration of the building and the art

One of the world's BEST museums. If you think the Louvre is impressive, this place will blow your mind. Not only are there are pieces since Catherine the Great built her massive collection, but they have amazing contemporary art as well. The architecture of the place is masterful and worth viewing on its own. It's HUGE and the Lines are very long. There is one day of the week that it's free so we went that day, and although the line was very long it moved - took about 45 min to get it. Well worth the wait, and at least a one day activity.

This is why you came to St Petersburg!. We enjoyed a two hour visit with my children. Be sure to get tickets online. Otherwise, you'll face a very, very long line. Also, don't miss the branch on the opposite side (from the palace) of the square. The architecture of the museum itself is unusual and very interesting.

Hugely opulent Palace. The Hermitage Museum is a must-do activity if you are visiting St Petersburg. The Hermitage is located within central St Petersburg, and is on most tour itineraries of the large number of visiting cruise ships; hence the large crowds which gather well before opening time. As the crowds make their organised way through the Palace, it becomes very hard to slow the human surge in order to take in all of the grandeur of the rooms and their highly valued exhibits. The Museum / Winter Palace is incredible to view, displaying the opulence of the former Russian Czar regimes lifestyles. No wonder there was a revolution!

superb. You cant see more than a fraction of the Hermitage in one go. If you only have a few hours, take a private tour, go early, and avoid the biggest crowds. Tour guide will show you a snapshot of the highlights, likely to leave you stunned.Its unbelievable . A must see attraction globally.
Must-See. If you're going to St. Petersburg, you will definitely see the Hermitage. We spent a day there and it wasn't enough - truly one could spend a couple of days seeing everything.

Great palace and art collection. Definitely worth a visit. It offers a wide variety of exhibitions, so each one can choose to see the ones they judge most interesting if in a rush. The interiors of the palace are also worthy of a visit, along with the impressionists gallery in the opposite building to the winter palace.

Not to be missed. Incredible as one would expect. I thought there would be more artefacts but was not disappointed. There were many more paintings and sculptures than I'd thought. I would compare it to The Louvre. Magnificent experience though i am glad I was on a tour and didn't need to queue. We were treated to an acapella performance inside... no idea what that was about but it was a highlight!

What Can One Say? . The collection here is magnificent. The new exhibition of impressionists and post-impressionists (in a separate building) is exceptional. This is what the Russian elite collected, not what Russian artists created. Still, it is an essential stop in St Petersburg. Look for hidden corners like Byzantine art or Islamic Art, as well as the blockbusters on the main tour route
Beautiful. What else can you say about this attraction. It's a must visit and you might want to get tickets in advanced.
Spectacular Hermitage . I spent two days there but still not enough to see all the history and antiquities. The State Room and malachite room were especially impressive
Amesing. It is rather difficult to express how it is impressing. The state's restoration effort for the building and for the exhibited art articles is beyond the imagination.

MASSIVE So much history to take in. Take a camera. This museum is Huge. We spent about 1.5hrs inside and only saw about half of what it contains. Make sure you get a map before entering. They have convenient luggage storage an cloak room. A very memorable experience and insight into the history of not only Russia but the world.

How to beat the crowd visiting glorious Hermitage. Beat the crowds by organizing private tour . Sis and I were spared the long wait in half kilometer queue by organising private tour- just Olga the guide and Anton the driver with slick car.and us. Lovely Olga had us at the front of the queue and we were in, in just a snap of fingers. Sure the palace is full to rafters with tourists but Olga had us ducking and weaving getting to the best art in the Palace - she was walking talking art, history book just a package of detail delivered in beautiful English. If this is your once in life trip to St Petersburg it is worth saving up for a private package. . Hermitage is not to be missed, I'd rather spend more time inside than hours outside in queue. Olga said best time for visiting palaces is Winter - fewer tourists. Hmmmm I wonder why?

Art, art, art. You could spend months at that museum and still have something you have not seen. From history of the earliest time to our century, exhibitions, art book shop - take your time to research and enjoy.

Plan at least a day and a half.. It's easy to get overwhelmed by all the fabulous items here, so break it up over two days if possible. Definitely buy tickets online before hand to stand in a much shorter entrance line. Photos allowed in most but not all of the rooms. The available cafes have edible food but don't plan on anything delicious. I suggest you mark off rooms on the map as you explore; it's easy to get lost in the maze of rooms and gorgeous sights to see and end up retracing your steps or missing entire sections. The coin display on the top floor is definitely worth trip, and don't miss the interior chapel of what used to be the Winter Palace.

Crowds and More Crowds. Make sure you get tickets for the earliest time you can as the crowds circle around the building perimeter. We had a guide who helped us tremendously as she was able to move us through the throngs but it was impossible to linger anywhere. Also with the thousands of people it was very very hot.

SOOO much to see..... This Museum is very Expansive. way too much to see in a single visit. we toured with a guide and were treated to walking about the whole museum, but only stopping at several locations to view or get full details on certain works. our tour only lasted about 3-4 hours, but we felt we saw enough and were not overloaded.I would recommend a tour instead of trying to do it your self for sure if you go. but definitely GO!

I've looked forward to visiting the Hermitage for years.. I shouldn't have waited! Maybe 10 years ago it wouldn't have been so so busy. Still very impressive.
The highlight for us was the 19th and 20th century art across the square. And there were fewer visitors here. The cafe here was superb.

One of the best in the world!. This is one of the top two museums in the world in terms of size and number of antiquities, paintings and other artefacts on display.We chose to use an english speaking private guide arranged for us by our hotel and that proved to be a great success. We spent nearly five hours there moving at quite a pace and still didn't manage to see all the sections of the museum.Can't recommend it highly enough.

Breathtakingly beautiful. This is probably the busiest museum in the world - it has over 20,000 visitors per day, so the only way to avoid a bun fight is to take a private evening tour when it is open to small selected groups. Be aware though that this is not cheap, but in return you will not feel claustrophobic and be overcome with the heat. There is no air conditioning in the building. However, whatever you do if on a guided tour, essential if you do not speak Russian, you will only see what the tour guide shows you, but at least you can get a flavour of the size and wealth that was Imperial Russia.Accept the restraints and it will be a memorable experience!

One of the most amazing Art collections. impressive from the outside, and even more from the inside. Already the entrance hall and staircase is worth the visit. And what follows is endless rooms with the most amazing art you can imagine. Bring time... you will not be done in one afternoon !

Specatular Building. We went hear as part of a tour with SPb tours. This is a must see for anyone visiting st Petersburg. Beautiful rooms with spectacular decoration. If you like art this is the place to see Rembrant and Da Vinci. Go early as the queue's get very long they are hours long. Didn't effect us as we had early entry with a tour group.
Museum visit. Fantastic place and well worth a visit. Busy however but if you have the right guide they will cut through all the problems and go straight for what you want.

Excellent but book tickets online. It is an impressive museum and a must see if you travel to St. Petersburg. Luckely we booked the tickets online because otherwise the queue is a couple of hours long. So with our online tickets we just had to pick-up the audio-guide and off we went. To save time we only visited second floor and that took almost one day ;)

Not the review I thought I would write. This was not a good experience. The museum was crowded, NYC subway at rush hour crowded. The art was fine not spectacular, if you have been to Amsterdam, London, Paris and Rome you have seen it in better circumstances. We have been in palaces all over Eastern and Western Europe, this place was ovedone, way overdone. Gold paint or gilt everywhere. The rooms might have been attractive but for the all over gold covering.This being Russia and our being on a ship visa meant we had to stay with the guide, no going off to a quiter part of the museum with less paint. I have been working my way down a list of places I wanted to see, this was on the list, now I wonder why.
ONE OF THE NICEST MUSEUM ON EARTH. You could stay months visiting this museum. Everything is outstanding from the Dutch old masters, the Italian Renaissance furniture to the architecture itself

Magnificent . Hard to know where to start with this amazing place. The best thing to do is to go and take a LONG look. Busy, yes, but worth the time taken to view the exhibits. There are so many wonderful artworks but don't forget to view the building as it is truly stunning.

Unbeliveably beautiful. This will excite your senses! We booked for a two day pass but felt one day was enough as we needed to digest what we had seen as there was just sooo much to look at. Utterly amazing. Do book on line before you arrive though. We did and we were the only ones going in at the online side door while there were 2 long queues at the front.
Mind blowing. You could spend weeks checking out the Masters here...so many amazing works of art. Sculptures, furniture, paintings are just a few of the things here.

Amazing . I didn't care much about what is inside the rooms, but I was amazed by the architecture. It's very amazing and I love the truth that in every room there's at least four or five different nationalities staring and admiring the same painting or sculpture. Totally deserves a visit. PS: if you're a student show them your isic card, you'll get a free ticket rather than paying 600 Rubles. The museum closes at 6 PM, so you should go very early if you wanted to see most of the rooms, it's a VERY big museum.

Simply Amazing...with a side of Spectacular!. The art collection in the Hermitage lives up to it's reputation! We went with a guided tour from our Royal Caribbean Ship and were so happy we did. Our tour went early and actually beat some of the crowds. I would read the history before visiting, Catherine the Great, especially. You will have a greater appreciation for this indescribable collection of art that was absolutely amazing. I cannot imagine NOT seeing this museum in St. Petersburg....it was a venue not to be missed.
Wow. Incredible collection. Booked a private tour, rather than a tour through my cruise ship, and was not disappointed. This museum is amazing.

Outstanding Gold. Privileged to spend two hours with amazing guide seeing gold and jeweled treasures, some dating back over 2000 years. Things that cannot be seen anywhere else. But you need to have reservations and be prepared for cost and crowds in the major parts of the museum.
Must see. One of the must see places in Saint Petersburg. There are some paintings from Leonardo da Vinci and also some the status built buy Michelangelo. The palace is also beautiful inside

A must visit in st Petersberg. Be prepared to walk as its 5 buildings but it's a must do in STP. Best is to have a guide but it's so beautiful to absorb all what they have and the Russian historical culture.

Private Visit with Symphony Orchestra. We were so lucky to have signed up for tour from our Oceania cruise to visit the Hermitage in the evening with just two tour groups and we had the Palace to ourselves for three hours. After the private tour we sat and listened to the State Symphony of St. Petersburg for about an hour. What a treat; what an evening.
A k. Fantastic & incredible!A lot of paintings and scluptures , unbelievable architecture .... nice views

Fabulous. This is a breathtaking museum with too much to see in one day. Well worth the visit -- get E-tickets for sure as you can enter in a side entrance with no lines (be there when it opens). There is so much to see that it's hard to comment on it, but I was enchanted by the winter palace and the events associated with it. Be sure to view the highlight pieces -- the DaVinci room is very crowded but fun to get up close and personal with the items there. There is one exquisite Michelangelo sculpture that you should not miss. Otherwise, just enjoy the experience and drift through the rooms as you wish!
Great Museum . It usually has line and it is packed inside but it is worth every penny. You can't see everything in less than 2 hours. AMAZING!

good museum but crowded. Toured this Museum with a tour from the cruise line, the Museum is nice with a lot of art but is very crowded. but it is a once in a lifetime trip to see Russia, so if you go to St Petersburg fight the crowds and go it's a place to say you went and soak up some art

Incredible, but some things worth knowing beforehand. The quantity and size of the Hermitage is daunting, but of course it is a must, especially if you like art and architecture. Tips: 1. get there early - it was raining the day I went and still at 11 o'clock the queue stretched across the inner courtyard, by 1 or 2 I saw from the window that it stretched out across Palace square. If you can't buy online and only want the standard single entry ticket I'd recommend using the auto ticket machines to the left and right of the inner courtyard. I only had to queue for about ten minutes.2. If they are out of maps in English at the entrance, maybe for other languages too, make sure to ask for one - getting around with no map would have been a nightmare. 3. Be prepared for crowds. There are a lot of people visiting, but a little patience and you can still see what you want to see. There are big crowds around some of the old masters works, especially the two Da Vinci's. Most people just want a quick look and a photo so if you wait eventually you get a chance to study them up close.4. I downloaded the official audio guide app and bought the Hermitage General tour for 5 USD. I ended up going off tour to see other things, but it was still a good way to get around if you have a smartphone. As well as talking about significant features and art works it also gives directions. It can be used offline and you can listen to it with pictures at later date too. Just using the free map would be enough if you just want to admire rather than listen to the history.5. They weren't well advertised, at least not in English, but the temporary exhibitions are worth a look. I really enjoyed the Erte one (I had always thought he was French but he was from Russia) and the Byzantine art one.

Sublime beauty in every way. The Belle Epoque, the 19th & early 20th century of wealth and class society resulting in the most opulent arts and architecture in the history of humanity (before ww1 & 2 changed everything), reaches its epitome in St Petersburg. There is too much to absorb at the Hermitage in 1, 2 or even 3 days, but a visit of any length in St P cannot miss it. HUGE TIP for tix on busy days: (1) either buy online and enter by special online ticketholders' gate between small hermitage (mint green) and adjacent (pale goldenrod) buildings next to the famed Winter Palace main building (Hermitage is actually 4 riverfront palaces in a row plus satellite museums such as General Staff Museum), or (2) there are two automated ticket kiosks in that same location (btw mint green and pale goldenrod adjacent palaces) that NO-ONE ever uses (very Russian -- give no signage or information, and place satellite ticket kiosks in hidden alleyway, while thousands wait in line in main square only 50 m away.....) : ) ... good luck and enjoy!!

Amazing!!. We did a tour here when we stopped in St. Petersburg on a cruise ship. This place is amazing and there's so much to see!! Even my 7 year old twin girls were enthralled by it all!! We had a guided tour which lasted about 2 hours. The only problem was that we all got really thirsty but you're not allowed to take water bottles in so it would have been good if there were water fountains around as it was pretty hot inside!! A definite must-see!!

Must-see in St. Petersburg. Of course you have to see this museum when in St. Petersburg. Don't be confused; the palace was turned into a museum and the museum itself is the palace. It's beautiful for inside and out. Remember to wear COMFORTABLE SHOES because you'll be doing a LOT of walking. And if you're going with someone, make sure to check the entry line going into the museum because there's a huge line to get tickets, but if you're just entering, there's usually not a big line. Use the automated kiosk machines to get tickets to speed things up. There's a good color-coded map for the different exhibitions and sections, and each room is numbered so the museum is easy to navigate.Since this is a huge museum with many famous art pieces, I recommend checking the Russian Culture section and the Winter Palace Interior section first to use your time well and get an idea of the Russian style. The Russian style presented in this museum are pretty heavily influenced by French and Italian styles so it's pretty eclectic. You can see the various experimental styles that are eclectic as shown in the Winter Palace Interior exhibition-there's a room that looks like a hookah bar with Moorish style cushions and velvet fabric, for example.There are several buildings in addition to the main building. Unless you have a particular interest in the other buildings' exhibitions, I recommend getting the generic (cheapest) one that allows entry to the most popular buildings.

Must See. The Hermitage is a must see in St Petersburg. I highly recommend a guide so you will be able to see the important pieces of art. There is something for every one from Dutch masters to the impressionist. The Egyptian section is nice but is only minor finds. Your guide should be able to keep you on track. To see every thing for just 30 seconds it will take you 8 years.
More wonders than your eyes can embrace in one go.. This is the place to visit in Saint Petersbourg. Better book trough an agency to avoid the long queue for tickets or go in the evening.

Scratched the Surface. Visited here on a Sunday afternoon and according to the guide was not so busy!!! So much to see and enjoy that it really does need a local guide to help you round as you could wander for hours and miss the highlights. The museum holds all sorts of art and artefacts and the rooms themselves can be quite stunning. With paintings from world renowned artists the whole experience is difficult to convey in a few words. One of those places you just have to visit to comprehend. Just go with mindset that it will be crowded and enjoy.

Rich colelction. We visited this museum 2 times. On the first day when we visited tit was so crowed you couldn't see some of the paintings. The exhibits seem to go on forever and many of them are fabulous. I think in the hermitage would be something interesting for everyone.

Stunning. Firstly you are never going to see all of this museum in one visit as it is vast but saying that you can see some beautiful things in one day. We had a guided tour which helped as our guide had a fantastic knowledge of practically everything in the museum and were able to cover a lot of ground which may not have happened if we had one of those self guide devices hanging round our necks. If I am back in Saint Petersburg I will definitely be back in the Hermitage.

Very large collection ,lots of walking...... Spent about 3 hours in this complex - multiple buildings interconnected and multiple floors in each. Larger art collection than the Louvre? - if I recall correctly. Go with a guide - there's just too much here to do yourself / unguided in a reasonable amount of time. Some small kiosks throughout for books etc but I didn't see any cafe style stops. Lines can at times be long - but this is to be expected in St Petersburg.

Super collection of Art. The rooms of the Palace alone are worth the visit with fantastic ceilings and floors. You need more than a full day so consider a two day pass.The art covers most genres and features some of the worlds best known art. See for example Rembrandt's "Return of the prodigal son". Select you styles or simply wander taking in the best. Don't miss the works by Da Vinci.Don't miss a focus on the rooms themselves with highlights being the grand reception rooms and the Throne Room.For your entry you can also visit the General Staff Building opposite to see more modern works. You will love the display of Impressionists with at least a room dedicated to each of the great painters See paintings by Monet, Sisley, Renoir, Van Gogh, Gaugin and more.It can get very busy but the tour groups move on quickly so just wait a minute or two.
Blows your mind!. The museum has so many exhibits that apparently it can take 11 years to see them all! Pick a great guise to see the highlights. For me the Rembrandts were unforgetable.

Go in the afternoon. The concierge recommended that we wait until the next day; however, we went by that afternoon to see the line. Using the automated ticket machine, we were able to bypass the ticketing queue and go in without wait. Beautiful, and crowded. We went on the outer edges first, as going straight through meant following the same huge tour groups. They have a coat check, but there also seem to be multiple entrances/exits each with their own. TIP: Buy tickets online and use a dedicated entrance. Ticket machine onsite also saved significant time.

Best appreciated on multiple visits. This has to be one of the greatest museums in the world and as such it's best appreciated on multiple visits. Huge and overwhelming. I spent 5 hours in the Winter Palace by just whizzing through the building and just made it for an hour visit to the General Staff building for the Impressionists painting. Shame they don't do something akin to Paris Pass where you can visit Louvre for the duration of the pass validity.

A brief glimpse of the Hermitage Museum's treasures. The Hermitage Museum is a state treasure filled with endless paintings worth review. Although we spent 4 hours there, we barely touched all that it had to share. We saw highlights - a Rembrant, Michalangelo and Degas, we were unable to see all of the modern art. This museum would take years to see in its entirety so I am grateful to say I have been there.
Tiresome and badly organized. I got exhausted after the first two exhibitions. But the art was spectacular.Remember to buy tickets in the automatic machine to skip the line.

Magnificent...art, art & more art.. First up, the crowds can be oppressive. They do open at night for some select tour groups, a much recommended option if it's available to you, otherwise, be prepared to brave the crowds as their collection is impressive, large and worth viewing!

Too much to see, too little time. We spent about 6 hours in the Hermitage but felt that our tourguide's comment that it would take close to 80 hours to see all the halls was closer to the truth than our alloted time.

Of course it is good!. Once overcome the mystery of how to get a ticket: you will find automatic tickets stations right of the entrance that accept cash and cards (and are in English as well). Once you have your ticket, go to the line "people with tickets" that leads you inside where you can buy your ticket! Why is there another queue with people also having tickets? I don't know. Pass cloak room and remain on the ground floor with the prehistoric exhibition to avoid the crowd. Once the bulk of the mass has gone head to the 1 floor where you will find gorgeous room: the museum itself is a palace to the items exhibited. Just stunning, really! If you travel on your own, you will find it difficult to find your way among all the groups but that is something that will be a struggle everywhere in Russia for people traveling alone.

One of the World's Best. Even with an early entry, it is a bit crowded but well worth it. You can certainly not see it in a day and the most famous attractions are also the most crowded but our guide was very adept at getting us to the right places at the right times.
Worth the waiting time. We stood in line for almost 3 hours but did not regret it. Come in winter or early in the morning if you don't want to wait

An amazing journey.... With an art collection to rival the Louvre, the Tsar's former Winter Palace and four other buildings is home to over many paintings & artworks including panting by Da Vinci, Monet, Tembrant & Renoir. Try to get in early as the que gets very long at these venues & too crowded as well inside.

A must see!. Was looking forward to seeing this place on recommendation of someone who saw it twenty years ago. I was on a Princess cruise tour in Aug 2016. There must have been at least twenty additional tour groups there, too. Consequently, it was very crowded and we were shuffled room to room and crowded around each item that our guide was describing. While the palace is very grand and opulent, I was disappointed that what were shown was all of the Italian, etc art pieces, Greek statues, and very few items of Russian history. My friend (who was with me) told me that we were NOT shown most of what she saw in a previous trip. We had a wonderful guide who did her best to maneuver us around (about 30 people) however, I think, due to the number of tours, we were unable to see everything. TIP: Go to the restroom whenever you have a chance! There was always a line! Glad I saw the place overall.

Excellent cafe!. The State Hermitage Museum is one of the world's 'must-see' attractions. Visitors travel from across the globe to view paintings by Rembrandt, the Dutch Masters, and the early Expressionists, as well as the grand state rooms of the Winter Gardens.However, for us, the greatest exhibit was the amazing selection of cakes and other goodies in the museun cafe. It can be thirsty work walking the miles of corridors adored with priceless objets d'art, but a cup of tea and a danish pastry brings fresh colour to many a faded artefact and restoration to many a frayed work of art. On the whole, the museum represents good value for money and the famous queues, although scarily impressive, are not actually that bad and do keep moving. There is no good reason to miss out on visiting this stunning wonder of the world. Do not leave it to your '100 things I must do before I die'. Go now - before the danish pastries run out.

Lots to see!. The entrance way to the museum sets up what's inside very nicely. The queues are generally very long so go under the left or right hand side archways and you will find ticket kiosks, these give you a Q jump. You purchase the ticket(s) in August 2016 600r for an adult, these allow you to gain entry but more importantly skip the massive Q! Once inside enjoy, you can either plan ahead where you would like to go or if you want to wonder around and just look at things it equally as enjoyable, I did the latter. If you love art you could spend the day inside, if like me you like art, 2 hours is enough time to walk around and look at all the different pieces of art.

Excellent Museum. Erstwhile winter palace of Czars now a museum housing invaluable paintings by masters like Rembrandt, Van Dyke etc. There is also a smaller collection of statues and an Egyptian section.

3rd museum in the word. Big. Very crowded. Different parts for different countries. Valuable things on it. Most about Art and history. Place to keep your things safe and a caffe was also available there

So much beauty!. From the outside the palace is vast and breath-taking. The courtyard is also full of fantastic architecture and is free to visit. Inside one room leads to another and is full of world leading art works. Great value if you are an art lover.

Day at the Hermitage is a SPB must. Its an amazing place. Buy your ticket online to skip the line! Plan your tour ahead of time and know there are multiple buildings to see. Your feet will hurt after a day at the museum. Downloaded the app for iPhone it was ok.
There is a lot of Historical Artefacts in this Museum!. The Winter Palace is huge and there is a lot of interesting art to see! - It helps, if you know a little about the Russian history...

Glorious! Be prepared for crowds and try to spend multiple days.. Loved the Winter Palace and the Hermitage. The history, the scale starting from the outside at the Hermitage square. Room after room of wonderfully detailed and preserved rooms open a window to a grand time for royalty in Russia. It is very crowded so be prepared for it. Ideally multiple days but realistically not so join a good tour.
Hermitage museum. It was so stunning and ornate. Lots of baroque detailing. Definitely worth going. Incredible collection of art especially Rembrandt.

Amazing!. We had two separate visits. Absolutely spectacular collection of art and the architecture all around was beautiful. This is a "must see" attraction in St. Petersburg. Wish we had more time to linger in the plaza.

Grand, that's what it is!. No doubt that this spectacular building contains Russia's most spectacular artpieces. Bring your walking shoes and make choices if you want to have any feet left. If you buy tickets on the internet you might be slightly more expensive off, but you will save yourself the very long queues. We were in in 5 minutes! Recently the impressionists moved to the General Staff building opposite of the Hermitage, giving it the space it deserves! It is not well know and there are no lines. Your internet pass is valid here as well. Of you take a two day pass, spend one on the winterpalace and one on the Impressionists. The Rembrant collection is awesome, as is the huge Picasso collection. As I said, pick you choice, make it easy by downloading the audiotour app of the Hermitage, there is a one hour one and another available. Guided tours tend to race through.

Beautiful . Let start with how to get in:if you have a credit card, book your tickets online, print them and enter from the side entrance number 4 with no queue at all. You will save yourself a couple hours of wait in line by the main entrance.About the museum:I was shocked to discover that trip advisor rate the hermitage as a second best thing to do in St Petersburg but after visiting it I must agree. The building itself is amazing and it's really worth visit.The art inside is all European (very little Russian culture to be discovered here).Anyway definitely worth seeing.

Amazing Museum. Incredible..amazing..opulent...luxurious. Our tour wasn't able to cover very much in the short time we were there, but the things we saw were breathtaking. Crowds were the only downside here.

Better Than Versailles. Biggest Art Museum on Earth. Best Art Collection. It was an amazing experience for me (I am a genuine art lover) going into a single place with so many beautiful paintings on display. For art lovers like me, this is heaven! If you are not a genuine art lover, however, please stay away from this.

Not really special, just an extension of other large European museums. Crowded and expensive too.. I hoped to see Russian art, but only saw hall after hall of French, Italian, and Dutch paintings, and Greek statuary all taken from their home countries. Not that any of it was bad, just not about Russia! The tour guide was good, but a bit of propaganda sneaked into her commentary. Entry was expensive, galleries were very crowded, some to the point of feeling dangerous. We were pushed along so quickly that we couldn't study any paintings at length. I would not recommend this museum to anyone. Visit the Louvre instead, and stick to Russian art when in Russia.

World Class Museum. There is more to see than time allowed. There were two Leonardo di Vinci paintings and there are only 14 in the world. There was a wonderful Michelangelo sculpture. A separate building houses impressionist paintings and the collection is outstandijng.

Need a few days, instead of a few hours!!!!!. The Winter Palace is an opulent imperial residence filled with a vast number of European masterworks. To avoid the crowds, consider cruise-line evening visits.

Too many tourist in Aug. Pictures and info on youtube made this place grander than itself for me.I went around 3:30pm (weekday) and was totally sandwiched amongst tourists. BOs, ill mannered group tourists and loud yells made it very unpleasant for me. Kudos to Russian citizens for putting up with chaotic tourists.

WOW!!. Massive museum with tons of exhibits! From ancient Egypt to Roman artifacts to da Vinci, Michaelangelo, Picasso, Rembrandt, etc. The museum definitely lives up to its reputation and is a must visit in the city. Tip: plan your trip to the museum in advance to make it easier to cover the most important parts of the building.
Hernitage Museum. Make sure you are with a tour company if you don't want to stand in line for hours to get in. Very impressive.

UNBELIEVABLE. This is a do not miss attraction. To be right there 2 feet away from a Rembrandt gives you goosies. you really need 2 days but can still take in a lot in a day. Take a purse fan it gets hot in there. lNo flash on cameras. Try to book a tour with Guide Guru (Anna).

General Palace was the highlight of trip so far. The Hermitage visit needs needs to be planned , from buying tickets to knowing which door to enter so you don't wait with the other bunnies buying tickets on the day. Get the 2 day ticket , that way you can go back to concentrate on what you liked.I was blown away with the French masterpieces. Concentrating them in rooms by artist almost overhelms you , but in a good way.

Private visit on a Monday which was wonderful!. You must see this museum on your trip. It is wonderful and you can see everything really close up. You cannot take long coats or water into this museum.

Opulent grandeur. This gorgeous palace did not disappoint. A must see if you are in St Petersburg.Be aware that the ticket lines can be dauntlingly long and it is much quicker to buy tickets at the machine. Buying tickets online is considerably more expensive than buying at the palace.Unfortunately the palace was, understandably, incredibly crowded and at times even the vast rooms felt stifling. It might be a good idea to get there early to beat as much of the crowd as possible.In spite of this, you cannot miss this attraction.

Wonderful but.... The whole experience in the Hermitage museum was really positive. The building itself is absurdly beautiful (both outside and inside), the rooms are breathtaking and there are so many masterpieces that just a day there won't be enough.But I have to say that is quite disorganised. There were very long lines to enter the museum, luckily we had already booked our tickets online. And going were the door for online bookers was we saw some electronic machines that sold tickets and nobody was there, because there was no even a signal.Then it is absurd that in a museum like that groups are not regulated! You can't even stand one minute in front a masterpiece that a group of 50 (!!!!) people enter the room and push to get in front of the painting. It was really tiring that I couldn't stand more than four hours, and it's a pity because as I said before it is not enough at all!Then in some rooms it was really warm and I have been stung several times by big mosquitos.I think that with all the money they get, they should try to solve these problems and it will be perfect.

Stunning. We visited through TJ Travel and what a joy that was. They organise a visit before the official opening hours which meant we had two hours of guided touring with NO crowds.How fantastic is that?It is overwhelming as there is so much to see.Da Vinci, Michael Angelo, Rueben, etc are all here along with the three graces.The building is amazing and the exhibits are endless.An amazing experience.Clean toilets.Highly recommended.

Worthwhile and a Must See. We had a whirlwind visit to The Hermitage with our guide. With a limited time in St. Petersburg and so much to see we could only spend a few hours at the museum but any time spent here is worthwhile. We also visited the exhibits at the General Staff Building for a couple of hours one afternoon.

Cannot Miss This! (Read review for secret). You need to do this as a group tour because they are allowed early entry before the public opening time. They also have their own entrance & exit so you avoid the crowds this way too. A huge prospect to try and do all in one visit. We were lucky enough to have the early entry and we had the place practically to ourselves for about an hour (along with a few other groups), we covered a lot of ground and also went to the "Gold Room" for a private tour. The building, along with the art is beyond compare. We did encounter a small crowd at the Rembrandt's and da Vinci's but it was manageable. ABSOLUTELY AWESOME!

A must see . This is an amazing place with stunning architecture and world class art. It's the number one attraction and queue are long so book online inadvance or if not use the machines inside the main courtyard rather than queuing for hours

A Reason to Visit St. Petersburg. The royal rooms in the palace are amazing. Don't miss the peacock clock. Then, of course, there is the art collection. If you love Rembrandt,Titian, Rubens, and Poussin -- you gotta go. I don't happen to love them, but I was pretty satisfied to see these in passing plus the royal rooms plus the two incredible da Vincis plus the Raphael hallway (copied from a Raphael hallway in the Vatican).

Too much to see in one day, and summer crowds are horrific. The Heritage is on a level of the Louvre in Paris. The vast number of things to see and the building itself is extremely impressive. Only the Vatican Museum in Italy is in this class.

Huge and beautiful . The place is absolutely huge. You'll need at least half a day to see it. Essentially an art museum with hundreds of pieces displayef in the luxurious and just as beautiful rooms of the winter palace. Tickets are only about $9. The line does get big but you can bypass it and go to the ticket machines which are a lot faster.

A treasure for whole man kind.. RIcher than Louvre, bigger than London National Gallery plus British Museum, this is a unique place to be. Book on internet to avoid the frightening queue outside the museum and be slow. The museum need time and A LOT OF ENERGY! (buy the 2days ticket, it allows you to make a break).

Impossible to visit. Although a fabulous museum it was almost impossible to visit due to the crowds. It seems like a big mall and a crowded football match at the same time, I was there in August and it was impossible to approach some paintings. Horrible!

absolute must - but everyone says that.. Of course it's a must, and it is worth the hype.Buy and print your tickets online, and get in faster.Plan to be there early (10.30) and you will get to see more rooms with less other people, but too be honest, everyone is going to show up.The content is astonishing. The luxury is astonishing, the concept and execution of the vision is astonishing.We purchased a two day ticket, which allowed for a repeat visit - or like we did - the chance to extend the visit to the main complex and use the second day for the other branches. It's open late on Friday nights as well, which may help play your time. Don't miss the General Staff Building on the other side of Palace Square (included in the ticket price) - especially if you are interested in the Impressionist and 20th century art.There's also the chance to see a smaller exposition of Peter the Great's original Hermitage, just along the Embankment from the State Hermitage, in the Hermitage Theatre. When we were there, we were the only people in the building that weren't staff.

The ultimate blend of history and beauty. As you walk around this museum, you will immediately appreciate that the building itself is a treasure, every room we walked through, more beautiful than the last. Within these beautiful rooms there is a Wealth of treasures. Rembrandt, Leonardo de Vinci, beautiful original art work that is as historically precious as it is beautiful. You could spend weeks in this place and still not see it all.

Only wished we had more time. The Hermitage was simply magnificent. The only reason I didn't rate it excellent is because I couldn't see it all. We only had 2 hours to visit. Our guide told us, that you could spend a week there and not see it all. What we did see was beautiful.

Lovely Hermitage!. Wonderful, if overwhelming museum. It might take days (weeks) to see everything in this museum. So do a bit of homework on what is there to plan your visit. There are YouTube videos with an overview of the treasures in the Hermitage worth a look. You must pre-book to get inside (& extra admission fee) the Gold Room, but it was stunning and worth it. Very crowded in summer, and the guides reminded us constantly to watch out for pick-pockets inside the museum.
World Renowned Collection. Leave time to visit the impressionist, cubism, and modern art found not in the main building. Great collection of art from around the world.

Modest? Moi?. A must see although we found the outside as stunning as the inside. Opulent expansive mansion huge square, statues etc. Inside it is a tourist nightmare and potentially takes 15 years to see all exhibits. I would take a guided tour just to not get lost as very difficult to escape once inside and awfully stuffy and hot in the summer. I would go early and not in high season. Interesting inside but I got the general impression after a few rooms but the tour takes a minimum of about 2 hours if you are lucky. Worth ticking off but be prepared to be exhausted.

A palace full of treasures!. Buy your tickets at the automated machines in the courtyard, and skip the large queues. It will be crowded, so be patient and plan what you want to see. 20th century art is across the square in the general staff building (a lot quieter!)

Great!!. Definitely need a whole day to see everything. Id recommend queuing early so you can get in on time. Entry is relatively cheap as well. The artwork is exquisite -great opportunity to understand the true grandeur of the Tsarist empire.
Best art museum ever . This is as good as it suggests. The winter palace itself is amazing. The art collection is phenomenal. Shame about the crazy number of crowds. They should limit numbers

Hermitage and Winter Palace. Must see!!!!! Absolutely Amazing! If you really want to see everything, it would take days and days. So try to plan what you would like to see so you don't wonder aimlessly and waste time - it is huge! We went in July and it was CROWDED!!!!!! If you can do a little research to find out maybe a time that is better to go - early in the day or a bit later after the tours leave.
