Overwhelming, rude staff. It goes without saying that the Hermitage is an amazing building with a fantastic collection of art. However, the staff are extremely rude (even by Russian standards!) and all is poorly laid out/explained - modern art is located in a poorly signed, separate building on the other side of Palace Square, for example, and you could easily miss this, not knowing that your ticket gets you entry to both parts.

Hermitage . Our guide was knowledgable and well organized. We maximized our time at this great place. Her explanations were clear and interesting. She took us to lunch at a charming Russian cafe. We were able to fond about 2 hours at the Hermitage.
Beautiful and Huge. We spent three hours here and just barely skimmed the surface of this huge museum. We had a private tour guide and I don['t know how you could do this museum without one.

Incredible Palace. The Hermitage Palace is what you would expect a Tsar of Russia to live in. It was immense (1001 rooms)...we spent 2 1/2 hours there and only saw a small part of it. It is beautiful palace.

You must spend a day here and skip lunch. If you are an fan of art and history, be prepared to spend a whole day here without meal or drink - well you can always adjourn to the café near the exit point before heading back into the museum itself. Leave your stuff at the cloak room, they'll be safe. As usual, no large bags at the security scan/checkpoint.Aside from the large collection of art (paintings, sculptures etc) and antiques, there are two large collection not to be missed: the Classical collection and the Egyptian collection.The classical collection has some of the best ancient Greek artefacts on display from every day utensils to armour and marble carvings that used to adorn Greek temples. It is housed in a hall that looked like you are in Crete or ancient Athens.The Egyptian collection is one where we felt was "worth more" than the one in Cairo. Not in the number of exhibits but in terms of the quality, display and the lack of a crowd. There is a real mummy on display when we were there, so you do not need to pay extra like somewhere else (ahem) for the viewing pleasure.At the end of the whole tour, your eyes may be popping our from sheer exhaustion of looking at all these beautiful and well preserved exhibits. Almost every corner of the Hermitage is a piece of vintage or antiquity!Coming out to Palace square is probably a relieve as the large expanse should calm you as you soak in the beauty of the Winter Palace in the background.

First class presentation. We visited the Hermitage Museum in St Petersburg as part of our 12 night Volga Dream program. While this was one of a number of similar attractions it stood out due to the quality of the presentations, ease to navigate the floor plan and overall organisation. Highly recommended to anyone visiting St Petersburg

Such beauty and opulence!. Every tour group gets there the hour before the museum opens to the public, so be prepared for crowds. But it is so worth it! Our group with TJ Travel was small (12 people) and our tour guide, Dina, was able to get us in and around the crowds to see so much.
So many amazing things to see.. You could take weeks to wander the halls of this amazing museum and still not see everything. The Winter Palace is truly a must for all visitors to St Petersburg.

Can't beat Peterhof Palace. The biggest mistake I made was, I visited Peterhof palace before The State Hermitage. It's a very huge area so not recommended for people who can't walk much..plus there are so many exhibits that no matter how hard u try it's impossible to see even half of it , so u always have that feeling that u have not seen the whole of it, nevertheless it's a must if u r in St Petersburg but make sure to visit it before Peterhof Palace..Hermitage is well maintained and looked after unlike most of the historical sites in India.

Private tour through the Hermitage. We went through the Hermitage with our private tour guide and learned so much about this museum and Winter Palace. The rooms are grand and filled with so much detail and history. We especially liked to view the artwork. Our two year old slept in the stroller throughout the entire tour but I think this wouldn't be a fun place for a toddler if they weren't sleeping. There's just too many things that they could get into that are not allowed to be touched! :)

Opulence, History, Architecture. How I wish I could spend a year viewing the interior of the building and its treasures. Our guide advised that to look at every exhibit for 30 seconds would take 10 years of one's life. It is a vast building so my wife and I had to make do with a selection of rooms and the Gold Room. Overwhelming opulence, treasures at every turn both as part of the building and separately displayed. As with most museums in the city, the huge collections of art, culture & antiquities are breathtaking. Words fail to adequately describe.One major drawback - the hordes, and I do mean hordes of visitors in every room and we visited in what is regarded as off-season.
Must visit. This museum is amazing by itself. The palace is magnificent: the decoration is fantastic! There are a lot of drawings of Rembrandt. Worth place to visit.
Just a taste!. We were told if one spent 1 minute in front of each exhibit, it would take 8 years to see them all. We were lucky to have been able to have 3 hours to be in awe of all housed here.
Amazing museum. A must visit! One can spend few days there but it is possible to get a good impression by visiting the highlights within about four hours. By tickets on line in advance.
Great works of art. This museum holds a lot of artwork and paintings by various people. It also holds treasures of the Romanovs as well. It is a must see on anyone's Russia visit list.

Wow . Fabulous! Beautiful sights in this amazing museum /art gallery. Take time to study the floor plan to find your way around. And do go to the beautiful and newly restored buildings that house the french impressionists. ... amazing

Really big!. A very big attraction and impossible to appreciate in one day. Do your research upfront and focus on a few halls only. Probably the only 100% wheelchair friendly attraction we visited in St. Petersburg and Moscow.

Great History Museum. This place is packed with artifacts from Asia and Europe, from thousands of years B.C. through recent times. There are entire rooms still as they were used in past times. Much of it surrounding the families that ruled during the past several centuries.

Must See!. This museum is truly amazing! You could spend 2 weeks and still not see it all! Truly a Russian treasure of art, sculpture and design. The Gold Room was very impressive with centuries old items from jewelry to crowns. This is a must see in St Petersburg !

Rivals the Louvre and the Vatican museum. Truly a very special place. Get a guide. It is critical to appreciate the Hermitage. My one overwhelming impression after visiting this place: It is no wonder that they had a revolution. I hope we are not headed that way in the modern US as well.

Without words.. Nothing can be said that wasn't said before.
It is breathtaking. You can walk for days and be amazed with every room you visit. Got dizzy from all the details.

This is the 1st museum in the world. I heard that Louvre Museum has a lot of exhibits. But it was totally wrong. State Hermitage has more exhibits than Louvre unofficially. Whatever, i saw a lot of beautiful arts, statues, information. I would like to recommend every people should visit Hermitage Museum in your life.

Delightful but much like the French equivalent. A nice way to spend the afternoon with the Royal winter palace and State Hermitage Museum with over 3 million paints, sculptures -and artefacts. The design is very much like Versailles although more compact and the artworks were really wonderful. It can be a bit of sensory overload and the crowds were huge. We had a guide which is a must to get through the highlights and find you way through the maze of rooms and corridors.

Amazing. This was the main reason for visiting St. P. and we were not disappointed. Our tour guide took us to the highlights for two hours but if we had been here on our own we would have visited over two days to take in everything...It is an amazing place. Unfortunately, one of our group had his wallet stolen and missed the tour as he had to contact his bank etc., so be warned...not only here but everywhere (as is in all tourist places) watch your belongings....

So much great art! Interesting Palace History. We were fortunate to have a tour guy who was an art lover and made this such a great experience. We loved the rooms that are maintained as the old palace. We love the story about why they named it the Hermitage (for the hermit queen who had tables that raised an lowered so if she did not even want to see a servant she did not have to). Mostly we loved the amazing art. Do not come here looking for Russian art. It is in a different museum, but the rest of Europe is so well represented here. Also, do not miss the large peacock clock. Though it is only allowed to actually function in full on Tuesday evenings at 7:00, there is a great video to show what it does. Must see. In short, a couple of hours here is not enough but it was all we had.
Busy busy busy. Tips.... Make you you book online or use the automated booking system with your cc in the side street. Great way to beat the queues as well as go against the traffic.

Overload !. A amazing guilt trip. More treasure here than anyone could believe.Imagine if they had used a third of it to aid their people? The rooms and art are spectacular. Just the parkay floors are spellbinding, if you can look down.

Just amazing. We had bought the tickets on line, lots of queues, bit confusing. It was raining so we were told to go to cloakroom, wasn't allowed rucksack either, more queuing although its free. Once we entered it was mind blowing, you could spend days in there. After getting away from all the tours we were able to go at our own pace, you go from one room to another and just get further amazed. There is the architecture, the painted walls and ceilings, grand master paintings, the gold everywhere, you could do a whole week there. Lots of custodians just sitting there, no smiles whatsoever. Not too be missed. We used our two dat ticked to go to the Staff office across the square where it is a lot quieter but just as amazing. Money has been lavished on all the properties and they have apparently a store of more treasures elsewhere. It was good to see a lot of Russian visitors amongst the many Asian groups taking all the photos, do they paper their walls with all their selfless!! NOT TO BE MISSED
Great Art Collection. Ranks as one of the worlds best art museums. You could easily spend two whole days here. On par with the Louvre in Paris.

You will need a month or more to see everything. Outstanding art museum. The problem is it is super crowded and these days you need to deal with tight Russian restrictions. So get a tour guide in advance this will usually get you in an hour earlier and they will head you to the attractions they like best. Ideally you will have a few days to visit on your own (unlikely). An artist friend who spent six months in St. Petersburg told me he never saw more than about 20% of the hermitage during the six months; it was just too difficult to access everything.

State Hermitage Museum. The Hermitage museum is so big and the interior full of gold artifacts and sculptures. Many of the rooms has so many beautiful paintings done by famous artists. The museum is well kept and maintained.

Very big museum. You need more than one day to realy explore the museum as it should be. Focus on the main art pieces to maximize your time. A little bit annoying is the crowd of groups that can make any room small no matter the size of it.

Must See. Of course if you go to Saint Petersburg you must go to the Hermitage. We went as part of our two day tour and thus got to skip the lines and enter an hour earlier, but however you get there be assured it is worth the trip. All the magnificence of the Russian empire is fully on display. And to think that all of the items on display were taken out and hidden from the Germans before they occupied the city and tried to destroy the building. Far too many works of art to even try to list. Go, take your time, and enjoy.

Plan on spending a day!. There are so many things to see and a day isn't even sufficient time!You can see the paintings from the masters Rembrandt, Van Gogh, Picasso etc as well as other not so well known artists.There are sculptures; furniture displays; clothing; jewelry, etc to see these amazing historical items - wonderful!

Scintillating St. Petersburg. The museum has an incredible collection although some of the explanatory cards look like Stalin typed them up. Great exhibits showing the treasures recovered from warrior tombs.
Wow. Better plan the visit. It's truly mammoth and a maze to navigate. If time is tight, you'd better pick the exhibits/galleries ahead and prepare for distractions. Incredible.

Big and Beautiful. Highlight of the trip. We purchased overpriced tickets from the Hermitage website in advance to skip the line. The rooms of the winter palace are impressive. An audioguide is worth it
Beautiful. Is one of the most important museum in Europe, the decoration and architecture from the room is amazing and the arts objects incredible. If you have a student card is free the entrance.

One of the greates museums in Europe. It;s collection is as good as the Louvre o Met and the place is a Palace so you get two for one. Dont miss the contemporary art collection at the Anexo, opposite to the palace.
Buy tickets online!. If you want to avoid the long queue to the ticket desk, just buy tickets online. On your printed tickets there also will be the link to audio guide you can download and use.
oh, the second biggest in the world. the greatest museum. very beautiful interior, fantastic collection! love egyptian part of it. as well as the roman and greek scuptures

Highlight of ST. Petersburg. Once again a must see site, paintings artwork, see the gold room costs extra
See it with a small group NOT a large cruise ship tour, you will regret your choice if you book it through the cruise ship

Great. The experience was great. There are so many paintings that we were not able to see them properly. After that we went to get a cup of coffee and a snack. When it comes to coffee selection is a bit limited.

One of the top museums in the world. This museum was once the Winter Palace for the Romanov's and is very ornate. The building's interior is as impressive as it's art. Today the Hermitage is a museum that contains Catherine the Great's art collection. Many believe that this museum rivals the Louvre in Paris. If you enjoy the works of Da Vinci and Rembrandt, then this is your kinda place. Guided tours are available.
Winter Palace. Beautifully restored, get a guide to take you to the best places and explain so of the historic points throughout, have comfortable shoes as you will cover a lot of ground.

Fantastic collection but plan well. You'll already know that this is one of the worlds largest art collections and there are some great exhibits here but be warned you won't see it all in a day. Or even a week - it is huge! It's also a bit over the top; massive rooms given over to 50 or so paintings in almost identical styles (you know those scary religious one?) - the building itself is fantastic but it passes you by as you're immersed in room after room of art. Top tips: book online a day ahead and save the queues (or lines). Get a map beforehand and plan what you want to see.

Lots of history. Filled with room of art, artifacts and sculptures from different parts of Europe. It can be quite overwhelming after a few hours. Tip: Instead of standing in a long Que for the tickets, there are some automated machines at the entrance from which you can buy tickets immediately. Somehow, not many people know about this,

You could spend a day, but you'll want more. This is a huge museum, with so many incredible works of art. Start with the Russian Imperial collection, then nationalize art in private hands after the revolution, and you get an exhaustive collection. You need about three hours if you are just going to walk through without stopping much, especially as now the more recent art (impressionists) is housed in a separate building across the plaza. we had two half day stints and were very pleased with what we got to see, but could have gone back for another day. I suggest splitting it up, as it can get mind-numbing after a few hours - one gallery just filled with Rembrandts. The newly developed space for the impressionists is beautifully designed, with plenty of room for the art. One downside of the displays in the Winter Palace and adjoining buildings is that there is ofter reflected light on the paintings, making some works difficult to see. I could have used a polarizing filter on my camera, as some of the work was impossible to photograph well without one.

Must visit!. If you are in St Petersburg you must be one or twice in this museum. It is beter to go there not n the season of cruises but you shourd see the collections of painting and the interiors of the building of the museum.

Amazing beauty. This place is amazingly beautiful. Each door and each floor and a wall were like paintings. Plus so many things to look at. Make sure you have enough time to see everything. We were walking in a very fast pace and it took us 3 hours and we still did not see everything.

A beautiful Museum. Another of the must stops on any visit to St Petersburg. We had a private tour thru Viking Cruises so we didn't have to fight the long lines to get in. Our private guide also knew the shortcuts to avoid some of the huge crowds and still let us see everything of importance. This was Catherine the Great's winter palace and it houses her massive collection of art. Probably one of the biggest & best collections in the world. There are four main buildings in the complex. We saw the Throne Room where the Tsars received visitors. Also saw the Gallery of 1812 where there are 332 portraits of Russian Generals hanging as well as Pavilion Hall with it's many gilded columns. Lastly the Gold Room that holds the collection of Scythian gold ornaments from the 7th to the 4th centuries BC. These were excavated from ancient burial sites around the Black Sea.

Interesting . I highly recommend a visit to this museum. You really need about 3 hours to see it. There are so many paintings,sculptures,furniture,architecture,artifacts to look at. It helps to have a plan and a map of the place (they will provide one inside for free). The rooms are numbered so it is easy to find out where you are. The palace is connected to the museum.

Exhausting, but worth it with a guide. There are too many things to see in here, but what I liked most were the parquet floors (yes, that's right!). Of course the collection of renaissance art is amazing, if that's your kind of thing. Go with a guide, or a set plan, otherwise you'll get exhausted and overwhelmed by the stuff inside.

Simply breathtaking!. The Hermitage, Catherine the Great's winter palace, is simply gorgeous. We took a private tour through Express to Russia through the palace. Would highly recommend some sort of guide as the palace has SO much intriguing history.Watch for the Hermitage cats :) About 100 cats live at the Hermitage and even have their own caretaker. Apparently, cats helped citizens of St. Petersburg survive during the siege by bringing them rodents to eat.
crowded but worth it. This museum complex is one of the bests in the world as far as heritage and art goes. The organisation of tours, tickets, infos etc. still have huge potentials.

Breath Taking Collection of Art. If you enjoy art and history the Hermitage is a must see in your lifetime. As I strolled through this beautiful palace I found myself pausing at almost every step to view another piece of this overwhelming collection of magnificent artwork. Since my day trip to St. Petersburg limited the time I could spend at the Hermitage after more than four hours in he palace I knew that I would return some day.

Huge and overhelming exposition. If you're real art admirer you should definitely visit this place. There are lots of things which are worth to see.Still be ready that the Hermitage tourist map will be difficult to read, the staff might mot be friendly (it depended on particular personalities), local wi-fi is intended only to download the Hermitage mobile app and will not you open anything else.Don't expect to see everything during one visit unless you intend to stay here from morning till closure, so plan in advance what you want to see.Don't take children with you as they will be bored soon and long walks will make them tired.Overall - most probably you will get the full satisfaction from your visit if you get prepared to it.

Lost all sense of time. In an ideal world you would have a spare week to look around The Hermitage and Winter Palace. Stunning from every aspect. My advice, research the things you want to see in advance, pick up a map when you buy your ticket and just head to those places. The Winter Palace is a must see! Take time out to visit the Diamond Room (separate entrance fee) the horse blanket with 16,000 diamonds must be seen! Your guided the trip for 2 can be around £100, we ouch asked general entrance tickets approx £6 each, an audio guide £1.00 and the diamond room tour in English £3.00 - check at the ticket desk for timings.

Gold and amber. This is an awesome place to visit and were it not for a cruise I was on, it was somewhere I would never have gone to. We had a wonderful guide who had a vast knowledge of the places she took us but as we had a big itinerary things were a little rushed. Mush was made of the Amber room, the cost and no photographs allowed. It was not explained why and most of our group would have liked to have a photo to show friends and family something they will probably never see.

Go Early & Spend The Day Here. There is so much to see in this grand museum, to spend less than a day there will do it no justice. It is huge and each chamber is filled with not only art, but sculptures. Definitely need a guide of some sort to decipher what you are looking at. An audio guide is good but a knowledgeable tour guide is the best. Unfortunately, we had limited time to spend at this museum so we basically rushed through each room and could not spend as much time as we wanted, and the line going into the museum was outrageously long even though each ticket had an assigned time to it. I understand that you could enter later than your assigned time but not before. Although the line going in was somewhat orderly, we still had tour groups who was running late and tried to cut the line to gain admittance so there were some chaos. But once inside, you'll appreciate that the wait was well worth it.

Unbelievable, overwhelming. I am still at a loss for words trying to describe this magnificent and overwhelming museum. You can spend days here, get lost and still discover new things. Go visit, experience it.

Beautiful but needed more time . My sister & I visited the winter palace & saw some of the art exhibits. Since we had limited time we had to be strategic on what rooms we went to. Luckily we had Rick Steves' book with us and it had a walking tour of the highlights. This was a great overview. We spent four hours here and barely covered everything. I will be coming back on my next visit.

Giant collection . This is of course a giant art collection but it's also a great insight into the mindset of the ruling class in Russia of 300 years ago. Winner take all. Everything is overboard sumptuous.
Advertising is not needed . The main minus - a lot of tourists. Always. But you must visit this beauty! What a spectacular the library of Nikolay! And not only...of course.

Stunning!. A huge museum which we were told if you allowed 30 seconds per item, would take 19 years to view everything!! Like other museums you go an get right up close to the objects and paintings. A guide is advisable to steer you through the most popular sections.

Jewel in the form of palace. Mesmerizing n filled with tranquility. The palace is charismatic n we were awed by its beauty. We saw it during day but during the night cruise its beauty was breathtaking. We were over awed by the opulence of the rooms and chambers. The artwork is incredible, the collection has Rembrandt, Da Vinci, Michaelangelo, etc, this is a once in a lifetime opportunity to see something so special.

Winter Palace and Wonderful Art!. Keep time to explore. do research into what rooms you want to see! check out the Architecture, and the Art! it is Fabulous!It is all indoors, so on a rainy day, it could be a good activity.

Everything...wow. I've been the Prado, Louvre, Reina Sofia, and this one ranks up there with them all. The buildings themselves are art, even if the walls were stripped of the paintings. Definitely a must see...
No need to advertise. A world class jewel. Perhaps one of the most impressive palaces and art galleries in the world. An absolute must to visit. Get a tour to avoid likely lines.

world class!!. We took a private tour allowing us to avoid the line ups. We were over awed by the opulence of the rooms and chambers. The artwork is incredible, the collection has Rembrandt, Da Vinci, Michaelangelo, etc, this is a once in a lifetime opportunity to see something so special. Only downside are all the American cruise ship groups, gets very crowded.

Amazing Experience. The Hermitage cannot be described adequately, it must be seen. Even without the artifacts, the building alone would be worth the visit. The amount of gold on columns and ceilings is beyond belief. It makes you understand why the Czars were overthrown. The art is everywhere with many, many masters. An entire room is dedicated to Rembrandt. You would need an entire week to explore every room. A tour with a guide is highly recommended to make sure you see the highlights. When we were there, the crowds were huge and most areas very crowded. We were told the daily attendance is around 10,000.Absolutely a treasure.

Day visit. With 3 days in St Petersburg this visit was a must! However I would allow at least two days to get around the collections and the winter palace as until you arrive, you can not appreciate the sheer scale of the landmarks. A guided tour is a must to really appreciate the collections. I would go again but would be a little more prepared to put up with crowds and queues.

Don' buy a combined ticket!. The Hermitage and the Winter Palace are absolutely worth a visit, but don't buy a combined ticket. You won't have either time or stamina to visit only one more museum or palace on the same day. There is no queue either, except the first hour after the daily opening, so you don't need an extra ticket from the ticket machine.By the way, Peter's Winter Palace (also included in the combined ticket) is a joke, not a museum.
A very large museum. There a very many item to view and a couple of days would be needed to do it justice. We did it in a few hours so in the end things become a blur.Well worth the visit!

Immense and Breathtaking. The Hermitage is certainly a must see. However, if you looked at each item for 1 minute, it would take you 6 years to see everything. That's why a guided tour is best - they will show you what's significant in the time allowed. Also, guided tours get early admission.
Exquisite Works. Truly a first class museum with a wonderful collection of art. They even have an entire room dedicated to Rembrandt works.

A Must-See. The Winter Palace is incredibly opulent, and the art works in The Hermitage are second only to the Louvre. We went at the beginning of May, and there were already crowds, and the room were uncomfortably hot. I can't imagine how much worse it is at the height of tourist season. We had a private guide who took us to those works that we'd travelled thousands of miles to see, so had a very targeted visit.As many have said, be on the lookout for pickpockets and dress to reduce your vulnerability.

Take your time.... How big it is! Three days are not enough to visit it completely. When short of time, you better make a selection, because the quantity and the level of all the masterpieces inside it, do need a due time to admire them all.
Definitely worth the wait. Absolutely stunning interior, excellent art - making it a must-see in the city. The earlier you go the better.
Amazing!. Such beautiful things to see!Takes at least 5 hours to visit the place. Really easy to reach, at the very bigining/end of Nevsky St.
the main Russian museum. Rubens, Da Vinci, Caravaggio, Tiziano, Rembrandt. I think that the Hermitage does not need any advertising and reviews.

The floors and ceilings are as spectacular as the exhibits!. Had a fabulous visit but be aware that some of the rooms, those housing the most spectacular of the gold and diamonds, can only be seen on a tour and the English ones finish early.

History inside history. A must if you are in this glorious city. The Hermitage / Winter Palace is so huge that we had to see it over two days. Seeing the work of the Great Masters in such a magnificent setting is a once in a lifetime experience. Book your tickets through the automated machines as it saves time

the most wonderful museum. We were guided around the Hermitage and I would definitely recommend you know what to see before you go. Count 3 hours minimum, only one cafe, so forget going for lunch, the queues are rediculous. Make sure you see the newly renovated chapel.

Ms. OUTSTANDING! It has always been my dream to visit this museum, and my dreams were surpassed. As a lover of art, I cannot praise it sufficiently. Other museums are fortunate to have one or two paintings by a great artist--the Hermitage has ROOMS of paintings by those artists! And only the best paintings by those artists. It is thrilling! And the buildings themselves are magnificent! It was an experience of a lifetime! A must-see in Russia!

Perfect setting for extraordinary treasures. The Winter Palace is a beautiful work of art in itself, creating the perfect setting to house such a wonderfully eclectic array of extraordinary treasures and artworks that make up the Hermitage Museum. Of course this is only one of the many buildings to house the Hermitage collection. We visited the Hermitage on two separate occasions, first with the aid of a private guide and then by ourselves. Due to the sheer size of the collection it is a good idea to either visit with a guide or do some research into areas of personal interest so you don’t miss personal favourites.For our first visit we chose to include it with our private tour through Dancing Bear Tours. We spent about three hours with our guide going through level one of the Winter Palace. We covered a lot of ground and, although like any such tour, we moved at a quick pace, it was a great way to get an overview and see a good cross section of rooms and exhibits. We saw the beautiful gold, blue, malachite and throne rooms and enjoyed temporary exhibitions including the mechanical curiosities. As well as visiting a broad range of rooms and artworks, it was a great way to familiarise ourselves with the museum and ask questions about how to plan future self guided visits.On our second visit we went through by ourselves. From our guided tour, and a bit of research, we knew where to get our tickets and what areas we wanted to focus on. We arrived at 12:30 and were thrilled to get tickets for an English guided tour of the Diamond Room in the Treasure Gallery. Within the Treasure Gallery there are the Diamond and Gold Rooms. Entry into these costs an additional 300 rubles per room and you can only enter through a guided tour, these tours are limited and popular. We spent an hour with our knowledgeable and friendly guide Anastasia and saw some wonderful treasures. Starting from the middle ages there was a lot of jewellery and religious gold pieces, moving through the ages into spectacular watches, snuff boxes, necklaces, rings and broaches. There are two magnificent sets of ceremonial horse attire, received as diplomatic gifts from the Ottoman empire, with one horse blanket containing a whopping 30,000 diamonds. There are 20th century masterpieces by Cartier, Faberge and Tiffany. Definitely worth the small extra amount for a visit. There is no photography allowed in this room.Definitely worth at least one visit and if time permits more. A guide is a great idea if you want a broad overview and help navigating through the vast site on a limited timeframe. There are maps available onsite and it is also easy to self navigate through the museum. Photography is allowed without flash, except for temporary exhibitions and certain rooms which signage will explain. Also no water allowed inside galleries. Large bags need to be left in the cloakrooms. A wonderful site to visit.
Massive and diverse. Huge museum with diverse art pieces. Steeped in history and definitely requires a day or two to appreciate all that it has to offer.

So Much to See!. The Hermitage was one of the best museums I have ever been in, including the Louvre! The amount of artifacts and historic pieces. The priceless collections were unbelievable to see. A lot of classic pieces from the Masters were included. The gold and wealth of the place resonated throughout. Worth a long walk through for certain!

Too many people in Hermitage. If you don't prepare this trip you get overwhelmed the numerous paintings and decorations and tsars and emperors. It museum is meant to impress by size of collections and buildings and use of gold. Together with the unstoppable stream of cruise boat tourists it made me almost crazy.
The Hermitage is a tresure of Russian and world culture.. You must visit The Hermitage. It is the Royal Palace , art galleries, architectual monument....Love very much.

it's just incredible.. You could spend days here and still not enough. So many rooms to visit and things.
Very crowded so be early ,the guided tour is best to understand the history and what you see.
amazing palace. The palace is amazingly huge. I could not finish visiting all the palace in half a day and was too tired to walk more :). It is definitively worth a visit

Stunning. Definitely do this tour with a guide. You can get so much more information. It was terrific seeing all the great artists works from centuries ago. Winter palace stunning.
Cafe and shop available.

Hermitage Museum. It is an absolute must to see in Saint Petersburg. You need days to see everything. It was incredible. I loved going through the main areas of the Hermitage. The museum itself is a piece of art. It was incredible.
Over-the-top opulence. No wonder the peasants revolted in 1917! This and the other former palaces are drop-dead gorgeous and are not to be missed. St. Pete is definitely on the bucket list.
Amazing experience. Go early or late to avoid the queues, Go and have a look at the impressionist in the General staff buildings across the square - no queues.

Amazing. Home to all of the Great Masters and worth several hours with a good guide. Don't miss the Raphael Loggia Catherine the Great had replicated from the Vatican original. Our guide said when the Vatican needed to be renovated, they consulted the Loggia of the Hermitage.

Amazing sights!. This is a must-see for anyone visiting St. Petersburg. Be forewarned - if you intend to see EVERYTHING in detail, prepare to spend 4-5+ hours doing so. In essence this a palace, stocked with valuable artifacts, statues and artwork. As such, the rooms themselves are as much a work of art as the contents! There were so many awe inspiring and extravagant rooms, and that was a plus for me (I enjoy the architecture more so than artwork). There was representative content from many cultures around the world, so expect variety. Some of the statues and carvings were so intricate, they were very neat to see.I'm in my early 30s, and am not an "art person" by any stretch, but I found this museum fascinating. The highlight for me was the Peacock Clock - be sure to see it when you are there!My only gripe is that I wish more of the placards/information was in English, and a free audio guide (like I received at the Kremlin Armoury) would have been nice.

Magnificent museum!. It is difficult to begin to review something so extraordinary containing so many great works of art. I think you could easily spend a week walking around this massive collection. I was particularly interested in the Amber Room.All the amber was stolen by the Nazis during the war, After the war it was pieced together expertly and now it is an almost unbelievable room to see. Unfortunately we could only spend a day in the museum.
Unbelievable. Unbelievable value for money..you could easily spend 2 days here..it's remarkable value for money, the with history and artefacts within is breath taking.
Beyond world class. Completely knocked out by the collections, the wonderful classical buildings and interiors, including now some great modern interiors. Fabulous

Amazing - Crowded and it was "early" in the tourist season. Interesting and a treasure trove of art - Try to get a guide who can get early entrance to avoid the crowds. There is so much to see in this palace!

Show off. A must see in St. Petersburg. This place is a real show off of literary tons of art work. We viewed with a guide (SPB tours) and if you don't have a guide or a very good book you will miss a lot of interesting detail. Of course on tour they move you through, but with so much to see it does get overpowering to spend a lot of time. We took 2 hours of walking, pointing out numerous spots. To see this place is a must do, even if you are not an art lover. It will impress everyone.

Do not miss!. You can't visit Saint Pete without stopping here. We spent two half-days exploring and still left lots to see. You should get ready to do a lot of walking. The artifacts are impressive and well displayed. Audioguides are great as well.
City tour . Like the Louvre. Overwhelming. Lots of people everywhere. Of course some fabulous art and sculptures. Made up of four or five buildings. TJ tours was excellent getting us in and out.

Lovely are museum . Take at least 2 hours here if you are interested in art. Minimum. There is lots of walking and it is not air conditioned so dress appropriately. Can walk not to far from here to the spilled bloom cathedral as well.
Stunning museum. Breathtaking beautiful, garish use of gold so much so that my eyes ached. Immense displays of incredible art and various crafts. A must

Rude Obnoxious Staff. From the miserable cloakroom attendant to the matriarchs on the scanners - why on earth do you have to check your coat in - it was bloody freezing. Oh and if you do want to keep it on just go through the scanner by the cloakroom - she couldn't have given a toss what you took in - lol!

Wonderfull. Beautifull place, full of artefacts where you can travel in time and feel a piece of history. Visited during ice hockey world championship and was really pleasently surprised by all the places in Petersburg not even this one.

Must see if you are in St. Petersburg.. Although some might think it is complicated to navigate its halls, on one's own, it is not. The map of the museum is quite good, plus there is English speaking staff in each room and the visit is worth the time and the ticket money. Even if you could see all the rooms and exhibits in one visit, rest assured that your mind could not digest it all at once.

"AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE". The architecture, the paintings, the sculptures , the armours , the icons , the chandeliers the magnitude of wealth is just unbelievable. Everywhere you look there is something that will amaze you. As you enter and walk through this marvellous building you can almost envision the aristocracy of a bygone era moving through the rooms with their beautiful period clothing. The jewels on the crowns, the precious stones on snuff boxes belonging to Catherine the Great, the intricate hair combs made of gold and the wonderful tapestries that covered huge walls were mind blowing.

The must in St.Petersbourg. This place is very special. There are always so many tourists. Every first Thursday every month the entrance is free of charge. In fact you may skip the queue by buying the ticket in the building opposite to the Winter Palace where the impressionost and modern art exepition is on display. There are practically no tourists. Attention, the exibition is so huge that you may need a combined ticket for two days.

A Must-see for art lovers. Catherine was an avid collector of Art and most of it is housed here. The exterior of this lovely building is stunning, but does not compare to the opulence inside. A definite Must-see

Incredible. The worlds best hotel bar none. Something for everyone to see from works of art to mourning caskets for the tsars. Staff can be a bit abrupt but that's to be expected with what's in thereDefinitely allow a full day to get around it all
Fantastic. This place is huge and has a lot of history and grandeur. On will need atleast 3-4 hours to see the place. I would recommend taking a guide or atleast the audio guide.

My Favorite Museum...EVER. I live in NYC in walking distance from the Metropolitan Museum which I adore. However, this is such an amazing experience with art. The place itself is beautiful and a wonderful way to view and enjoy art. I spent two full days here. I highly recommend downloading the app and audioguide before you go. I "studied" the Hermitage General Tour before going so I could spend my time there enjoying. I visited in April so the lines were not bad.Would LOVE to go back someday.

Glorious. Firstly pre book online to get early entrance ahead of stated opening time. Use this time to look at the masterpieces as you will then have the time and space to really view and study them. The artwork is mind blowing, we did it with our Russian guide who we had for the whole two days in St Petersburg and it really enhanced our experience. Also paid the extra to do the Gold Room which you have to do with an official museum guide but worth every penny. Again you have to prebook. You could spend days In here!!
Dabulous. Wonderful art in a stunning building, extraordinary architecture and mind boggling decoration. Wonderful sense of history

Amazing!!!!!!!. Visited and looked at the place with awe and reverence. I kept wondering whether to Take photos or keep looking at the paintings or sculptures or the other exhibits at the hermitage. We thought that Catherine was an amazing monarch to have built a place of this magnificence. A must see....you'll really miss something awesome if you don't include it in your itinerary....

Must See. My family took us to the Hermitage and it was a great experience. The museums offers so much stuff to look at and review. It's a huge time capsule. Even if you take a full day to tour it, you will not see the entire museum. It's exquisite and overwhelming all in one. It's a must see to anyone that comes to St. Petersburg...I'm glad I was able to visit and tour this wonderful place.

Fantastic, but book online in advance.. Firstly, book your tickets online in advance to avoid the long queues at the entrance. There is so much to see once you are inside (more than can be done comfortably in one day) that you don't want to waste time in queues.Secondly, if you take one of the tours (we took an English one), you can find out quite a bit about the history of the buildings and it can also serve as an orientation tour in advance of your own exploration afterwards. Admittedly, these tours are variable in standard. Ours was one hour long and a bit dry, but we know people who went on one a couple of months ago and they said theirs (for the same money) was two hours long and that the guide was really interesting.Thirdly, do save time at the end of the day to visit the Winter Palace of Peter the Great, which is only a short walk away from the Hermitage and main Winter Palace. A visit to this is included in the general ticket price. There weren't many people there when we went but it was well worth the visit. It is such a contrast to the opulence of the other buildings and provides you with a good insight into the Tsar himself - whose very life-like model will stare you straight in the face!

Overwhelmingly beautiful! A must! . You could literally spend the whole day here taking in everything. Or alternatively you could whizz around the key items you want to see in 1-2 hours. Be prepared to spend at least an hour here but really at least a min of 2- 3 hours. Entrance is 600 Rubels (about £6 per adult). Pre book in advance to avoid queuing. We didn't and we regretted wasting 30 mins in a boiling hot queue outside. Then once in.. The biggest dilemma ...What to see first. Get a plan together, the da Vinci and Rembrandt collections are a must and so is the golden peacock (seriously amazing) and the thrones! Enjoy!

Very big and lots of different eras to view. We went around all the floors and found the hermitage to be good value for money as there is so much to see. Amazing paintings and artefacts throughout. You have to go if you're in st Petersburg as you will kick yourself if you don't

Magnificent, astonishing,.... Even if you're not into art, this is a worthwhile visit. We dedicated one whole day to this and still didn't manage to see everything. Make sure to book your ticket online (but it seemed more expensive) or to arrive half an hour or 45 minutes before opening to beat the lines. As the lines can be very long. You will find an English map of the museum inside. There is free wifi, shop, cafeteria. We payed 600 rubbles to see the other museums including the hermitage. The entrance of the hermitage is easy to find from the dvortsovaya square.

Simply astonishing ..... An extraordinary museum with a wealth of treasures and the most stunning art collection. We took a tour with St Petersburg Free Tours and our tour guide, Irina, was a delight. Incredibly knowledge and passionate about the place. I'd definitely recommend booking a tour with them as the collection is vast and it would be hard to prioritise what to look at without insider knowledge.

Amazing. This place is picturesque. Looks like you're in a movie. Crowd is amazing and you can see all sorts of people - lovers, friends, family, kids playing around. Now the most important thing is the museum itself. What an architecture!! You get lost in the beauty of it. Make sure you're energized before going there because it's full. When I was there, they were closed on Mondays. Not sure if it's the regular thing or because of public holiday.
Top. Must see. You cant see everything, but you can try. Buy ticket online. See Da Vinci, Rubens, Rembrandt, etc. Its not only about the paintings, but the palace interiors also. Amazing.

must see. this is a world class museum and a must visit. the 'scale' is huge overall and some of the rooms themselves are worth seeing for their size and beauty, not too mention the breadth of the collection here......book online in advance and allocate a lot of time.....a 'quick visit' here would be 3 hours!

Free entrance the first Thursday of each month. This is a World Class museum and it is little to add to this fact. It is one of the best museums in the World. The only observation I could indicate is the deficient illumination of most of the paints that results in light reflection over their surface. This review is directed to the free entrance to the museum. I had the oportunity to visit the Hermitage the first week of April 2016 and decided to take advantage the free entrance. We arrived at 9:30 am and stayed on a line of about 50 people outside the palace. This queue grew fastly to about 300 people when the doors were opened to access the couryard at 10 am. Another queue was formed at both entrances of the museum and when admission was granted at 10:30 am,in groups of 20-30 people. The queues in the courtyard reached the entrance to the palace about 1000 people. The entrance was free but a ticket had to be adquired at the box office to actually enter the museum. This process worked pretty fast. It took for us only about 15 minutes to enter the museum after it was opened. We assume that if we would have arrived not at 9:30 am but much later probably the queue would be for at least 1-2 hours to enter the museum. Note that if you had already bought tickets before in internet or buy tickets in the automatic machines in the courtyard (entering at right), you could pass directly in the entrance control. My conclusion about free tickets is that it worked for us arriving one hour before admission in April that is not the top season. I suppose that in Summer this would not be practical and would be better to pay the entrance or even go other day when the museum would not be so crowded due to the free entrance. Practically all tourists entering the museum were russians with a few foreign visitors. When we walked outt the museum at about 3 pm the queue exended outside the palace enrance into the palace square.

Amazing. It is a must go in St. Petersburg, but to really see it you need at least a full day. I just scrolled throw the amazing rooms and saw a few of the amazing paintings, and I was dead in the end. It is huge. And impressive

Charming!. One of the historical museums...it has everything under the sun from most of the parts of the world. There are self audio guides in various languages, so there is no need to hire a tour guide and spend extra money which we did. Just follow the map given on entering and go through different gallerias one by one. At least five to six hours to be allotted for spending time at this museum.

Golden chapel was breathtaking. We had been warned that the museum is so huge that you could spend weeks in there. As we were only in St. P for 3 days we were quite easy going about our visit - and planned to stay for about 3 hours. Queued to get in - did not take too long. Cost about 600 rubles to get in I think. We literally walked through the rooms at random- and each room was great. The highlight was certainly the Golden chapel. It was sunny at the time and the beauty of the room was quite breathtaking. One top tip - If you do leave the museum through the exit sign - they wont let you back in!! At the end of our visit we decided to visit the souvenir shop - we misunderstood the route and went past the exit sign. No re-entry I am afraid. The customer services desk was quite clear about this!

Number one in the city. The most popular place for turist , had big expectations but was let down by poor planning at the entrance. Was among the first 100 people in the que and thought we would get in ammediatly. Suddenly they said that the amount of guests inside has exceeded the people allowed inside so we had to wait for 45 minutes in 30 degrees celsius and there was only a few hundred people let inside at the time , how can it be full??? Finally got in and the place is so huge that if youre interested in history you can spend a day there. Getting burned by the sun we stayed for a while and left. The excecution was poor, two lines with about 500 people per line and two cashiers in each line, oh my god. If you go be shore to buy tickets from the self service machines inside the gates.
Wouw. Great history. All rebuilt. Take a guide to focus on highlights.we were there out of the high season and could actually see everything we wanted.

Top hit of St Petersbourg. It could take a year, but, if you have one day, it will impress you beyond any luxury you could imagine. These Romanovs were surely a line of strong characters. They built and manage 2 centuries of wealth and, everything got concentrated in this impressive museum. From the large square, you enter into a nice green court and enter as a prince into gold and flamboyant architectures. You find here all possible painting you may dream on. It is quite well presented and organized. We ran through in one day, and never got lost. Of course, you need to pick your priorities, but, imagine the life in such place, in deep cold winters, with high snow outside, looking at a frozen Nevia river through the windows. Unbelievable!

Incredible palace. I wasn't so interested in art, but still this is a wonderful place to visit in Saint Petersburg and defenitely a must. The rooms are incredible and is very nice (in case that you think that this art is not for you) just to have a wolk around.Important: free for students if you show your valid student card, no matter where you're from! It's not possible to get a student ticket online, so you will have to wait in the line. Try to go a little bit earlier than the opening time so you won't have to wait so, so much (1 hour aprox).

Wonderful museum. I have been many times, if you have a group, do hire a local guide to take you to the museum highlights. It kind get pretty crowded and long lines can be expected if you do not buy your tickets ahead.

Try to book a private tour. During the regular opening hours it is way too busy here. You need to make your way to the paintings with your elbows. Not my cup of tea! But try too book a private tour if this is possible. I had the benefit to visit the Hermitage when it was only open for us.

Art and Decadence Like you've Never Seen!. The Hermitage is so large that it would take days to view in leisurely way. If you are an art affectionato and love museums, this is one of the top Art museums in the world. It's a museum not to miss and one of the highlights of a trip to St. Petersburg, Russia. There's something for everyone there! An enjoyable day in St. Pete.

Use the ticket machines. First of all, if you want to save some time, buy a ticket at the ticket machine, then you won't have to wait in a really long queue. The ticket there costs 600 RUB (about 8 EUR), while in the e-shop of the museum they want 18 EUR! O_oThe museum is REALLY crowdy (in some halls there is so many people like in the metro during rush hour...), even tough we have visited it on wednesday morning.Also the navigation through the halls (the complex is really big) is difficult (poor marking) and moreover the staff doesn't know we are the exact exhibits which you are looking for.

Highlight of St Petersburg. Definitely a must if you're visiting St Petersburg. An amazing collection, we spent 3 hours but could easily have spent a bit longer. When buying tickets we found it was easier to use the self service kiosks in the courtyard rather than queuing up. They have an English language option too and was much faster.
Unbelievable collection. We spent a whole day here but still missed out a floor, there is so much to see. If you are an art lover it is paradise.

Grand place and a must see. Whether you are in Saint Petersburg for a day or a week allocate several hours to see this magnificent place full of art from all over the world. Collected by the Russian Royals over the centuries The Hermitage offers a great range of art from the ancient Greeks to the modern times. The best way to do it is by buying a two bus hour tour of the city, which includes the guided tour of The Hermitage museum at the end. And the good thing you don't have to wait in the queue, the guide will take you through the special guided tours line. There are tours offered in various languages. Enjoy, you'll love it.
classic but overcrowded. Very impressive museum, however the lines make it a nightmare. Lines are for tickets, then entrance then seeing paintings

Amazing!!!!. You must go!!!!!! Such a beautiful museum. You need about two or three days to see whe entire thing. They have a few cafes and lots of gift shops. They have a audio guide which was great, but you have to pay for it (Also bring your own heaf phones) if you have questions please go to their website for hours and special events

Stunning splendour . Every bit as amazing as the reviews suggest. There is a lot to see and a couple of visits of 2-3 hours is better than a one long stint to get the most of it. The new impressionist/20th century exhibition in the Admiralty Building is fabulous too and a visit in its own right anywhere else in the world.
Beautiful Museum. The museum is a must to visit. Do beware of pickpockets when it gets very crowded. Best time is to go in the morning as it is less crowded and less tour groups.
fabulous museum. There's something for everyone here from Michael angelo to Rembrandt and Egyptian and Greek relics. I'd recommend a guide as there is much to see; certainly allow half a day minimum

Unbelievably beautiful. Glorious. Beautiful. Unparalleled. Very reasonably priced. The architecture is stunning, the history almost palpable, the artwork - well - magnificent. You cannot go to St Petersburg without seeing it - and it is a must-see for any art lover, or anyone who appreciates beauty. Tip - buy your ticket online beforehand, and print it out to avoid the line, otherwise you will wait a long time.

Well maintained historical Museum. The best time to visit Hermitage is just after 10 AM, later the place is very crowdedand takes extra time to buy the ticket. During my over 3 hours visit I was able to seemost of the opulent master pieces. Outside the first floor, close to so called Winter Palacethere is a small garden full of nice flowers. As the numer of paintings is very big, I thinkI could take another opportunity to visit the Museum during my next trip.

Fabulous buildings . Make sure to buy ticket from the machines just inside the entrance for only 600 roubles (6pounds) then you can walk right in without queueing
Also lets you in the gallery across the square
Worth seeing but make plenty of time

Very interesting. If you are going book tickets before hand we tried to book for the gold and diamond rooms while we there but was not able to, so this year it's already pre booked. Yes it's worth it.

Amazing!. Huge, extravagant, amazing!!
Never thought would enjoy roaming around in a museum as much... Winter palace is spectacular.. Planned to visit impressionists and post impressionists as well, but winter palace in itself is so huge and tiring!!
But surely a beautiful place to be...

Excellent, BUT be prepare!!!. Hermitage is really an excellent place - it is a must like Louvre! BUT!!Buy ticket before - if possible eticket but on russian web page!!the ticket cost 600 rubles...on english version of the web page the offer was 1200 rubles:(If you are not able to buy via internet..go to hermitage and buy ticket at the machine!you save 30min of your life;)Enjoy

Amazing. Well I like a bit of art and when i heard this Museum had 300 rooms - I thought it might be too much for me. I went with friends and we spent over 3.5 hours there (including a break of tea and cake ;-))The museum interior (as well as exterior) is stunning - as it seems to be the case with all the buildings I have visited. Each room was different from the next... some were opulent, others understated. I've never seen so much art and all in one place. Definitely recommended.There's a cloakroom which you can leave your bags and coat in although it did say to leave bigger bags - i didn't and no one told me otherwise as I only heard the announcement on the way out but can only think this was because the place wasnt overrun with tourists.

Loved it. I loved the Hermitage and I would reccommend it to anyone who loves art, modern and classic. I needed two days to see everything I wanted and I still skipped parts of the museum. So find out what you want to see most before strolling around and losing track of time. But if you are just looking for a relaxed activity strolling around without a specific goal might be perfect. If your a student, bring your student card because you will get free entrance.

Fantastic!. Need I say more? It's the Hermitage and Winter Palace!!! One of the best museums in the world. A little tip: you can buy the ticket straight from the ticket machine right after the main entrance, instead of queuing the line for the ticket office.

A must when in Saint Petersburg. What to say... Everything that is written about the Hermitage is true. A beautiful building packed to the rafters with treasures from around the world. Surly staff aside, it is worth the queues!

Not to be missed. You could spend days here there is so much, we had a guide as part of our package holiday which made it so much more enjoyable by focusing on the major aspects of the Museum and prviding the historical context to the exhibits and the building. I would recommend that this visit is made with a guide to ensure you get the best from your time.
stay for hours or stay just a few and come back a couple of times.. wonderful place. a went on a sunday and spent 4 hours and returned on Tuesday and stayed another 3 hours.
most amazing place. never seen such a lovely museum. what a place to keep up everything, very well kept heritage. russian culture as well as mixed european ones can be seen

A Must!. I never expected to be so impressed and I loved every minute we spent here. We booked a tour in English which they run once a day in Winter and I highly recommend doing this. Our guide was very knowledgable and had studied art and history so she could show us things about the paintings and their detail that we would never have noticed! The Winter Palace was amazing to see but the real highlight was the room full of Rembrandt paintings. The tour ran for approx two hours which doesn't cover everything as the museum is too vast but we spent the remainder of the day looking at the rest of the exhibits ourselves.

A Treasure of World Civilization. This is a treasure of art, history, and architecture. One of the premier sites in Europe if not the entire world. To enter the Hermitage is to walk into a living history book. One of the most wonderful sites I have ever visited. Days can easily be spent in these museums.

Friday after work it's open till 830. Start with the second floor of general staff building to escape tour guides then go back and do winter palaceGet ticket online there is separate entrance read the online website downliad free app from App Store it helps if you get twisted round like I didLittle shops in old building lots of placesWear tennis shoesCheck your outer coatTake a million pictures with you cell phone it all blends after a whileIt's worth every pennyTake an umbrella

Amazing. I don't even know what to say. The building is stunning, and the collection inside is worth the trip to Russia alone. You could spend a full week here and not see everything. The more modern (1800s and newer) are across Palace Square in the General Staff building.

Overwhelmingly large and beautiful. It's possible to spend your entire time in SPB just wandering through the halls of the buildings that make up the Hermitage. But of course there's lots more to see so a day is the max that most tourists can devote to the museum. The Winter Palace is gorgeous as a structure and the exhibits are beautiful too. Though there's only so much the human brain can assimilate! :) There is a small cafe in the main building with excellent desserts (try the carrot cake!). Peter the Great's original residence which is right next door is also very fascinating and I would recommend visiting that as well. We took a guided tour and got to see all the highlights because the thought of navigating those hallways on our own was a little overwhelming! But in retrospect, we could've managed on our own with an audio guide and there's enough information at each exhibit in English to give you the information you need. I would imagine roaming the museum, with some lovely classical music playing on your iPod would be a great way to take in all the beauty.

The building itself is a work of art.. The museum is world class, the rooms are amazing, the marquetry on the floors and the ceilings alone would make this a place to come to. The art is well displayed and the place is huge, you would need three days to do it all. Don't rush however, sa our each new delight.

huge, extremely valuable collection of old art. - you could spend many days. Unfortunately quite crowded. You have to expect 3 cues:The first one for the ticket - if not procured beforehand (eg through the hotel)The 2nd for the cloakroom - they are full soonThe 3rd for security.

A temple of wonders. This museum is with the Louvres in Paris, the most amazing museum in the world and can't be missed. The square, the malachite columns as you enter....everything is magical and you feel you are in the presence of Catherine the Great herself.

Not as expected it, beware of the cloakroom!. When announcing we were about to visit St. Petersburg, the first thing everyone told us to visit was the Hermitage museum. Of course it was no.1 in our list as well. Unfortunately, we would say that it was not as exciting as we thought it would be. Yes, the interior was majestic, but other than that, most exhibits were quite average in our humble opinion. We might not know every single artist there is for sure, but for such a renowned museum, we were a bit more demanding. Interesting visit nonetheless, we would not recommend spending hours and hours there though. Beware: in case you want to buy something from the souvenir shop, make sure you take some money with you before leaving everything in the cloakroom! The souvenir shop is INSIDE the exhibit area, so once you exit you cannot go back and buy anything you may have liked! We, amongst other fellow tourists, learnt that the hard way, leaving the premises empty-handed...

It's a big museum with a palace in it. As you know it's big. Real big that you probably won't see it all. It gets crowded so go early to beat the rush. It's really instance getting in and out. There are 2 revolving doors to funnel people in and out and it's not very orderly. Also of note you need to check all the things you bring. It's mostly room after room of art. Some of the individual rooms' architecture is pretty remarkable. Really what makes this place is the throne room. It's awesome and huge. Just standing in the room imagining what happened there when it was fully function makes the entry worth it.

A real piece of history!. Firstly, allow yourself more like 3.5 hours to see the highlights because you will be mesmerised by the sheer beauty of the rooms, ceilings and floors, as well as the various artefacts which adorn these rooms.I am not, by nature, a lover of art, but even I fell in love with the various pieces of art that are available.The wow factor continues in every room, whether you are looking at the stunning pictures or impressive sculptures on the lower floors.Coming from London, which itself is full of history, I can only say that this winter palace makes Buckingham Palace seem like an outhouse!But please, allow yourself plenty of time and pace yourself and take regular breaks so that you have the energy to continue throughout the exhibition.

Reason enough to visit St Petersburg. This extraordinary jaw dropping museum lives up to all the hype and expectations. Would revisit St Petersburg just to spend 3 more days here. We had to wait for about a half an hour so probably should have booked online. We used the guide found at St Petersburg.com which was useful in order to see some of the highlights.
A must do in St Petersburg. In summary, amazing. You can wander the halls of this museum for a day and still need to return to take it all in.

No Words Can Explain...It WOWS!. After the chaotic entrance...one door only open upon arrival. However, once inside it wows! It would take a lifetime to see all it the exhibits, but we did as much as we could and at a fairly slow pace. We had a guide and she was outstanding at making sure we saw all the "big" items and many of the lesser rooms. She got us into some rooms not open to the public. She also lectured on the Winter Palace aspect of the building. It was such a highlight and one of the main reasons to come to St. Petersburg. This art major/art teacher was in heaven!

Unbelievable. This is un unbelievable place. One's lifetime is not enough to admire all the beauty and splendor of this museum. My husband and I spent two whole days, and still we only saw a tiny little amount of the entire museum. I particularly recommend the impressionist section, but be sure anything you pick is just magnificent. My recommendation is that you read about the museum beforehand, and pick the rooms that most call your attention. Otherwise you get crazy trying to figure out at the last minute what you want to see. If you can afford, pay for a private guide. That way you do not waste time buying tickets, staying in line, not knowing where to go, etc.

Top #1 Tourist Attraction to be on your list. If you miss this Museum and Winter Palace, you will be upset with yourself if you see photos on TV or cable. These photos do not capture the "real moment" when you are on the steps of the Winter Palace and re-live the richness and historical appeal of this super tourist attraction. I took the local Metro and walked several blocks and tooks tons of photos (make sure to bring an extra one or two camera card -- you will need it). I was attending a conference and met with other professional the next day -- who were doing the same thing as me -- visiting this same point of interest. It is strange to take a group of academics and find a common point of interest -- but we all agreed - this was a highlight of the trip. Everyone I met that day was just super and made me feel so welcomed to be part of this historical environment.
The artwork was stunning. Loved this tour. The artwork on display was amazing. Some of the most famous and recognisable paintings of all time.

superb. We booked a Guide in advance through Trip Advisor and said that we were more interested in the history and the Palace rather than the Art. Our Guide was terrific, very knowledgeable and charming. We had a marvellous day with her. The Winter Palace was quite beyond anything we had imagined - it is enormous and just packed with fabulous treasures.

Excellent. You can spend easy two days in this museum. IMPRESSIVE ! I visited Russia for the first time! Sankt petersburg is a lovely city and we visited few sites during our stay! We had the privilege to visit Hermitage. I was impressed about the size of the palace!

Beautiful Museum. There is far more here than one can hope to study in one visit. The museum--housed in the former palace of St. Petersburg--is interesting both architecturally and for its vast collection. Many great works here.
One tip: To skip the line, buy tickets at the automated kiosks out front.

Impressive. The Hermitage is one of the most impressive Museums in the world. We spent the whole day just on the second floor and then failed to complete it by the time the museum closed at 6pm. A wonderful experience. We cant wait to return in the autumn.
Wow. Just go there!! And I mean the Winter palace, minimum 3 hours. You can spend a week and not see it all :)
ONE the best meuseum of the world.. The meuseum is huge and was winter palace of King Peter. The meuseum takes minimum 2 to 3 hours to see. The building is amazing and near city centre.

Hermitage is a visit worth doing in St Petersburg. Be smart and buy tickets in the "atm" outside so you don't need to stand in line for long time. Use a map so you miss not anything. It's very nice musea I think you should spend in more days to optimal visit it.

Amazing. I've visited many of these old European palaces and they are all impressive but the Hermitage has to be the most impressive of them all. It quite took my breath away as we walked up the white staircase into the main building. Room after room of exquisite decor alongside amazing art work. You could spend days here and still not have time to take it all in properly.

what a great museum. I spent three hours in this wonderful museum and we could not be able to complete it.it is more than five section each needs more than one hour to see all in it.each corner is apiece of art about the history of Russia.also there is a painting by famous painters like leonardodaphenshi,,,also japanease corner and Egyptian corner.also many Italian and roman fine arts are there.we spent a nice time there and you should see it.

Exciting. Very beautiful2 days of excersion and didnt finish half of itEvery exposition is unique.Offers additional points of interest - made only 1 additionalDidn't have timeIf you have any question - ask the room keeper (the old lady) - she knows better :)

another Palace. I could not believe how many Palaces there were here in St. Petersburg, but all were beautiful and also so many things on show, you cannot see all on one visit just enjoy whatever is in front of you. It is very busy but there are quieter areas.

Vast collection with many outstanding and very beautiful works. Don't think it can all be seen in one visit. Rather make several short visits and take a guide. The Dutch l7th Century is very strong indeed.

Absolutely astonishing place. Wow, this place has everything! Paintings from all over the world (Europe, Asia and others), Russian culture, gold and diamond rooms and unbelievable architecture. The place is open later time on Wednesday. So, we choose this day to maximize the time. You also learn a lot from history. Excessive jewelry for kings and queens. No wonder there was a revolution from peasants eventually! Too many beautiful palaces and churches in this city. Looks like there was competition between royal family and clergy to impress the masses! I am glad these have been preserved for people to enjoy and reflect on the past nd history as they move forward to future!

Fabulous Historical City. St. Petersburg was far beyond what we expected and part of that was due to the fact that our group of 6 hired a private guide for 3 full days. Veronica had lived in St. Petersburg all of her life and she had a degree in art history. She knew every single important historical place and where to go to see the best paintings and sculptures. We also were treated to local dining areas for lunch which served delicious, inexpensive food. Because we had a car/driver, Veronica was able to spend her time discussing the history of the areas we were going, which at times were 25 miles outside of the city (the summer palace and St. Catherine's Palace.) I gave the Hermitage a 4 because it was not our favorite of the MANY places were were taken by our Shore Trips guide. BE SURE AND USE A GUIDE FOR YOUR STAY. The cost includes admission to all sites, car/driver and guide. We have never been disappointed.

Magnificent. They say if you want to see all the objects in this museum,it will take 12 years! one of the most beautiful places I have ever seen throughout all my life and if I had enough time and money to stay in St. petersburg, surely I would spend one of those 12 years in the museum! on wednesdays museum is open till 9 pm.Museum has some very beautiful shops as well.

A first stop. This is obviously a must-see. We did it in one day, however, the Hermitage has rooms on rooms and museums on museums. If you want to see it all, you might consider taking two days. Get tickets in advance, if you can do so, and be sure to do a little research beforehand to find out about special exhibitions.

Highlight of a visit to St Petersburg. An incredible collection of Old Masters & Modern Art. Too much to see - you need 3 or 4 days minimum to do these collections justice. Room after room of French impressionists are a marvel. You contemplate billons of pounds worth of art, would it ever come on the market. Don't worry it won't. This has to be the home of the finest art collections in the world. Well displayed with good descriptions in English & French. An extraordinary experience!

Can't be missed! . We had booked an English speaking tour prior to travel. Saw the highlights. Amazing place. Could spend days in there. We returned the next day to view the french art in other building. Massive collection of impressionists. Fantastic.

Fantastic - but beware of Cultural Gluttony. Even with a list (culled from the internet) of must-sees, and where to see them we spent over 6 hours in the museum. We saw the most beautiful things, buthad to totally ignore art that anywhere else would be a must-see.

Great and wonderful. This museum is one of the biggest museum in the world. If you want to visit this Museum and Palace, you must allot a full day about 8 hour non-stop in all time. This museum is very huge. Inside the Museum and Palace you can find a cafe for a rest in Museum.

Superb. Probably the world's best museum. We hired an English speaking guide and paid extra to get into the special gold rooms. Absolutely fabulous as the building itself is magnificent even without the exhibits ! It needs 6 hours to give it justice and you need the guide to appreciate everything.

Remarkable. More art than you could ever hope to see, the malacite room where the Royal Family were captured and a whole host of the most remarkable and fascinating history and sights imaginable. Recover with a lazy boat trip afterwards. Spectacular building as well.

Buy one, get one free!. I thought I was going to see the art collection of second largest art museum in the world. I did get that but... I also experienced the lavishly opulent Winter Palace of Catherine the Great that houses the collection.

Hermitage. This was so much larger and so much more beautiful than I could have ever imagined. We had a guide who walked with us through all the open parts. Some were apparently off limits for whatever reason and she argued with the guards about that for a bit, but then backed off. Also, the bookstore was not open for tourists either that day; entry strictly forbidden. But that's Russia. The paintings are awe inspiring. The sheer amount of history stored away there is something to behold.
A must see museum. Museum that holds masterpieces from some of the great artists, sculptors and historical figures.Former palace that is enormous and too big to view in only a few hours.

The mist magnificent museum in the world. I have been to the Hermitage a few times in my life as I grew up in Russia. But after visiting a few state palaces around the world including The Buckingham Palace its in my opinion much more grand and interesting including vast collections of art, the only one true magnificent place to visit
Majestic! . What a museum! There are over 400 different rooms and almost too much to see in one day! The palace is worth a visit even if it's only to see it on the outside!

deservedly popular, world class collections. The former Tsars' Winter Palace, now the Hermitage museum/gallery, is justifiably renowned as one of the world's most important and extensive collections of art works and a highlight of any visit to St Petersburg. It is also probably the most attractive setting for a gallery in the world, and you can view some of the imperial state rooms in addition to the impressive rooms in which the collections are housed.Whatever your preferences in terms of period, genre or artist, there will be something here you will love. There is too much to take in in one visit, and you shouldn't try. Our guide expertly shepherded us round the most important features of the collection and then left us to our own devices.
