Most of us were keen to view the Picasso, Matisse and Impressionist collections, which are now - wisely, in my view - housed in a new building just across the square, in attempt to disperse the crowds somewhat. Two things to note about this - there is a separate charge for this in addition to the main collections, although not excessively expensive (a few hundred roubles, if memory serves). Also, it was surprisingly difficult to find the collections in the new building, even being able to read the Russian and having asked several members of staff. No doubt this will improve/have improved once the annexe is fully up and running!The only other reservation, if you are visiting in the summer months, is that it gets very busy, especially on Wednesdays, when many of the city's other attractions are closed. I first visited Russia in December 1992, on a school exchange shortly after the fall of Communism and, in the winter at that time, we had this place virtually to ourselves, an experience I imagine will be impossible to replicate these days! But of course, it's good that this world-class attraction is now accessible to so many more people.
Best museum in the world. If only I had more time to visit another day. Advisable to make more than one visit whilst in St. Petersburg with so many wonderful exhibits.

how long will you spend there?. this is probably the only question you should be asking yourself; the museum is huge and some of the paintings there are extremely famous; the system there was in place when I went to enter the museum was not the most optimum one and it was a bit long
Gorgeous and humbling . Simply stunning, just make sure you give yourself plenty of time to appreciate it all .buy your ticket on line, saves queuing. Beautiful gift shop too.
Mind blowing. The most incredible place I have ever been. It may be worth booking a tour guide as it is such a big place and it is hard to fit it all in.

stunningly amazing. went on an organised tour so wasn't able to see the whole thing but - time constraints - but what we saw was stunningly amazing in an old fashioned faded bygone era kind of way. be prepared for lots of tourists but a must if visiting - tip - go independently if possible and spend the day wandering the vast expanse of rooms.
Hermitage. One of the great museums of the world, to par with Louvre, the Brittish museum, El Prado. At least a whole day is required for a few of the halls.

Take at least a day to enjoy ALL of the Museum and Palace. If in St. Petersburg, the visit of the Winter Palace and the Hermitage Museum is an absolute MUST. The beautiful halls with lots of golden ornaments and paintings you will not see anywhere else in the world. You should join some group visiting in order to cut down on the queues. If you are a single visitor you may have to queue a very long time, until you will be able to enter the Palace. Best to visit is off season in spring or winter.

One of greatest museums in the world . It is indeed one of the greatest museums in the world. Not only it houses most precious and unique collections and art, it's architecturally beautifully building. Must see

the world's great art museum (or one of them). at very least, it is one of the world's handful of best museums, with entries from antiquity through modern times. get a two-day pass on line--it's worth the few rouble surcharge not to wait. begin with the new japanese sculpture outside.

Huge!. 600 rbls. Take your ID as it is required and also all bags are scanned and jackets put in to the cloakroom.This place is huge. So many artifacts, rooms, works. Everything. Sadly there was no descriptions in English about many of the things. Buy the audio. It will make a huge difference in appreciating what you are looking at.There are some seats dotted through out for a 5 mins pause before starting again.

The best museum I have ever been to.. The first time I went I was so blown away by the ornate building I missed most of the art? ! So I had to go back again to check out the artifacts, which wasn't a problem. I could spend many, many more days here.
Impressionist/Post-Impressionists!. Great collection in the General Staff building. Very cool building and good cafe as well. Decent audio guide available via the phone app.

A walk through history. Make sure to take time viewing the artwork, the interior design and architecture. It's very ornate. beautiful parquet floors throughout. I was honored to be walking through this historic palace. Definitely a must see

One of the best museums. This is the most famous museum in Saint-Petersburg. I was lucky to visit it in autumn, as there were not many people there. They say the crowd is too huge in summer. The museum deserves its fame: there are many precious paintings and cultural objects inside.

One of the more interesting things in St. Petersburg. As a disclaimer, I am someone who is easily bored in art museums. However, there is a good amount of history here and the architecture is really quite ornate. I spent a few hours here until I got bored with it. Before coming, you will want to drop all your stuff off at your hotel, as you will do a lot of walking here (the palace is very big). For the most part, you can take photos, but there are old ladies in all the rooms and some of them will nag you out if you try to take a photo (apparently their rules on photos are arbitrary). You can rent an audio guide (basically like a phone device that explains the various rooms) for 500 rubles (roughly $8 US as of 4/13/2016). If you like art, you will really enjoy this place. I gave it 5 stars for that reason, even though I'm not a particular fan of art.
Wow. One of the most incredible museums in the world. It was a true pleasure to visit such a unique part of history

Really nice. Definitely worthy to see, especially second floor, I liked most the gold room and the vast corridors with huge paintings. Except the Winter palace (smaller building aside) that has a entrance from a side - this place is really boring and nothing to see there.

A stunning place to visit. This must be one of the greatest wonders of the museum world. It is packed with art treasures and the architecture inside and out is jaw-dropping. Unless your hotel can arrange tickets for you, avoid visiting on Thursdays - the free day when all St Petersburgers and every tourist seems to want to go.

A phenomenal mixture of opulence and style. Clearly this museum should be on everyones list when they visit St Petersburg. Recommend that you buy on line to avoid the queues and the audio guide is very authoritative without going on too long. Also consider going on a Wednesday if you want to get your money's worth in that it has extended hours and you also get access to the State General Staff Administration rooms opposite. These have a much more modern take on art and of course house a very impressive set of impressionists all on the same ticket.The Hermitage and winter Palace are breathtaking. I particularly like the fact that the museum showed its opulent decor, furniture and pasting side by side and the wooden parquet and marquetry floors are incredible.Simple tour books say allow a couple of hours - this is way out of line, we spent 8 hours there - through we were totally 'museumed' out at the end. Miss this one at your peril.

Hermitage on a first Thursday of a month (free entrance). Well, Hermitage- we all know it. And still is quit impressive when you get there and see all the beauty yourself. Don't even try to see everything - just stroll around and see what are you interested in :) Or just get lost and look around- no matter how you decide to explore this marvelous place COME EARLY! On this very morning I stayed in a queue for 1.5 hours.

A magnificent museum. World renowned and for good reason the Winter Palace has such a wealth of exhibits that one visit is barely adequate to appreciate all that it has to offer.Works class art, sculptures, artefacts and treasures in abundance - what a testimony to mans creativity, imagination, craftsmanship and the compound of culture, history and time.

The best museum complex in our Planet. It was free entrance ticket every first Thursday. We went about 12:00 and there were huge line. We decide to visit Friday. And it was good, some rooms were totally empty, no visitors :)You have to go also the General Staff Building! There were all the Art Masters like: Picasso, Gogh, Monet, Matisse etc.Also architecture is great in the General Staff Building!Have to go back sometimes.

Great Museum for sure, Tips for visiting off-peak. OK I read many of the comments regarding the long queues to get in, so I booked the more expensive ticket online. I have to emphasize that I entered at 4PM in late March, on a Wednesday (when the museum opens till 9PM). There was just a very short line (like 4-5 groups). While having a reserved ticket, it took me a bit of time to change my printed ticket to a "normal" ticket from the booth. So my suggestion is, to visit the museum on Wednesday without a reserved ticket if you are visiting off-season. The museum got emptied after 7PM and I was often the only one in a particular room, which I enjoyed a lot.Most visitors focused on the European arts on the second floor, but I found the collection of Siberian and Central Asian culture on the first floor very interesting too! Don't miss them as there are not many places you can see collections from these areas on earth.

Vast!. A wonderful experience and so much to see. Something for everyone. We had little time and focussed on the Rembrandt collection. The largest in the world. The museum could be a little better prepared for English speaking visitors with signage and guide leaflets. You need two days to do it properly.

New extension of Hermitage (2015-) - not on old guidebooks. The Hermitage is a really big place - now it even bigger. New museum billing is opened on old "General Staff" building - it is across the Palace sq at the left from the arch gate. It is not easy to see the modest door. Inside they have rebuild, extended and rebooters four floors of museum space. It has also nice facilities after the security check at outdoor including cafe/restaurat and giftshops. The extension was opened in 2015 and it is still (April 2016) work in progress.The main permanent exhibition is international art from 1800 - ca 1950: Picasso, Matisse, van Gogh, even the unique black icon by Malejevits is there. You can see how modern art was invited! You find the exhibition from 3rd and 4th floor! The is guidance, but the first and second floor are mainly empty with termorary exhibitions. You can find one eastern egg and other fabulous works of Faberge from there. Anyhow, take your time - walk the corridors, it is great.Take time at least 2 - 3 hours. Much more if you are fan of modernism. After security check you have better have tee/caffee and visit toilet... it is a really a long walk inside.What is also interesting sis the architecture of the new buddings inside the old frame. Its is a palace. The rest of Hermitage - that's another story.

Best art museum I have ever visited . This is my second visit to the Hermitage and I was able to fill the day with new rooms that I was not able to see during my first time. Amazing collection spanning the prehistoric to modern and rooms full of priceless works that I had only seen in books or during lectures on slides. Amazing place and a great deal (under $10 admission to 4 buildings). Make sure you visit the General Staff building a rooms Palace Square as that is where you will find Picasso, Manet, Monet and others.

Go For the Building, Not the Art. You will find yourself gawking at every room you enter into, but the artwork gets lost in the poor presentation and the overwhelming nature of the architecture. Too many pieces of mediocre quality.

Exhilarating at first, but extremely elaborate and tiring later. This place is gorgeous beyond doubt. But due its elaborate nature, some individuals who need continuous stimuli for entertainment like me, may get a little bored around an hour or two into the tour.But just the thought of each room amounting to millions of dollars or more, and there being so many rooms, its a life none of us could have ever imagined. Recommend it!!

One of the best in St. Petersburg. I have to tell I am not the biggest fan of fine art. It is nice, but I do not know much about these paintings and people working on them, but although it is not my cup of tea, it was really great to see Hermitage. It is on of the nicest building with beautiful interior. And for fans of fine art, there were many Rembrandts paintings, really beautiful.
Amazing. Hard to describe the sheer magnitude of the place and the amazing collection of paintings, sculptures, the building itself, its overwhelming you could spends years and not see it all

Extraordinary. We were here for 7 hours and probably saw a fraction of it. The sheer opulence of the palace is jaw dropping,The modern art and impressionists are now housed across the square in the Staff Building and should not be missed.

Overwhelming . The second largest museum in Europe with the largest collection of Rembrandts in the world. The intricate parquet flooring and gorgeous interiors. The souvenir shopped not to be missed with an outstanding collection of books, which they can mail you. Can't miss this.

The Hermitage - St Petersburg. Requires more than a day to do it full justice. It has an immense collection but worth every second you spend there. Best to take a section bit by bit rather than scurrying through all of it and perhaps do as we did and take a guide who knows the key areas to cover first then allows you to return for a more in depth viewing. All in all a great and MUST DO part of visiting St Petersburg. The building and architecture in itself is jaw dropping and the standard of renovation is high.

not to be missed!. This is a huge but very interesting museum. Even if you're not really into art, you should really see the beautiful inside of the building. Some rooms are just breathtaking! Keep in mind that the place is enormous and even just wandering around will take you at least 4 hours. The museum wasn't too crowded, but I assume that summer season will be a lot busier. Definitely a must do!!!
Great!. This is the most famous gallery in Russia. A lot of people here. Inside we see paintings by Leonardo da Vinci, Titsian, Rembrandt, Picasso and others. It’s very cool! 5 stars!
Great way to spend many hours . This place is fantastic but vast. The scale of exhibits is mind blowing as is the number and wide variety. The building is spectacular

Luxury living at its finest. This amazing collection is well worth viewing. The palace is unbelievably beautiful, lavish living personified. It is well worth a visit. I was there in April- no queuing and about £6 to get in. Be prepared for sensory overload!

Millions of pounds worth of treasures - in fact priceless. Room after room of treasures. Too much for a day, 2 days or probably a lifetime. I spent time looking at The impressionists Manet, Monet, Renoir, Van Gogh etc room after room filled with these precious paintings. Probably worth going for a few hours each day rather than one long day. The cost is very little to get in. The Faberge miniature Tsar crown was perfectly made replica that had been exhibited at the Paris exhibition. There are Rembrandts in the main building. The Impressionists are in the buildings opposite the main Winter Palace building.

Art History. Experience the Romanovs, European Art, European aristocracy, Russian History, and St Petersburg.We downloaded the Hermitage AudioTour app ($4.99) and we're happy with the General Tour.We spent 3 hours going through the museum, and still will have to visit again for a lot of the art, as well as the a la carts Diamond and Gold room tours.

Amazing gallery. A must see attraction. This massive building surely houses one of the finest art galleries in the world. A vast collection, it is easy to while away a day in here and the building itself is as impressive as the paintings. Reasonable cafe

You have to take your coat off!. We were told by a friend that you could easily spend 2 days in this museum, and I can see why now. Unlike many European attractions, you don't get lumbered with following a large crowd, or being followed by one. There is plenty of room to explore at your leisure. Any lovers of History will be agog at the paintings of the Russian royalty that used to inhabit this building. But beware - you can get lost in there! I would thoroughly recommend a visit, but you do need a lot of time to explore properly. Only downside is the queue to offload your coat (which you need to do), and to retrieve it.

More than expected. The Winter Palace and all the other wings are unforgettable. The impressionists wing is unbelievable with room after room of paintings by Picasso, Monet, Degas, Van Gogh, Renoir, and many more. It is the reason to come to St. Petersburg.

World class museum - amazing decor. The Hermitage is 2 things in one. Firstly, the imperial winter palace which is super impressive, while also highlighting the incredible riches of the Czar. Secondly, it is decorated with an amazing art collection, although I found this less impressive - perhaps overpowered by the building, plus the fact that French impressionists are now in another building so the paintings tend to be 1500-1800 European works that are often darker and less interesting to me. The tables (often semi-precious stone) and statues were, I felt, more beautiful and interesting. I was there over 2 hours, and didn't even get to the 2nd floor - you could spend days and days inside.

Beautiful, the building and the collection!. Just for the building and the views already the hermitage is worth visiting. The collection is almost over the top. The most beautiful paintings, Russian heritage, Chinese culture, French artists of the last century, the hermitage has it all.Make sure to be in time for the theatre!
Leisure. Can't compute so wonderful ..awe inspiring..beautiful accessible..what can I say ...gogo ..loads of ceramics and impressionists

Huge museum to be explored. This is a massive collection and takes a careful planning before visiting. It is highly recommended to hire a private guide or the audio guide to start with, since it is really easy to get lost in between the rooms and getting confused with the path. Moreover, hermitage is a true gem of Europe and the best museum in the whole of Russia.

Another must in SP. Very well organised but I recommend you buy your tickets from the automated machines just inside the inner square. Huge crowds were queuing unnecessarily. The machine is easy to use - takes cash and card in all languages. You have to park your backpack etc.in the cloakroom before you can proceed. It's hot and crowded even on a good day. So pace yourself. Check to see if its closed before you visit as they close one day a week. The art is magnificent and is the building as you would expect. Regal and awe inspiring. It can all be a bit overwhelming so you might do as we did and decide in advance what you wanted to see. Even on a highlights tour it took us half a day to get around. In one of the rooms a russian school choir was singing - brilliant acoustics.. It is surprising to see such important works of art up so close and accessible unlike other european art galleries. Wonderful experience. 10/10
Family trip. Wonderful. We did not have a guide and I would get next time. We had a guide for Pushkin and Pavlovsk who was brilliant and great with young kids. I would use next time at Hermitage.

Russian Revalation. This was our first visit to Russia. I was blown away be the breath-taking rooms, decoration, architecture and collections in this museum. The organisation was faultless and it was extremely clean and well tended.

Overwhelming Museum. The Hermitage is one of the finest museums in the world, as there are countless process exhibits from all of Europe. The museum is crowded making it difficult to see many of the top exhibits, but it is still worthwhile to spend as much time as possible at this treasure.
Day at the Hermitage. The Hermitage is really interesting. I'm not a really keen art person but could have easily spend another half day there.The Russian culture rooms were an unexpected highlight.

OMG!!. Every time you turn a corner, another masterpiece awaits the eye. You cannot believe what you're seeing....such grandeur. No wonder there was a revolution. Amazing building, works of art, the interiors......you could easily spend several days here. We did our usual summary of a gallery.....dedicating more time to the works of art we are particularly interested in & glancing through the rest. Incredible place, you have to go.

Buy tickets online. Come early. If just for Impressionists - they in a new wing. . Come here 2-3 times a year - one of best museums in the world. Tips:1. Must get tickets online - they cost the same, but will save you at least an hour (typically 2-3)!2. Get there 20 minutes pre-open. Get cup a coffee on your way to make wait better. But if you manage to get there at open, you will be alone at all halls - trust me, its a cool experience. 3. If you doing this after lunch, start at the new wing (separate entrance, your ticket works there, its called Gen Shtab). Brand new, tons of natural light. Also thats where they moved all their best works of Impressionists (80% of people goto museums to see these anyway, right)? They are all on top floor 4. Gen Shtab also has cool book store on ground floor. Because of RUB devaluation, they sell Taschen books for half of what you would pay in London.
The best part of it is the building itself. The best part of it is the building itself, the art display is interesting but the most breathtaking thing is to feel as anastasia walking down those rooms
Amazing Architect and Paintings. Lots of master piece paintings and sculpture , worth to visit for 3 times to see every thing! Leonardo Davinchi paintings are the best parts.

Beautiful. Something you must do in St Petersburg although you need to allow plenty of time. We had a private guide for three hours and experienced a fraction of the wonders on view. The state rooms of the Winter Palace are jaw dropping before you get to see any of the art in a series of other buildings. Makes us want to return as soon as possible.

Huge,impossible to grasp in one visit.3. This was probably our fifth visit there.Huge entry line.To avoid the line ,you must pre buy the tickets on the net.The internet site is simple and easy to operate. Stuff is friendly and knowledgeable but not all speak English . Audio guide is great , but expensive and covers only small portion of the exhibited rooms and items.Maps are graphically poor.The halls have been and are constantly renovated .Impressive , huge, must be visited.

Sheer opulence. A must see in St.Petersburg. In the actual Winterpalace there are not only the apartments of the zsars, but also hundreds of paintings of anybody of rank and name in the art world. Da Vinci, Reubens..... The impressionist paintings and also Picasso, Kandinsky and Matisse to name but a few are found across the Palace Square in the General Staff building. We spent a whole day in the Hermitage and only scratched the surface. Tip: students of any nationality get free entry, they just need to show ID,a student card or in my son's case, his British bus pass! In between seeing the two museums we had a little fun on the Segways on Palace Square, 300 rubels for a round.

Hermitage Museum. The museum was founded by Catherine the Great and comprises an 18th century winter palace and four other buildings. Here is one of the world's most extensive art collections with more than 2.7 million exhibits. These include literally thousand of paintings and rare sculptures along with carpets, embroidery, lace, porcelain, silverware and furniture. It is these wonderful exhibits which will enchant the visitor but there are just not enough hours in the day to appreciate them all. Please be aware there are quite a few stairs to negotiate.

Fantastic, varied exhibits. There are so many wonderful exhibits to view it is essential to read a bit and prepare a plan. It is impossible to cover every area. The building itself is a wonder of decoration. Buy your tickets before you visit to save standing in the queue.

The Hermitage- Beautiful. We visited The Hermitage with Natalia from St Petes private tours and enjoyed it very much. The marble, gold and silver parts of the Hermitage are exquisite, as well as the wooden parquet floors. With Natalias' guidance we saw the highlightes and didn't fall of our feet. Most recommended
Amazing. Somewhere I've always wanted to visit and I was not disappointed. Some of it is truly jaw dropping. Note the seated guides do not have much English.

Best place in Piter. Even if I had only one month in St. Petersburg, I was stayed in the State Hermitage Museum and lived only here! The collection now contains more than 2.7 million pieces! You cannot see THIS for one time! You must be here I think 10 times!

plan on waiting in line - buy ticket on-line beforehand. Thought waiting in line for an hour would be fine, but even though I joined the line 10 minutes before opening time, I was still about 40 minutes from getting in 90 minutes later (they let groups in every 20 minutes). So I gave up and instead purchased a ticket on-line that evening and went back the next day. But even so, I then had to stand in the "pre-purchased ticket" line, which was not clearly marked. Everyone was confused. And once you make it through the door, then there are two or three more lines before you actually get into the museum itself -- a line to show your ticket receipt and get your ticket, a line to check your coat/bag/water (no water allowed), & a line to go through the security checkpoint. And it seemed as if it were the first day with a new system, as most people working seemed as confused as the guests - & to think they go through that every day...(!) But once you've made it in, it's wonderful. You can easily spend all day - I did. I was one of those very last people they shoo out at the end.

Hermitage was overwh elming in a good way. Before touring the Hermitage I thought I would prefer to wander and discover my own treasures. I was wrong. Our tour guide led us through the huge collection, highlighting what deserved to be highlighted. I would have missed so many of these. Yes, I would have discovered hidden items but I will save that for another visit. As with a visit to an iconic city, an excellent orientation gives you a road to run on next time. The architecture, the paintings, the sculptures, the (fill in the blanks) ... stunning. Go to St. Petersburg. Go to the Faberge Museum. Run to the Hermitage.

huge museum.... when we visit its more than two hours left and about to close its very convenient because they have machine you can pay and take the ticket and it worth to visit its very huge museum need more time to spent..

Biggest museum in the world.?. Certainly seemed to be never ending. Glad we went round in March as fairly quiet and had easy access could be unbearable if crowded and warm. State rooms are well worth visiting and the history is varied and exciting. Everything has been said about the art collection...one of the best in the world. Get there early if you want to see the diamond or gold exhibits as you need time tickets for English tours and the impressionists are now housed in their own block across the square.

“A Huge Museum”. We joined an excursion so we skipped the queue - that saved a lot of time. Because this museum is huge (six buildings combined), you can spend a few days here to enjoy the collection of art, sculpture and antiquities from all over the world. The museum and the Winter Palace are very beautiful. My camera worked hard, I even used the backup camera battery.Happy Travelling!

Go to see Russian architecture, central Asian artifacts and try to snag a visit to the gold and/or diamond room. This museums is the best in understanding and appreciating Russian history, culture and the old imperial family. The place is laden with jaw dropping architecture as well as good artifacts. I enjoyed visiting the winter palace and looking into the rooms with all their rooms and furnishings as well as paintings. The place is dripping with imperial Russian history and a little of Russian revolution history. I would suggest visiting the central Asian, exhibits and artifacts as well as the Siberian areas which are not so well visited sincerely are on the ground floor. Personally, theses are probably the only artifacts you will find from that region that is well preserved . I wouldn't visit the Western European exhibits since you see similar stuff in the Lourve, Vatican Museums, Metropolitan museum of Art etc... Which tends to be more comprehensive since they came from there. Try to snag the visit to the gold or diamond room to get a personal guided tour by the museum curator to those rooms. I managed the gold room tour at around 1300hrs but not the diamond room tour which was at 1345hrs. You need to book it at the main ticket office in the main building and be the first 15 pax (English speaking) for that day. It cost 300Rubles so quite worth it. You will need to buy the main ticket first from any if the ticket office outside or the automated machine before you can purchase this special tour ticket though. The tour is 1.5 hours long. In the gold room, you see Central Asian, Old Roman and Greek gold artefacts around the Volga and Caspian Sea region as well as middle eastern and Chinese artefacts. Worth spending 4 hours in the palace with gold or diamond tour.

Hotter than the sun. Found it very hard to enjoy the museum as the heat was unbearable. Leave all your jackets and jumpers in the cloak room! Head to the third floor to get away from the crowds and see some interesting Asian exhibits.

The most amazing museum I've ever been to.. The most amazing museum I've ever been to.The collection is out of this world, suggest to visit it twice if you’re in st-Petersburg fr a few days. All in one day was just too much. I would go back 1000 times...

Awe inspiring!. One of the greatest museums of art treasures on this planet and it's a miracle it's still here. I spent 7 hours on the 2nd floor alone. Anyone who is a designer should visit here as the arts and crafts alone are incredible. Everywhere there is art...the floors...the walls....ceilings. Have an enormous piece of honey cake in the downstairs cafe and an espresso and get yourself stoked for another few hours. At the very least 2 full days.

A must see!!. Bigger and much more impressive than the Louver itself!!! Such a gigantic venue that has history in every corner. It is fascinating and overwhelming, specially for real museum lovers. Need to spend a full day or may be 2 so you can absorb it all. Need also a lot of walking inside, so better wear comfortably. It shows Russia at its best!

Incredible museum - be sure to moderate your visit. After looking forward to visiting the Hermitage for decades, I was disappointed only in how enormous it was. This museum must be digested in small bites. Visiting the rooms of the Winter Palace was a wonderful experience with some masters thrown in. The variety of rooms and artwork was spectacular. We had a guide. Without one, we'd have been overwhelmed. As great as I expected.

Huge!. Very beautiful and very ornate, historically relevant and well preserved museum with an incredibly large and diverse art collection. Very helpful to have a guide purchase tickets on your behalf and navigate you through this immense property and also show you the relevant pieces of art and give background information.

Great Museums but Inefficient Entrance. Hermitage is a must while visiting St.-Petersburg. Now they opened an exposition in "Main Stab" which is on opposite side of the Place and moved all impressionists, Kandinsky and Rodin there. In contrast to old building this exposition is easy to enter. There is a big mess in purchasing tickets through internet as nowhere stays you must print your ticket out. You cannot go with your mobile and scan from it for any reasons which nobody could explain. So you have to stay in a slow queue very uncomfortable under blowing wind. At the same time there are purchasing automates which allow you to make it faster.

Amazing museum!. I have seen a few art museums in europe in my time, but i must admit, the eremitage simply took my breath away. Since I am a student, I was admitted for free (very useful for budget-travelling students, you do not need an international students card, you will be admitted for free regardless of nationality) and spent the day marvelling the various paintings and other art objects.

Impressive. You probably need two days here to visit all of the rooms. Get a ticket at the automatic machines before you enter and then you walk straight in. Signposting inside is not intuitive - treat it as an adventure.
Amazing. One of the best museums ever. Reserve at least one day because it is worth it, without any doubt. Please visit not only the winter palace but other galleries such as the Modern Art one.

Superb Collection: Better with a Guide. The collection is outstanding. Most times, especially in summer, the crowds are large and the lines can be long. If you can manage it, hire a guide. Small groups or even couples with a guide go through much faster and you can spend more time in front of pieces of art. Either way, it's part of St. Petersburg you won't want to miss. Treasures.

Book the general tour!. In many have written about this excellent work of art. It's breath-taking and seriously enchanting. To make sure you make the most out of it, I strongly recommend to book the tour. I did it and it was impeccable. The guide spoke perfect English and gave us lots of useful information that made us appreciate everything around us even more. The tour lasted for about a couple of hours and costed only 200RB extra.

Amazing!. Absolutely amazing! It is very difficult to go and enjoy with young children, we will try to come back when our son is older. You can buy the ticket in the machine or online at the entrace, but you will have to pay the whole price 600rub for the children, but you can avoid the line.

Just amazing. Like so much architecture in St Petersburg, this is stunning. Huge place with great exhibits. You have to queue to pay and get in, and check your coat in, but it's worth it. Grand rooms, staircases, art from many periods and places, bookshops and cafes. Great place to spend a few hours.
A week to see all. The exterior of the Museum as well as its artistic of are overwhelming. If you have just one day, choose the rooms or the floor you intend to visit!

My dream has come true. I always wanted to visit the Hermitage Museum. And I couldn’t take advantage of this chance, when I came to St. Petersburg. Hermitage is very large. It’s hard to say that something liked me more, and something is less. In the Hermitage all is the luxuriously! A huge number of pictures and various statues, expositions. And everything is divided on eras. And big massive ladders add to the Hermitage even more greatness. Only to get around the whole museum is necessary to allocate at least a couple days, and it is better week)

Amazing, incredible breathtaking collection of art. It is hard to capture in a few sentences the magnitude of the art collection held at this museum, which spans several hundred years from before Da Vinci to early twentieth century. We allowed a morning - after more than 7 hours we had seen about 3/4 of the collection, and that involved skipping some galleries.
Unforgettable!!!. One day is not enough to visit the Hermitage. The amount of history and culture contained in the Hermitage needs no introduction, but visiting it nevertheless overwhelms you.

Palatial. We had only one day and that is not nearly long enough to do justice to what has to be the greatest art treasure house on the planet.I advise doing some research and planning your visit, however also try some random areas. We saw some brilliant Byzantine and Iranian exhibits.Read somewhere that if you spend one minute in front of each of the exhibits then it would take nine years to get through the collection.Only complaint is that other galleries will be a bit tame.

Excellent museum!. I've been here few times. Make sure to plan few hours just for the museum, so that you can fully enjoy the time there. Usually you'll need to wait in queue around 20 minutes to enter the museum. Therefore try to get there as early as you can. Also before you go, check the website of the museum, because they sometimes offer free entrance or some similar promotions.

Evening tour with Disney. Went for an excursion with Disney. We had the place to ourselves after closing. Private tour with a private concert. ABSOLUTELY amazing. The only way I would have taken my 6 year old here because of the crowds during the day. He wanted to go but I knew he would not be able to see a thing during the day. There is not enough time in the day to see everything so plan ahead for what is important to see and do that first, then everything else is a bonus.
Grandure. Splendid grandeur of riches and a great insight into how the elite once lived. Plenty of walking involved - both inside and out!

Simply Incredible!. Even if the State Hermitage Museum was empty it would still be a must-see attraction, as the interior decorations are stunning. The Jordan Staircase and the Malachite Room are my faves. But the museum is also full of incredible art, artifacts and sculptures! You can easily spend a whole day here. Just be careful; your ticket only allows you to enter the museum once and the guards are very strict on that. Unfortunately the lockers, while being within the building, are outside of the museum entrance, so be careful.

Impressively massive art collection worth spending time to see! . The Hermitage is absolutely stunning. The collection is so large that only a fraction is on display. I highly recommend s your of the room of treasures. If you're pressed for time do the room of treasures instead of the gold room which covers a lot of detailed history about the pieces. The ticket line is usually very long and small groups are let in at a time so if you're traveling in winter bring a warm coat! There are student discounts but you must have a student id,international ids are fine.After buying a ticket,you will need to check your coast then pass security and scan your ticket. The museum had 3 floors and most of the collection is stored on the second floor. We did a quick loop around the first and third floor then spent the remaining time on the second floor. You can find a golden peacock clock on the 2nd floor that animates and clucks on the hour. It was closed when we visited so be sure to ask before seeking it out.

A private tour is a must for the Hermitage. We hired a Russian guide to give us a private tour of the Hermitage and to get into the Gold and Jewel room. The Museum is special and the Clock was the highlight. The Faberge eggs were special too...

So huge, so amazing. Well where do you start, this is true for both writing this review as well as viewing this massive museum and palace. So huge and so much to see. You really need to select key areas and go for that. So beautiful in every way. Thanks to Catherine the Great!

What did I just see?. The Hermitage is located in the Winter Palace in St Petersburg. It is humungous and an endless maze of corridors and rooms that somehow all look the same. Do not, I repeat do not attempt to navigate this without a map. The cafe and gift shop are fairly reasonably priced compared to what I am used to paying in other major European Cities. However due to the sheer volume of stuff in the museum it can be a little bit overwhelming. If you don't have much time I would recommend the little Hermitage which has an amazing collection of impressionist and post-impressionist paintings. To really appreciate the Hermitage you need at least 2 hours but a morning till lunch would be ideal.

Great.. We're not the most patient museum guests. But still expect to use 4-5 hours just to see the rooms. A good tip: inside the yard, use the ticket machines. Then you can actually skip the whole line. Saved us at least 1 hour!

Great but. This is a must see when in St Petersburg, but figuring out how to get in was extremely frustrating. It was busy and it was hard to figure out what line was for where and how to get in. We did buy our tickets online but it still took us 2.5 hours to get in. It is worth all the trouble.

Endless. This museum is filled with beautiful rooms, and art. The ceilings decorated in gold and molds are wonderful! While visiting you always feel as if you have seen everything! dead wrong it never end its huge!

Not to be missed.. Absolutely essential when visiting SPB. Beautiful inside and out. Make sure you wear comfy shoes as you may end up walking for miles but worth every step. So huge it's impossible to see it all in a day. Such opulance.Would visit again and again.

Must visit place when you are in St Petersburgh. This museum is one of the best museums of the world ... it can only be compared to Louvre... If you want to see the opulence of the Tsar Era... this is the best place..Do not give it a miss !
박물관. AmazimgVery huge and not possible to see all in aday but have to visit due to No.3 museum in the world.

Possible the best!!. This museum is possibly the best for history and art that I have been to in the world. Very impressed with the Hermitage and wished I could have spent another four hours in there.

Brilliant, lots to see, ensure you leave plenty of time to see everything. This place is massive, lots of world history, paintings, armoury, egyptian artifact, something for everyone.Such a fantastic history for the russian people and visitors.

It is what it said on the tin, one of the worlds greatest collections. The Hermitage is a massive facility of connected buildings that contain one of the most extraordinary collections anywhere. We were told that there are over three million items here and for sure we only saw a small portion of them. We were fortunate to have a private tour with a local guide who was extremely knowledgable of the art and able to guide us around the buildings so that we were able to find the thing we were most interested in. We only had a singe day to explore here but if given a chance would certainly go back to see more. The wonderful Winter Palace, the building that forms a portion of the museum is worth a visit by itself, once home to Russian Emperors. Wear your track shoes when you visit here and be prepared for crowds of people. You will benefit from a guide to help you make the best use of your time. And, be prepared to be amazed!

Magnificent. When others noted that this place is huge I didn't understand just how big until we'd been walking round for 3 hours and only seen about half of the rooms. It was noted on one site that to see all of the rooms would mean walking approx 6 miles! We were more interested in the key rooms rather than the exhibitions and still spent most of the day wandering around. A few tips:- It was closed on a Monday, go early as it got busy even in low season with groups and school trips, use the kiosks in the courtyard to buy general admission tickets to avoid queues, if you want to see the gold or diamond rooms you will need to do a tour and buy tickets from the desks inside, use the free cloakroom for coats and bags - it's too hot and too far to walk to carry them, if not doing a tour or using an audio tour grab a map and mark off the rooms as you go - we managed not to get lost by doing this, the room numbers are above the doors, if you want to see the key rooms ask the audio stands for their route map - it shows the rooms you don't want to miss, if you want to see the exhibitions plan before you go - there's lots to see and you probably won't be able to do it all. Really pleased we went. It was stunning.

This is why you come to St Petersburg. What can one say? My lifetime dream to visit, come true. Plan on a good two days to see it properly. You don't have to purchase expensive tickets online, there are vending machines just as you enter from the street where you can purchase them.

Spectacular!. The museum is interesting not only with its pieces of art but itself the building and rooms are very beautiful and decorated as a real palace. I was absolutely amazed. Also dont miss two extra excursions to the golden room and to the brilliant room. You should buy tickets for them separately but you will not be disappointed. Especially the brilliant one with the treasures of kings and queens will leave you speechless.

Extraordinary. One of the great museum and art collections of the world. It is huge and rambling, and you'll probably get lost. Use the room numbers over the doors to find your way around.Also note that the Impressionist collection is now housed in the General Headquarters building across the square outside.

A time saving, queue avoiding tip. The Hermitage is one of the most wonderful museum/galleries I've ever visited. It is wonderful. I was there in March which I do not think is a particularly busy time. But here's a tip to save you queuing and wasting time:- Buy your entrance ticket from the machines in the courtyard. (Don't buy from ticket office inside which is where lots of people queue because they haven't bought from the machines.)- Then enter the museum... There might be a crush of people when you first enter. But they are queuing to buy tickets. Politely push through them explaining if anyone harumphs that you've got tickets already. You'll pop out into a virtually empty lobby area where you can go straight to cloak room, toilets or the actual museum entrance turnstiles. So buy tickets from the machines outside and don't fall into the trap of queuing with the crush of people inside. Just keep pushing through. And then you'll be in one of the most wonderful museums ever. This tip worked in March. I can't vouch for it in the busier summer months.
Lots to see! . A must-see for any art and culture aficionado! Lots of halls to visit featuring artwork and figurines of various cultures and eras. Wear comfortable shoes!

Not to be missed!!!. It does not matter when and why but this is one the the best museums in the world and you don't have to miss it. Just the ourside of the palace makes you feel in another world, and inside ...well inside it is just wonderful!

Spectacular!. A must see, world-wide famous museum full of AMAZING things to look at and admire. Stunning decor, beautiful masterpieces, you can get lost in these halls and corridors. Splendid, magnificent, full of history and rare finds. Take your time, it is a very large museum!
Wonderful. One of the most spectacular places you can hope to visit. Arrive early and also take out if you can a sponsor ticket that will allow you fast track access

I guess I expected more…. Make no mistake the State Hermitage Museum is incredible and the pieces are exquisite. One could spend days here and not see all it has to offer. Also took the English speaking tour of the gold room and it was well worth it. My disappointment was with the Winter Palace itself. We visited 8 different palaces in the St. Petersburg area… all so rich in history. I found they individually told their own stories of their respective pasts. I did not however, find this to be true of the Winter Palace. In my opinion the Winter Palace seemed a bit sterilized from its unique history. While opulent and beautiful, with the exception of the library, it seemed to me lacking in the presence of those who had once lived there. Also, beware of taxi cabs waiting outside. It cost us more to take one of these cabs less than a mile to our hotel, than it cost us to take a private car in from the airport. The meters are jacked to exorbitant prices.
The Hermitage is a must. On the first Thursday of the month all in the building of the Hermitage with free tickets, which are issued at the box office. Come and watch.
nice. I have seen a lot of nice museums and enjoy paintings. Specially enjoyed the buidling and all the european masters.
as legendary as you've always heard. Room after room of glorious art, furniture, decorative art. Watch out for pick pockets in the courtyard.

Hermitage. We were at the Hermitage off a cruise on a day it was officially closed. If you have a private guide you can get in, as I guess someone gets paid off. This is the only way to see the museum. WE literally flew through the museum, being literally the only 4 people in many exhibit halls. We felt like billionaires. The museum of course is incredible and you could spends days there. So if at all possible go when it is "Closed".

Must see for art lovers is the new section opposite the palace.. Wow! For lovers of art, This has it all. The new section is beautifully set out behind the facade. If you like impressionist art, you must go. It is all here. The main palace is rather like visiting the V & A in London. Huge passageways and rooms with everything from pictures, furniture, stonework, armour, you name it, they have it. Could have spent a whole day here. However, a thing to note, the cafe is not good. Only served stale pastries with tea, coffee or soft drinks.

Fantastic Place to Visit - 2nd trip. Toured while on a Viking Star cruise. Used a private tour company (TJ Travel) this time that give us door-to-door service with a guide and a driver. A little more expensive but a great way to see St. Petersburg as the traffic and tour crowds cain be horrific. Beautiful site worth a visit. The art collection rivals the Louvre. The private tour approach gets you in before the large general crowds and tour buses plus having an individual guide lets you see what you are interested in with a personal explanation.

Amazing and huge museum!. It is very important to have a guide there that is capable of showing you the highlights of the museum. In any other case you might spend days there. With our guide it was amazing!

Unmissable. The Hermitage and Winter Palace is something you cannot miss when visiting St Petersburg. Saying that, however, it was not a highlight of our trip. The Palace Square however was incredible. A place of such history and splendor with the Winter Palace and General Staff Building on either side. We were there early in the morning and it was almost empty which was very special. The Hermitage, bizarrely, is focused on the art work held by the museum, rather than the lavish and fascinating history of Russia and the building itself. We found this rather disappointing. The state rooms themselves have not been preserved or set up to represent the actual state rooms of the Romanov Family, but rather as example rooms of popular decor and furniture of the time. If your passion is art - then go for it! This has one of the largest collections in the world and I'm sure you will be blown away.If your passion is history - still go for it! But read up before hand on the building and the rooms. The information in the building is very scarce on this. And we didn't fully appreciate what we were seeing because so much is focused on the art work. We were there in the low season so were lucky enough that the building itself was not busy and we pretty much had the place to ourselves - a rare treat I think. The best parts for us were the grand staircase upon entering, which really is beautiful. And the Grand Church of the Winter Palace was also absolutely incredible.As I said at the beginning, you cannot go to St Petersburg and not going to the Hermitage. I'm very glad we did it, but we were hoping for more history than art history.

Set Aside At Least 3 Days. I had half a day to cover the Hermitage and boy did I underestimate the size. So many artifacts that are of so many varied interests from Egypt artifacts (nothing beats the real thing though!) to paintings galore. In order to fully appreciate the whole place, you would need a few days set aside to be able to walk around and see it all. There's the general ticket and then the cost for additional rooms so prepare yourself for that. The cloak rooms go on and on but very well organised and structured. If you have made it into St. Petersburg- this is the definate must do of the town!

A very very big museum. It is really very big that have around 300 plus rooms and it took us around 3 hours to finish the whole place. It has a lot of paintings from different culture such as Russia, France, Europe and Asia. Warning to people who dislike arts, will be a little bit bored for u :0
Just awesome. . Just the most breathtaking experience. A trip to St Petersburg would not be complete without a visit here. A guide is a must or you could be in there for weeks !

The best Palace and museum in the world. The winter palace is enormous and you can go into most of the rooms which have been fabulously restored. The Palace itself contains some wonderful artifacts - massive silver pieces etc - quite apart from the paintings in the Hermitage itself. You must go into the church in the palace which has only recently been restores. The Hermitage is world class and has several masterpieces in it - 2 Leonardos (he only painted 5 or so small paintings - the rest were frescoes etc), some brilliant Rembrandts, several Dous, the list is endless. You must also visit the Impressionist section which has been located in the Guards rooms in the curved building opposite the main palace. Fantastic!! For anyone who enjoys museums and art, this is the best place to come to. It gets busy on a weekend as many locals visit then (and even busier in the summer with the tourists) and we recommend that you go as soon as it is open to avoid queuing for tickets.
THe Hermitage. There is no doubt that it is the must see attraction. Put on comfortable shoes as there is a lot of walking.

AMAZING!. A must see for everyone. Could take up an entire day. It is that huge. There is a small cafe. Book tickets online so you can print them at the ticket machine when you arrive. Also arrive in the morning to avoid the huge lines that form.

Beautiful building . The Hermitage is an amazing building, both from the outside and inside.Even if you're not a big fan of older paintings (like myself) there are plenty to of other things to see inside making your visit worthwhile.

Waited 50 years to see it. It does not disappoint. I would advise buying the tickets online to avoid the LONG lines. This is the best museum ever. Chock full and rooms and rooms to see. They do have added pay-extra rooms and yes if you have the money see them! Loved the watch room and the coins and the Faberge Egg room.
Must to see. . I don't know what to say. Just if you ha e never been to this fantastic place, it's your time to arrange your trip and attend some of exibition.

Beautiful building and exhibitions. The State Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace are a location that combines both art and history. The building has a magnificent history (Revolution, Tzars, etc) and it has nowadays art.
Away we go. The Hermitage is huge so make a plan of attack before arriving. This is a must visit for locals and tourists. Enjoy and take in the art, history, and culture.

Unbelievable beauty and grandeur. If you do nothing else in St Petersburg you MUST see this. Nothing in your wildest dreams can prepare you for it. Trip Advisor commissioned someone to advise on sights in St Petersburg and he allocated 4 hours for this museum, gallery, fantasy. Nonsense. We spent a full day and only saw one level of it. The main building has 3 levels and there is a separate building with Impressionist art we didn't have a hope of getting to.The museum has apparently something like 3 million art pieces, not all on display, but it feels like they might be.. Apart from that the building itself, structurally and in fitout, is a major artwork. To say that it is grand is inadequate; indeed, words cannot describe. I have been to many of the major art galleries in the world and they are eclipsed, not necessarily in the volume and quality of the art, but by the enormous, outstanding, extraordinary and amazing gallery. What is also terrible is that this total tsarist indulgence was built by virtual slave labour suffering the cruellest and harshest conditions.There are over 400 rooms in this palace converted to this gallery. Each room is different in decor with splendid vaulted ceilings, ornate columns, massive inlaid doors, worked double windows, decorated walls and timber pattern floors the like of which cannot be found in any other palace anywhere. We were told that the floor in one medium to large room (about 25 metres by 15 metres) took artisans 5 years to make. The room contains 2 malachite urns which took 10 years to craft. The splendid throne room is about metres 50X25x15high and, of course, exceeds the other excesses. And the art! There are rooms full of Rembrandts, Van Dyks, Rubens and more much much more. Works of every major classical artist is here in superabundance. Not just on the walls but sculptures, chandeliers, furniture, decorative items and the list goes on beyond your imagination and expectations. Every turn and every room is a surprise and delight until and past surfeit.

Phenomenal . The museum is wonderful. There is a collection that would meet everyones needs. The location is perfect and winter palace is a museum in itself. If you only have a couple days in St Petersburg make sure you come here.

Must visit place. Been there few times and with every time it is more beautiful than before. I usually go in winter, as it has a really "old fairytale" atmosphere. There are a lot of different things to see and to explore, especially if you have a guide who will tell you interesting stories about everything you can see. Worth money and time spend there. Definitely strongly recommended.
Must se. Incredible opulence, stunningly place and the art work s just a bonus. Beautiful building recommend visiting the state rooms.
Amazing. For sure the best place I ever been in my life. It's a very rich and organised museum. The best time to visit is in the summer.

Hermitage is a must for anyone. This museum is one of the most important in the world. We saw most of it but unfortunately we didnt find the section of contemporary painting. Make sure they give you a map because we were not given one... There is also a phone app of the Hermitage
Must see. I believe a wonderful museum to go if you an Art enthusiast. State rooms beautiful. Enjoyable experience. Worth the money.
Stunning. This is a must do when in St Petersburg. Well worth doing the tour with an English guide to get the most out of a wonderful place

Don't miss it. This should be the place you do not miss in Saint Petersburg. The museum is huge and holds works for the world's great masters.Even if you are not a museum purchase you should take a stroll through.

THE LARGEST AND MOST PRESTIGIOUS MUSEUM. The bulk of the Hermitage collection is housed in the Winter Palace, formerly the official residence of the Romanov Tsars, and its several annexes. However, there are a number of other sites that constitute part of the Hermitage, including the recently opened Storage Facility in the north of St. Petersburg, which offers guided tours through some of the museum's vast stocks.

You must visit the Hermitage!. What can I say? The palace is itself a beautiful piece of art. Then it's also filled with room after room of priceless art. I've been here three times and it still takes a minimum of three hours to get through. If you've never been here before, budget even more time. They have a couple little cafes that sell some very tasty pastries should you need to recharge mid-visit. Don't miss the revolution clock, it's small but a really neat piece of history.

Absolutely the most amazing museum ever!. A not to miss experience if you are lucky enough to be in St. Petersburg. The collections are even more incredible than you imagined. We had a guide to direct us to the most popular exhibits. If your time is limited, I would urge you to consider hiring a guide. If not, take your time and soak up everything this amazing museum has to offer.

Stunning Museum. 26 rembrandts, 2 da vinci's more gold leaf than I have ever seen in any one building, what more is there to say? This is a breath taking building with some outstanding exhibits. The cost of decorating some of the rooms was huge and this is so evident when you see them up close.We got a guide for 3000 robles and this was worth every penny of the fee.We thought it was busy but the guide thought it was empty! Some friends have told me that during the summer it was frighteningly full and you could not get near some of the more famous exhibits. A vist in the winter is advised not only for the reason that it is not as busy but also St Petersburg looks even better in the snow.

best in st petersburg. Central location and easy to access, good value and good organized. Definitely use the map or download the app. you will get lost otherwise and will end up wasting time. Its possible to do it one day but 2 is optimal. Get down there as early as u can to avoid some of the crowds.

Great way to do end a day. Visited in Feb so got straight in without queuing, £6 entrance fee but free if your a student and have your student card. There are maps of the Hermitage once you enter the building in all languages with key pictures rooms etc highlighted. We did it without a guide and found it really easy to follow the map. Coffee bars also inside so you can go and get refreshed before starting again. Cloakrooms available so you can wander round in comfort. Be careful when you go in, we made the mistake if going to the post office to buy stamps when we arrived and came out of that area through exit. ..... That made our ticket invalid. However administrator at an entrance recognised we'd only been in for 10 mins and let us back in without paying again. Fantastic experience

Must see in St. Petersburg. This and the Church of Spilled Blood are the only two things you really need to see in St. Petersburg. We got there 2 hours prior to closing and had no trouble getting tickets at the door. Each hall is a new surprise. Enjoyed seeing some rare fines from some of the greats here.

A Must See. You really need a few days to see everything here, but 2 - 3 will give you a taste of the wealth and history this country is steeped in. A definite 'Must See' of any trip to St.Petersburg.

A museum in a museum. The Hermitage is simply amazing. Not only does it have the second largest collection in the world (behind the Louvre in Paris), but the very building itself is like a museum. They say that, spending one minute per exhibit, it would take something like eight years to view the entire collection. So clearly you will not see everything in one go.My recommendation, and what we have done every time we have visited, is to get a guide. They have guides in the museum or you can find private certified guides that you can hire for yourself. In any case, in my opinion it really is not worth getting an audioguide and simply wandering around. You will likely miss the most interesting items in the collection this way.

One of the best museums in Europe for sure!. This place is huge, there are so many things to see that one needs to make a plan and pick out what one really wants to see if time is limited.Entry is not expensive, around 600 rubles, however for those with an international student card, admission is totally free of charge.

Beautiful exterior. An unquestionably beautiful building from the outside. Once you enter the main lobby, you are once again greeted by a fantastic entrance hall. Unfortunately, after this, it all gets a bit boring...

Bit stuffy.. First of all the place is massive so pick and choose what you really want to see. Secondly it used to be a residence so a lot of the art is in poorly lit kind of rank rooms. The Greek and Roman statues on the first floor were incredible. You should go even if most of it just seems a bit tired.

Visit in winter!. Had a room with 3 paintings by Leonardo da Vinci to ourselves! Wednesday evening open late.... that's the time to visit ...IN WINTER. OK it might be cold (it was -15C outside)...so wrap up well to get there.The newer wing where the impressionist works are housed could do with some better information and signage, but the works themselves are wonderful so apart from occasionally wandering around looking for things, it's pretty close to perfect.

Beautiful. The Hermitage is worth seeing for the building and the rooms alone. The wonderful and extensive art collection is a fantastic bonus.The galleries are well set out with exhibits so numerous that it would be impossible for a casual visitor to do them justice. If you have specific things that you'd like to see, get a guide and ask them to take you to those personal highlights and then browse the galleries until exhaustion kicks in!Do be aware that Impressionist and post-Impressionist art is in the gallery opposite the Winter Palace and is paid for separately. This 4th floor of this gallery is an absolute must-see with Monet, Matisse, Degas, Picasso and many many more
Magnificent. A treasure trove. From the magnificent building which was the winter palace of the Tzars to the Leonardos to the beautiful gold automaton peacock, is truly amazing. Simply magnificent.
Amazing !!!!. Must say do not miss this totally amazing place went out of season February not many tourists ticket office empty will need a full day to see most of this..

Spectacular!. You must visit the Hermitage when in St. Petersburg: it's one of the greatest museums in the world, and the palace(s) are simply spectacular! BE SURE to buy your tickets online; otherwise, you'll stand for hours outside in the long lines. In the bitter winter, this is a great way to spend a full day inside.

Amazingly wonderful. The Hermitage is simply stunning. Incredible art works beautifully presented. This is one of the true treasures of the world. Need to allocate quite a bit of time as this is really a major facility. Minimum three to four hours but preferably at least a whole day.
Lots of art!!!. This is one, worldwide, if not the one to see! To use the word "magnificent" is an understatement! Simply GREAT ART!!!

Great . We've visited the Hermitage a few times with different friends, it's a Must See site for tourists (not only) in Saint Petersburg, Russia. Beautiful museum, historical and meaningful art pieces. Very large spaces - it is recommended to check and choice a head the areas which is interests you since it is almost impossible to see all in a day.

100% must see!. Amazing place that everyone should see at least once in their lifetime! Stunning halls and rooms - it's great to wanted around just looking at the decorations of the palace but then there are also stunning works of art everywhere! Be prepared for some waiting in case you go by yourself and not with a group - I had to wait for about 20 min (not bad compared to Vatican museum). Students remember: with ISIC (international student indentity card) you get a free entry to the museum!

two days of cultural highlights. The ticket includes the General Staff building, the Menshikov Palace and the Museum of the Imperial Porcelain Factory. We bought a two-dayticket in advance and you definitely need two days. A part of the collection of the Hermitage has been moved to the general staff building (e.g. paintings 19th and 20th century like Monet, Picasso, Degas...). You can visit Hermitage on one day, and General Staff on the other. If you have time left visit Menshikov (historically interesting), we skipped Porcelain... Tip: Start your two-day-visit on Sunday. Because the museum is closed on Monday, you can go on on Tuesday. Do something else on monday... Enough possibillities in St-Petersburg and so you avoid spending two consecutive days inside (interesting) buildings..

Better in winter time. February seems to be one of the best months to visit St Petersburg and its museums. The weather was perfect. Even snow was light and temperature was around 0 degrees. Hermitage is a must among all museums here. It is not crowded this time of the year and you can enjoy it as much as you like. We had a perfect guide through Aviator. Ilya was fluent in English and very knowledgeable about the art exhibits. He also kept the pace I was interested. We also visited the Diamond chamber. There our guide Anastasia was very helpful. We were also lucky to have both guides for ourselves only as if a special personalised tour although we bought small group tickets only. This is again due to Feb not being high season. Lastly, I can also remind that even if you don't buy tickets beforehand there are no long queues despite school holiday period.

Do not miss this. This is by far and away the most impressive art gallery I have ever visited. Unrivaled collection in an incredible building.The cafe is not great so fill your boots at breakfast before you go.Make sure you make it to the exhibits of Picasso, Monet, Van Gough etc which are in The General Staff Building across the square.
Amazing palace vert Big and welcome for foreigners. You van Walker in Manu roms which are vert différent each others and discover ma y and différent exibitions !

Very interesting, but too much to take in!. This large building is completely full of interesting items, maybe a bit much to take in all at once. We wanted to go across to the general staff building which had other exhibits, which was really good but so wierdly organised. They had loads of work by Monet/ Van Gogh and so much more, but this was all on the top floor and not really advertised. Wish I'd spent more time here and a bit less in the actual building as by the end I couldn't take anything else in!
Huge museum. This is a huge museum, so much to see. It is sometimes compared with the Louvre, not sure if it's in this category, but it is impressive nonetheless.

Outstanding!. World class museum. A place you must visit before you die. The collections are extremely comprehensive and contains art from all over the world - including the Old Dutch Masters. The size of the museum is extensive so prepare yourself for a long day - or better: split your visit into two-three days. Rumours say that it will take you eight years to walk through the exhibitions if you spend one minute per piece of art!

Huge, overwhelming, and worth it. It's an enormous collection, but if The Louvre, Versailles, Prado, etc are your idea of fun and interesting, this is a must-do! The collections are beautifully worked into the showpiece that is the palace itself. Add in the history curated in the rooms, it's a first-rate world experience. There is so, so much, that if you only have one day, you need to do a lot of planning ahead. But it is worth the effort. If you have more than one day, and are into opulence and Russian history, take a separate tour out to Catherine's Palace, on the outskirts of the coty.

Very opulent. Quite a long queue to get in, and very busy inside. But the architecture and displays in the museum were wonderful - not enough time to see it all unfortunately but enough time to appreciate and absorb the details of the art and exhibitions. Definitely worth the visit.

Get lost in history.... We could've spent days in the hermitage. The building is absolutely huge and everywhere you turn there is something interesting to see. We were there for half a day and felt like we hadn't even seen 1/5 of the things inside. One thing to note... You need to make sure you pick up a map before you enter which tells you the room numbers and where the different sections are located. We didn't do this and ended up walking aimlessly and relying on the scarcely located interactive maps to guide us around. Our mistake though so definitely not worth downgrading this fantastic museum. I would definitely recommend the Russian interiors section of the hermitage (if you can find it).
A must see Museum. Amazing Palace with one of the greatest collection of Art in the world. The Louvre of Saint Petersburg, for 600 rubles, don't miss it!

Three days is not enough!!. One of the best museums I have ever seen.It cannot be seen in two or three days and would suggest spending a day or two, having a break and then returning.The gold room was unbelievable with gold paneled walls, ruby doorknobs one can understand why they had a revolution with such extravagance.Arrive early to avoid ques and do not take many posessions with security is tight.

Beautiful. A must see if you're visiting St Petersburg. It's not expensive at all (700R) and there are so many amazing displays. Make sure to get a map of the building and have at least 3 hours to spare

Best of the Best. Where do I begin ..? This is the best museum in the world... from the moment you enter , and walk through some of the 1000 rooms , your breath is taken away. The long room with the giant chandeliers -- mind-blowing. The works of great masters are everywhere.... Opulence beyond belief... no wonder there was a revolution ! MAGNIFICENT

Too Much To See In One Visit. An overwhelming collection of the most beautiful artwork in the world. One day is not enough to see it all but give it your best shot. Among the finest museums in the world.

Hermitage is an absolute must see.. Absolutely full of beautiful collections and treasures. The opulence of the jewels, clothing, china, and art work is over the top. You could spends days within the walls of the Hermitage and still not see every thing. Don't even think of spending less than three hours inside. It is so worth every minute that you take to inspect everything.

A must see in st Petersburg . We bought our tickets in advance online (I highly recommend you do this so that you can skip the queue).This hermitage is HUGE so do some research in advance and know what you want to see. I think we were out of season so it didn't get too busy, the size of the place means that people are spread out a lot, having said that the pieces by very popular artists do get tour groups stood in front of them for a while but if you get there at opening time, you miss these. The museum is made up of a large number of interconnected rooms which I found incredibly confusing! Pick up a map on your way in and use it!

Pure Culture!. I am amazed how Russia is described within popular American criticism, but surprised every time I visit the former USSR. St Petersburg is a federal city and as such no visa required for up to 48 hours per entrance. This city is spotless ,well maintained and clean even though very old. The metro connects everything so cabs unnecessary. Walking is the best way to see all. My only problem in St Pete was the encounter with a gypsy cab man and it seems his need to rob me. I refused his help at a Metro station days before. Later while walking I again noticed him circling city blocks attempting to use his auto to hit me at a crosswalk.He came close the first time but an old woman was between he and I. I noticed him again and again at every other street rushing to turn in front of me. Finally I asked someone at a neva river tour jokingly and was told he will hit me then run from the cab claiming it my fault then rob me for damages to his vehicle.That was amusing. I went down a side street waited and there he was.

DO NOT MISS THIS!!!!. I am from Australia there is not that much ancient history here but the hermitage museum is absolutely stunning! To know that you have been to where the segue of St Petersburg took place is unreal. The old women volunteers who watch the palace don't smile though EVER!The architecture is amazing and there is gold everywhere!Overall the best tourism experience of my life.The state hermitage museum is a must Visit!

The most amazing museum and palace. It is too big for one day visit, so take your time. I recommend to take a private tour. Suggest to pay a visit to the Florentine Gallery - you can spend there a week.

So.Much.Art.. There were so many pieces of art that the Hermitage is daunting without a tour guide. The imperial apartments were opulent and gorgeous. My favorite part was all of the art covering the walls.

Good history. Nice historical spot to hit up. It is much better with someone who can share the story behind what you see. First time went there with another traveler and just thought things looked cool; second time had someone explaining everything and it was much more interesting.
It was the most memorable tour. If you wiish to know a lot about Russian Rojal Family and European Art it is the best place to go! The guided tour helps a lot not to miss the important exhibits.
Beautiful!. The decorated rooms are very beautiful ! The little plan is not always easy, but everyone want to help

What a Cazar can do with unlimited funds and ego. If you go to St. Petersburg the Hermitage is a must. Note, you have to plan in advance. This very popular place can be crowded but it is worth it. If you are part of a cruise the ship will handle the details and you could avoid the expense of a Russian Visa.
Amazing collection, very confusing maps. The visit itself was great but finding your way isn't always easy. Some descriptions aren't even in English either. All in all well worth the 600 Rubels!

Cannot miss!. This is a place that cannot be missed and is great to visit during winter. On a Wednesday night, the golden peacock clock is a must see. The peacock is so lively and delicate in its movement. I was glad that I was here early enough to watch the show without anyone blocking my view. The Madonna Benoir and Madonna Litta by Da Vin Ci is also a must to see.I will recommend to take on the guided tour as a start. This will give you enough history and story about the hermitage. From there, one can take its time to go around at their own pace.

Museum . We visited as part of a 2 day guided tour. We had been here about 20 years back when things were dark and gloomy. Now the museum is in fine shape with restored masterpieces and good lighting. We got in before official opening time and was able to avoid most of the crowd. One can spend days admiring the paintings and sculptures but on a guided tour we had to rush thru visiting the highlights.
Amazing . It was absolutely amazing excursion. I've never seen such awesome art collection. You need at least a few days for looking the main collection
Too beautiful!!. This place is absolutely gorgeousThe inside decoration is amazingI love every room,very ports trait, the fountains The sculpturesThe story inside etc etc etc

HUGE place - go there at least twice.. The Hermitage is a must see place in St. Petersburg. But it's absolutely massive so I would highly recommend either getting a guide or deciding on what sections you really really want to see instead of trying to see the whole thing. It will knock your little socks off.

Wow what a palace. By having a private guide we were able to move around more freely and skip the lines. It was much more crowded than I thought it would be. But don't miss the opportunity to see this incredible palace.
Cannot be missed. The beauties of this world class museum are well known. Also save some energy for the rooms on traditional siberian art - great art and surprising culture.

Wonderful but exhausting!.
