When we entered the Hermitage Museum very early in the morning, we were told that we would only be there for a maximum of 3 hours and would probably beg to leave long before that. It was indeed a very exhausting visit, as the crowds were unbelievable. It was like being part of a long production line whilst being pushed from one exhibit to the next. We saw so many Old Masters and were surprised to be standing next to a Rembrandt, a Matisse or a Van Gogh which had no visible protection from the people walking passed. There was too much to see in one visit and very tiring after the first hour. One would need to spend at least a week in the Hermitage to see just half of the amazing exhibits. Worth a day of your life!
Beautiful exterior, wonderful inside. So big you need to choose the areas you want to see. We went with a guide and spent 3 hours and this only touched the surface

Crowded but totally worth it!!!!. This museum has unique objects not available anywhere else in the world: fully assembled throne room, royal dining rooms, fully decorated guest rooms, decorative art from semi-pressures stones, and many more in addition to outstanding collection of art from all over the world. Cannot miss it for any reason.

Wow - The Hermitage!!. This is a must see for anyone visiting Saint Petersburg. Be warned it is incredibly popular with the local citizens too and on public holidays the queues to enter can stretch for a mile. Once inside though it is worth it. Fantastic art and furniture collections and incredible displays of arms and armour
Man muss einfach hin!. If it's your first time in Spb, you need to visit Eremitage! You never have seen such a wonderful museum in the world with its history!

Incredible! So much to see. This is a must do if you are in St Petersburg and if not, a reason to visit. Every Room is full of treasures. It is impossible to see everything in a single visit, so i would recommend visiting at least twice. I visited in December and it seemed very quiet, i was sometimes in rooms alone. Don't miss the Rembrandts or the Raphael loggia.

Greatness. To visit St. Petersburg and not visit the Hermitage, it's like to go to Paris without seeing the Louvre and fly to Rome and not visit the Vatican. They are similar and yet different, but they all share the splendor of colors, gold and the silence of history. Come to the Hermitage, at least for an hour or two, but better three or five hour, and you'll understand why your short story, I titled one word greatness ...

Huge Museum- Get a tour guide! Incredible collection!!. They also have those small handheld things for the self tours which I saw people using. But we had a tour guide- this place is huge. Get someone who knows what they are doing- It can be pretty crowded and also you can get lost. Not a lot of places to eat inside and the coat room was very very crowded! Incredible collection! A must see.
Don't miss this place. One of the most popular and defining places of St.-Petersburg. Always crowded and noisy but if you miss it duting your trip to the city you will never forgive yourself.

Huge and Amazing Museum. This museum was a palace of Tsar called winter palace. Beautiful and amazing building with a lot of stuff to show to you. The stuff that fascinating me much is the collecting of painting and statue. if you stand here, you do not go anywhere to see mummy, Leonardo da Vinci's Painting about baby Jesus and the famous stolen kisses painting. Beside the collection very amazing you can enjoy the beauty of every room you entering. The staff very helpful even cant speak English. Every room have one the most beautiful collection. So before entering the museum make sure you have the brochure. The brochure make you not to lost and find the jewel of the collection in every showroom. The Museum will free for visitor in every Thursday in every month (cmiiw) cause when i was there the museum was free for every visitor.

Art Lovers Paradise. A huge amount of art by some of the old masters. Very busy so difficult to see everything you want. Of all the palaces in St Petersberg this is the least impressive but only because Peterhof and St Catherines are so stunning. Didn't have time to look around outside.

So good … I hate it!. Yes, I really do! Hate it … I mean. It is so beautiful, so rich of art and masterpieces and the palace is just so marvelous that I never know whether to look at the collections, the furniture or what else …. to the point that I feel overwhelmed and end up losing my concentration and see nothing at all! Or remember very little of what I have seen.The Hermitage, of all the museums that I have visited in my whole like, is probably the richest in terms of collections and diversity and sure enough one of the most beautiful, if not the best.

For the history & culture lover, a must-visit on the bucket list. Took 7.5 hours of almost non stop walking, reading & taking photos, to comb all the display area. i think i only manage 80% of it. Get a good pair of walking shoes and have a super heavy breakfast before starting.
WOW !!. Words can't describe this palace. I don't think any words can describe just how beautiful the Hermitage is, you just have to see it to believe the grandeur of it.

Very big art gallery. While definitely recommended, I found the museum just average. There's a large art collection. However, the museum is way too big and is very confusing. We ended up walking around in circles, and not being able to find certain exhibits. Similarly, very little is in English. Additionally, the staff do not speak English which can make things difficult. I'd recommend using the audio guide option. Overall, I found this museum average.

Winter visit. So much to see that you need to plan what you want to view. Could easily take a couple of days and not see all. We had a brilliant guide organised by our hotel Casa Leto. A host of gold leaf, marvellous art from Michaelango to Canaletto. Really worth visiting. Recommend visiting in winter when absolutely no queue!

I mean, how do you sum this up.... Really, it's the Hermitage. There's so much art, it's dizzying. In places, I'm more fascinated by the filigree than the paintings. If you have the money and time, it might be best to take this one on over several days (skip the portraits--they're a bit monotonous). If you have a particular piece you want to see (The Return of the Prodigal Son, for example) and sit with, do that first. You might be overwhelmed by the time you get to it.
"A must see" attraction. Combine Louvre, Versailles, Reichsmuseum and you are close to what this has to offer. “A Must See” attraction.

Beautiful museum and art gallery. Better than Palace of Versailles, Paris. This is the Winter Palace of the Russian Czars. Built and furnished in a grand but tasteful style. Conducted tours in several languages available at an extra price. Can take more than one day to fully explore this museum; most visitors make do with one visit; Allow 5 hours at least.

A simply must go to if ever in St Petersburg. We spent all day exploring the various displays and exhibitions and it was still not enough. This attraction simply cannot be missed and if possible I would recommend 2 days to ensure you don't miss anything

Stunning,beautiful and more.. We only managed a fraction of it and because of the time of year it wasn't too busy. I would recommend going with a tour guide as you really wouldn't know where to start on your own and they also get access before the general crowds. It is vast and huge so a tour guide really does help. We spent 3 hours but it didn't feel like it. If you go to St Petersburg this is the one place to visit. We will certainly go back and try and see the rest of the it.

No words to describe the grandness..... The state museum now is made up of 5 buildings one of which is the Winter Palace along the banks of Neva river... hermitage established as a museum in 1764 when Catherine ll purchased a collection belonging to a merchant Johann Gotzkowsky which included 225 canvases..but now has 3 million exhibits...the grand stairway a white marble affair with twin flights..make it very majestic..St George Hall...with its bronze chandeliers!! Peter the Great Hall walls covered with velvet embroidery with silver has a silver throne made in England . The Malachite room preserved in its entirety. The Pavilion hall..houses one of the highlights of the museum..18 Century Peacock Clock.Collection of European great paintings...the Madonna litta by Vinci ,the return of the Prodigal Son by Rembrandt, Woman with a Fan by Picasso..Besides houses artistic and cultural relicts of ancient Greek Roman other empires No words can describe the grand show and display of all...will visit again one day.

Very nice and impressive. We visited this very impressive building during our trip in Russia. This is one of the most beautiful building we visited there. The only thing a little bit annoying is the "people traffic" but that's what happens when something is famous ! I recommend
absolutely amazing!. It is place NUMBER ONE to visit when you are in Saint Petersburg. They have good discounts for students! :)

Nothing else like it in the World. There are no words that can really describe this. You could take a week, a month or even a year or so to see everything depending on how much time you want to spend on each item. It is said the if you looked at every item on display for 10 seconds it would take 7 years to go through it. That said, you can get a good overview in about 3 hours, but that is just walking along and glancing at things as you go by.The biggest thing to know is don't go on your own! Go with a licensed tour company like Alla Tours so that you will have an English speaking guide and even more important, the tour companies get access to the building before it opens to the public so you are first in before the main crowds. And, believe me, there are crowds.

Wonderful museum even if you aren't a museum lover.. Beautiful historical site. Definitely see the gold room. The entrance and exit is very congested and the lines seemed long. Visited as a cruise ship excursion and had easy access thankfully.

Amazing structure and history!. Absolutely loved the building, the history, the art... There's over three million pieces on display... A definite thing to do in St Petersburg! Guided tours with translators available!!!

Free with a valid student ID!. It is free with a valid student ID card. Great place to admire Russian art from the past. Many things are not explained in English but enough to get an idea what is it about. There is a lot to see, so focus on a small part or be prepared to spend the whole day there (and there will still be something left to see!). Downstairs it has cafes that have Wifi.

A must see. To echo what everyone else has said, the complex is huge, and navigating it becomes a rather daunting task as you start to absorb the sheer, overwhelming grandeur of the place. Definitely set aside a half day (a full day if you can manage it) to explore, as the exhibitions are fantastic and the architecture unparalleled. Photography is allowed in most rooms, so capturing and remembering your visit is easy, even if you start to become a bit overwhelmed by it all! Gift shops, toilets, and cafés are conveniently located on site, and prices are very reasonable - free for students providing the right documentation is produced. A must see when in St Petersburg!
O my. If one travels the world and saw many gorgeous place with art and such and thinks the one saw all, it is a false. Most magnificent place is hard to imagine. The place has all and more

Beyond opulent. To see the outside of the palace in its entirety ,you need to stand about a half a mile away To the right, there is a smaller palace where Catherine installed her boyfriends. the palace goes on forever with one treasure after the next. I especially like the large golden peacock CLOCK which actually works. It has an owl that makes the sound of the hour at night, and a rooster that crows the hours during the day. [ I gotta get one of those]

A once and unforgettable visit to this magnificent palace. I felt like stepping into the past, to the 18th century where this museum used to be a residence of Russian imperials. I love 18th and 19th buildings, especially when they have stories and still well maintained. This museum is one of the best in the world (much of them I must visit in my wish list!), and oh-well I was astonished to see the most beautiful museum I've ever seen in my life. The collections are impeccable, the interior designs and decorations are elegant. I could not remember each rooms, some of them were spacious dance and music halls, with St.George's Hall striking for its red center and parqueet floor. The room of ancient Egypt gave me creeps (since I read they put real mummy there...), the jordan staircase, the war gallery, the skylight rooms..you name it, every room, every hall, every hallway...this palace is a masterpiece. I would spent days here just admiring the stories and taking pictures of those beauties! I hope I had some luck to visit this place again, one day.

Awesome experience. Been lucky enough to have visited the museum twice now. On the second occasion managed to avoid the long queues to enter through local contacts. It's quite hard to describe the beauty and amazement of this place, once you visit this will become apparent. Clearly the Russian royal family lived it up prior to being wiped out in the revolution. Simply a must do when visiting St Petersburg!

High up on my bucket list!. Friends that have seen this are awestruck at its excellence and incredible detail and quality! Beautifully and lovingly restored, it is as amazing as when it was constructed to be the best artisans could offer worldwide...they succeeded, I hear.

Amazing place, amazing palace but just so huge huge huge!. This place really is an experience! You just can't really describe it very well in words. It is absolutely ginormous and expect to see only a tiny part of it when you visit. We visited as part of a shore excursion off a cruise ship so I don't know how you would go about visiting it independently. It seemed very busy and confusing so I wouldn't have liked to have gone independently. The rooms and items in them are fascinating but start to get a bit hard work, repetitive and tiring after about an hour or so. There are vast numbers of people all milling around the building so be prepared to get a bit hacked off and fed up with everyone. These issues aside, it is truely a magnificent place to visit and a must see in St Petersburg.
the best museum in the world. to be honest i dont like to visit museums but i like hermitage very much.and you can take photos inside

Get a guided tour, well worth the money!. The building is stunning and colossal in size! We went in with it in mind to go all the way around, after we had a guided tour of the gold room. Our guide was the sweetest lady whose speciality was in fact Spanish art, however, her grasp of the English language and depth of her knowledge with regard to the contents of the room was impressive, to say the least.There is so much in the Hermitage to view that like with all museums, you reach your saturation limit, at which point we called it a day... Given the size of the building, we believe there was much more!!

The best museum I've visited. This museum is awesome. You can enjoy the paintings and sculptures, but also the art on every floor, walls and ceilings. It's really impressive, so beautiful. We visited on october so it was sort of empty, we could enjoy all the masterpieces at our own pace with no rush. We had a guide who explained us a lot. We loved it.

Must do - a quality tour would be best. As awe inspiring as you'd expect, this palace goes on forever and has over three million pieces in its collection. Yes, you read me right. Three million!While of course you can just wander in on your own and start being impressed, you'll have a tendency to just be amazed - while missing the intricacies/unique qualities/best bits. You must get some kind of tour happening - which is available in every budget size. I went massive with a private tour by Irina from Marina Tours - expensive and worth every ruble! We did three hours in the main buildings with a private one hour tour of the Golden Treasury. Show stopping and an unforgettable experience. But if the Hermitage isn't on your bucket list and you're in the market for something less pricey, an audio tour in most of the languages of earth is actually all you really need.I must say though, put aside some coin for the treasury rooms. Because who could miss an opportunity to see gold jewellery from 4000BC and a saddle quilt with 18,000 diamonds?

Number one in the world. Unfortunately, this rating gives you not correct vision what is really the best.I see it be the number one . Number two is Louvre. Number three is British Museum.And only Number four is Metropolitan Museum. I have been in all of them and many times.Come and see. Enjoy!To see something you need minimum one whole day, 10 hours .

Great, but the visiting map a little confusing. Nice exhibits, halls, paintings. It closes quite early (that day, closed at 17:00). Reserve plenty of time and visit even few days in a row. Some exhibitions were moved in another building, as maintenance works were carried out. Also, some sections were closed. This happens at each big museum, though.The most troubling is their printed guide. Not only the museum has double corridors (in parallel) and you need to see where you are, but also the room numbers and their corresponding rooms do not match those from the printed map. You follow a corridor and see on the map that it should come a certain room. When you get there, you are in a slightly different point. A bit disconcerting, but manageable.

Stunning Place. This building is simply vast and stunning. A whole day visit barely does it justice. Magnificent design, decoration, artwork and vast array of pictures, artefacts etc to see. Mostly all freely available to take pictures of. Not expensive to enter. Good facilities inside too with free cloakroom and various cafe's.

Review this with a guide. The only way to see this beautiful building is with the help of a guide. There is so much to see and cover and the guide will be able to take you through the group line, check your coat in the group cloak room and start from there. We spent a lovely 3 hours in this beautiful edifice and it's a Must in St. Petersburg.

Simply astonishing. I never thought I could be bored by Canova or Picasso but the assortment here is so wide and rich that, if you manage to not get lost, you will find plenty of masterpieces from every land and every time.The staff was very kind and welcoming, maybe even because it was winter and there were “few” visitors: perfect for looking at every piece with no hurry.

A Must Do Visit. We spent at least 3 hours here, should have been longer but it gets a bit tiring, especially as it was so busy. Some of the rooms were delightful with fantastic ceilings.The problem was that it was very difficult to take everything in, there was just so much to see. We are spoilt in the UK, especially London were we have such wonderful buildings. St Petersburg was so special to us as the architecture was so beautiful and different. It has been on our to do list for years and we are so glad that we went.I could go on writing this review for a lot longer, all I would add is that it is a must see.
Fantastic and historical place. Fantastic and historical place, which will help you get more educated, learn about history and enjoy luxury and beauty of old times.

World Class. Be ready to be blown away by Art and Architectural overload. Surprisingly a lot of Western European Art ranging from French Impressionists, Dutch Masters and Avant-garde Picasso. Words can't describe so go visit. Check for free visit days e.g. Thursday but better be ready for long queue. Better to book online. Hermitage is a collection of museums so be prepared to travel e.g. to Palace of Menshikov.

Highlight - a must see! Amazing Building!. One of the places I have wanted to go all my life - an incredible building - with immense history and a must see - I was more interested in the outside and the Romanov rooms/reconstructions but of course the artwork is so impressive and the building is huge - you could so easily get lost inside! We booked tickets (valid for 2 days) online before we left to avoid any queues but there weren't any.The cafe was good to eat in with plenty of choice and not over priced ( even though we had read reviews said it wasn't much good).

Great building but don't expect alot of Russian works. This is an amazing & beautiful building, especially with all the history that goes with it. The stairways, ceilings, chandeliers, mirrors, doors, furniture & even door handles are amazing & stunning. Going during winter is great, there are no lines to get in & you can get up close & personal with the art works. There is a good range of Rembrandt, Raffael & Leonardo da Vinci works in this place.It would have been good if the administrators could have upgraded the toilets, so toilet paper could be flushed instead of having the used toilet paper go into the bin. Otherwise this is a must visit!
Amazing, amazing, amazing!. I had read about this museum in many books and finally got to SP and went. What an amazing place, busy but well run.

Palatial. Fantastic visit well worth the few rubles it costs and more! Take time to do a tour like the Diamond room,very interesting and don't miss the chance to see Baroness Rothschilds faberge egg. Plenty of cloakroom and cafe space too. A real treasure.

Superb!. The Hermitage is truly one of the finest museums of the world. Part of that accolade goes to the Hermitage for the quality of its collection, and part goes to it for the setting of imperial grandeur in which those pieces are set. Here you can see the monumental Ruben’s The Prodigal Son in person. Note: modern (Impressionists and on) pieces have been moved out of the building to a new, separate museum across the square. A separate ticket is needed for access to that museum.
Just wonderful. Beautiful palace at the Niva river side with a large patio. a huge and stunning museum. undoubtedly one of the largest and most gorgeous in world. unmissable!

Lots of art and historu. Visited this place with my wife. There is so much to see here. It takes hours to go trough just a small part of the place. Rooms are covered with gold and very cool stuff in every room to browse! Must see place in St.petersburg
Amazing Place. This is a place you need to go at least one time in your life, you need to leave at least 4 to 6 hours as there is such amazing history to see in this Museum.

AMAZING. Such a interesting place - i studied all about the Romanovs at school and the Winter Palace was the highest of my list of places that I wanted to visit and it didnt disappoint. The Palace is huge, and then there is more buildings. The Palace was very opulent and gorgeous the detail that went into every room - and every room was different to the previous. We were on a tour and were told to look at some art but looking at the ceilings or walls were just more interesting sometimes. Got to see the Throne room, Church, Apartments and Ball room, Grand staircase as well as so much art. The painting of all the Tsars and Tsarinas were very interesting and unique but my favourite thing was the Peacock clock - this caused me to get separated from my group though and i spent the next 30mins slightly lost. Because of its size, and that its made up of many buildings its not a place you want to get lost in - wearing in and out of buildings and up and down levels is very confusing - however i did get to see some interesting things that others might not have :)Amazing place - definately recommend
Amazing. The Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace are beautiful buildings containing an amazing collection of artefacts. I only spent 4 hours there and could have spent days.

A great museum!. This is a huge museum with many different expeditions to see. A beautiful castle with amazing art and history. In spring-summer you can go see the cats that live there, and if you visit on the first Thursday of the month I believe, entrance is free for everyone. I visited there in 2014 (the app won't let me change the date)

Must see!. I've always wanted to go there, and it didn't disappoint me! It's enormous. Has so many interesting things to see. And the rooms itself are beautiful. It's a must see for those who like museums.
Amazing. Awe inspiring... Have a guide. Give it a couple days at a min. The various parts of the building are as important as the amazing collections. You need a guide to really appreciate them.
Jewel in the crown. We were lucky we didn't have to wait, except at the obligatory cloakroom.Well worth it. We were blown away. Definitely one for the bucket list.
Amazing museum. You could be lost in here for days just gawping at the building, but on top of a sumptuous palace there is more artwork than you can take in. Go see!

Stuff dreams are made of. It's been half a year since I visited the State Hermitage. It is forever etched into my brain. An absolutely fantastic museum and arguably the world's best! Took two solid days to roam around and soak in all the beauty. Rembrandt, Van Gogh, Picasso, Matisse, Michelangelo, Da Vinci and so, so much more to view here. You can get pretty close and see the masterstrokes of each of the artists. Having grown up hearing about some of these and seeing them in pictures, my experience was totally surreal. Swarms of people gather around certain paintings and pieces whilst there tour-guide recites the story behind each piece, however, you may listen in and exhibit a little patience in order to get up close and personal when its your turn. Most of the pieces are from individuals' private collections, and if you try to touch something or get too close you'll be escorted out. Oh and, they say that if you spend a minute looking at each piece at the Hermitage, it would take you 11 years to completely view the gallery :) . Take your time, pick your artists / pieces, and head on over for some feel-good viewing.

The winter Palace-the Hermitage Museum,the Baroque masterpiece of Rastrelli.. The winter Palace-the Hermitage Museum,the Baroque masterpiece of Rastrelli.Luxurious Museum in the capital of the Russian Empire,established by Catherine the great for relaxation and enjoyment,a unique Treasury masters of painting sculpture!

Impressive collection of world's art. So much has been said... the Hermitage is such an impressive place... the buildings, the different collections, the rooms! Plan your visit carefully, a whole day is by long not sufficient!Staff if wonderful!

Absolutely beautiful! A must see. This beautiful museum and palace is a must see. The splendidly decorated rooms take your breath away. I was especially impressed with the chandeliers and the parquet floors. My daughter and I actually danced the waltz when we entered the main ballroom. We spent 4 hours there and only toured the first floor. Make sure you see the incredible Peacock Clock. I recommend that you get your tickets on internet before you go to avoid standing in line.

Excellent experience. What can you say about the Hermitage? It is an enormous palace with every room containing articles of artistic, historic, or cultural significance. A tremendous experience that I would recommend to any art lover or lover of Russian history.

Huge is the word. We spent over 4 hours in the museum and barely scanned through the more important galleries. The collections are mind-boggling in their expanse and variety. The Winter palace itself is an exhibit most breathtaking. The Golden hall, the Czar's church, the main throne and the Jordan staircase are just marvelous.

Must See!. A grand Museum which is has the same level as Louvre or Prada. And the building itself is no worse than a unique collection of paintings and other exhibits. You will definitely enjoy it, but remember, that all corridors and halls are 24 kilometres long. So that is going to be a looong visit.

Overwhelming. Fabulous museum with an overwhelming amount of exhibits. Book online to ensure you don’t have to join the long queues at busy times. There is far too much to see here in 1 day so if that’s all you have you must either book a guided tour, pay for the audio tour or do some research on their very helpful website which lets you plan what you want to see before you visit. The Winter Palace is a must see.

MustGo!. My husband and I wanted to go to State Hermitage Museum the next day as it was already late but a student came to us and selling us half price tickets. We took the risks and as it was already late, we just stayed for 2 hrs! I must say if I have the chance to go there again, I will definitely stay the whole day! Everything there are so beautiful and interesting especially the 'Mummy' ! Worth visiting!!! Go! Go!

Winter on St. Peter's . Wonderful, wort to visit each single inch of the winter palace is wort to see and appreciate. If you are in St. Peter's make sure you spare at least 2 or more hours to visit it.

Wow. wish we had more time. Breathtaking. We were doing the 72 hour visa free stay and a visit here with our tour guide was included. I WISH we could have spent 72 hours here alone it was amazing. I just loved this place. Every room had me in awe and SO much to see. All the paintings were amazing the sculptures, the building itself and the walls, ceilings and furniture. EVERYTHING about this building is incredible and fascinating. A wonderful surprise was I can now say I have seen two original Leonardo Da Vinci's and one Michaelangelo.

Amazing Museum. The buzz around this place is amazing..massive crowds on the day we were there. Bit of a bun fight to leave your coat and bags into the cloakroom. Be prepared for a huge amount of walking as the museum is massive. Get a map before you start the tour if you are not using a guide. We had a knowledgeable guide who took us to the areas she liked which was fine but would have liked to have seen some Russian artwork such as Faberge. All in all a must see if visiting St Petersberg.

Stunning!. Not enough lifetime to enjoy it all! An amazing collection and well presented although in some rooms the daylight plays tricks on the glass in front of the paintings. The building is beautiful and well renovated. In winter the queuing up for tickets can be cold, better to get tickets via internet.
Splendid!. Must see museum! Every room you would see would impress you more and more! Recommend spending at least a day there.

Breathtaking experience!. Absolutely amazing! I spent there 6 hours and couldn't get enough of it! The interior are just breathtaking and the collection of art will suit any taste! Especially I liked the 3d floor with the modern painters of 20th century! Highly recommended! I advise to get a radio set with descriptions of each painting, I was travelling alone and never felt bored! If you are in St Petersburg it's a MUST!

Amazing both the art and the palace. On a very cold -26 January day we bought tickets online ( a must to avoid the queue and spent and intoxicating day in the palace and general staff building across the square. The palace is breathtaking, the art incredible, Leonardo, Michaelangelo, Rembrant, what a collection . Ticket prices very reasonable. Cafe very ordinary but awarm place to rest between art binged

Timetable. Price. Free pass.. days off - Monday.Open:10:30 - 18:00 Tuesday, thursday, saturday, sunday.10:30 - 21:00 wednsday, friday.Ticket: 600 rub per person. You can buy a ticket from the divices in the courtyard of the Hermitage. They look like ATM. Sо if you buy a ticket like this, you dont need to stay in line. Some say these devices have problems but i think in that case you can ask hermitage worker for help.Free pass to the museum is on the first thursday of every month. But the queue sometime is huge))

An absolute beauty. I have waited in very cold weather (-23 degrees) for hours to enter this jewel. And it was worth every minute of torture (cold). It is absolutely stunning and every art lovers dream. The moment you see the main staircase and you walk up your mouth falls open and you tear up. So much precious art! Stunning, stunning, stunning! If I have to give one negative comment it would be the extreme long queues all day long which is simply inhumane during winter time. It does not matter if you have a internet voucher, you still have to stand in row for hours before you have the ticket itself. The Hermitage should work on this.
Fantastic. Very rich place with so many beautiful items on display. Really exceptional. You need plenty of time to see all these marvels. We had a great time there indeed.
Spectacular. Huge museum with absolutely breathtaking collection of paintings and sculptures - Dutch, French, Spanish - you name it. It is a must for everybody, just remember to save a lot of time!

Absolutely stunning. I can't think of anywhere that has given me a bigger joy than my first sighting of this beautiful place. We visited when the ground was full of snow and the Christmas tree was still in the main area-completely magical!The palace and museum are not to be missed as they are stunning and well worth a full day of your holiday schedule.I cannot emphasise enough the beauty of this place

One of the worlds greatest collections a MUST to visit. When visiting St Petersburg the Hermitage is one of the worlds greatest collections if not the greatest ,where else are they 49 Rembrabts and Rubens all in one place!!This is not to mention the extreme conservation work that has been completed on the State Rooms of the winter Palace I would hate to even think of the money spent on the restoration of this unique world treasure .THANK YOU Russia for the foresight and care that has been taken on these monuments.To give this collection a fair coverage you would need many days HOWEVER even a short visit is an eye opener into another worldThe visitor number are however huge therefore you may well want to consider booking ahead to avoid the queues ,take on a half day guide to allow you to see that parts of the collection that attract you ,pay extra for the limited time slots available before or after closing times and limit yourself to see a few parts of the collection and rooms rather than try to run yourself silly and cover it all.This is just not possible on a single visit.HOWEVER this place is a must for any world traveler regardless of there interests.

Amazing collection of art on a more amazing setting. A stupendous palace with an impressive art collection. We spent 6 hours here and still would love to spend more time. The experience is definitely improved with a professional tour guide, which we had.

Magnificent museum and palace, not to be missed . I could not stop taking photos of the awe inspiring buildings of the Hermitage museum and Winter Palace. We had a guide, which meant we did not have to queue for tickets in minus 19 degrees weather. The guide took us to the highlights of the museum, the most spectacular rooms in the palace and some of the most important collections in the different galleries. Truly magnificent art collection inside a majestic setting. A magical experience.

Stunning. We did this with a guide, I would definitely recommend this, it is a simply HUGE museum. We were taken to all the highlights, got out share of Rembrandt and Da Vinci, a sculpture by Michelangelo. A great place to go but quite overwhelming. A guide is recommended or you will miss the great stuff!

The best museum in the world. The building matches the contents. Now in two sections with the 'Modern Art' transferred to the Administration building across Palace Square featuring some exciting architecture in-filling the old courtyard.
Everything kept immaculately clean and dust free, but the cafe was a let-down. Not up to the standard of our last visit and the one blot on such a wonderful experience.

Stunning building full of interesting things - night visit. To get the most of this beautiful palace we went on a Wednesday night when it's open until 9pm. In addition, the New Years light show was on at the same time so we were very lucky.Going at night means much less crowds and you can wander around at your own pace with most of the rooms to yourself.The combined museum and palace are enormous so make sure you have comfy shoes on!!I particularly wanted to see the chapel, throne room and Royal family portraits - I wasn't disappointed.We did the self guided tour which gave us freedom and a bit of the excitement of exploring.It's a must see!!
Amazing. for this amazing museum one day is not enough i start to walk and in one day just visited one floor ...Its a little expensive but if you r in StP you have to visit this amazing museum
So much to see and such grandeur. A must for any visitor. So many rooms to explore with fine art and magnificent ceilings. You could easily spend a whole day or two here.
Huuuuge. If you like museums you'll love the Hermitage. A must see in this beautiful city, although it's so large it's overwhelming

Amazing but as most Russian museums. The first floor is stuffed with everything one can imaging, gold and paintings! I can only recommend to use the audio guide, otherwise it could become quite boring after some time. Not surprising was that the other floors containing historical findings of different parts of Russia are not as interesting as floor 1
Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace in St. Petersburg. This is the place to visit if you are into art collections. It is definetly one of the highlights of this town.

Heaven on Earth!. A MUST-MUST-MUST visit place when visiting (or living-in my opinion) in St.Petersburg! If you are an art fan and have good taste THIS is the place to be! Absolutely breathtakingly beautiful.The ceilings (my secret obsession) are magnificent.The marble statues speak for themselves.My only dissapointment was that although i am a student in the State University I was not given a discount. Secondly the entrances i found confusing and walked the wrong way and when i exited couldnt get back in but the information office was very friendly and explained how to get around to it and let me back in.Don't miss it a unique experience!!!
Must See!. Just to have the chance to get a sneak pick on the palace where the Romanov's family use to live should count immensely! Not forgetting also the amazing collection of art available.

Need to entertain the kids too. For history buff it was a good place to be to learn the Russian History and Art. The ancient egypt section was also interesting alongside the Rennaisance section.Need to caution though as the place is really huge so need to take it slow especially travelling with young children aged 9 and 4. Need to also entertain them with explanation on whats what otherwise they will get bored easily.

A Must-to-See for St Petersburg - one of the most impressive museum/palace in the world. Spent 5 hours in Hermitage and only finished not even half of it... it was so impressive - both the collections there and the architecture/decoration of the palace itself!! Make sure you leave 1 day for it - unless you really have zero interest/appreciation in art.... Bought my ticket online I still had to queue in the ticket office to collect me ticket!! (maybe because it's winter/low season so they closed the ticket collection machine..). But I found it's cheaper to buy there! Cheapest ticket is £6 but I bought it for £12 online (the cheapest option) - it might be that the £12 offers more buildings/wings of the museum to visit - but I can't even finish one building within 5 hours, not to mention having time to visit the rest.... No idea about how long the queue is in summer - probably that's when you really need to buy online and pay premium if needed!
arrive early for tickets. need a week to see half the exhibits. Not just art but artefacts from many civilizations plus the state rooms in all their grandeur
Beautiful. it is one of many must see attractions. the interior is mind blowing and will take you back in the history, the audio guide is very helpful.
Amazing!. One of the best museums in the world!The luxurious, gorgeous, amazing ...I do not have time to see it all.Are mandatory to be here.

Overwhelming Beauty . Went twice this week to visit the museum. Both times with a personal guide. If you love art and have visited many other museums you will not want to miss the Hermitage. I can now cross this of my life list. There are some fantastic pieces of art here, but it's the palace itself that stands out as the work of art. I highly recommend a guide.

Bucket List Must See. Stunning and unforgettable. We did a private tour to miss the endless queues. We only managed to see a tiny part of what this spectacular place has to offer - it would take days to see it all. However what we saw was breathtaking. The beautiful paintings on display by artists such as Rembrandt, Monet, Renoir were close enough to touch - could see the actual brush strokes. Evening finished in a beautiful gallery lined with Old Masters, sipping champagne and listening to St Petersburg philharmonic orchestra. Amazing!

Amazing collection of fine art. I spent 2 days in this wonderful museum, continuously amazed by the beauty of the exhibition of so many and beautiful art pieces they have there. In my opinion is at least comparable with Louvre.
Anazing. Amazing.. not possible to say in words, must see! Please calculate enough time for visit - 1 day is not enough.

One of the world's great treasures. This amazing museum has an incredible political history in addition to one of the world's best art collections. Fridays early or late have much smaller crowds and the first Thursday of each month is free. Because the collection is so vast, it pays to get a guide for an overview of the collection and the history of the Palace. Don't forget the General Staff building which houses an amazing collection of modernists and contemporary work.

One of the best places in Saint Petersburg!!!. Hermitage is one of the most important and greatest places you need to see in Saint Petersburg. It's a wonderful place , Winter is the ideal time to visit it because there not so many people as in summer.Enjoy Russia!!!

Culture at every corner. Don't miss out on the new Impressionists museum which is across the square from the Hermitage in a separate building. It has a wonderful collection of paintings that should not be missed/The Hermitage was simply fantastic. so much so that you stop being amazed!!However don't go between My and September as the cruise ships disgorge thousands every day and it gets too busy.

Huge museum. To do in st petersburg. Very nice museum with amazing room in the palace. Quick advice download (and bring your earpiece) the audio guide on your phone if you rent one there it will cost 450roubles

Amazing. Amazing from the outside to the inside! I am not big on museums! But in the world this one and the louvre are the only 2 worth going to for me! Just plan for more than a day to see everything! I went for a day and still missed some! I would advise more than one!

Beyond imagination. There is nothing to be said about the magnificence of this palace that would be over-stating it. The opulence and level of craftsmanship are breathtaking. Do remember that the entire palace has been restored after fire and damage during conflicts. Truly stunning
Dec visit. Visiting in the winter is amazing! No crowds and a chance to see the incredible art in almost solitude....wow!

Possibly the most beautiful museum I have ever visited. It's not just the magnificent works of art in the Hermitage that grab you, but the rooms and corridors they are found in. Just fantastic. I never think it's wise to spend too long in a museum at one go, but this one we stayed in for 6 hours, until we were exhausted - but exhilerated. The queueing system and automatic machines for buying tickets was very poor and took over one hour.

Had a great time. This museum offered a variety of histories from different cultures. It is all quite fascinating! There is no need to do the tour though, it takes up too much time. Just explore! Most of the signs are in english as well.

Amazing art collection. It is not very often, when one can see so many paintings of great artist. I was there three times for two hours each time and still managed only to see the major things. The best was when I was with a group of Guests from our ship. Our guide, Olga had her way very well planed, so we saw the most in a relatively short time.
Remarkable collection of art. It would years to truly appreciate all the masterpieces and the architecture! A guide is essential and we had the benefit of a guide for just 2 of us - well worth it.
Outsanding Museum. Fabulous setting and works. Transcends time and history. Accommodations for handicap now in place and supportive staff.

Stunning museum, not to be missed. Come early and make sure you have a day to spend, there's so much to see it can easily steal hours without you noticing. The building itself is the highlight, make sure to look up at the ceiling and down at the floor in every room. Lives up to it's reputation as the world's greatest museum.

No words can do this justice. I dont think I have ever been so overwhelmed by a collection in my life. Any superlative would be an understatement. Quite simply the finest collection you will see anywhete. I am in awe of it. Addtothat that it is housed in a sensational and historic building and I can't think what else you could possibly want. Don't forget to cross the squate to see the wonderful impressionists also. Loved the rooms showing tbe palace interiors also.

Unbelievable, overwhelming contents and architecture....Cannot be missed.... robably the one site that has brought you to St Petersburg in the first place. The Hermitage Museum complex consists of six historic buildings (one of which was the former residence of Russian Tsars) today make up the Hermitage Museum, housing one of the finest art collections in the world. Allegedly, Catherine the Great bankrupted Russia in the process of building this incredible museum, which collections containing over 3million items include many works of the great masters such as Rembrandt, Rueben's and Van Dyk, plus many, many others.  The Hermitage is as huge as it is amazing.You’d struggle to visit even the most important sections in one day. If you go independently, you must choose what to see before starting your tour but it will be unlikely for you to enjoy the Treasuries. Artwork aside, the interiors are breathtaking and you can get up close to both furniture and paintings & get a real sense of how the Romanovs lived. Must sees include the Gold room, the crimson boudoir, the church, the Jordan staircase & peacock clock. The signage isn't great & it's huge so do your research in advance, or you’ll spend a lot of time retracing your steps. Make sure you don’t miss the Raphael Loggias, designed to mimic the Gallery n the Papal Palace in Vatican City. It’s s fantastic tunnel like hallway, with concentric arches the whole length, making for a great photo opportunity. Take some shots of the full gallery, but also zoom into sub-elements to focus the eye.           The experience is just as much about the building, not just the stuff on the walls. All you need to do is walk from room to room and try not to let your jaw drag on the floor. As a drop dead imperial statement these buildings are without equal. Wander and look up, look down, look out the windows at the river or out across Palace Square and let yourself be impressed. Then get a coffee and something to eat and go to the building on the other side of the Palace Square, The Building of the General Staff. It was the Foreign Office of the Tsars and recently had an internal refit. It houses the 19th and 20th century French collections and is one of the greatest art experiences it's possible to have. Forget the museums in Paris, these galleries are the greatest visual art experiences you'll ever have.  Tickets for the complex are very limited and you must arrive at dawn to secure your entry. Some hotels also sell tickets, so if you have that option then it’s worth considering, as you’ll bypass the queues. If you have connections, or your guide is approved, you maybe able to get in on a Monday, when it's closed for the public. On any other day, or unless you go in Winter, the museum will be very crowded - don’t expect to be able to be left in peace to ponder over individual items as you’ll likely be shunted along. The Museum is free of charge the first Thursday of every month. To get the most from this place, a Guide would be helpful. They’d be able to explain the history and significance of key items and rooms, ensure you don’t miss any critical pieces, and provide insight into the life of the Royal Family .. however, from a photographers pov, that may be not a good option. Guide’s are generally not happy to sit around while the guy with the DSLR stops to take photo’s through a random window of the view down below the street, or fiddles with their camera settings for 15mins while taking experimental shots of the ceiling.  Photography is permitted, but strict rules on camera equipment and bags… you’re not allowed any bags or tripods..Also, you will not be allowed to go back to your bag unless you have a multi-entry ticket so you’ll need to be some creativity If you need more than 1 lens (e.g. zoom and wide angle) then you'll’ need to be able to put one in a coat pocket or very small handbag. You’ll not be allowed to use a flash anyway, so you’ll need to to be running at high ISO’s unless you can leverage natural light coming in through the large windows, but that’s only good for a few of the rooms. You will not be allowed to take photo’s in the Gold and Diamond Rooms.I always believe that first impressions last. So if you want a an impressions you won’t forget, I recommend approaching via the small side street 'ulica Bolshaya Morskaya’ which will lead you North and under the Archway of the 'Building of the General Staff. This will open up into the vast Palace square revealing the museum entrance directly opposite you, and beautiful in each direction.  To the North is the triumphal central column and the aqua coloured museum, west is towering domed roof of St Isaacs, behind you will be the gentle neo-classical curve of the General Staff Building. The square is a fascinating place, try and spend some time there spread out over the day. You will find yourself transported into a Romanov period setting, with player's dressed in Romanov costumes trying to get tourists to take their photo’s for a fee, traditional horse carriages, and if you are really lucky you may even find a film crew making a period drama, complete with extra’s. In the evenings, the square transforms into a concert arena, with impromptu bands blaring out various genres of music and the youth of city dancing.

A must. I was there with a guide, and that helped. Otherwise I think I would have spent a whole day inside and still not see all the important things. I would compare it to Versailles in terms of what it offers to tourists, you can really see a lot of different things and admire a very nice architecture. In case you go on your own it would be handy to try and book in advance.

Wow!. You have got to visit here if you are in St Petersburg. We took a guided tour as we weren't sure which were the best rooms to visit (recommend St Petersburg Free Walking Tour) and it can be a bit overwhelming for first timers.The opulence and décor of each room really is amazing - so much gold/gilt it's unbelievable. And so many art including among others Da Vinci, Rubens and Rembrandt. Highly recommended.

Amazing . Definitely worth a visit! Try and book a tour, it makes it much more interesting. You can easily spend several hours exploring the different rooms and collections of the museum. We were there in November and took a 1h tour of the Gold Collection and then went exploring the rest of the museum on our own.
Must see, must do. It's a dead sin to go to St Petersburg and not to visit this world renowned collection of fine arts. Book one full day to visit, take your time, take your curiosity and enjoy.

Friday night. Glavny Shtab - part of the Hermitage opposite the Winter Palace, accross the square. Not everybody realizes that this is also Hermitage. Fantastic interiors. Impressionists. Temporary exhibitions. Open till late on Friday and Wednesday.

Stunning. Suprised and delighted by this spectacular Museum, we had only allocated a half day...really need 2 full days, a must see, collection from all over the world and from all ages. We were luck enough to be there in early December so not to busy.

Incredible Art. Beyond beautiful with art from every civilization and age the world has seen. I was particularly impressed by the Egyptian, Russian, and Steppe peoples' displays. You could spend a week here easily, but we went on Wednesday when it is open later. The Diamond exhibit and the Gold exhibit are separate and require pre-purchase (made with general entrance ticket purchase). You will have to choose a tour time. There is a cafe with food to recharge you, as you cannot leave and return the same day. Amazing collection!

no word to say. this is one of the best museum I have visited ,I spent all day ,it was not enough ,I would like to go there again to see this palace wonderful building and wonderful items to see ,I would definetly recomend

Out of control!. There's little to add, new discoveries around every corner in this museum. Watch the Russian Ark before you go for a wild one take ride through much of the Winter Palace. The recently expanded wing is architecturally oddly vacant, but still much amazingness contained within. Apparently there are 100 (or hundreds?) cats living in the basement - to help with rodents? Frida Kahlo seems to be paying a temporary visit right now. Try to time your visit to the peacock clock unfurling its gold tail!

Hermitage Museum. We visited the Hermitage in June of 2015. We were on a cruise with Holland America Line but booked our St Petersburg tour with SPB Tours. The Hermitage is must see when in St Petersburg. It is truly grand.However be prepared for huge crowds. The tour groups are kept to a time frame so there is no time for wondering on your own.

Wonderful Museum. This is a "must visit" museum... It is very big so we dedicated a good 6 hours to visit almost all of it. The display of art work is amazing, as well as the actual building construction.There is a lot of variety and the collections are outstanding.There is a cafe where you can grab something to eat quick. Gets crowded so finding a place to sit at the cafe is quite a quest (this is why I am leaving 4 starts and not 5).

The beginning of December - the best time to visit. If you want to see the masterpieces of the Hermitage way through the motley crowd and quietly walk the halls, go to St. Petersburg at the beginning of winter. And don't forget to buy an e-ticket. The voucher, which you exchange for a ticket at the Hermitage, is valid for six months, so if your trip fails, you can use it another time.
The must see. Great museam with beautiful halls and a tremendous collection of European art. If you stand in front of each picture for 30 seconds, it will take you3 years to see every picture.

few great exhibitions. with multi entree billets which can be bought at the entrance of the entrance of Hermitage 650 rubles you can do 5 museums. Do not miss Modern and impressionist exhibition in General staff building near by included in the price of the billet

For who loves museum. The most amazing collections of arts. I repented because I didn't spent one week there. The sculptures, mumias, paints... All the space was a type of magical culture, because all things are there.
Overwhelming. You can spend the whole day here, art for every taste and amazing original rooms of the palace! Must place in St Pete!

The Must of St. Petersburg. Being a museum nerd.... This museum was the purpose of my visit. Before, I had thoroughly explored various websites to be able to make a choise..what to see. It is SOO huge that one must limit oneself and go to the 'rooms' interesting for you..! Was I happy I did. The five days I spend here were magic!

A St. Petersburg must. Simply put, this is THE worlds greatest art museum. Millions of pieces spread across multiple buildings, you need to understand you won't see it all in a day, let alone 3. I bought a 2 day ticket only which allowed to skip the queue but it wasn't that busy as I visited in Dec so the crowds had subsided. Make sure you put your bags at the free coat checks and take all you need with you because unless you have a multi entry ticket you won't be able to go back out to get stuff from your bag. It's also easy to get lost so grab a map of the winter museum and if you want to see the French impressionists, walk across palace square to the General Staff building on the 3rd floor to see them. The museum is closed on Mondays but open late until 9pm on Wed & Fri nights so make the most of the open times. Plus the first Thursday of each month is free for everyone!

Catherine the Great bankrupted Russia to build this. Catherine the Great bankrupted Russia to build this incredible museum. There never has been, nor can I imagine there ever will be another art museum as grandiose and spectacular as this. If you do only one thing in St. Petersburg, make it this.

Palpable sense of history. The Hermitage is an amazing place - the art collection aside, the interiors are breathtaking and you can get up close to both furniture and paintings & get a real sense of how the Romanovs lived. Must sees include the gold room, the crimson boudoir, the church, the Jordan staircase & peacock clock. The signage isn't great & it's huge so do your research in advance, we spent a lot of time doubling back on ourselves looking for rooms. We completely missed the 3rd floor!We went on the first Thursday of the month so admission was free but although we had to queue for an hour to get in, we found that it wasn't too busy inside (probably because it's so huge).

Museum visit on a rainy Sunday. A very nice museum and a must while in St Petersburg! Its a very large museum so make sure to arrive with lots of energy for a minimum of 2h. Its worth spending a small amount extra to get the guided tour available in different languages. We visited the museum on a rainy Sunday which is not recommended! Lots of people were standing in line and we had to wait at least 30min before even entering the museum. Dont miss out on 2 fantastic and original paintings from Leonardo Da Vinci!
Gorgeous building and nice collections. The building was the best attraction in Ermitage museum, where you can also find great art, especially in the Russian and Caucasian area.

Stunning palace rooms and artworks. To get the most out of the visit to the Hermitage, take a guide particularly if you don't speak or read Russian.The extent of the palace and the opulence of the materials used in construction of the building and it's rooms, furniture, fittings and decorations were far more opulent than you could imagine.The art collections again are far larger and contain many works of the great masters such as Rembrandt, Rueben's and Van Dyk, plus many, many others.Plan on spending at least 3 hours plus here to get the most out of a visit and cover all the exhibits, and even then that would allow you to focus on the best of the exhibits.We visited in early December which is the low season for visitors and it was pleasant not to have to deal with vast crowds and waiting times that are often the case in warmer months

An experience not to be missed. The museum was stunning with many paintings and items to see. The ceilings with the paintings are breathtaking in themselves - It is mind blowing wondering how long it would have taken the artist to paint them. Catherine the Great left a beautiful gift to the people of Moscow.

What a day. So much to see and for £6. Excellent . We visited on Saturday. Arriving approx 1130. We purchased our tickets at the ticket office and opted for the multi site ticket for £6 each. The hermatige is made up of different connected buildings with so many interesting exhibits. We were in awe. Some dating back to 3c bc. We visited the winter palace. A little odd. You have to go out of the hermatige walk along the canal and enter from the embankment side. It's not well signed for non Russians. We were told to take a large card guide, without which we wouldn't have understood anything we were seeing. Perhaps the most bizarre thing is the wax man. A life size copy of Peter the great created from casts 3 days after he died. It even has his real hair which was cut and used. It was then back up the canal and across the square to the gallery. We didn't really know what this was but being as it was included in our ticket we gave it a try. We were fortunate to see a steve mccurry photographic exhibition which was outstanding and lots of other artifacts. We didn't see everything as there is far to much to see in a day. Our legs ached from all the walking but if in st petersburg don't miss this place it is fantastic.

The best museum in the world. The former imperators palace. Huge collection of arts. I prefer the third fllor with the collection of impressionists, may be not huge but consisted from master pieces. Just one advice, don't try to visit all halles at one day. It is impossible)) Or even if you can run very fastly you'll have just a mass of impressions.

Largest painting collection in the world in incredible buildings. Founded in 1764 by Catherine the Great one of the oldest and most important museums in the world with a collection of 3 million items, the largest in the world. 6 buildings form the Museum, accessible from the courtyard, in front of the Winter Palace, a building with 1,786 doors, 1,945 windows, 1,500 rooms & 117 staircases!!! Hermitage is huge.You can't visit even the most important sections in one day. If you go independently, you must choose what to see before starting your tour but it will be unlikely for you to enjoy the Treasuries. Tickets are very limited and you must arrive at dawn to secure your entry. I had the luck to visit the Museum on Monday, when it's closed for the public and that's why I enjoyed the collections with nobody around. Although we were a group with a guide, we had to be separated in the Gold Room, in smaller groups with extra guides. But it was worth it, even for the small gold jewel created by a Greek artist. Unique in the whole world, no one can guess how it was achieved. The gold is so fine, it's like a hair. You can't believe it's real. The Museum is free of charge the first Thursday of every month. Photos are allowed but not in the Gold and Diamond Room.
I'm guessing you're coming for this!. It's an experience you can't possibly miss. The amount of stuff this museum and palace contains is absolutely mind blowing!

Overwhelming experience. This is a personal view of the Hermitage, everyone has one, this is mine.The Winter Palace and Hermitage are enormous, we clocked up just under 5 kms walking. The whole place makes you wonder just how many paintings there are in the world. It's very easy to get tired very quickly. And really, it's the triumph of quantity over quality. There are a few nice Leonardo's and a Caravaggio was on display, but part from these, the actual collection didn't do that much for me.The experience is about the building, not the stuff on the walls. All you need to do is walk from room to room and try not to let your jaw drag on the floor. As a drop dead imperial statement these buildings are without equal. Get there early and just wander and look up, look down, look out the windows at the river or out across Palace Square and let yourself be impressed. Then get a coffee and something to eat and go to the building on the other side of the Palace Square, The Building of the General Staff. It was the Foreign Office of the Tsars and has just had a smart internal refit. It houses the 19th and 20th century French collections and is one of the greatest art experiences it's possible to have. Forget the museums in Paris, these galleries are the greatest visual art experiences you'll ever have. To stand in the same room as Matisse's overwhelming Dance and Music canvases will always be a high point in anyone's life. When there's so much fear and loathing all around, a visit to the General Staff reminds you of what human beings are also capable of. It's uplifting, inspiring and a great remedy for the world's ugliness and stupidity.

Perfect visit, exceptional tour guide. A guide is necessary for the huge range of items in this magnificent of places. Lena was great, identified all the top exhibits to see & gave an excellent detailed explanation on each. Ceilinfs, floors, walls, chandeliers, clocks, paintings, sculptures, pillars, vases, marble.....can't say enough about the must see range of diverse elaborate decor, shown in its original glory. Lived up to all my expectations with knobs on. Exceptional place can't be matched. If you don't visit the Hermitage you haven't been to St. Petersburg!

Sensory overload. Everywhere you turn there is more art and architecture than your mind can absorb. Our guide said that if you spent one minute observing each of the major pieces, it would take 7 years to work your way through. We had 90 minutes. It was a wonderful blur.

Go Just to See the Opulence and Beauty....Don't Try to Do in An Hour. The large scale of the Hermitage and Winter Palace alone are worth going.A couple of tips: if you are going in the winter, you must leave all coats in a coat room. So bring a small purse or satchel to put valuables in to take with you in the museum. Secondly, you can take photos, but all flashes must be turned off. Thirdly, make sure you allow plenty of time and eat before you come. There is a cafe, but I would suggest going on a full stomach so you are not forced to rush. Lastly, there are plenty of clean restrooms so no need to worry about that! I was pregnant and was thankful for this last one :)Pictures do not do this justice because the size of everything is so large and dimensional. The beauty and craftsmanship will make you smile in awe. A perfect backdrop for the many works of art and artifact that are housed here. All ages will find something to appreciate, we saw many children in awe over all the gold and the horse armor section!

Enough splendor and beauty to last for a long time. It is the place for everyone that arrives to St Petersburg to visit,You should have days to wander and take in all the beautiful paintings and admire the handiwork of the workmen that build such a huge palace ,I wonder if the zars had time to visit all the rooms and admire the art they had collected,It all is so rich and hard to comprehend that someone lived there. I found the rooms really amazing with all gildings , drapes , chandeliers , all mirrors reflecting the light and making the ballrooms looking even bigger. Absolutely, you have to visit the Hermitage, you cannot imagine how grand it is before you see it .
Awesome!. When you walk into the square and see the Winter Palace, it is just overwhelming. The museum has lots to see and is an unforgettable day out.

Breath taking. I LOVED The Hermitage. I was expecting a boring old museum with too much art to look at. Goodness me, this was the most beautiful and opulent place. The pieces of art were so well displayed with such attention to detail that even non art lovers had to be impressed. I could have spent several more hours here. It was so exciting to view original works of art. Some of the pieces were so large, they took my breath away. Could go back here again and spend several more hours just looking and soaking up the atmosphere and history.

World Class. All I can say is the interior of this building is truly amazing. The range and type of art works in enough reason to want to spend time in this building. However the finishes on the walls and ceilings is what takes your breath away. They are so wonderful it defies my ability to describe.If you went no where else in St. Petersburg but the Hermitage Museum you would come away saying it was one of the best places in the world to visit. How I wish I had more time to spend in it. You could spend days in there and not get bored. The displays have good description in both Russian and English.It will be on my travel list to go back to it.

One of the Must See Museums of the World. This is a must see museum in St.Petersburg. The biggest museum in Russia and one of the biggest museums in the world. You will have the chance of seeing the finest art in the world as well as the palace itself. Don't skip the The General Staff building across the palace, your ticket is valid there too. No need to say too much about it since you can find a lot of information on the internet. All I have to say is buy your tickets online and skip the long ques. You can buy your tickets through official website of the museum.

Amazing collection of art and architecture. This is the sort of place everyone who can should visit just to have the experience. But be aware, the throng of tourists all eager to see and experience the well known masterpieces within vast collection, inhibits the opportunity to properly appreciate the most notable pieces. I found there was much to admire in the lesser halls and rooms. The perennial flow of guided tours kept me moving on too.

World Class Museum. I've been to the Hermitage on two different trips to St. Petersburg and consider it my favorite art museum in the world. Two days is not nearly enough time. The museum itself is enormous - make sure to hit up the annex also, as there are many pieces that got moved there the second time I visited. I love the Hermitage.

Beautiful. The building itself is so beautiful that I did not even care about the paintings. We were there on a Sunday as a group of students in the afternoon and there wasn't too many people around. I recommend a guide to get all the cool facts about the architecture and the most famous paintings.
Too much confusion. It's hard to visit, due to the fatct that it seems everything is put "random" in this magnificent palace. Buy your ticket in advance online, you will save time.
One day is hardly enough. A fabulous setting for a museum. If you can get past the stunning architecture of the palace then you might just see some of the art and artefacts.
A must see. So much history in one place, it is breathtaking. Must bring your walking shoes and try to spend as much time as you can.
Very confusing layout.. All the exhibits are in halls which aren't in any type of logical order. There are very few signs in the museum to help guide you. This is one place where a tour is a must!

Don't miss it!. The State Hermitage Museum is a must see when visiting STP. It is huge though, so if you want to see the collection and everything make sure to allocate a day here. Personally I was mostly interested in the famous Winter Palace and skipped most of the collection, and even so I spent almost four here as the palace is huge and has a lot of history. In short: don't miss it!! Its cheap too.

Must in St Peterburg. It is one of the precious treasures of Russia. Not possible to describe in words all the beauty, and all the priceless pieces of art...this has to be seen and experienced personally.The only problem is that in order to really see all of the treasures of Hermitage you need to be inside for minimum 1 week.... they say if you stop for 30 sec in front of each of artfacts you need 7 yrs to go around all the museum...Some parts of the museum are limited assess, like the Golden Forest-you need special permit.

A lot beautiful things to see!. It's a rally posh place, worth seeing. Russian "posh" architecture is much more pompous than european. But it is an activity for a long time, maybe even almost the whole day, so have a good breakfast before you go there!

More culture please. The art on display is undoubtedly some of the finest in the world, and the palace containing it is very impressive. However, my trip was sullied somewhat by large groups of tourists of a certain ethnic background (I won't name names, but judging from the small flags waved by their over-zealous guides, I will assume they're from the very large and powerful country in Asia that isn't India or Japan, the one that gets on so very well with Taiwan & Hong Kong). I mean, it was disgraceful. These groups were raising their voices, barging through elderly visitors, completely uninterested in anything other than taking pictures of the art on their iPhones & Canon cameras and rushing on without appreciating anything. New money and all that. I would suggest going at a quieter time, because it's absolutely worth seeing. Just don't let the other tourists spoil it for you.

Visit in the past glory. Quite nice visit, this is an impressive museum that you need to take time for. I went there on a sunday afternoon and had the funny pleasure to see all these young couple flirting without really paying attention to the art pieces

Mega cultural experience.. There is enough here to keep you occupied just browsing for a week. Felt our visit was superficial but in awe of the art masterpieces on display - need to spend much longer to do it justice. Magnificent building.
Impressive and Must see. One of the best Museum I have ever seen. The palace property is very impressive and must be visited.

Most amazing museum. This is one of the must visit attractions in Russia. Unfortunately I went on a group tour and we only spent less than 2 hours here - so it was a whirlwind tour. If you love architecture, culture and arts you will need to spare at least 3 - 4 hours here to visit all the sections and get up close to works by Da Vinci, Van Gogh, Raphael and many other great European artists.Travel light as you will need to leave big bag at the clock room. Again be prepared for a lot of walking as there's a lot to see. As any where in Russia toilets are limited here and there's always a long line.
mng. this is so unreal you have never seen anything like it a big must allow 4hours and do it twice once with a tour and once on your own you can take pics
So much to see. This vast place is beautiful, even if you do not like the style you will still be impressed by the building and the vast size of the art collection. Very impressive.

Very impressive. I am very interested in architecture and this palace did not disappoint. The basic building is not particularly impressive, but the inside detailing and craftsmanship are unbelievable. The multi-variety inlaid wood floors alone are worth the visit, but there are treat for the eyes everywhere you look for the floors to the ornate ceilings with each more impressive than the last.

You cannot miss it. You have to go in this marvelous place. Just outside you cannot miss it, you can imagine inside.There is no words to say something about this Palace and what inside.Great, favolous place.

Exquisite!. I don't imagine anybody actually "sees" the Hermitage. Rather, they see a small part of it, and that's exactly what we did. Much like the Metropolitan in New York, or the Louvre in Paris, you would need to dedicate at least a week to have any hope of seeing a high percentage of the masterpieces contained there. This museum, which includes the Tsar's Winter Palace, is unbelievable! Much of the art is religious in nature. It is fascinating to see how the last Tsar and his family actually lived, and the palace quarters have been lovingly preserved, and in some cases, restored. You will need to climb stairs, and it requires a good deal of walking. However, there were benches and chairs here and there along the way for taking brief respites. I would recommend this tour to anyone who wants to get a look at Russian royal life in the early 20th century.

majestic, impressive, worth a day of browsing. I could have stayed here for days. I was traveling with people with varying degrees of art appreciation, but I think everyone found something to enjoy for a few hours at least. If you do not care so much about art, I would still recommend a 1-hour browse through the Hermitage. If you enjoy art, plan to take a day or two to take it in.
The hughlite. It felt really like the louvre, the grandeur was overwhelming, and the information provided ok for non russian speakers.
Don't miss this experience. It's one of the world's great museums and art galleries. You can stand with your nose an inch away from 2 Da Vinci paintings - what's not to love about that

Art lovers museum!. Any one who loves are will love this museum! Even though they dont allow photos I managed to snap quite a few. You can spend days in this museum. I recommend this museum for people of all ages. The only thing that is unfair of course is the admission price. They have 2 prices. One for locals and one for foreigners. The foreigner price is much more expensive than the local. Other than that you will have a great time!

Superb collection and venue. The museum building is very famous as the Winter Palace and is it's interiors are a prominent part of the exhibition.It is massive in scale and in the number of exhibits. It is situated on a picturesque Square opposite another pretty building.This museum is a treasure trove of art and specially for the paintings. It has a superb collection of original paintings from famous artists like Leonardo da Vinci, Rembrandt and many many more.It is a must visit on a tour of St Petersburg. Please keep aside half a day for this museum. But if you love art then you need to devote an entire day.The museum has good facilities for the visitors. If you hire a guide, it would be even better.The museum has few souvenir shops and they are a gem. I bought a brilliant necktie which was a print of a Van Gogh masterpiece.This museum is among the best in the world for art. Enough said.

Awesome. Our tour happened to be on a Monday which is the day the museum is closed to the public.Only open for tours and students.Our wait time was short but on any other day would have been extremely long.With over six hundred rooms unable to see everything,however the tour did give us a great opportunity to view many works of art and the history of the site

Amazing . Wonderful Museum, everything is so organized and clean! Speechless! It is worth going, the atmosphere is really special! And I think it is better to go in autumn or winter because you will not find a lot of tourists but It'll be cold!
Incredible. One of the best museums in the world, it is worth the entire trip to St Peterburg and it is a tour through worldwide art.

Beautiful, Beyond All Expectations. We had an amazing Russian tour guide, and spent about 3 hours here. One could easily spend days...the place is huge! The art, the statues, the tapestries are WOW! Even the floors, doors and ceilings are works of art. This incredible museum should be a "must do" on everyone's bucket list.

A Must see in St. P. We booked a guide in advance and would strongly recommend this, to skip the entrance lines and also to bring the building to life much more with the history of it. A guide can also keep you moving and not get you lost!
