I would not attempt this palace without booking a tour, the line for independent visitors wound around and out of sight.

You need a whole week to see it!. What an incredible Museum! Fantastic colection of itens from all over the world! The building itself is Beautiful! Art! Art all over! You will need severas days to see it all!

Amazing display of art in beautiful surrounds. One of the best, if not THE best, collection of art, ancient and modern, from around the world. All housed in amazing and dazzlingly impressive palatial surrounds. As others have said, you can easily avoid the crowds & tour groups, the place is huge! We found ourselves alone In quite a few of the rooms...Just a couple of negatives to point out are that the Museum cafe is very poor, and also there is not the ability to 'step outside' for a while during your visit if you need some fresh air (or a smoke). Once you're in, you're in and you have to stay in for the duration.

Something special for everyone. I must state a large proportion of the treasures from across Russia has ended up here. Hence, must visit. My big insight from visiting the Winter Palace (where one of the 3 hermitage museums is located) was how the metro stations in Moscow were as magnificent as the hallways in the Palace. The collection from the earlier periods: Siberian Antiquities and Central Asia was particularly interesting to me. The grand peacock gold clock was worth the entry price. Tip: Eat before going, café is dreadful.
A Great Collection. State Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace St Petersburg is a great collection of masterpieces. Its a must visit in St Petersburg.
Astounding Display. An amazing display of artifacts, both Russian and otherwise. It is very crowded upon entry, but smooths out once you get inside.
So Much to See. It is best to plan what you want to see in advance and advance your tickets. There is so much to see. There is a cloakroom to leave coats and bags when you visit.
A reason to visit. If you see nothing else but this, it is still worth travelling across the world to see...As an art lover, I was in heaven!

Try to find a quiet moment to visit :). Unfortunately some rooms are too busy to see the exhibits properly. Especially the first of the two DaVinci paintings is situated right in front of the room entrance, which makes groups block the way for others. Soem areas of the museum are quiet though, and you can enjoy the collection as well as the decorations very well.

A must see when visiting St Petersburg. I can't do justice to this wonderful museum in a short review. This place rivals the Louvre in Paris. There are several good websites that tell about The Hermitage Museum / Winter Palace. There are guided tours if you want a personalized experience. But the museum as a really good self guided tour with headsets in many languages; a much less expensive option. We actually hired a driver a private guide for two days while in St Petersburg. Even they suggested the self guided tour of the museum. Which we did. In the museum, you will see artifacts and paintings, including Rembrandt and Picasso. This a must see while visiting this great city.

A must see museum. Wonderful museum. I spent three hours in it moving non-stop and only scratched the surface. Many beautiful rooms. Your better off researching what there is to see and dedicate yourself to your preferences. You can't see this all in one day! It's too large. I tried to see the highlights. Do not miss the Gold room. You need to arrange a special appointment to see it before you go. Your tourist agency should be able to have that arranged for you!

Required for a visit to SPB. I had to run through the Hermitage, which was a shame, because after seeing so many other amazing sights I got there about 90 minutes before closing on a Sunday, and it turns out they are closed Monday, which was my last day in SPB! I bought the 600 ruble ticket anyway because when I dreamed of visiting SPB the Hermitage was always at the top of my list (or so I thought). Anyway, I was awed by the beauty of the palace -- the walls, doors, and ceilings were incredible. Simply incredible. The exhibits were cool too, but the walls and ceilings are what will long remain in my memory. Worth visiting just to see the building alone.

Fantastic!!!!!!. It what come s in your mind when you think St.Petersburg.This building is a piece of art. Inside and outsideAnd a part of russian history and culture.Anyone who visits St.Petersburg has to sucrifice a part of his time there.

Excellent museum,someone has to separate time and visit.. Well, this is absulately amazing and very breath taking experience.This place has to be visited and someone has to spare time (atleast minimum 5 hrs) inorder to enjoy and not to miss thousands of magnificent and sumptous ingredients.Please buy a ticket by getting in to queue.Not to buy enterance tickets from Hermitage weg page at all!!Internet tickets are rip off and it is double the price of the one in main box office.

Breath taking. Beautiful building inside and out. The painting & history and artifacts of the czars were fantastic. The winter place has a small beautiful theatre that does productions of Swan Lake.. Need a few days to visit all the different floors.

A great building with interior issues. Having travelled to St Petersburg from Moscow on the excellent connecting TVG style train we naturally had the State Hermitage museum down as a must see attraction when in the city. Obtaining the necessary entrance tickets was easy from our excellent hotel, which was the official hotel for the museum.However, when we eventually made our visit we were left with mixed feelings. On the plus side, the museum is housed in the most impressive buildings imaginable and face on to a magnificent square by the waterfront in the city. The unforgettable Baroque architecture of the Winter Palace and its unique green facade will linger long in our memories, but our experience inside was less impressive. Quite simply, there were too many people circumnavigating the museum at any one time, making the visit something of an ordeal, rather than the splendid experience it might have been. Certainly the art treasures on display were magnificent, particularly those of the Dutch masters, but then there are many other famous art galleries around the world which house an impressive collection of great masters. Those in Paris, Florence and New York to name just a few. The volume of people jostling for a viewpoint hindered our experience and I was left with the feeling that I had enjoyed strolling the streets of St Petersburg far more than I did competing for space inside this, one of the world's most famous collection of art treasures.

Crowded but worth the visit. Amazing antiquities and paintings, eg a room just for Rembrandts. The rooms themselves are a work of art. Lots of visitors so be prepared for crowds. However, the place is huge so able to handle them

Palace of Treasures. This place rivals the Louvre. Gallery after gallery of masterpieces and treasures. The Rubens paintings were simply stunning. And like the Louvre you need time (read many days) to really do the collection in this palace the justice it deserves.
Fantastic walk in life history. Absolutely MUST SEE ! Try to look for late hours visits and book via Sergej for easy access to avoid queues.

Fairy Tale living.. This was a surreal dwelling of many of the Monarchs and their consorts, most famous among them-Catherine the Great. The palace is the predominant building in Palace Square. The style of the palace (even though it was built and rebuilt) is that of the Baroque Period. There are a number of guided tours that one can take, from one that focuses only on the building architecture and interior works to that of room after room of art work. We spent 2 days looking at the art work. Just a note; the Impressionist Art work is now located in the "New" Hermitage building, across the Palace Square.
this rivals the louve. Need at least 3 full days to see everything,don't rush thru it there is a lot to see and due such as a carriage ride, most rooms allow photos but a few do not.

Truly unique; miss something else, but not this. World's largest museum. Comprehensive collections, save for modern art. Breathtaking buildings (Winter Palace, Hermitage, Small Hermitage, New Hermitage). Better to be selective in what to see than try to take in as much as possible. Read up on the collections before going; perhaps photocopy descriptions of what interests you most. Tour I took was excellent.

One of the worlds top museums, a must see.. The hermitage is impossible to explain in words. The sheer amount of items to see is astounding, and one trip can only hit the tip of the iceberg. I highly recommend going to see the ancient art if possible, it is without a doubt the greatest exhibit i have ever seen. Art for all people can be found here. Also try and find a less busy time, if at all possible. I would check out the exhibits ahead of time, and plan your trip around what you most want to see.

THE museum. Must-visit museum for Leningrad guests. Russian treasury, history and art -you can find it all, along the ancient Egypt and European culture.On the bleak side - staff could be more polite and effective. Once you approach the building, you start waiting in lines. If you did not buy ticket on line, it can easily take you couple of hours just to get in. Line for the audio guide lasts forever. But once you passed all that - you will enjoy one of the most distinct museums in the world.

Beware of your student card. And please, add more toilets. The palace, from the outside, is great. Could use some refining as in real life it feels a bit "fake", but it's great nevertheless. I was lucky to visit in October, and on a sunday at 11am the queue was almost non - existant. I had only one issue when trying to get my free student ticket: the student card of my university does not have any date on it to show the validity, so I had to go to the reception to get a "pass" with which to claim my free student ticket at the ticket booth. Still, all this was done in under 15 minutes.It was then time to leave my jacket at the cloakroom: a large bunker in the basement which had a rather unpleasant smell. I suspect that was due to the bathrooms being present in the same hall. The bathrooms were not the best ones in terms of cleanliness, but I attribute that to the hoards of tourists which seem to forget any form of manners once they step in a public WC.The art on display is so much you could fill a whole week if you wanted to carefully look at every painting, but it's not my thing, I was mainly interested in the interiors of the palace, which I was literally awed by. Some rooms were literally magnificent.However, navigating through the museum was a challenge in itself, as there are a thousand micro - rooms (sometimes numbered, sometimes not) and you have to keep track of it, or you get lost. Especially since the map they give you is not terribly clear.Major downside: the people. So many people everywhere. It was unbearable.Another downside: not enough toilets! I think I counted only 4 in the whole museum. And not enough places to sit down in some areas, which are a must in a museum this big.However, I have to say that all in all, the interiors made the visit worth it. If you're not interested in the interiors, go only if you're serious about art, otherwise you'll end up enjoying the first few rooms, but then skimming and running through the other ones, as I had to end up doing due to the massive size of the museum.

Geate art . Itvis a huge placeA lot of art (for art lovers)U need to go there with a mapI was there thursdy 1st day of the month so the entrence was freeThere was a huge line at the enrtance but worth it

Beautiful art and architecture. Went on a Wednesday afternoon/evening. Earlier in the afternoon, there were alot of tour groups and cruise ship passengers. Later in the evening, we had the place relatively to ourselves after they had all gone. It was a totally different experience. We were able to enjoy absorbing the beautiful art and architecture without having to squeeze through throngs of people.This is truly one of the best museums in the world. Just pace yourself since there is so much to see. Getting an audioguide for the Winter Palace is also worthwhile. Gives you great information on the history and architecture of the former palace.
Amazing place. Such a beautiful and breath taking place. Arhitecture is so beautiful. It's one of the best places to visit.

Timing is everything. September is a great time to visit St. Petersburg. There were no line-ups in front of the famous paintings, reasonable number of people and no pushing along. Give yourself a day and a good pair of shoes. Have a guide to make your time more effective. Go on Wednesday to see the golden peacock clock chime.

Must visit if yr coming to st petersburg . Your brain on an art vacation! Note that the ticket to this museum and winter palace is combined. Even though they are different buildings they are connected and you may have to find your way from inside the winter palace to hermitage

More Than You Even Thought It Would Be. No matter how much time you think it will take, it will take longer. And please do not miss the Impressionista and Post-Impressionista, which are located across the square from the Hermitage. Not only is the art spectacular, the galleries are much less crowded than the main Hermitage.

An essential visit. Whatever you have read or heard about the Hermitage is absolutely true. You must not miss this experience. There is also a superb exhibition of French Impressionist painting in the building opposite the Hermitage - it is superb. Suggest you go early morning or afternoon to escapevthe tour groups.

An art lovers paradise. We spent about 2 hours here and barely scratched the surface. There is just so much to see. It has been said that if one would spend 1 minute at each piece of art, statue, etc., it would take 11 years to view everything! Be prepared for the time spent here to be spent on your feet.

impressive, too crowded, labyrinth of art. Should buy your entrance tickets to Hermitage Museum in advance from internet to skip long, long ticket queue. If you are an art lover or art student, you may well spend one or two full days inside. Otherwise you will complete it in two or three hours. While you are inside, take a floor plan and carefully follow the room numbers (above the doors) to see all exhibitions. Do not expect something like Vatican Museum, Louvre or British Museum, else you will be disappointed.
Resplendant History. Magnificent displays to get an idea of the splendor of the period.Don't miss the neighbouring building with the beautiful impressionist paintings

2.7 Million art pieces for € 8 !. For anyone even only slightly interested in art or architecture this is an absolute must. For a price that is only a fraction of what you would pay for the Louvre or the British Museum you get just as much or maybe even more and even without the art this entrance fee would still be worth it just to see the inside of this magnificent palace.

One great museum.... This is easily one of the top museums of the world, spreading through two, and soon to be three, buildings. After depositing bags, coats and umbrellas, at the Cloakroom the great hall leads up a majestic stairway to the exhibitions collected in large halls and dedicated to a period or subject. The main treasures lie ahead including antiquities (Rome and Egyptian) , old masters paintings ( DaVinci, Titian, Raphael, Michelangelo, Rembrandt). as well as impressionists painting (Renoir, Degas, Van Gogh) It's very likely to get crowded in this area. We were in a guided group with an interpreter which helped us get around quickly and included a trip to the gold room, which was a highlight. I recommended it highly if you enjoy unique jewel artistry among these Romanoff treasures. Another interest is the mechanical peacock clock with a bee circling the clock section as the second hand, when it's working, in the Pavilion room. Recommendation: Use their website for individual tickets. Or join a group tour for quick access as the museum is crowded, or go at night on these tours. The Gold Room was accessed at a particular time arranged through the tour. The Docent speaks only Russian so a guide-interpreter was enjoyable And more highlights can be accessed in the limited time allotted. There is no way to see everything in several days there.

You cannot miss it. This is the most exciting palace and art museum to visit - period the end. The palace itself is well kept and simply magnificent and gorgeous! I cannot describe the beauty of every single details from wood floor, doors, trims to the grand taste of ceilings. I personally prefer Hermitage over Louvre either from either architectural exterior or interior. Now to the art collection - simply mind blowing! Hermitage probably has the best collection of impressionist paintings - room full of Gaugin, Cézanne, Renoir to some less famous artists but just as breathtaking. Also, room after room of Matisse, Picasso. Also I noticed that each exhibition room is exquisitely decorated. Too grand and beautiful. You need at least 4 hours to marvel this place. I will go back.
huge impression. This place you must have in your list. Preferably plan for 2 or more days to see the whole thing. Winter Palace suggesting you marvellous exhibition

Huge Impressive and very very crowded. This is one of the best museum in the world, and you need 1 day or more just to see the main thing. The problem is that due to policy of the management , there is no real limit to the amount of groups they let inside. As a result it is almost impossible to move arount and to take pictures. You must learn your way in advance in order not to get lost. the explanations are sometime is Russian only.

Massive and mind-blowing. Allow a full day to explore the Winter Palace/Hermitage Museum, and you will still only see a small percentage of the place. I spent the better part of a day here and felt overwhelmed by the amount of incredible art on display. The building is decorated with such elaborate beauty, and is filled with highly esteemed paintings, sculptures, and items of astounding value. If you have time to visit one place in St Petersburg, I recommend this.

Mesmerizing. Indescribable experience to be able see evidence of an era. Golden covered wall and rooms that witnessed history events left me speechless. The 4 hours that I've spent at the Hermitage just wasn't enough to see whole place. I'll definitely try to go back again someday.

Huge Museum. As a museum lover, I would have enjoyed much more time here. We were part of a tour and so had limited time. It was much TOO crowded, having to wait at one exhibit for people to move on before we could see whatever…We were supposed to eat at the bistro/snack bars inside but it was much too crowded. We chose to go outside and found snacks and beverages there as well as an uncrowded place to sit
Excellent. Can't miss this museum. Take several hours off so you don't miss anything. It's like travelling in time.
A real treasure. This museum is really gorgeous! I liked it so much even though I haven't seen all of it! The interior is awesome so are the expositions there.

Stunning architecture!. We'd bought a two day pass for the Winter Palace as it's huge! Although lots of history, beautiful decor, furniture, walls, floors, ceilings etc., there's only so much one can take in before it starts looking a like.Absolutely worth visiting, but for us a one day ticket would have been fine.

See this. This is an absolute must. Allow yourself plenty of time - a whole day if you can. You don't have to be an art lover to get a huge amount of pleasure from walking around this vast collection.
Must be visited. The largest museum in St Petersburg. A must to visit but many tourists and tickets are booked for certain times.

A Wonderful Visit!. Viking River Cruises offered a limited access optional excursion. We are so glad we took it! The museums were not crowded when we visited, and we got to see items not on public display. Wow!
must go. One of the biggest museum in the world! It is impossible just to walk it in one day! Very interesting temporary exhibitions!
A must see .... BIG! Be prepared to spend some time, or be sure to map out your visit in advance. There is a lot about most everything here.

Over the top!. This is the most beautiful museum I've ever visited! Tons of Jasper and malachite on display, gilded walls and staircases, plus fabulous inlayed hardwood floors. And then there's the beautiful paintings and sculptures! Don't miss a visit to the Gold Room. Unbelievable jewel encrusted and priceless gold items. All I can say is WOW!!

Very crowded. Totally worth the visit, we had an excellent English speaking guide , we only seen a small part, it would take several days to see it all, it was very crowded which didn't help, but that probably proves what a popular tourist attraction it is.

Overwhelming!. This museum is a combination of 5 palace buildings and it is huge. There was so much to see that we were unable to get to all of it in our allotted tour time. You need a guide or you will get lost. The palace opulence is magnificent and the collection of artwork is vast and amazing. Plan your visit ahead of time. This is a must see in any trip to St. Petersburg.

Great museum.. It should be a stop if you're in St Petersburg. I wish we had more time to wander and enjoy every piece. It has an amazing collection of art, sculpture, and pottery. They have a beautiful Egyptian collection with a mummy and delicately carved sarcophagus.Enjoy!

It's massive but allow lots of time you won't be sorry, first room alone is gobsmackingly fab. we had a private guide for five of us over 2.5 hours and wasn't nearly enough time but you need to be able to walk around for a long time (we had oldies in tow), there's so much to see but the private rooms of Catherine the Great are amazing, then there's lots of collections from various countries, you won't see it all and it can be hard to avoid large groups for some of it

Most impressive. We went there with a private guide, not a tour group. We really only managed to see some of the most important pieces, as recommended by our guide. We were pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to move around and see the exhibits. We were told by our guide that it was because it was towards the end of season for large cruise ships. She said it was because the water was getting low and, for obvious reasons, ships cannot come in when it is winter. A tip is to come at a time when there are very few cruise ships. One can imagine how thousands of passengers arriving together must make the place very crowded. We stayed 5 nights in St Petersburg but feel we only scratched the surface. Apparently it would take three years to cover everything in The Hermitage even if one was to spend only about 3 seconds in front of each exhibit!
One of the best museums ever. You need to research what you want to see before visiting. It is so large you could spend days touring the exhibition. The gold leaf everywhere is spectacular.

OMG so much art!!!. I wrote in my other review (White Nights Travel) the most important thing to understand about the Hermitage is that it is stunning but it is MASSIVE. If you have the means / opportunity plan to spend a few hours over several days here. You can not even begin to really appreciate it in one day. We took a private tour first to just acquaint ourselves with the general layout and got an excellent overview. After that we returned over a week and used the excellent audio guide (NOTE: the audio guide is only a few hundred rubles to rent BUT you must either leave your passport OR 2000 rubles as a refundable deposit) . There is also a downloadable Hermitage iPhone app but we couldn't get it to work reliably inside the building. You can also buy tickets ahead of time online which allows you to skip the long line to buy tickets at the box office. However other people warned us that there is still a long line ( even with tickets) just to get in. Since we had a week we avoided the morning rush and never went before 11 and just walked in without waiting in any lines. Also note: they have recently moved all their impressionists and modern art across the square to the General Staff building. You can get tickets there as well but you have to get WHOLE complex tickets if you wish to visit the main body of the Hermitage AND the impressionists other wise just get tickets for one side or the other. Also another good thing to know is you can NOT enter and exit the main hermitage multiple times. Your ticket is only good once a day so plan accordingly-- you can not leave for lunch and then come back without buying a new ticket. They do have a "cafe" on the ground floor but I found it the most disappointing thing about the whole place (lol)-- really just coffee and very sweet cakes and ice cream. The place is so massive I definitely wanted something more to fuel up half way thru the day. Another good thing to remember that-- while it is closed Mondays-- it is open late (till 9 I think) weds and Fridays. So on those days you might want to aim to come late afternoon and try to avoid some of the giant tour groups that sweep through elbowing everyone out of the way in their race around to take the most pictures ( if you've been to the hall of mirrors on a bad day in Versailles you'll recognize this breed of visitor). In addition to the main halls there are two separate tours of the "treasure rooms". Each room (gold room and diamond room) have English tours a few times a day. You can NOT see them outside of these tours and can only buy tickets the day of at the inside ticket booths. (Once again buy your main tickets online and then once you get inside just buy these add on tickets). Hopefully some of these tips helped-- it really is an amazing collection and should not be missed!!!

Viking cruise from St Petersburg to Moscow. Our tour went in one hour before the museum opened! This is my second visit and by far the best! There were not too many people visiting until 10:30 so we had plenty of space and time! Then we went on to the hermitage warehouse storage off site which was fabulous! Many things being repaired and Loy's of furniture and mummies and restoration pieces! What a treat!!!

Must visit if you like art!. Huge museum with too many different eras in it. It represents various kind of movements in the history of art. If you really want to make the best of your culture trip, try not to hesitate finishing your tour in one day!
a must see. a dive in the history of the great Russia. Its splendor and its treasures including the palace abounds. How many days does it take to go around?

Masterpiece. To tell you the truth this museum is the masterpiece of human creature of all around the world that gathering together and
i have ever seen .please take my advice and go there immediately.

A must!. Lives up to its reputation - beautiful artwork; review a guide book ahead of time and choose what you'd like to see - can't do it all in one visit. Quickest way in, if not with a tour, is to purchase tickets from the machines by the ticket office. They're easy to use and accept cash or credit. Otherwise half a day can disappear waiting in line. My favorites - the Rembrants and the Peacock Clock. The building is as amazing as the paintings. Do go!
Golden Palace. Paintings & Sculptures set in some of the most stunning rooms in any building in the world, don't forget the camera.

The Absolute Must-See of the Imperial City. We visited on Wednesday, when the museum is open for longer hours, and thus a bit less crowded than on other days. A licensed guide can book an entry time a few minutes before general opening too, which gives you a head start on crowds. We found the museum immaculate and perfectly maintained. It is actually several buildings connected by walkways, only one of which was originally called The Hermitage. It contains one of the world's great collections and is simply impossible to absorb on one visit. We were completely overwhelmed with the opulence and the quality of the art we saw. We would definitely go back.
Indescribable. 3 million pieces of art in one location..... on a 4 hour tour. A week probably wouldn't be enough! If you are in St. Petersburg, this is a must!

Wau!. It was a winter palace when the Tzar was still in place, nowadays it is a museum with paintings. But I love it more for the interior as it is so rich in marble,... The words can not describe the beauty its many chambers,.. Well worth waiting in the line to enter it,..

Happy organised a private tour. I missed this on my last trip to St Petersburg due to time limitations and the massive queue, so this time ip rebooked a tour and it was well worth it. What can I say... Wow! I don't regularly visit palaces as not a huge interest but this one is what you'd expect from a fairytale palace - vast, shiny and decadent. Would go again as you are never likely to be able to take it all in even on multiple visits. Recommend a guide though if you only have a short time to ensure you find the highlights.

Out of this world fabelous!. The most magnificant rooms and decor I have ever seen and I have seen a lot. They even have 55 Rembrndt paintings. The Hermitage is not to be missed when in St. Petersburg.

Great Museum and History. If you are in St. Petersburg, this is a must see. Excellent history and wonderfully kept rooms. The Hermitage and Winter Palace can take full day to see it completely but i did it in 03 hrs as was short on time.

Unmissable but unhelpful. Spectacular place to visit but less than visitor-friendly, considering the number of overseas visitors who pour in here. There were no English maps available on the day we visited, the descriptions on the exhibits are scanty and the museum doesn't guide you around in a helpful way. Needs some solid curating from experts who understand how the modern public wants museums to work! Why can't they have large floor plans in each room showing you exactly where you are and what is in the room? The museum seems to rely on tour guides to do its job for it.

I wish I have more time there. The Hermitage is a unique museum because the combination of the Winter Palace of Peter the Great and extensive art collections. When I visited it, I did not know where I should focus on, the majestic architectures or masterpieces of art. I just wish that I would have more time to appreciate all.
Outstanding display of art. Massive display of paintings by world-renowned artists. Beautiful upkeep of floors, stairs and all decor - incredible considering the devastation from World War II.
Must do. Amazing collection. Use a guide. Don't miss the new section across the square. Buy ticket online to avoid the queue.
Great history. Went there for a six hour visit the whole palace is great but the gold and diamond rooms are outstanding

They've moved the Moderns. What can be said about the Hermitage? It's an embarrassment of riches. But it might be helpful to know that the museum has moved out the entire modern collection (Matisse, Monet, Picasso, Van Gogh, etc.) to the building across the square from the Hermitage. Save some time for it. Three whole rooms of Gaugins! And we were confused about where to enter with an internet ticket. You go through the same arched entry as everyone else and right inside is a booth for redeeming your internet ticket receipt.

Absolutely amazing!. This is museum is absolutely amazing!!! The artistic value, architectural value and the historical value all together, this is just another amazing place you must visit! Highly recommended!
Original works of Art. The museum has a rich and diverse history well laid out, informative and extremely interesting.I wish we had more time in this beautiful Palace
Too crowded. Yes the place is nice the art is nice but you can't even see most of it because there are too many people. You have wait a loooong line to get in.

FULL OF THEFTS AROUND THE HERMITAGE MUSEUM. inside was goodOUTSIDE WAS FULL OF THEFTSconsider seriously going at night OR EVEN GOING TO RUSSIA never encounter such robbing in public areas even in less stable countries like egyptWORST TRAVEL EXPERIENCEALSO, POLICE ARE NOT HELPFUL AT ALL. they didnt show intention to help or even point the directionWILL NEVER GO AGAIN

Must-see but plan well. This is the third time I have visited the Hermitage – always on a 2-hour guided tour. It is always a pleasure, and on the first occasion, with an engaging expert, it was a joy to view a selection of the massive collection of famous artwork from the great Masters. On this trip unfortunately our guide was dull and vague and at the end of two hours my daughter (aged 13) declared that once you’ve seen one Madonna and Child, you’ve seen them all. The museum is overwhelming and if you are not already well-informed you really need a good guide (or at least a good guide book) who can pick a selection of work that will appeal and inform according to your taste, interest and level of expertise.It is worth knowing that the collection of impressionist work is now in a separate building so a short guided tour (especially from a cruise ship) is likely to offer EITHER Rembrandt, Rubens and Raphael OR Monet, Manet and Matisse. A real art-lover should probably visit for several days and, to get the most from the visit, organise a bespoke itinerary!The Hermitage is, however, worth a visit even for people with minimal interest in art. It is a beautiful building with jaw-dropping interiors. My daughter was thrilled by the splendid rooms of the Winter Palace and loved the mechanical peacock clock – a quirky highlight (and there were many highlights)of the Pavilion Hall.I have to recommend the Hermitage as a must-see in St Petersburg but I would suggest that good planning could make quite a difference to the experience.

An amazing museum with hundreds of rooms to explore.. This place is huge and breath taking. Take a whole day to admire the beauty of the old empire and its artifacts. Lots of gold and gold plating, accessories such as jewelry and armory. Make sure to wear comfortable shoes, as there is a lot of walking. The fine art collection is exquisite. We had taken the guided tour to the gold room. Very interesting, but be prepared to listen a lot. Definitely felt like a fine arts history lesson. Would do this again, because we didn't have enough time to see nearly everything.
Must do!. An absolute must do and see!! I'd recommend you to pre-book youre tickets online. It will safe you value time.

One of the best museums in the world. The architecture is magnificent and sometimes overshadows the art. However, when you so see the art contained in this fantastic museum it is quite emotional. There are also views of the river from certain parts of the palace.

magnificent!. It is the Palace that has most impressed me of all palaces I have ever seen. Not too ornate but easy to imagine the opulent life styles of the tzars. Lovely floors. The rooms of the Winter Palace are exquisite and cannot be missed. The exhibitions are beautiful and interesting.

Use a guide if it's your first time. I have no words to adequately describe the Hermitage. We would have been completely overwhelmed without our Best Guide, Irina, who, prior to our tour, learned what our preferences were and built a tour around that and her own suggestions. We left the Impressionist Art, now located in another building, to tour on our own. Here's when you know you've seen too much art in one day: you walk through room after room of Renoirs, Degas, Manets and Monets, scanning each room and slowing down only for the one or two pieces that leap out at you. So glad we had someone to skillfully help us in the many many times larger Hermitage.
Unbelievable. Great art and history place. You are going to experience all you want and need. Always visit this place whenin STP...
World Class. World class museum with very large collection. This museum breaths history. Even if you are not into art, the building alone is worth a visit.

Not to be missed!. The State Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace hosts one of the world's largest museum collection of fine arts and relics. The interior of the building is mind blowing with each section of the palace themed differently. You could easily spend a day here if not more.

Just awesome.. There is nothing in the world to rival the amount of exhibits in this collection of palaces.They say that if you spend six minutes looking at each painting and exhibit it would take you years to see them all. For me the most amazing aspect of the buildings are the interiors themselves, just jaw dropping. The one drawback are the crowds who visit in their millions, try seeing the galleries on a tour in the late afternoon when the cruise ships have departed.

Heaven of pick pockets. Visited this world famous place on 19th 2015. History and its collections are awesome. On the other hand management should have been taken care off for security and safety for their tourists and so reputation of this place. Everyday thousands of tourist are pouring in from all over world. With my experience of my money wallet nicked and from their records inside, There was not any warning of pickpockets. I lost my chained wallet with lots of cash, driving license, credit and debit cards.Please take care of your wallet while enjoying this historical place.

St. Persburg's Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace.. For art lovers, this is the place. The said it will take us 11 years to see the whole collection of beautiful art in this place. Hermitage Museum is amazingly marvelous. One has to see it to believe it. It is beyond words to describe the collection of art in this place. Beautiful, stunning, magnificent and sublimely fascinating. A must see!!!

Hermitage. The Hermitage is so big and the galleries so extensive and maze-like I recommend a private tour guide. We booked a local guide through a company based in Vancouver called Tours by Locals and were pleased at how it worked out. Once you leave the Hermitage you can't go back in. We had a four hour private tour, then had lunch down in the Hermitage cafe, and then spent another two hours meandering on our own.

So Much To See and So Little Time. This is one of the landmark places to visit while in St Petersburg, and quite crowded. Lines of people show up early to get in and there is a wait usually. But if you are on a tour you get in past the lines of private people. Entire facility is amazing. So much to see inside. Hard to really get a grasp of the entire deal on a cruise ship tour like we were on because there is a schedule to keep up with. We were here 4 hours and it just isn't enough time. Plan to stay longer if you can. Really worth the visit.

Special. This is a truly amazing place but heaven knows how long it would take to see everything! We went on a trip from a cruise ship so as part of the tour we only had a couple of hours in the Hermitage. We had been twice before however and had booked this particular tour because we got time on our own in St Petersburg afterwards without having to apply for a Russian visa.

Stupendous and Annoying at the Same Time!. The contents of the place are better than anything we've seen in London museums, the Louvre, the New York Met, Berlin, Madrid etc. And they've really been renovating and getting more signs up (other than in Russian). So stupendous and alone worth the visit to St Petersburgh.Annoying though because, as in so many galleries and museums, the curators never think how people circulate round the place. Even with a map the geography is almost incomprehensible as there are so many buildings, most of which are only linked at certain floors. Bit of a frustrating nightmare as there are no signs or maps within the place. Only other negative is the places to eat or drink are few, tiny, badly designed and awful. But as I say the contents are world class so these are prices more than worth paying for such a fantastic museum.

One of the top ten museums of the world. Be sure to start your visit before the official opening hours. The additional fee is 100% worth it because you get ahead of the crowds. Three hour visit minimum!!
Beyond Belief.. So much to see, so little time. Stunning. Amazing. No wonder the peasants revolted! There is so much to see and be sure to wear good walking shoes and get there early.

Deserving of being one of the great museums of the world. The architecture of the Winter Palace is extraordinary, you won't want to put your camera away and, of course, some of the great art work of the world.I would suggest that this is one place where a guide is really worth having. The place is rather a rabbit warren and there is just so much to see that I think that it would easily be overwhelming to do on your own.There is no way you can do it justice in just one visit but it is certainly worth trying of that is all the time you have.
Incredible!. Absolutely one of the best museums anywhere in the world. Go early, with a guide - so much to enjoy! Visit each and every room. Also plan time outside in the gardens.

Need to come back to st Petersburg to finish this off. What can I say but just wow! This place blew us away in almost each room we went in. We went in on a Sunday morning late September and we lined up for about 15min no big deal. Then we hired an audio guide which if you don't do a tour I would highly recommend. It was busy but it didn't feel crowded. We spent the full day there and still didn't see everything. this was my highlight of st Petersburg

Wonderful Exhibits and Buildings. This is a must see.! The place is so big I cannot emphasize enough how important it was for us to have a guide. it made the whole experience very pleasant as there are so many exhibits, and it was nice to hear the stories behind the items and rooms. The building is itself wonderful to see, both the architecture and the opulence of the decor. The floors, ceilings, heating systems!Do not miss the staircase or the portrait gallery. If you are a Rembrandt fan, there are a couple of beautiful paintings on display, my favorite being the Return of the Prodigal Son. In the museum shop there are really nice quality books for reasonable money and these will have top class photos. We got a beautiful book for 14 euro. Give yourself plenty time and enjoy.

Possible Number One attraction of SPB!. A complete art venture! Where you can upgrade your artistic taste in say a day time. Whatever time you dedicate to it is not enough. Better to look and pass! You can stop where objects are to your special interest.
Stupendous museum. This is the old winter palace of the Czar. Now it is part of the Hermitage museum which is housed in 5 buildings. This palace has 1000 rooms with 4 million works of are.
Spend a day here!. This is a must see sight for anybody visiting St. Petersburg. There is so much to see it is impossible to name the many attractions.These include two works by Michelangelo.

Too much for one day but amazing :). A must see in St. Petersburg! Only bring your camera and good shoes. You can't bring any liquids inside. It's very crowded sometimes but it's a big place so sometimes you'll be alone in a big room. An amazing place :)
very nice. very nice place, with many fantastic paintings, specially the christian ones (which are the majority). a place u must go when visiting Petersburg
Hermitage Museum a must see. What a museum, you could get lost for months. I only had a tiny tastier, but it was so worthwhile, from the beautiful art works, statues, displays etc
day 2 in Russia. Beautiful!!, very busy, a lot of people but worth the culture. It was a guided tour and the guide was very knowledgeable about art and culture, this was one her degrees.
The best museum of St.Petersburg. Fantastic museum, if you want to see everything, then you need at least one week. Not expensive, but can be crowdy.

The BEST Museum in the World!. The hermitage is without the doubt the best museum in the worl!!! More than 3 million works of art in the collection... Magnificient collection of art with a separate impressionist collection across the square in a new modern building. The art is truly mind boggling. Da Vinci, Michelangelo, Caravaggio, Ruebens, Rambrandt to the most outrageous collection of impressionists from Monet to Cezanne to Renoir to Gaughin and Matisse and Picasso. It is a sensory overload to see so much stunning art in one place. If there is one place in Russia you have to visit, this is it!
Stunning!. Just amazing, architecture, views, ambience of the place, so much to see in the Hermitage and Square.
Fantastic. Mind blowing! What an experience made even better by the knowledge of Marina. We could have spent hours and hours there and still wouldn't see it all

Essential item on the bucket list. The Hermitage one of the best museums in the world according to many scholars. The edifice of the building alone is astonishing and breathtaking at the same time.
This is a must visit for who're interested in art an architecture
2 Day Grand St Petersburg. Fantastic. We entered before the crowds . Beautiful rooms and amazing pictures by great artists. thank you Alla Tours

Average collection of old masters - BUT SURPRISING OF THE MODERNIST'S!. The collection of old masters is not so special (if you have visited Louvre, Prado or Metropolitan Museum in NYC...), you can recognize, that they begin to collect too late :-) More interesting is the building itself, than so many works from the second-rate painters. What was for me really surprising - collection of modernists - perfect and wide range of masterworks by Mattise (must see it!!!), Piccaso or Gauguin. I did not expect this. Only one thing - it is little bit difficult to find it. It is located in the building opposite the Hermitage on the fourth floor and it is called Brothers Morozov's collection - no word about modern art or impressionism's etc. But it is Russia...

St Petersburg via Fred Olsen. This was my second Baltic cruise, having previously visited St Petersburg with Thomson in 2007. The first thing I noticed in St Petersburg was the new cruise liner terminal, currently accommodating six cruise ships with plans to extend the terminal to take sixteen cruise ships. The second point was the relaxation of Russian Immigration control. Yes, they're still a surly lot but the administration aspect of entry was greatly reduced. On our previous visit vouchers were required for taking photographs in public buildings - no longer a requirement. The Hermitage was the cruise driver with its three million pieces of art. Our first visit to the Hermitage was in conjunction with a visit to the must see Peterhof Palace. Unfortunately, Putin was in town, reslting in road blocks and therefore coach delays leaving just half an hour for the Museum visit. On this occasion we took a designated ship's three hour tour of the Hermitage for £50 per person. A benefit included entry to the museum some 90 minutes prior to opening to the general public, and we were the only cruise ship in town on the day.In the evening we took advantage of the ship's tour, 'Evening on the Waterways of St Petersburg'. at £45 per person. When visiting Russia we take advantage of the ship's visa authorisation rather than the messing about and cost of indepentdently acquiring a Russian visa. All the main sites take Euros. Finally, we took the ship's tour of the Spilled Blood Church with a 90 minute shopping opportunity. The shopping element was unaccompanied at £35 per person. Many passengers enjoyed an evening at the ballet for £55 per person, an event we enjoyed on our earlier visit.I cannot speak to highly of the Fred Olsen Cruise Line.This was our thirteenth cruise and first with Fred Olsen. The food was excellent, the waiters and stewards excellent mainly because they were from the Phillippines. They are so happy and professional. The entertainment was of Thomson standard, and I can't praise higher than that. The ship was the Boudicca sailing out of Newcastle. If you live in the north of England and Scotland, and wish to cruise Norway or the Baltic, I can't think of a better place to sail from, or cruise line top sail with.

Unmissable. The highlight of any trip to St Petersburg. We had a guide organise by our river ship and there was no queue when we arrived [late morning] but I guess there is a trick to a good time to arrive. We were guided so had no decisions to make about what we saw which was probably a good thing as the place is huge. We started in the winter palace and then into the museum mainly looking at European works of art and sculpture. We were disappointed that the Caravaggio wasn't there but that was the only disappointment.

One of the World's Great Museums. We had 2 hours on the SPB Tour and covered most of the main exhibits. The Museum is really part of the Winter Palace, and most of the rooms are truly Palacial. Highlights are the Rembrandts (24 I think), The Dutch Masters and a Michaelangeo, all of which are really accessable. Definitely one of the many "must sees" in St Petersburg !!
Winter palace. Loved every minute walking around the museum The opulance was out of this world Fantactic place This is well worth avisit

The most worthwhile stop in St. Petersburg. We only had part of the day to tour the Hermitage and we managed to get in early. We had an English guide who allowed us time to appreciate the collection. The museum was extremely clean, bright, and well organized. I was surprised that there was no crowd at all. We were awed at the opulence of the building alone, not to mention the collection. It was the most worthwhile stop in the city. I am glad that we didn't miss it.

Loved it!. This place is packed full of history! Everything is so beautiful and most importantly, English friendly! I'm happy I saved the Hermitage for the end of my trip. Every question I had after visiting other sites I had clarified at the Hermitage. The only negative I have is it can get veryyyy busy with tour groups. But, not enough to ruin the experience.Note: as with most places in SPB one day a month they offer free admission. Check the website for the day. You will have to mention it at the admissions counter as they will gladly take your money!

Impressive. There are no word to describe the beauty of this museum. There are masterpieces for all over the world. And the building itself is a masterpiece. You'll need a LOT of time to get through all the rooms. Be prepared and eventually take 2 days to visit it!
A great attraction. An amazing place if you want to see the winter palace. It can get very crowded in summer. The artwork is amazing if that is your interest. Go early to beet the crowds.

Try to Beat the Crowds. We went with a private tour group that got there well before the museum opened to the general public. It meant we got to see many of the exhibits without having to fight for breathing room. We didn't realize what huge positive this was until we came to leave and encountered heaving masses of tourists on their way in.You can cover the museum in a day if you are happy not to linger. They allow photos which was great.

Make time for this!. Magnificent exterior and equally impressive interior. As part of an organised excursion, we only had about an hour and a half inside. We had headsets and our guide was very informative, telling us about the rooms of the Winter Palace and taking us to see the works of the most famous artists. I would have liked to spend a little more time here but there were so many other places to visit, only being in St. Petersburg for two days.

Hermitage: So much art. So much to see and so beautiful. Need a good guide to help you enjoy it to the most. Give yourself a few hours at the least. It is said that if you only spend a minute at each exhibit, i would take you a few years to see the entire museum. If you speak English, we an recommend a super good guide

Exceptional. Hermitage is not to be missed. Crowded, but the experience is awesome. I took lots of photographs as there is so much to see. Fabulous collection of art with something for everyone. From Michaelangelo to Rembrandt and everything in between. Need a full day just to see the highlights. One should go on a Wednesday as the museum is open for longer hours.To avoid the queue at ticket desk, purchase your ticket from the ticket machines in the courtyard. They are in English and Russian and you avoid the long queues.

LOVED the Hermitage...what a place!. What can be said about this incredible place? If the awesome art collection isn't enough, the Winter Palace and its rooms are incredible and truly defy description! While very crowded on the day we attended, booking with a group tour got us past the lines. The group tour also provided some narrative about the palace, the furnishings, the paintings, etc. Even though we were only able to spend about 3-4 hours at the Hermitage, it was enough time to get a taste of this magnificent place. LOVED the Peacock Clock!

Yes, you can see the Hermitage in one day. Obviously you cannot stop and look at every work of art, but it you plan your route, take multiple lunch breaks to clear your mind, and arrive early, you can get thru every room, focus on one or two items you like per room, and spend a lot of time in a few rooms you really like. Unless you have limited time and a few rooms (art periods) you really want to study, I suggest you ignore the conventional wisdom and try to get feel for the whole place, or at least most of it. Skip a few room that have never really been among your favorite art periods. In some of the rooms, the architecture and design alone is worth stopping to admire This one day tour is even easier if you have a private guide (we did) who is young and energetic. There are fewer toilettes than you might expect, so when you are near one, use it. The line to get in is long. You can avoid a lot of it if you pre-buy you ticket on-line. You can also do this with the help of the front desk at most hotels.

Impressive building and exhibits. We had a guided tour through the Museum and I think that being there the first time was the best way to do it. So much information and little stories, hard to keep up with my notes! It was nice that we could take pictures. It was busy but apparently not as crowded as it usually gets so we were fortunate to see it all, some areas more of a quick run through than others. So glad to see it and would go again in the future and take my time.

One of the highlights of our Cruise to St.Petersberg. A must visit. So much to see, a truly beautiful building with breathtaking rooms and countless pieces of Art amongst other exhibits. Get there early to avoid the queues.

A simple must see. Ranking among the greatest art collections in the world the hermitage is an absolute must see for any visitor to St. Petersburg. If you are a lover of great paintings or an artist yourself, do not visit the hermitage during the tourist season ( summer months ). You will have no chance to stop in front of even a single painting for more than a few seconds, for you will be pushed along by a human torrent of visitors consisting of tour groups from all over the world. Pickpockets abound and it is wise to leave every valuable item in your hotel safe. Even a cloak room ticket needs safe guarding. Apart from all that and the oxygen depleted atmosphere, the visit to this world cultural heritage site will leave a deep impression upon you. To revisit the place in the comfort of your own living room , buy one of the beautifully illustrated books on the hermitage or a DVD, before you leave through the exit. Enjoy your visit.
Amazing place!. Wow! this place was amazing! a day wont be enough to spend just to see everything in this place. Exceptional!
Wonderful!. What a place. Spectacular. Don't try to see all at once, it takes several days. Much to see if you like history and art.
Brilliant. Beautiful art housed in beautiful buildings. It's worth going to St. Petersburg just to visit this great place.
Very interesting by VERY crowded!. The palace is unique and breathtaking. The gardens are unbelievably set. Because of their attractive nature there are tons of visitors!

Stunning but pace plan your visit. Visited on a Thursday in September. Surprisingly few tourists were there despite what we had read. Getting in was easy and we also purchased the audio. This was almost as much as the entrance fee but for what you are about to see has to be good value. The museum is vast so sensible footwear is a must. The state rooms have been restored to former glories with masses of gold leaf and grandeur on display. Some of the rooms are jaw dropping in there grandeur. You can understand how the uprisings occurred given the displays of wealth on show. Paintings. Antiquities in abundance and want you to learn more. Audio of individual paintings very good.
Private 8 Hour tour. Fantastic.. Our Hotel, Nevsky Contour, arranged a tour for the three of us through Mango Tours. It cost about $130 each and was well worth it. Highly recommend.

Highlight of my trip. Wonderful. What else is there to say but an amazing collection that needs days to do it justice. From the moment you approach the building and enter, beginning with the marble staircase, you know you are in for an overwhelming treat. Sadly we only had time to do the perimeter and to see some Dutch masters. Lucky for us itcwas not as crowded as Id expected and with a good guide felt it easy to access its treasures.

great choice for a tour or just a wander through to look at the amazing art and buildings.. An amazing building within itself but it also contains some amazing works of art. You need a lot of time to really see many things so could easily spend a full day here. Can get very busy though!
Winter palace. Winter palace so beautiful that I can't believe my eyes, I strongly recommend for a visit, you can spent few hours to look thought every rooms, just beautiful.
Unesco Hermitage . Simply an awesome Museum in the world ! Most of the displayed art pieces are priceless and the amazing winter palace as my highlight !!

Just Superb!. This was visited as part of a 'Go Russia' trip and we had an excellent guide for the day. It has often been said that you cannot do this place justice in one day but we felt that we saw as much as we could see of all of the most important treasures on display.The highlight of the trip for me was the building; it is so ornate, with the main staircase being a complete knockout sight when you stand on it (bearing in mind that you may be standing next to 10,000 Chinese tourists at the same time). At least in this museum they let you take pictures. . . . .One small point; Russian citizens can enter for free on the first Thursday of every month. Guess when we went!So much history in one place; the pictures, the architecture, the ornaments and one room that made you stop and think for a moment. There is a royal private dining room that became the 'birthplace for a revolution' as it was where most of the ministers were found eating. It was spooky to stand in a place with so much history.

One of the world's best art museums. A very impressive art and artifact collection housed in an impressive former palace. This is not only a must see while in Russia, it is worth a special trip for any world traveler to see. The special tours given before or after public hours are highly recommended and a much more comfortable way to visit the otherwise very packed museum.
Highlight of St. Petersburg. Traveller who has interest in history and museums will not be disappointed at the variety and collection displayed at this Museum. Was awestruck !!
immensly great!. Great place to visit, so many famous paintings and artists are exposed on this immense museum, possibility to have a guide too
Absolutely a must visit !!. This museum has gorgeous architecture and wonderful treasures. It is worth the time and money to visit it. Do the highlights tour with a guide for the best experience.

A spectacular museum. It is visually breathtaking and very profound. You could spend many days learning about this place! When inside you should take a seat and time to admire the works of art geniuses! After visit you will understand that the history is amazing everywhere in St Petersburg!

What a beautiful place. Wow what a place it's one of the best museum I have ever visited.The inside of this place it's a museum I mean the walls the rooms the halls everything about it's a wow, the painting, Rembrandt, Rubén etc....just beautiful

Almost no comments. How to speak about one of most notorious world museums and heritage places. Hermitage and Winter palace complex is one of places which must be visited by every person who want to speak about European culture.
Fantastic. So much to see in a wonderful city but this is the jewel. Wonderful collection and dazzling building that gives you a wonderful insight into Russian history and culture. A must do

One of the great museums of the world. An amazing collection in a beautiful setting. The winter palace is stunning. Especially at night. The museum itself is very large and can been roughly seen in 1.5-2hrs. Mind you that just provides you a taste. You can spend all day if you have the time. Italian, Dutch, Flemish, Spanish, and more. The rooms are lavish and was a former palace with stately rooms. Truly amazing. We went with a private tour but I'm told it can get busy for individuals trying to enter so line up early.

Must Visit. What more could I say that has not already been said.My wife and I had our own guide - the way to get the best out of your visit. You would miss so much about the displays and the history on your own.

Take a guided tour.. You need a guide or you'll get lost and not see much, yet there is so much to see that about 3 hours is max before you get brain overload. We used a Free Walking Tours guide as we'd been on a tour around the outside in the morning. You pay a set fee for the Hermitage but Irina was excellent.
The Best Museum in the world. it's a dream, magnificent, superb, interesting, unique, my whole purpose to visit Russia. Simply beautiful!.

Beautiful and opulent . This place is a must-see. The art in here is extensive and impressive. The opulence of Catherine the Great is truly reflected here. If you are an art lover, plan a full day. The impressionist art exhibit has been moved across the square, so don't forget that too.
A museum worth visiting. The size and opulence of this place is mindblowing.There is so much art from well known artists you have got to see to believe.

Gold, gems, amazing chandeliers. Fabulous China and furniture. This is a must see for any visit to St Petersburg. Each room surpasses the next. The treasures contained in here are extraordinary. Restoration is on going and new rooms are completed each year. Get there early as queues can form in the peak holiday time. We were fortunate to gain early entry as we were on an Abercrombie & Kent trip and had most rooms to ourselves. The same early entry applies for cruise ships. Not enough superlatives to describe this fine museum

Amazing...but wear your hiking boots!. We arranged ahead of time for a private tour guide and boy were we glad we had! The Hermitage is absolutely mind-boggling...in terms of art and architecture and history. Easy to experience Sensory Overload there without a skillful navigator! Our tour guide (thru Red October company-fabulous) was fun, interesting, accommodating to our panopoly of ages (from pre-teen to cool college age to adult) and really savvy! We went expecting monster crowds-and there were many people to be sure. However, we never waited anywhere and saw most of the highlights, including the Impressionists. The only thing I thought was pretty ho-hum was the much touted "Gold Room"...kinduva yawner in my book but a couple of my kids loved the dazzling carots on display. I wish we had more days to explore it all, but as it was, we clocked nine miles in the Hermitage according to my daughter's Fitbit...so be prepared and wear those hiking boots!

Gorgeous. One of the beautiful museums in the world. Exceptional collections not to be missed.It's a bit long at the tickets and at the cloakroom.Avoid being over charged for the visit is very long. You can easily spend all day.Not very convenient for people in wheelchairs.

Disappointing. We were really looking forward to the hermitage. It's a fantastic building, beautiful from outside with all the status on the roof and so ornate. We queued for ages to get in. If you know when you're going, book tickets in advance to jump the queue. We paid about a fiver each for an audio guide which started well with a description of the staircase, but then we only found about 3 things which had an audio description so would suggest is a waste of money. We found the displays a bit dry with few written descriptions to help. Worth a look but don't expect to spend all day there.
World Class Museum. This Palace Museum is very impressive, make sure you see the gold room, it is amazing with diamond encrusted horse blankets, simply incredible.

Difficult to find words to describe!!. A magnificent building houses an amazing collection of artefacts. Only a tenth of the collection on display, but it's all wonderful.. So many outstanding paintings, sculptures furniture and costume. A must.

A Museum as beautiful and precious as the treasures it houses!. Walk in the footsteps of the Romanovs - stroll through the galleries of Catherine the Great - down hallways and stairways where Peter the Great stood - Whether you are an art lover of have an appreciation for Russia's imperial past, or both - a visit to the Hermitage is a bucket-list experience. The scale of architecture , decoration and grandeur is truly imperial - precious and semi-precious stones carved and inlaid in wall panels, balustrades and ceilings, chandeliers etc, and that's not even beginning to count the precious items on display as part of the museum's collection! Like a visit to the Louvre it's difficult to see everything in one visit, or absorb everything you see. I had booked a private guide rather than visit with a group so we were able to move through the rooms at a slower pace which I found much better - watching the larger groups being rushed through quickly. It's a crowded attraction at any season, so I recommend visiting either at the beginning or end of the opening hours if possible, and don't short-change it! St. Petersburg deserves several days on the ground - if you're trying to do this as a shore excursion be aware you'll only get a glimpse and be left wanting more; splurge and get the land visa - the complications & expense are worth it! Recommended viewing - the moving "The Russian Ark"

Spectacular!. The Hermitage has a world-wide reputation for its art and rightly so. But yu could spend your time simply looking at the rooms in which the priceless paintingss and artefacts are set. This sumptuous palace is just breathtaking with an extraordinary variety of period settings to enjoy. If you don't mind the crowds then Thursday afternoon is also free! Don't miss out on the fantastic remodelling of the general Staff Building across Palace Square. We saw the highlights in five hours over two days. It's well worth that amount of time.

Fabulous wealth and opulence.....it is simply like nowhere else!. Seeing the Hermitage is not to be missed. Crowded it may be but the experience is awesome. I was so pleased that I took lots of photographs as there is so much to see it becomes an assault on your senses which sent me into 'cultural overload' .The photos served as a memory jog - the tapestries, chandeliers, enormous oil paintings of Russia generals - the fantastic peacock clock. The museum provides you with a sense of pre 1917 Russia and the enormous wealth of the Romanoffs. We spent three hours there - which just flew by.Would I go again? Absolutely!
Beautiful place. Hermitage is a place that does not need reviewing or rating as it is one of the biggest,most beautiful places that you can visit in St. Petersburg

This is a must place to know . It is just spectacular due to the history involved and the treasures of art that containr. Try to selct the most important art treasures. It is important o be selectuive. Impossible to see it all in one visit

Amazing. A visit to the State Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace is a must. The enormity is amazing. It will take many hours to visit. We were on a guided tour and only walked passed the exhibits. It is huge and crowded. The crowds move along slowly. Get there early. There is an admission.

Hermitage. Beautful building and extremely interesting, both English audio guides and guided tours in English were available, I walked round with out either, as most exhibits had writing in both Russian and English. Important to get there early, as it is always busy. Top tip to avoid the queue at ticket desk is purchase your ticket from the ticket machines in the courtyard...they are in English and means your avoid the long queues...R600 for foreign tourists..well worth it

Stunning. I had long wanted to visit The Winter Palace mostly because of it's place in the history of The Russian Revolution as well as the home of the Romanovs.It is a beautiful Palace and my partner commented on ascending the ornate and gilded staircase that one could see why there had been a revolution.We had a 2 day ticket purchased online .I would recommend this as we avoided all queues and access was straightforward.We didn't manage to get back for the second day so only saw the collections in The Winter Palace.I was disappointed that there did not seem to be any information or displays about the revolution and the many pivotal events that took place in the Winter Palace.For me the highlight of my visit was the magnificent Peacock Clock brought by Catherine the great.My regret was not to have got back to see the French Impressionists.I suggest that prospective visitors read up on the collections and exhibits before going and pick what they want to see and how long they want to spend there.The Hermitage has a good website.A local man told us that if one was to spend one minute in front of every exhibit in this Museum that you would be there for 11 years!Slight problem on exiting with retrieval of our belongings from the locker.We eventually got the locker open but a young Korean lady we met had been told she would have to wait half an hour before her locker could be opened.Word of warning.The area outside the Palace is a pickpocket zone so be careful.They act in groups.One diverts your attention another slows you down by blocking you and another picks your pocket.We had a narrow escape.

Worth the Line Up. Defintely worth the line up to see this Museum. You could spend hours here and still not see everything. Due to the massive crowds it is pretty hard to see things properly though but absolutely worth the visit.

Either get on a tour or go in the afternoon to avoid HUGE CROWDS. Get there later in the afternoon or ask your hotel concierge (if not on a tour) about tickets. The lines are LONG in the morning! All the tours line up and get first crack before the publicDiamond/Brilliant Room tickets: NOT easy to get or find out about! We stayed at the Official State Hermitage Hotel for the very reason to get tickets into these very special rooms. BTW, the hotel is fantastic!

Spectacular Landmark, but....... Wonderful paintings and tapestries. I especially appreciated the spectacular staircases and all of the marble statues. However, I felt that our tour was frantically rushed from start to finish. I understand that the purpose is to give everyone a brief overview and then you can come back on your own. However, with the crowds, we never wanted to go back. In regard to the paintings, I was hoping for more.

Visiting St Petersburg – a few tips for 2016 & Impressionist paintings. OK it had been a long time since I was there. As always the drawcard is Catherine’s Hermitage museum and Winter palace – open all year round. As we were very tight for time we chose to book a guide but it is not necessary - others seemed content with the audio guide or iPhone apps. Next up is the Peterhof gardens and summer palace. If you liked Versailles then this is a must do. If you like large formal gardens and fountains then this has the most you are likely to see in any one place including the trick fountains.Getting there – do not do a group tour. Take the hydrofoil from behind the Hermitage (1300 roubles return). On arrival don’t do the gardens – go straight to the grand palace, get in the line and grab an audio guide with your ticket. The audio guide is excellent – a little too detailed at times but it does have a fast forward button.We were there start of Sept – wow the large groups of Japanese tour groups off the supersized cruise ships are huge (e.g. group No 27 from cruise ship X). Now the bonus. For crowd control and humidity control the room wardens hold back the groups. But as two solo travellers with audio guides we and you will be able to walk on through overtaking the groups being held back, as well as lingering longer where you wish. We had not known this benefit and we were very glad we had not done a group tour. The rom wardens seemed very appreciative of sole travellers taking time with audio guides (i.e. we were genuinely interested) and went out of their way to assist us or chaperone us to best positions.One of the super wealthy Russians has opened the Faberge museum – which houses the substantial Faberge egg collection he has assembled as well as much other Faberge stuff – well worth a visit. He also has his personal Renoir there for you to see !The big surprise though was the new museum the Hermitage has spun off for its Impressionist painting collection. Opened progressively since Dec 2014 they have taken over half of the yellow semi-circular General Staff Building opposite the Hermitage and this has enabled them to put on display their 19th & 20th century art. Truly excellent as before so much of it was in storage. Architecturally the building renovation is also excellent. Well travelled as we are, we have never seen so many works with so few people viewing them - no one else or only a few in the same room. Room after room dedicated to single artists, with many paintings not under glass. By my count we saw :Matisse 38 paintings Picasso 30Van Gogh 8Gauguin 19Cezanne 14Renoir 23Pissarro 6Sisley 4Degas 6Monet 14Bonnard lotsAnd many more recognisable masters. Other tips ? I don’t do ballet. But many years ago when I was young I had the pleasure of joining a bus load of little old ladies from the Smithsonian Institiute in Washington to see the Bolshoi Ballet perform at the wonderfully impressive old Kirov theatre in St Petersburg. So as no major companies were playing this time I said to my wife we could do one of the shows run by entrepreneurs at Catherine’s private theatre in the Hermitage, but be aware the quality is not at national level. So we went to see this commercial production of Swan Lake. Yup – after Act One an older Chinese lady came up to the usherette and said the male star is too old to dance. As we watched it was clear the choreographer had set his role so he mainly walked rather than danced. It was barely OK only as we mainly wanted to experience the inside of the theatre. This production is attended almost solely by tourists and is regrettably low tourist quality. Enjoy the theatre ambiance, not the dance !It was good to see St P again after all these years. The streets are full of friendly people and are safe. You don’t need a guide. Just get a good map such as Ulmons, which works on your phone’s GPS system and a good guide book, using audio guides along the way. We stayed the W hotel which has an ideal location and also ate at the nearby Craft Brew Café and SiCaffe which is sometimes an evening jazz venue – all three we would recommend to friends as worth doing.

Superb. Words cannot express the beautiful buildings , relics , paintings, artifacts ,and the history that this area / buildings represent. The wealth and excess that is on show gives you a fell to just how the aristocracy lived. Ensure when you visit you have comfortable shoes and be warned you cannot take it all in. You end up being overcome with the amount information and exhibits you have seen. A Must

If you are to visit only one place in St. Petersburg this is it !!. I travel the world regularly and I can honestly say that the magnificence of this place is just off scale. There is just nothing more to say, you will be amazed and shocked at the architecture, artwork and history of The Hermitage. The Impressionist and Post Impressionist works are now housed across the courtyard. Picassos, Van Goghs etc.. abound. Works I didn't even know existed. This extensive collection is nothing less than astounding. If you see one thing in St. Petersburg this is it.
An art lover's dream. How does one describe the most comprehensive display of art on earth. Each room was more impressive than the last.

St Petersburg - Beautiful place.. St Petersburg is beautiful, people are quite friendly unlike in Moscow. If you want to visit Heritage Museum, be prepared to stand in queue for one hour to buy ticket and inside also you need to spend full day. Its quite tiring and hets boring at times.

Hermitage. A jaw-dropping experience, best seen with an experienced tour company/guide who can get you in before it is open to the general public (ie before 1030hrs). Our group spent 3 hours going round and barely scratched the surface, but it was enough to appreciate the splendour of the palace. Well worth a second/third or more visits. However beware of tight crowds - pickpockets abound!

Overwhelming. Catherine the Great started collecting in 1764 and kept building extensions to the Winter Palace in order to house her artwork. There are now 3 million objects, including the world's largest collection of paintings, spread across five public buildings just for you and 3 million other visitors. We went during the mid-afternoon and the crowds were overwhelming, as was the grueling 2.5 mile gallop to see the top pieces. You really couldn't enjoy them as you should. Try to get in first or last!
Beautiful museum. So many things to see! Da Vinci, Rubens, Michaelangelo, van Dyk, just to name a few! The peacock is wound up and played on 5pm on a Wednesday.

Stunning. Simply put, this is a stunning visual experience with amazing items at every turn. We traveled with a guide for a special evening tour that included a concert performed by the State Symphony Orchestra of St. Petersburg. It was just a BRILLIANT evening. While we couldn't possibly see all the highlights (it would take years), we managed quite a bit of the major items in the Western European Art collection. The symphony was superb (in the Large Italian Skylight Hall, so we were surrounded by lovely art as we listened to a fine orchestra play excerpts from major pieces.) Have been to concerts/operas in NYC, London, Paris, Boston, etc. - so we do know top quality performances when we hear them. Of course wanted much more time time at the Hermitage, but we are on a cruise and the ship is sailing.... If you can only do one thing in St. Petersburg, then make it the Hermitage - and try to book a concert as well.
