Otherwise, get there early, be ready to enter when the doors open, because later in the day it gets quite crowded.

Hermitage Museum. Definitely one of the major places to visit in St Petersburg. This was the winter palace for the Tsars and now a museum. The sheer size of the place is mind boggling and the variety and quality on display -- paintings, statues, curios, artifacts -- can take your breath away. Spending even 1 day inside this is not enoough. So use whatever time you can afford.
Hermitage Museum. A must see when visiting St. Petersburg. An enjoyable walk through history I spite of the throngs of tourists. Returned that night for a performance of Swan Lake. Breathtaking!

Hermitage Museum is one of the oldest and largest museums in the world with great art collection. Hermitage Museum is one of the oldest and largest museums in the world founded in 1764 by Catherine the Great. It is one of the world's greatest art collections located in St. Petersburg. If you are travelling independently suggest to arrive early to avoid the large tour groups who are arriving by the bus loads.
Amazing Collection. Visited as part of Best Guides Tour at a busy time of year but still able to see the magnificence of this building and the collection of artworks.

Russian Versailles!. A magnificent palace in a great location!You will feel at Versailles in here! Amazing views and great for spending a summer day walking around through beautiful gardens.If you want to visit all the areas, try buying online a full ticket, otherwise you will need to make infinite lines for every site.

Went after hours with a cruise excursion.. PLUS!. We were lucky and being on a cruise ship was able to visit the Hermitage in the evening. Very controlled as to how many groups are allowed in and only with a tour guide. However, we could see the works of the Old Masters very well. So we were not allowed to see the entire Hermitage, but that was more than okay. Also the gift shop was closed. But was an excellent way to see some very special art works!

Fantastic . My visit to the Hermitage was simply perfect. I did enjoyed every minute of it. So much rich history, culture, and heritage.The museum is so big with more 3 Million peace of art and you need more than one day to explore. I strongly recommend that you have a tour guide to explain more and save time. It's definitely a must see attraction in St. Petersburg.Enjoy. . .

So big, so beautiful!. It is so big that you get lost more than once. Try to figure out what you really want to see and then try to find it!! The map you get is not very helpful and you'll find yourself a few times in the same rooms. So it gets really exhausting. But it's worth the effort!

Tips if you go without a tour guide.. Best piece of advice I ever read on Trip Advisor is go here with a tour guide! This place is just not geared up for Independent travellers. The maps are pretty useless not specifying the contents of the rooms in any more detail than 15-17th century French art and on some floors you cannot move from one side to the other without going upstairs crossing on that floor and then coming downstairs again!. There are lots of ladies placed helpfully around the building but none I encountered could speak any English. Pretty much no-one over 30 will speak English and all the staff seem to be older than that. If you see anyone serving in any of the numerous shops below 30 ask them and maybe you can get directions that way. An audio guide would be great but they are in limited supply and you need to leave your ID or 2000 Rubles deposit. We stood in line 20 minutes to get one but they ran out just 2 people before us. I found a museum app claiming to give a downloadable audio guide but the download would not work and I suspect it would only be in Russian anyway. If like me you don't heed the above advice then hopefully these tips might help. Go on a Wednesday it's open till 9pm arrive early at 10.30am as General admission starts. As you enter under the arch ignore the signs for Kassa or ticket office and turn immediately left or right back on yourself to some green temporary canopies. There you will find computer ticket booths available in English as well as Russian, you can use card or cash to buy and print your tickets there. With tickets in hand you can avoid the line and follow signs for entry to ticket holders, this will be by a side entrance not the fancy staircase. As other reviewers have said you will not be able to see it all so if you want to see the old masters or what the museum website describes as it's highlights then go directly to the first floor. This way you will get there before the tours who will go in a more logical chronological order. Room 247 houses the Dutch masters PP Rubens and next door A van Dyke, 283 is either Titian or Da Vinci, can't be sure now but you will now be in a flow and each room in this sequence will have famous brilliant artworks. When you have enjoyed the masters you can then work back through the rooms including the staterooms which will be relatively less busy now (still very busy!!) Most tours start at 11am so you can have that 30 minutes almost to yourselves.Currently an L shaped area is under renovation and the impressionists are in the General staff building across the square. Floor 3 contains Japanese and Chinese art and the ground floor artefacts from the ancient world which you may see better in Greece, Rome or Egypt.There is a very hot and crowded cafe on the ground floor serving limited but inexpensive salads, sandwiches and cakes.

Spectacular building with incredible treasures but little or no control over number of tourists and signage patheti.. Wonderful building and treasures unsurpassed anywhere in the world but too many unruly groups of tourists whose behaviour is umanaged, extremely poor signage to find your way, , the place is a nightmare if you dont speak Russia, many attendants quite rude ( one in fact could not even read rhe plan we showed her to direct us as she hadnt got her specs). Go early to avoid the crowds and groups from cruise ships

Must see in St Petersburg. We visited the Hermitage and Winter Palace on a recent trip to St. Petersburg and feel it is a must-see attraction. We went on our own and had pre-booked tickets online. Pre-booking the tickets cut down on the waiting, although we still waited about 45 minutes in line. If you use this approach, remember that you have to have some form of identification to get the tickets. The main part of the exhibition was extremely crowded with many tour groups, but we were still able to see things well (although some patience and maneuvering was needed). The high point of our visit was the Impressionist Art - located in a separate building. It appeared that very few tours go to this part of the attraction as it was not at all crowded. It was possible to take one's time and really see one of the most impressive collections I have ever seen. Do both of these when you visit if you possibly can. We spent about 3 hours, but one could spend days. I would recommend choosing the things you really want to see and focusing on these.

The queues!!. Oh my the queues were long! Unfortunately my visit to St Petersburg coincided with the first Thursday of the month which is free entry day and so people were queuing all the way around the square. Nightmare. The next day we got there early and queued up for 3 hours again before getting in. I'd advise ordering tickets online or trying to use the self service machine. Once inside the museum it is rather fantastic I must say.

Full of Interest ....... As part of a group booking we were able to enter the Hermitage on an early timed slot. This meant that queues and crowds were minimal and our tour around the museum's various buildings and levels were conducted at a leisurely pace. We didn't get to see it all but those areas and exhibits we did see were superb.

Beautifull. There is a great variety of fabulous paintings and sculptures of the most famous artists such as Michelangelo, Da Vinci, El Greco and many many others! If you go to Saint Petersburg but you do not visit the Hermitage, you can not say you have been to Saint Petersburg!You need a day to visit it just in a decent way!

THE top attraction in St. Petersburg. Saint Petersburg most important attraction and definately a must see in your visit to the city. Even if you are not a big museum fan (my case) the Hermitage is on of the most famous and important museums in the world and therefore a must. Try visiting sometime between 12.30 and 14.30 to avoid the overcrowding caused by the millions of tourist groups visiting. Also dont forget that there 5 buildings and some exhibitions are held on the other side of the square. Finally the whole building is an attraction so dont forget to walk all the outside perimeter.

Read a book, go look at the outside, skip the inside. I try to be “open to outcomes” when I go new places or do new things so I wasn’t disappointed in Hermitage. I was disappointed I spent all that money and time for it to be more or less what I expected, and the point of this review is to give you permission to skip it. If you are going to Hermitage because you feel you ought to when visiting St. Pete, I recommend you read about it and envision it or see a video about it, and then go do something else. Almost anything else. To begin with if you spent two weeks in the place all alone you wouldn’t see 5% of what is there. The buildings are beautiful, some of the interiors and pieces are spectacular, but between the volume of what is there and the hoards who are also visiting, beyond experiencing a bit of grandeur, you won’t see anything as well as you could see it in pictures. Even with a very knowledgeable pleasant guide, a decent sound system, and early entry because we were part of a tour, we still spent more time and energy trying to hear and see and keep up as we did actually enjoying what was there. On your own I’d think you’d spend more time trying to orient yourself and figure out where you were than you would appreciating things.If you are a hard core bucket list person and Hermitage is on it, I guess you have to endure it, but for me it will likely be the last thing I do as a “I suppose I should because everyone will ask about it” venture I otherwise have serious reservations about. In retrospect I’d be far happier recycling that old Yogi Berra quote about “it’s gotten so crowded no one goes there anymore.”As a seasoned world traveler, I expected this would be more of a hog-rassle than an enjoyable experience, and I'm indeed sorry my better judgement didn't prevail.

Versailles of the East - Romanov style. Huge green & gold panorama of a palace. Magnificent interior but the level of grandeur, so reminiscent of my experience of Louis XIV's similar Versailles Palace, left me thinking that often less is more! Way, way over-the-top grandiloquence. The interior apartments had the same calibre & decorative style of gold & white elegance. The Museum opens on to a sublime, white marble staircase with large numbers of visitors on it snapping shots of everything in sight. The plethora of portraits of Russian generals from the Napoleonic Wars (all in one corridor) was somewhat of an overindulgence I thought. Fantastic array of 17th-18th century art works on display which makes many other galleries pale by comparison - including Rembrandts & paintings by other Flemish/Dutch masters, a Michaelangelo sculpture & two rare Da Vincis.

Plan your visit and try and avoid the crowds. No visit to St Petersburg is complete without a visit to the Hermitage Museum - but plan your visit and try and avoid the crowds, especially tour groups. We bought a two-day ticket which enabled us to go back a second day and pick up features we had missed the first day. The first day we had to convert our voucher into a ticket which meant queuing, but on the second day we were able to walk straight in. We selected the features we wanted to focus on - in our case, the Dutch and Flemish masters and the royal state rooms - and gave the rest a miss. About three hours was enough, but the best piece of advice we received was to go on a Wednesday when the Hermitage stays open until 9pm. We arrived at 5.30pm and almost had some rooms to ourselves. All the paintings etc have English as well as Russian details next to them and the audio guide is well worth the hire. Many of the items have audio commentaries. I found the room numbering system a but of a struggle. If you can find it, the royal chapel is an (almost hidden) gem.
St Petersburg's Treasures. The architectural ensemble of buildings that make up the State Hermitage is mind blowing and the art works and embellishments add to this
Highlight of St Petersburg. It's a wonderful museum inside a magnificent palace. Try to be there a wednesday afternoon, at 7pm, to see the peacock clock working.

Must visit. There are 3 levels although many people mainly view the middle level. It is helpful to do your homework before arriving to ensure you do not miss items you really want to view. The architecture of the building is superb as is the magnificent collection. You are allowed to take photos in most areas.

Make sure you leave plenty of tme to visit the most famous St Petersburg attraction. A simply fantastic attraction where you could easily spend all day. If you are into rich salubrious rooms then plenty to see but if you also enjoy art and museums pieces this fits the bill too. The queue can be quite long but there are automated ticket machines in the courtyard inside where if you have the right change you can get ticket and walk past the queues (600 roubles at time of review)

Best visited outwith the cruise ship season!. My son (11years) and I visited as part of a private tour which meant that we didn't have to wait in line to enter the museum.Our guide's knowledge was incredible and she expertly guided us around the various rooms and galleries to ensure that we were able to see the main highlights of the museum. You cannot fail to be impressed by the opulence of the decor and the quality of the exhibits. We spent a little over three hours in the museum which was enough for my son but you could easily spend a few days exploring the museum and appreciating the exhibits.The museum was unpleasantly crowded which spoiled out visit as being pushed and shoved by coach loads of rude cruise ship passengers was not a pleasant experience. In addition we were berated in Russian by a tour guide more than once for no particular reason which scared my son. Our guide suggested that this is because she earned less than the guides that are able to speak other languages.The museum should also consider banning cameras as viewing through a camera lens detracts from the experience and spoils the experience for others.If you can visit outwith the main cruise ship season or at a quiet time of day it would be a more enjoyable experience.

If you like museums, you will love this one.. Spread over several interconnected buildings, Hermitage is a vast museum. Like Louvre or Smithsonian, you can stay here for ever, or pick and choose areas you like and skip others. The Winter Palace is an attraction in itself - both outside and inside. Be sure to go with a tour that gives you early entrance and therefore a shorter wait time. By the time we came out, there were long lines of people waiting to get in, and inside was packed. Luxury in palaces in St Petersburg is mesmerizing - Winter Palace is no exception.

Must see museum in St Petersburg. If you only visit one museum during your stay, it should be the Hermitage. Enormous collection of Russian and European art exhibited in the ornately decorated Winter Palace of Peter the Great (and the Romanovs). It will take you all day to see half of the museum. Be selective and stick to the Winter Palace rooms. Arrive at opening time and stand in line to secure a guided tour of the gold room; it is worth the wait and the additional cost. Bring a snack; the dining options are practically non-existent and there is no reentry.

What more can you say?. Crowded and exhausting, it's just as huge and amazing a collection as you can imagine! The Winter Palace is an attraction in itself. Be sure to go with a tour, giving you early entrance and a shorter wait time. You'll probably just see highlights, since the collection is vast. The Impressionists are now in another section, and may not be included in your tour, so check before booking.
Amazing. Fantastic - not to be missed experience although quite crowded. So many things to see here it would take days to see it all.

everlasting museum. Hermitage (peaceful place) Museum is full of luxury inside and outside. It is near the Neva River with the view of Palace Square in one side and Peter&Paul Cathedral other side. I wonder if it is possible to see every part of it in one week! We had only 1 day to visit it and even without any rest, it was impossible to see 1/5 of it. Just fascinating! You must visit it!

Beautiful, amazing place - extremely crowded. The only reason I have rated the State Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace as average is because of the crowds. The building itself is magnificent and is a must see for any person visiting St. Petersburg. While I am not a huge art lover, they have a large, impressive collection. For me it was the opulence of the rooms themselves, the amazing ceilings and the history that was so impressive. As to the crowds, we visited as part of a cruise tour. Our tour had gone to Catherine Palace in the morning and then we saw the Hermitage in the afternoon. Well, by afternoon, the place is packed full of pushing, shoving tourists. Our family included a older woman who walks slowly and two children under the age of ten. Our tour guide was going at such a fast pace through the museum that we spent most of the tour more concerned about keeping up with her and making sure that no one got lost in the enormous crowd. We did not get to enjoy our visit nearly as much as we had hoped - more the fault of the tour we were on than of the museum. However, my brother had booked a different tour in St. Petersburg than the rest of us and they visited the Hermitage first thing in the morning. He had a much different experience than we did. Whereas my pictures show rooms packed with people, his show open rooms with only a few people milling about. In the end, I recommend a visit to this amazing place, but you need to get there first thing in the morning, be able to spend the better part of the day exploring the many wonders of this museum and try to avoid going on a day when all the cruise ships are in town.

Visiting. This was fantastic however the crowds in August were absolutely horrendous. It was wall to wall with people. Apparently later in the year during the off season they open more rooms up. Not a recommendation to go during August.
Beautiful. Jaw dropping beauty. Loved the floors and ceilings. The opulence is unbelievable. The art is amazing

Absolute must but very crowed. Don't miss the beautiful general staff building . Buy your tickets online. It's super busy and it hurst anyone that loves art to see how poorly the conditions are in which they keep the world heritage of art there. Windows open let the smog air in, it's too warm, the sunlight shines in and the light is so poorly regulated that you can hardly see many paintings. Don't miss out on the Dutch painters. There is almost a whole room with Rembrandt paintings.Also, take enough time to leave the crowed hermitage and visit the general staff building a cross the square. It's modern, restored and modern rebuild. They do care about climate conditions for the incredible collection of Van Gogh, Monet, Matisse etc etc. don't miss out!!

A required stop in St. Petersburg. Huge and crowded but a "must see" anyway. I was glad we were on a tour that got preferential admittance. Wonderful collections. Just wish I could have spent more time there with fewer people. Not really complaining---enjoyed it very much!

Hermitage St. Petersburg. Very enjoyable time.It's a statement of opulence and over the top treasures. It can be very busy but we were on a tour that included the admission fee and priority access, so saved the long line ups that we otherwise would have had to deal with.

A must visit place in one's lifetime. Enough has been written about this place and I can endorse every thing about it. A sort of place which is a must visit. Minimum one full day required to see it fully. Purchasing tickets on the internet is highly advisable as it cuts out all the waiting in the queue.Grandeur of the palace has to be seen to believe and it is huge

The Best Place to Visit by far. We were in town on a cruise ship for two days and toured this establishment with Alla Tours. It is a very interesting museum and you must visit it with a guide, to be able to explain things to you. If you can, try and spend longer time in this museum as it huge. We were there two hours there, which is nowhere near long enough.

It's enormous!. We went with a guide to tour the palace and after 3 hours we had done a whistle-stop skim round which was mind-blowing due to the number of items to see. You could definitely spend the whole day there - if not longer - looking at the architecture, pictures, furniture and absorbing the ambience. Beautiful museum but not a place for young children due to the 'entertainment factor'.

Even Tops the Louvre and d'Orsay!. ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! That's all you really need to know. Incredibly beautiful masterpieces by da Vinci, Goya, Raffaello, Canova and more. We saw the highlights with a private guide in about 4 hours. Honestly, I could visit every day for a month - it's that impressive. I've been to the Louvre and d'Orsay at least six times and the Hermitage even tops these two world leaders.Be prepared for lots and lots of crowds and tourists, especially around the more popular works.

Overwhelming. The richness that was Czarist Russia is overwhelmingly presented in this seemingly endless museum. The size of these combined buildings and the dazzling contents staggers the mind. Room after room of gold (paint, now), high decorated ceilings, enormous paintings and lovely furniture will numb your mind. Crowds can be bad so try to go early. Best seen with a guide. The gardens and grounds should be visited as well as they are beautiful. Hard to go to St. Petersburg without visiting this venue.

Visit to the Hermitage Museum. We visited here on a tour with the Disney Magic Cruise Ship. A young lady called Jayne, fifth generation St. Petersburg resident took the tour. She knew her stuff! She took us on a whizzing tour around the museum, showing us the objects and rooms which were the best sights to see. It was absolutely fantastic. Even my eleven year old son enjoyed his trip to the museum. The rooms were fabulous, such opulence you could see before you. We saw some famous paintings and the room with the paintings of all the military officers, floor to ceiling paintings was unbelievable, that was my favourite room. Also I loved the entrance of the museum/ palace, it was stunning, the columns and stairway was something else!When visiting this city, this visit is a MUST!!

A Really Great Art Museum. Catherine the Great's Winter Palace and Art Museum. Includes many works of art by the masters as well as some of the largest bowls (15 feet in diameter). Beautifully restored and quite the site to see. Highly recommended.

Too huge for one day!. The Hermitage Museum is such a huge complex, you could easily spend days there. We also attended an evening performance of "Swan Lake" in the theatre. Excellent! If the opportunity exists, go see it.

Worth a visit but leave lots of time. It's well worth visiting but it gets very very busy so you need a lot of time to get around all of the exhibits. It also surprisingly seemed to get busier towards the end of the day.As well as looking at the works of art keep looking up and take in the building itself - just spectacular.

One of the reasons to come to St Petersburg. The hermitage is a world class museum that is astoundingly grand. I have wanted to see this for decades, and was NOT disappointed. It was all I thought it would be. If you do not visit this, you have missed the heart of St Petersburg.

Fantastic tour. Ad fun activity during a job meeting we visited Hermitage museum:it is beautiful and huge.if you want to visit it completely,it would take several days! Inside you will find a lot of historical stuff coming from all over the world,and the palace architecture is simply awesome.if you visit this city you can't miss it.

Evening visit . We were with a group and visited this amazing opulent place after it had closed for the evening . It was a special treat and we were able to walk from room to room in an empty building admiring all the collections included in this evening tour was a champagne reception and a wonderful recital by the Hermitage orchestra , a very special experience to treasure - yes it was still very warm even then .

"its good to be king" An amazing place. Seeing the art is only part of the attraction of the Hermitage. The whole experience is amazing. After spending half a day at the Hermitage you start to appreciate what an outsized lifestyle the Russian royalty had.Go see it.i'd suggest hiring a guide. you can get one for $50 for three hours and they can get you early admission plus you can buypass the lines at the museum.

CROWDED but wonderful:-). We were at the Hermitage on a Friday morning and it was so packed that one could barely get through all of the people. We were told that it was only medium as to crowds there. The building, walls, ceilings, floor, plus the art work make this an amazing place. While there, a quartet was singing just around the corner from where we were. When it worked well, all groups were headed in one direction but that was not always the case. The Hermitage is HUGE with countless works of art and impossible to see everything with one visit. It is an experience that one will always remember.
Must to visit . This place is a "must to visit ". However the visit needs to be planned well in advance since it is easily can be lost in the labirinth of the Palance.
A very nice museum. A big museum, the visit for us to saw all was 2 days (4-5 hour in a day). Wonderful collection for sculpture and paintings.
A must-see place.. This is a great museum.One has the feeling the excibits never end in this place.Save at least half-a-day to enjoy the visit.

A piece of art. What a magnificent architecture! Beautiful exteriors and richness in the interiors. It takes you back in time with its beautifully crafted designs. for not so fan of museums one can choose not to go inside.

Truly impressive. This is the most impressive palace I've visited. I liked it better than Versailles! I took most of my pictures of just the rooms; I could have come back and spent a couple of days looking at the art!

Truly Amazing and Easily Overwhelming. This is a must visit site while in the city. It is huge! If you have a few hours, just walk through the palace and take in all of the magnificence. If you have more time, get a audio guide and spend the day (or two). Big lines inside and out. Get your tickets online before you go and skip some of the lines.

One of the largest museums in the world. We had a guided tour of some 3.5-4 hours and have been through 4 buildings and have seen in fact very little. After such a tour, all you can do is to sit and have a lunch to recuperate. Paintings are endless and occasionally there is a sculpture and some of the rooms offer a view on Neva river and Petropavlovsk fortress on the opposite bank. Tis is definitely a must see I St. Petersburg.

Top destination at St. Petersburg. This museum is one of the world top class. I found there at ticket machine at the entrance which is working all times and short queue. So if you did not reserved ticket ahead, it may be good to go there before 10:00 and go to ticket machine.

Incredible!. We toured this museum and had tickets to the gold room within it. There is so much to see one could be there forever. Our guide was great in keeping us moving, as crowds quickly grow. The Rembrandt paintings, furniture, artifacts, jewelry, decorated rooms, very unique items take your breath away! If you are in St Petersburg, you must see this museum.
Number one attraction in St Petersberg.. We were told that to examine every exhibit here would take several years so there is quantity as well as quality.

World class museum. The Hermitage Museum is a must-see attraction in St. Petersburg. It has one of the largest and richest collections of art in the world, featuring all of the major artists. But the building itself is spectacular in its design and decor. You simply won't know what to look at next!Some hints -- The museum is very famous and popular and can get extremely crowded. If you join a tour in advance, you may be able to get in an hour ahead of the opening and avoid the line-up. A tour will also help you get around inside the museum (because it is HUGE) and zero in on some highlights. If you don't take a tour, at least go for the audio self-tour. If you can, you may want to research ahead of your visit to identify the things you want to find.

Awesome!!!. A must if you are in St Petersburg! Huge place snd you have to have at least 3 hours to see something. It is not just the art that you will see there, for me the palace was much more interesting!

What an amazing place!. It was my Mother in Law who told us we HAD to go to the Hermitage. It really isn't my thing - museums and lots and lots of art, but how wrong was I? I have never seen anything like this place. Utterly and completely stunning.The masters just kept coming and coming. The standard of the artwork just amazing, the quantity of things to look at just mind blowing. It's no wonder the museum has the reputation as a must see. So thanks Mother in Law for suggesting it. You were spot on!

Incredible but crowded. There are so many incredible works of art on display here, but book your tickets in advance otherwise you will have to queue for ages to get in. We decided to get the handsets to help us with our tour, but unfortunately, they weren't very good. Perhaps it might have been better to book an official tour guide? It was very crowded and I was often barged out of the way by other determined tourists - this did detract from my enjoyment a bit. Having said all of that, I wouldn't have missed it for the world. If you enjoy history, it's hard not to be captivated. Might be better to visit at a quieter time of the year.

Art: Five Star - Atmosphere: One Star. The art collection deservedly lives up to expectations. BUT, is it that so much art is owned by the nation that the proper conditions for its preservation are neglected? Since when is it acceptable to have these irreplaceable works of art in galleries that are not climate controlled? And to have open windows is inexcusable.I went for two days - once with a tour group and later on my own with a ticket purchased online.I will return to St.Petersburg, but definitely not during the height of the tourist season - the mega-sized tour groups with the people elbowing each other to take inferior photos of the paintings was ludicrous.The second visit was more successful, the galleries were relatively uncrowded for about five hours. The next visit will be in late spring or early fall. The Hermitage is worth many visits.
Amazing collections. We had an intense 3.5 hour tour, but we could have spent a full day. Loved the collections as well as how they were displayed.

Book tickets ahead of time!. I will not spend time here describing the great art that Hermitage has, everyone is aware of it but concentrate on practical things that I learned. The ticket line to the museum is enormous but you can purchase tickets on-line for no extra charge. It is done thru Hermitage shop link on Hermitage site. You are provided with a voucher that you can use to redeem for tickets within 6 months. There is a special ticket window for e-tickets. When I came at 10 am there were maybe 5 people at that window compared to thousands in the other line. I have also purchased guided tour in English for my family of 3. The best thing I have done and completely worth 7,000 roubles (a little over $100) but you do have to purchase entry tickets separately. The tour was 2.5 hours which was plenty. Actually you do not have to purchase entry tickets before hand if you are doing a guided tour, they will arrange for everything but I did not know it at the time. You have to arrange for guided tour in person at the Hermitage but we did it a day before and took 5 minutes. We had a great visit! Get the guide!

Hermitage has a first rate collection of some of the BEST. An after hours tour of the facility that is spectacular in many many ways. It's beauty is overwhelming and can dwarf the marvelous pieces of art work. Five buildings of art work collected beginning with Alexander the Great. Catherine the Great purchased complete sets of famous artists thus beginning the extensive collection that fills the Hermitage. We had the opportunity to see significant works by Michelangelo, Rembrandt, Titian, and de Vinci up close and personal.

Hermitage Museum. Excellent museum - a lot to see and a guide would definitely help - we were also lucky enough to get access to the Gold room, restricted to special parties of 10 or less, and this is highly recommended.

quauntity, not quality.disappointing.. having a degree in religious studies and one in art history makes me an art lover focused on greek, roman, byzantine, renaissance and reformation art.. not interested past the 17th century,.good thing too,,because the impressionists are in a separate bldg.the hermitage is big, enormous. built in the 18th century by peter I in the Russian baroque style it is a marvel of gold leaf, marble and staircases. it's not that the bldg. si better than the art within it's the fact that there are tour upon tour upon tour shuffling people past the most famous pieces, eg., there are 2 Leonardo d'vincis. each member of the group looks briefly at the painting, snaps the obligatory photo and moves on as another person moves in, glances, takes pic and moves on to the next prize. this was the most disappointing room for me. when I visit an art gallery I like to sit in front of a painting and absorb all aspects of the painting. I've been known to get so engrossed in a painting, that a friend has to retrieve me after they have seen the whole exhibit.. not possible here. the "famous" paintings are under glass and there's no place or opportunity to enjoy the great work of art. think, mona lisa in the louvre, under glass, and people 10 deep staring for a nanosecond so they can go home and tell their friends they have seen the mona lisa. same thing at the hermitage x 10.after my river cruise I had booked a hotel for 3 nites so I could spend quality time at the hermitage. never happened. the cruise tours come at 8:30 and fill the bldg. the general public enters at 10:30 on depending on when they arrived to line up for an hour to purchase a tix for 800 roubles ( $16 CAD) this tix allows u to visit the main bldg. only. u can't buy tix in the line for the next day. one day only. u can't leave and return on your tix the same day.SUGGESTION:: BUY YOUR TIX ON LINE IN ADVANCE. I PAID $23.95 CAD FOR TWO DAYS IN A ROW, NO WAITING IN LINE. THIS TIX ALLOWS U ACCESS TO ALL FIVE BLDG.I found arriving at 1 pm and leaving a 6 pm closing time gave me the most access to the exhibits, eg. I found the room of french renaissance art and got lost in several pouisson's. I gave up on the Italian masters. if u do not have a guide there r wands or purchase (500 roubles) in many languages. the women at the desk speak fluent English, which i found funny because the info desk staff do not. the wand will introduce u to the major exhibits.If u only have a day i suppose u could enjoy a few paintings, but the unique exhibits r hard to find. it took me 55 min. to find the byzantine exhibit. (none of the guards speak English and they will point left and say "right")u can take pix sans flash in all exhibits except the byzantine and I am at a loss to know why and there was no one to ask. it took equally long to find the Siberian art and artifacts and I had a map. it's just soooooo big and the elevator does not take u to the byzantine exhibits on the top floor altho it goes to the top floor -- it's a matter of finding the right staircase in an enormous barn w/ hidden staircases. it's worth it, however, the Siberian artifacts r kept in a special cold room and there is no where else in the world u may see them. unfortunately most art is labled in Russian. the Russians just haven't caught up to tourism yet. for 500 roubles extra u may go to either the sparkle treasure room or the gold treasures room. u must have a guide and tours r offered in several languages at different times. I took the sparkle room tour - the hard part was trying to find where they sold the tix when no one speaks English. in the sparkle room they have a bejewelled reliquary (12thcentury) to hold a piece of the true cross, a phenomenal 12th century statue of a monk holding a jeweled bible. my favourite was a glass engraved w/ Anne of Cleaves (henry VIII 4th wife) name. while I enjoyed what I found and experienced, the inability to sit in front of a painting and explore it thoroughly was frustrating. the crowds were frustrating, noisy and disinterested in art. even the rooms, unlike varsailles, have pieces of furniture of a certain period stored in them, but other than Peter's throne room, none of the furniture belongs in that room. it has been collected and stored in a room in the hermitage so u never get the sense of the real winter palace when occupied by the romanoffs. fortunately, for the most part, lenin left the hermitage unharmed to show the peasants the debauchery and extravagance of the tsars while they starved.I am glad I went for four days, however, the louvre, the british museum and the museums on museum island in berlin r better organized and more tourist-friendly. the hermitage has a lot of art, but it is poorly displayed and is sorely lacking in languages other than Russian by both the labels and the employees. Russia is trying, but it has a long way to go.

unbelievable really. we paid to go in after closing time so we went round with an excellent guide in a group of 20 who showed us some highlights. Then a symphony concert and a glass of champagne. So worth it. I wouldn't like to try and visit with no sort of tour at all- the queue is endless and the museum is just so BIG!. Hard to express how much gold, how much stuff, how much to look at there is.....

Best museum in the world. When my husband insisted that the Hermitage was a top attraction, I was sceptical given the riches in other top museums which I had visited. Nothing had prepared me for the scale and artistry of the whole. Aside of the exhibits which of course were first rate. I found the actual buildings and rooms within of utter beauty. I could have spent days in there, it is s truism but can not recommend it enough. Top tip: don't queue, buy the tickets from Internet or use the ticket machines if just turning up. At the time of writing, this info is not in the guidebooks nor any staff available to inform punters of this option. I found this a sore note.

Not worth the trip. The Hermitage is very, very crowded and uncomfortably warm. The staff personifies the stereotypical unfriendly Russian. Despite its beautiful collections, it's not worth the hassle of traveling to Russia. Although, it has lovely jewelry in the gift store.

What an experience!. We visited the museum as a part of a cruise excursion and spent couple of hours at the Hermitage. I would recommend spending a lot longer, especially if you are an art lover. We could have easily spent the entire day. Don't missed the impressive collection of Impressionist Art at the building next door.

Awesome!. Well worth braving the crowds. To stand within inches of Rembrandts, Van Goghs, DaVincis, Gaughins, etc. was amazing. The museum is huge so try to set aside more than one day for this place! Also, if you sign up with a tour group you can beet the lines (somewhat).

So many things to see take more than one day. To avoid the queue buy you ticket on line. There is a great deal for 2 day tickets and it avoids the queues if you go for opening time.The only thing to watch is that if you want to see one the individual tours such as the Gold or Diamond room those tickets need to brought on the day and they only have 1 English speaking tour a day for both.In general the staff are helpful if you know what you are looking for and usually the map is very clear.There is also an app you can download to do several audio tours as wifi is available in several areas.I don't recommend the sandwiches in the main cafe but the drinks were good.
Stunning!. Truly jaw dropping rooms with more gold then I have ever seen in my life! A vast place that you could visit time and again and still have something new to see. A real experience.

The peacock clock was amazing - it 'displays' only once a week, Wednesday I think.. Unbelievable. We spent 7 hours in the museum without even noticing! It was uncrowded and most rooms had excellent English explanations.
Amazing. An amazing museum that you can spend days & only see a small part. Our guide did a great job showing us some of the amazing art in only half a day.
One of the best meseums I've ever been. You just have to go in and see it yourself. The quality and amount of collections in the museum are unbelievable.
Huge One.. Do not think you can cover this Museum in couple of hours. It takes even more than a day or two or even more time. There is always a big Q. Best way to get ticket is on ATM type Machines

Fantastic Opulence: The Hermitage Palace. A must see for all St. Petersburg travelers! Extraordinary opulence that is beyond belief. The inlaid parquay floors, crystal chandeliers, renaissance art and fabulous treasures will utterly amaze even the most cynical traveler.
Must visit museum. Fabulous museum in St Petersburg. Must visit. It takes minimum of 3-4 hrs with a good guide. Buy your tickets in advance as there are long queues.

So much to see!. Our hotel arranged a Guide for our group so that we didn't have to wait in the long queues. She was excellent, and took into account the mobility problems of some of the group by stopping near benches to give her commentary. As it was peak season the galleries were crowded, but the wireless system used by our guide meant that we didn't have to be near her to hear her. We were only in St Petersburg for 72 hours and the Hermitage is closed on Monday, so our time was limited before catching the boat.Our guide planned a tour that would allow us to see as much of the most interesting exhibits as possible on a booked 3 hour tour and then left us to see the things in which we were particularly interested. The building is superb and it is possible to get very close to the exhibits.

Beautiful with amazing art by all of the greats!. We really enjoyed our visit to the Winter Palace and Hermitage. It was almost as I imagined when I read Nicholas and Alexandra with the kids before our trip, only more opulent than the imagination can bring up! The Palace itself is quite a site and then you get to the Hermitage and you can see something wonderful from almost any great artist you can imagine. Catherine the Great started the collection and it continued from there, so it is quite a show! Don't go to the city without a stop here, but bring a guide so you know what you are looking at and what importance it may have had. We brought our kids (12-14) and they enjoyed the visit too. We had just under 2 hours here, but you could easily use more if you are an art nut!
Amaing. A must see on a trip to St Petersburg. Winter palace is extraordinary and full of history. Hermitage museum is wonderful.

An experience. How do you describe such a place in words. Spent 5 hours walking around and saw amazing paintings, rooms , sculptures and exhibits. I'm sure you could spend days and still not really see everything. Wander at your own pace and just absorb the history and skill that surrounds you.

Excellent place for art but totally crowded with people. Checked out Eremitage and enjoyed the placeEspecially the Russian Art is great and the Palace itself is amazingUnfortunately it's totally crowded with big tour groups who are noisy so I have to reduce my ranking to four stars

Even the entrance hall is spectacular. 2nd day with TJ Tours, once again no queue. I wanted to see The mechanical peacock, in a case now but video runs to show it. Also Rembrandt's the prodigal son, they were both beautiful and amazing in their own way. Everything else was a magnificent bonus.Like all tours I would have liked more time, but we got a flavour.

Fine if you like pictures!. Included in the two-day tour but SO crowded in August as to make life difficult if on a tour. Still - somewhere one just has to go. Lot of paintings when personal taste would have been better at the Faberge museum

What an amazing place!. Visited the museum as part of a 2 day tour. This was the highlight for me . The opulence of the building and is vast range of exhibits was overwhelming. Only wished we had more time there!

Yes, it's as good as they say.. There's a lot of hype about the Hermitage. Is it justified? Well, yes it is. There's so much to see that a two day pass is a good option. It's also a good idea to get your ticket in advance on the Internet.On the downside I'd say it has the worst signage and guidance of any such museum or attraction I've ever encountered. In fact the signage in the Staff Building where the impressionist set care housed is positively misleading. Probably a good idea to research and plan your visit in advance.

Impressive but no impressionists. The palace is imperial but I was disappointed with the art collection. They removed all the impressionists to another museum - literally around the corner but you had to buy another ticket. Apparently they do this often...

Be prepared to wait, but it's worth it. It took us approx. 1 hour and 10 minutes waiting in a line outside before we could enter, but it was an amazing experience. It's enormous, so it's a good idea to plan your visit. You can plan it on the website, so you know what you wanna see. We left after 3 hours inside and we didn't see it all, so you can easily spend a whole day there.

Amazing place full of so many treasures. This has got to be one of St Petersburg most opulent buildings. It is recommended to pre book tickets so that you can skip the long queues that build up outside so that you get to spend as much time as possible inside. Our guide walked us around some of the most impressive rooms with many dedicated to works by famous artists such as Monet, Van Gogh and Renoir. Rooms were full of stucco, gold leaf, sculptures and treasures amassed by the Tsars over many generations. The only downside of the visit was that it was too crowded and it was virtually impossible to stand and spend quality time appreciating the many treasures here. You definitely need good walking shoes as the Hermitage is laid out over a vast area.
paradise for lover of art. If you want to see all works of art you will need minimal 2 days.We´ve already seenseveral galleries in Europe but I think Hermitage is one of the most beautiful.

Breath taking and tiring but worth it. This is surely one of the biggest museums in teh worl. My feet certainly did plety walking. The rooms of art are staggering. I saw more than 10 Picassos in one day let alone all the other treasures.
Majestic . The ticket isn't expensive and to visit the all hermitage it could take up to one entire day. Thousands of pieces of art from every corner of the world.

Gorgeous building, great works of art -- Book a tour!. I'm going to start by telling everyone to book a tour otherwise you'll be waiting hours to get in. There are so many people inside it's difficult to read everything, so with a guide you'll have it all explained to you as you go through.The Winter Palace is one of the most gorgeous buildings I've ever seen in my life. The Hermitage museum had a great collection of works. You will NOT see everything, so don't go in expecting to. It's such a large building you'd need a few days to see it all. I'd recommend everyone checking this one if in Saint Petersburg, It's well worth putting up with the sheer number of tourists flocking in. Quite an amazing place.

Beautiful, but do it with a guide!. The Hermitage is absolutely amazing, but best done with a guide in a SMALL group! Our private group of 8 (Alla Tours) was able to navigate quickly throughout most of the Hermitage vs touring around in a huge group. We were able to see all the most important sites in a shorter amount of time. Without a guide, I'm sure this would've been overwhelming! You could spend a full day here, but since we only had 2 days in St Petersburg, we had to make the most of our time!

In the top tree museums of the world. Two places that you must see in St. Petersburg, Catherine's palace and the Hermitage. I would highly recommend a guide with an early viewing. The crowds can be crushing for a reason...the museum is fabulous. It compares with the Louvre and British museums. In fact, a serious art lover would plan on a guided tour for at least two days. Not only is the artwork smashing, but the building is just as nice as well. Keep a look out for the twelve thousand year old mummy. And if you are lucky, schedule your visit to coincide with the peacock display!
Great tour of St Petersberg Museum. Tour guide was very knowledgeable in her tour of the rooms of museum. Enjoyed learning more about the history of the city.
Unmatched collection of art.. St Petersburg is a beautiful, clean European city. The people are warm and friendly. There are more worthy attractions than one can see in a lifetime.

Stunning Architecture & Magnificent Art Museum!. Hermitage Museum is one of the largest museums in the world; it is impossible to see it all in one or two days, as it consists of about 400 rooms and 3 million items!! Hermitage contains a huge collection of art from different countries / cultures and time periods. It is one of the oldest museums too: Hermitage was founded by Catherine the Great in 1764. It is also the Winter Palace, a former residence of Russian emperors - a huge beautiful palace with breathtaking architecture! A MUST-SEE place in St. Petersburg!

Unbelievable museum. So beautiful museum. Is enormous and very rich. For me most interesting thing are the rooms. Lots of people and big line to enter. If you buy thicket by internet you will get two slow lines so I think is much better buy it at the museum. Is faster. The only problem is most of things doesn't have English translation. Anyway the museum is wonderful to stay one day long. At least 6 hours.

A must for Museum Buffs. People line up for 4-5 hours to see this museum for a reason - it is astonishing. Luckily with a tour we got early entry and could visit this museum before general crowds thronged the museum. A must see on St. Petersburg visit for museum lovers.
Summer cruise to Russia/Scandinavia. It would take a week (at least) to go through all the art in this building. We only saw the highlights and it was amazing.
Art fest.. If you are into art this is the place to visit. Wonderful collection of paintings and sculptures. You will need a lot of time to see all the treasures here.

Fantastic museum. What a wonderful place. We had only 2 1/2 hours here, but frankly you could spend days in here and still not see everything. Again crowds, but our cruise ship did have an early entry so we managed to avoid a lot of this. It is worth paying the cruise company to be on a tour that has early entry. The exhibits are outstanding and the actual museum is magnificent in itself, without any exhibits! A must whilst in St. Petersburg and if you have days to spare, then you could do it real justice

A must!. This phenomenal building houses one of the largest art collections in the world. Even if "not into" art you must visit! Go as a member of a group tour or be prepared to join long line ups to enter. Photography is permitted.

Interesting and rich. The museum is a large complex with several galleries on art and Russian history. Though the museum was extremely crowded and we didn't have time to fully comprehend the pieces in all of the galleries, the experience was one of the most astonishing. In addition, some of the paintings are in another building of the museum. To see those (in particular impressionism style) visitors do not need another ticket and it should not be missed. One should make sure that he has at least 4 hours to visit the museum.

Hermitage. Absolutely wonderful and full to the brim with art and artifacts. Its huge, and one can not see enough of the many wings even in a week. Breathtaking !
Check for specific wings to visit with tickets booked in advance.

A stay in St Petersburg. A wonderful city to visit and explore great Museums, Palaces and Churches. The Hermitage Museum most outstanding and displays second to none, the biggest problem being the crowds and long queues. Not to be missed on a visit to St. Petersburg.

Wonderful museum, reserve plenty of time to visit. We visited on a hot afternoon in August and found it very relaxing to stroll around the enormous complex. We enjoyed the state rooms the most. I recommend reading about the other exhibits before you visit so you can prioritise toy time.There were long queues but we walked past them and bought our tickets from a machine. There was an English speaking option and it was very easy.

Awesome. So much to see here. Wonderful art collections and amazing architecture - almost overwhelming. It is said you would need 10 years to see all the art if you spent 1 minute at each item. Definitely worth a day or two.
Great Experience. even my kids (aged 16 and 11) enjoyed the Hermitage. An additional advantage was the low price to such a famous place since kids' tickets till the age of 18 cost 50 rubles.
Great art collection.. Wow, This is a really nice place, worth the visitMake sure you leave enough time to see it all, like at least a full day.

One of the world's greatest art collections. A must see! You can easily spend a week here, but try to allocate at least a few hours. One of the world's greatest collections, located on one of the world's most magnificent squares.
Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace. Theres no comparison the the beauty of this place . The museum is so huge that a day is not enough to look at the exhibits . It is a Must to visit the place .

If you love art - this is the place to see!. Visited Hermitage with husband while in St. Petersburg this summer. Amazing! Hours & hours of walking. This place is huge & filled with all the masters. Words cannot describe how exquisite this museum is. A must see for any art lover. Very crowded though.

The stunning Hermitage. The most stunning collection of artworks on a grand scale. Leave plenty of time to try to take it all in. Slight disappointment is that the famous English made pheasant clock now only performs its routine once a week but you can watch a video of it at any time. The room settings were our favourite part: you could imagine what life may have been like in times gone by. Utterly captivating!

Lovely but sometimes overcroeded. No mater if you are on a cruise ship or if you are staying in the city you will always find this location a bit crowded, is one of the main attractions on the city so is expected to be fully loaded with guests from all over the world, my advise is just to take your time to get inside and not to go on a rush because if you go like that you will end up frustrated and not happy with your experience in this fabulous Palace that now is one of the 3 most important Museums in the World together with the Vatican in Rome, is wheelchair accessible and also remember that some of the rooms are restricted to the visits only if you have a pre booked ticket you can visit some of the rooms like the Gold room that is not covered in gold is just the room for the crown jewels

Prepare to be overwhelmed. No one goes to St. Petersburg without going to the Hermitage, but it's impossible to imagine just how vast it is. If possible, one should allow several days although that would probably entail several admission fees. An alternative would be to allow a full day with a break for lunch and rest in the very adequate cafe in the museum.There are audio tours as well as guided tours, and either would be helpful in navigating the huge building.There are computers near the cafe where you can research exhibits.
Above the words!. Splendor, wealth, history, greatness... A place where you can spend a whole holiday. Don't miss it, and reserve two or more days, depending on your time.
Beautiful museum. First Thursday of each month is free entry but the lines are very long. Expect to wait up to 2 plus hours. Several days are needed to see the whole thing.

Decadent. One of the most amazing places to visit. No matter which tour you take, it's breathtaking and humbling. Even the long queues can't detract from the sheer beauty, opulence and wealth. Just beware: if you are interested in the French Romantic collection, they are now shown separately.

great museum. Hermitage is worth seeing at least once in a lifetime. Large collections of ancient Egyptian, Greek and Roman art are particularly impressive. Though I would not recommend to visit it in summer as it is overcrowded with tourists from all over the world and it is a bit hard to enjoy some of the most popular parts of exposition. You save a lot of your time if you buy the tickets to the Hermitage from home on-line (https://www.hermitageshop.ru/tickets/), as the queue to the ticket office is very very long - in summer it often starts near the center of the square (Dvortsovaya ploschad) and goes through all the inner court of the palace. E-tickets are valid 6 months so it is possible to choose aby date for a visit.

Opulent . This is reputedly the largest museum in the world housing some three million artefacts. The fact that we only had a maximum of three hours here on a guided tour meant we only saw the tiniest fraction of what this museum had to offer, but what we did see was beautiful and opulent.Large rooms decorated with intricate gold fittings and columns; large polished floors that use several different types of lacquer to polish them; a peacock clock automaton that is stunning to see; two DaVinci Madonna paintings in the same room. I could go on but really this place has to be seen to be believed. Absolutely stunning.

Bewitching Winter Palace or The Hermitage.. Certainly one of the most dazzling display of wealth. Leaves you spellbound by the artefacts and massive decorated rooms. Housing splendid vases and bowls made of precious stones like lapis lazuli and malachite. Also pieces of finest porcelain tableware vases glasses of all sorts wine coolers .It has the largest malachite vase in the world. There are world class paintings by the masters. There are decorative fireplaces few pieces of furniture most of it burned down sadly by fires. A history to remember a must see for all visitors. A rare clock is also on display along wth a number of other running clocks. I could go on....

One of Most Important World Museums of Art. Most fantastic collections of European Art. Entering up the Jordan Staircase is the adrenalin rush that does not stop as you spend the day here. Stop for a break and then carry on! They also have an exquisite group of shops with books, jewellery and much more. The quality in the shops and variety of items is one of the best in the city. The Winter Palace building that houses the main collection, is a beautiful building right on the banks of the Neva River. A childhood dream come true to visit the Hermitage! Go with a tour group to avoid standing in line...extremely long! We walked right in at 9:00 am with no wait at all as we were in a tour.

Among the best in the world!. As others have posted, this museum is overwhelming and captivating. We were fortunate enough to have booked a private Alla tour guide in advance, who was beyond competent with her knowledge and navigation of the entire museum. We saw and learned so much, and, by time we left, we were satiated - and saturated! - with our newly acquitted art knowledge. Our tour was approximately a half-day (3-4 hours), and yet, we didn't see a great deal of what is offered...the Hermitage is that impressive and enormous. I do believe that having a private tour guide with us was a huge benefit, and would suggest that anyone do so. In all, a must-see while in St. Petersburg!!

Opulent and Beautiful!. This museum is truly amazing! The artwork reaches through the centuries and presents itself in the most amazing venue imaginable! Each large room is more breathtaking than the last. Plan on spending an entire day wandering through this palatial museum.

World Class Museum. This museum is a cultural icon for the world. If you visit St. Petersburg you have to see this amazing place. We are fortunate the Russian people have opened these treasures for the tourists to see. We were there two hours could have spent days. The collection is so vast it would take years to see every piece.

Splendor and wealth of the Tsars. The greatest of all the museums I have ever been . His sumptuous richly adorned halls are really impressive . In this museum tourists will find one of the largest collections in the world .

Overwhelming. It's a giant, this museum, both in size and offerings. The masses of people are huge, the numbef of high-class paintings as well.From the Middle Ages to the late 19th century - da Vinci, Rembrandt, Rubens, Titian, Watteau, Tintoretto - all there in the Winter Palace.Impressionists and 20th century-art are in the General Staff Building across the Palace Square.Don't bother quequeing long before opening times. Get there for opening hours and get your ticket at one of the vending machines in the courtyard. Or, come in the afternoon when all the groups from the cruise ships are through.Taking pictures is possible, but I didn't bother - there is simply too much to photograph.Take comfortable shoes - you'll be walking several kilometres.All in all - one of the places you've got to see!

Uncomprehensible wealth and grandeur. Beautiful exterior, but the grandeur and wealth of the interiors are mind blowing. You can see why there was so much anger and vilification over the wealth. However from a historical view quite amazing. If you get the chance, book to see a ballet as the theatre is quite intimate and you can easily imagine the gentry sitting around and being entertained.

Amazing and overwhelming.. There is so much to see at the Hermitage and so little time. If you want to wander around and take it all in give yourself at least two days and don't go for the controlled tour early opening. Note that their large Impressionist collection is kept in asleep rate building.

One of the Best in the Workd. The Hermitage is perhaps the largest museum in the world. It has a lot of the treasures of modern Russian history from Peter the Great to the Bolshovick revolution. We learned a lot about Russian history from visiting the rooms dedicated to the life and history of the Czars including Catherine the Great and the last ruling family. Magnificent Russian Art is exhibited in the Hermitage, an Art which rivals the best western painters that we were familiar with. We simply could not enlist everything that we have viewed. It was an educational cultural experience of the best quality.

Mind-blowing!. This place is utterly breathtaking! As I said to friends, too often one hears people say something is "mind blowing".... Well; the Hermitage truly is MIND BLOWING!We're all accustomed to visiting a Palace or Stately Home, where there are a handful of amazing interiors and a smattering of remarkable works of art. Well, the Hermitage is room, after room, after room of UTTERLY BREATHTAKING, MIND-BLOWING staggering, ornate beauty.I've a reasonably good, but superficial grasp of Russian 20th century history, but had never fully grasped how obscene the difference between the Romanov's and their subjects' really was. Suddenly I could really understand what caused the two Revolutions when I saw the extent of the astonishing opulence of the Hermitage. And this was just ONE of their palaces!

The Hermitage Impressionist collection has been moved out of the main complex. We had a private guide / tour of the Hermitage which was excellent - overwhelming, impressive and spectacular.Our guide Irina P from tours by locals was incredibly knowledgable and somehow moved us through the museum by avoiding the crowdsHowever, if you are interested in seeing the Hermitage collection from the Impressionist period onwards, be aware that they have been moved into a separate building across the Piazza and make arrangements accordingly.We found that after we spent some hours in the main museum we were too tired to do the Moderns justice, so we were lucky enough to find a amazing guide, SVETLANA at (kotlyarenkoa@gmail.com) who arranged a private tour, with a car and driver, of the moderns for us.This was truly a highlight of our trip to St Petersburg.Svetlana is a wonderful person, easy to engage with and above all, a lecturer in Art History at the universityApart from the wonders of the collection, I loved the architecture of the building.The inside has been gutted and provides a modern environment to showcase the artOverall 2 amazing and informative visits

Imperial Ellegance. We were on a guided SPB tour, our guide Luba gave a 'quick overview' which lasted almost 2 hours.to see the Hermitage properly, it is recommended to take at least a month!!You need to get in early, we were there at 9.55am and it was over busy.
Cant miss this wonderful collections. Breath taking .Every room in the museum is special in different ways/ well maintained and every article is a treat to our eyes .

Buy your tickets advance online.. Incredible place, well worth a visit. Thanks to my hotel receptionist who mentioned buying a ticket online skips you to the very small queue and gets you in immediately. Don't wait in the huge line!

Beautiful palace with beautiful art. Our tour through the Hermitage was great! The building is beautiful, and I think I have more photos of the architecture and rooms than the art. On that level alone, it's worth a visit. I do recommend a guided tour of some sort if possible, as it makes the museum come alive - we learned and understood a lot more than we would have just wandering ourselves.One thing to remember is that this museum is huge! Be prepared for a lot of walking, or not seeing a lot in general. Also, the maps in English tend to disappear quickly, so if you know another language, grab that map instead. By the time I was looking for maps, all I could find was French.

There are no words. Really there are no words that can describe the magnificence that is the Hermitage. Not only should it be on your list if traveling to St. Petersburg but it really should be on your bucket list for life experiences.You will never be able to see everything so choose your time wisely. Definately check out 2 of only 10 DaVinci's in existence, a couple if Rembrandt and a Michaelangelo.

Real Capital of Russia. While in St. Petersburg, you just can not miss this place. There are separate entries for conducted Group tours (Facing the Canal) and for general Public (Through Palace Square). You can spend entire day here - its never ending. What a collection and depiction of richness - truly royal. There are several wings of this Palace and we didn't mind repeating some of them. It definitely was the real Capital of Russia because there is nothing like this in Moscow. St. Petersburg is THE PLACE to visit while you are in Russia - even if you have to skip Moscow.
Magnificent. The Winter Palace is not to be missed when visiting St. Petersburg. It is breathtaking in every way. The Hermitage Museum has the most impressive display of art.

The number one reason for visiting St. Petersburg. A private guide and driver will get you in ahead of the lines. They will also customize your tour so that you will have the option of not only seeing the incredible collection of Impressionist art (in a separate building), but once they gauge your interests, they can show you exhibits "off the beaten track" such as Siberian archeological artifacts!A couple tips... it is very warm and "stuffy" but in most rooms, if you look toward the windows, you will a small portable a/c between the windows... standing in front of it will "revive" you. Also, the Impressionist exhibit and Siberian artifacts are MUCH less crowded than the main exhibits.

Wow!. An amazing collection of art and artifacts. You can get up close to DaVinci's and Rembrant's. The amber room is extraordinary. It must have been amazing in the original. Try to get an early opening ticket as part of your tour. Otherwise it gets very crowded.

Amazingly grand and beautiful. This spectacular building is the best attraction in St Petersburg. It's absolutely vast and impossible to even attempt to get around. We had a private guide who showed us all of the main state rooms which were magnificent, and edited highlights of some of the art. I think it should be the last attraction you visit in St Petersburg - it's certainly the best and everything else pales into insignificance by comparison. Of course this does mean that it's packed with tourists so be prepared for a bit of a crush. Having a guide also means you avoid queuing for tickets to get in. You could spend many hours in this amazing museum and not get close to seeing everything. Highly recommended.

Buy tickets at the machines or internet, don't stand in line. Had a lovely afternoon strolling around the magnificent Hermitage. Could have spent days and days there, however, our time was limited. The lines to the tickets (to actual cashiers) are very long, but there are ticket vending machines (600 roubles per ticket as of August 2015), where you can buy a ticket on your own and can walk past the line straight in.Highly recommend, even if you only have a few hours - it's worth a visit, it's stunning and magnificent.

A must if you are in St. Petersburg. What a beatiful building! Their collection is very big that if you spend 10 seconds on each piece, it takes 80 years to complete! Entrance fee is around 10 Euros and if you are a student and have ISIC card, it is free! Beware that it is very crowded and select your musts inside in advance.
Crazy huge and spectacular. If you've ever seen the Louvre then this is the same deal - brace yourself for an art overload and tourist crush - but still worth a look!

Amazing. Amazing! If you love art, you can spend there many many hours (especially on Wednesday when it's open until 21.00). It's third biggest museum in the world, so if you love art, don't forget to visit it.
best museum. Must visit with a guide . that is money spend well.. absolutely stunning. Must see. Need a week to see everything. loft the rembrand area and the beautifull golden clock from Catherine

Its a world class museum in a palace. Its a world class museum in a palace, you could remove all the priceless art from the building and it would still be an incredible place to visit, add in the art collection and it blows you away.

Great Building. It is shame that in this incomparable GREAT building this incomparable COLLECTION of art is presented in such a POOR museum setting: * windows are opened due to lack of AC * most likely, partially due to the above, many oil painting works are framed with a glass covering, which has NOT a flat/non-reflective, but a regular/reflective surface, resulting and contributing to the below:* art is displayed against the window light causing not only aging, but also making it absolutely (!) impossible to look at due to endless reflections "shining" into your face and eyes

Know before you go!. I've been to museums around the world and have a pretty high tolerance for what comes with them (lots of people, a lot of standing, some pushing & shoving and warm temperatures). I wasn't that impressed with the Hermitage - to start with, there were thousands (yes, thousands) of people from all over the world and I can't tell you how many times I got my feet stepped on. There were tons of prams so that made it quite difficult to maneuver around exhibits and moving from room to room through the narrow doorways. Also, there were not a lot of places to sit so be prepared to be on your feet for hours. While I'm fully aware it was summer, it wasn't just warm inside - it was downright hot and sweaty. Recommended wear would be shorts or a skirt and a short sleeve top. Finally, very important to know if you go with older people - there are not a lot of elevators for wheel chairs so be prepared for some walking and stairs.

Amazing Palace. One of the most amazing palaces that I have visited and I have had the opportunity to travel around the world. Make sure that you have a knowledgeable guide. The history is so rich. Just amazing. Truly a must see if in St. Petersburg.

An Amazing Place. This is such a gem . As one of our fellow tourists commented,I never expected to see so many pieces of work by the Masters. I only wish that there was more time to dwell on such treasures. It is a lifetime memory not to be missed.

A must see in St. Petersburg. If you can only visit one place in St. Petersburg, this is where you should go. Not only is the artwork amazing, the palaces that comprise the museum are works of art by themselves.

Excellent Palace and museum in the middle of St Petersburg. This is an amazing palace with excellent art collection,now known as the Hermitage museum .We spent half a day with an excellent guide who managed to take through important areas. The impressionist paintings are kept in another wing of the museum.If one has time it is a good idea to get a two day ticket and go back and see again to get a better perspective . (around $22)

Avoid high-season of summer. Hermitage was everything it was promised. The sheer size, the artistic way it was built and the art itself is just amazing. But try to avoid the summer high-season. It's just too crowded. We went in July and want to go back in an October or November trip. My 5-foot-tall wife could see nothing, due to the rooms packed with tourists. And we both missed actually seeing the work of the masters such as Rembrandt or Da Vinci, for which Hermitage is known. But still worth the visit.

Huge musuem - Lots to see. We are not big fans of museums but this one was very beautiful. Huge golden staircase leads up to the displays and did not feel crowded. Lots of must see paintings in this place but we enjoyed seeing the beautiful and ornate palace rooms.

How to skip the huge lines to get in:. Really nice museum with lots of different expositions BUT the organization is horrible! Each morning there were huge lines (1,5 - 2 hours to get inside). Some of those were just to pick up the internet ticket! Just ignore them and walk into the inner yard where you can buy your ticket in the automat machine! Not many people use them, its easy (cash or credit) - it took us about 15 minutes. Then you can skip those long lines and simply enter. Unfortunatelly, lines are not the only problem: there are not enough toilets, no fresh air, poor tiny cafeteria, closed rooms with no way to get through and the amount of people inside is tremendous.

Excellent cultural experience.. I spent a whole morning in the museum and still feel like I missed bits. I wandered around without a guided tour and still felt like I got a lot out of the experience. I would highly reccommend buying tickets before going as the queues were long, even at 10:30am when the museum first opens.

A Must for Art Historians and History Buffs!. Always a highlight for St. Petersburg and never a disappointment. It requires more time than most of us can afford in one trip, nevertheless even a quick overview of this historical building and its collection is worth the journey to Russia.
Don't miss this. You could spend days here. The famous artist works were everywhere. The palace is wonderfully sight to see.

buy a two day ticket online and skip the lines. It is beautiful! Skip the huge line and buy a two day ticket online. You can walk in and out the Hermitage during two days without waiting in line. Do not forget the satellite across the square, that is where the Monet, Picasso, Gaugin ect. are. That building is not as amazing, the paintings are better exposed, better light, no reflections in the paintings. Hardly any visitors, maybe because the directions are not very clear.

You could psend days here. If there's a single place that's the top of my St. Petersburg must-see list, this is it. You could spend days here, first to appreciate the Winter Palace, then to see the world-class collection of artwork.I was there with a tour group and we saw that we were able to bypass the snaking line of single-ticket holders and avoid the long wait. Do try to arrive in the morning 30 minutes before it opens because within an hour of opening you can't even see the end of the line.As with every heavily trafficked tourist location in St. Petersburg, keep your valuables in a money belt because pickpockets are afoot.

A place to visit repeatedly to take it all in. I was lucky enough to go at night time which was organised through my work. This meant it was far more quieter than normal, so I haven't been in the daytime when the crowds are at their highest.There is such a large number of art here it's impossible to take it all in so if you get chance you need to take mulitple trips here and I mean that in a positive way. A must for anyone with any appreciation or passion for art and history.
A visit to St Petersburg. Russia. Fantastic. A must see but could do with weeks to look everything. So many wonderful treasures to inside and the rooms are spectacular

So gorgeous - so many masterpieces and too many people.... The museum was absolutely excellent, no doubt to receive 5-star ratings, however, so many minus points there that's why my rating is 4-star. Too many people make congestion for photo taking everywhere....... easily get lost coz the number of room is not clearly shown (only very small plate). Staff are mostly non-English speaking, so communication problem happened. And the pictures of the impressionists were displayed in other building, which was described in Russian only - when I arrived the place where the impressionists' works were supposed to be hung, it was closed and no sufficient indication was given - finally gave up going. So sad - the authority must be aware that quite lots of visitors are non-Russians, floor plan and English website must be properly updated in other language. I stayed there within 3hrs. If I had knew the exact location of Monet/Renoir/Gogh/Cezanne/Gauguin.... it could have been 4hrs. Definately time-/energy-consuming place.. So gorgeous !!

Fabulous oriental,Byzantine and Islamic departments. Up on the third floor away from the hordes you will find some really exquisite pieces in the oriental and Islamist sections, really stunning budhas in particular.
