You will find something you will enjoy; ancient China, Rembrandt, the Golden BirdTip 1 Buy your tickets on the internet and pick up from internet kiosk (queue 3-5 people) and then bypass all other queues and walk straight in. Queues for ticket office can be very longTip 2 European 20th century paintings Monet, Matisse, Picasso, Gaugin, etc are displayed across the square (the one with a big column in the middle that took 2,400 men two years to hew the stone pillar for - fact courtesy of my wife) for which your ticket is valid. Great modern gallery setting in a traditional building - my favourite part.

Fabulous a must do while in St Petersburg. I agree there is little to add that has not been said. It is incredibly beautiful and has the most amazing collection of wonderful art and antiques of all ages and from many countries. My personal favourite was the room of filigree and highly decorated bouquet vessels. I agree with a previous reviewer, explanations were missing from many exhibits/pieces and not all were in English.We were lucky to have VIP tickets so didn't have to wait in the very, very long queue to purchase tickets. If you can get them via your hotel or a guide I would advise you do. The queue to get in is horrendous. If you can get a shuttle service to and from it is a good idea. Taxis are not easy to come by when you want to leave. Try not to take a large bag or items you need to leave in the locker room, it also has a queue and is a tedious exercise.Don't expect good food, it is very average.Regardless it is an amazing place to visit. Don't miss it.

Wonderful Museum. Our guide could only show us a few of the many items on display in The Hermitage due to a hectic schedule - one of my favourites being the peacock clock. I also enjoyed looking at the ceilings and floors, the latter having as many as 16 different woods creating the different patterns.

must visit, more than one time. this imperial size museum, composed of about 5 different palaces is unique, and maybe the largest worldwide. The collection of russian art, religious art and the palace decoration are remarkable. The new building, opposite to the winter palace is modern and complements the old part as well as the modern design. It inhabitates a wonderful collection of the impresionists. As Ada, our guide, told us - if you look at each exhiit for half a minute you will need 11 yeras to cover the current exhibition, nothing to say about numerous art pieces that are kept in the palace cellars.

The Worst At Its Best.. This museum gets a poor rating for its lack of layout and crowd control. It's truly a beautiful museum with incredible works of art. But there's little way to enjoy when you're fighting crowds, selfie sticks, and being pushed around by the masses. As an independent traveler who doesn't tour with groups to be told what to look at, when to walk, when to stop, when to eat... this, like most major sites in St. Petersburg becomes a challenge. Shame that one of the most stunning museums in the world gets lost to the crowd. Why I preferred the State Russian Museum over the Hermitage. It was less for tour groups coming of cruise ships, etc., Granted it's collection is not as vast nor is the interior as opulent but you have the museum experience. What I didn't like about St. Petersburg is the mass amounts of tour groups. Who take precedence over anyone else. You might be the first in line, but expect to be pushed out of the way by a Russian tour operator so the sheep can follow. They'll be pushing you out of the way as well. Apparently countries with a large population that can now travel freely and have the money to get off the mainland seem to not understand the etiquette of travel. We're all in it together and just because you're with a tour group doesn't mean you're any more special. One just couldn't relax in this museum. The line to get in was at least a quarter of a mile thick. It was the most crowded and fight for space museum I've ever been expereinced. Same reason I avoid the Louvre. It's a must see but an impossible to see. Witnessed people just walking by art work and talking photos. No thought for composition or if in focus.... just to have it taken. A bit of a nightmare. Another thing is that the museum is so large and so crowded you lose sense of the flow and what room to walk into. There's no markings with direction. You just get jumbled around with the others. Most of the art work is also poorly lit. Glare seems to be an issue and you can't get a clear look at a painting. But I don't think the Hermitage is concerned with the art. I get that they just want to pack in as many people as possible to make money. It's not about the art at this point. This is the same case with Catherine's Palace and the Peterhof. Mass tourism at its worst. My suggestion is to order tickets online which I did. Saved hours of waiting in a line. Can't imagine having done that to only walk into a bad dream. Remarkably some rooms were not crowded at all. The tour operators are on a time schedule and won't allow all to be seen. Only what "they" think you should see. Why I just never do tours. I might miss out on some but I get so much more by the element of surprise. Case in point, is the Hermitage annex across the Palace square. In an old building with a modern interior. This is where the modern art collections are kept. Here you'll find what a museum should be. With educated and well mannered people. It allows you to gaze and have a calm amazing experience. I only saw one tour group here but they were on their best behavior. Bless the Spanish. This is highly recommended to see. Especially after the pandemonium of the Hermitage. Depending how you travel, the Hermitage might be perfect for you. Many seem to be OK with crowds, being pushed, and being herded along. Not for me. No thank you. Been to many museums throughout the world and the best experiences were the one's where I could look at art, take it in, and have a moment with a piece. With the Hermitage I couldn't wait to leave. Unfortunate.

always worth to come back for a visit and again!. even if it is not the art one is interested in, the sheer exuberance of the buildings themselves is worth to go and stroll through the various halls and stair cases, rooms and exhibition areas! amazing architecture, grandeur and incredible richness of decor! and then, there is the art on top of this, too!!!

Must not miss this. Breath taking in sheer size and number of invaluable pieces. Very crowded with long queues so try to go early. There is strict security so do not bring large bags. Liquids are completely banned because of a terrible incident in the recent past when an insane man threw sulphuric acid on one of the paintings that caused irreparable damage. We enjoyed the commentary of a tour guide but for those who are doing a self tour, there is an app that can be downloaded by the free wifi in the Hermitage itself. There is also a QR code to download this. Amazing rooms done in different styles, one of the largest collections of Rembrandt paintings and a number from Da Vinci, Raphael and others. Give yourself at least 3-4 hours to enjoy this.

Great museum. I would imagine that I cannot add much to what is already written about this museum. It is huge and personally I prefer it to the louvre. The interior architectural detail is stunning. It is said that if you spent less than 1 minute looking at each item on display, for the 8 hours a day that the museum is open, it would take you 15 years to see all the works of art. I recommend getting there early and booking at the ticket machines. For some reason they are empty whilst the queue for exactly the same ticket is long to say the least. It's fantastic a expect to spend at least a day there

excelent. Don't lose hermitage museum. So beautiful and big. If you have a leader in it she/he can get more and more information toy you. Unfortunately there is not enough text and document in museum for reading.

If you love art.......... An amazing place to visit. Saw paintings that had not previously been out of the country - although some came to London at a later date. So much to see but had just a little time to see it in but worth the visit....the guide picked out some interesting subjects for viewing.

The biggest art experience. One of the hugest museums in Saint Petersburg is situated in the city center – next to Dvorcovyj bridge – on the Dvorcovaja square – one of the most famous places, which you can find on the cards from here. From obvious minuses – long queues and quite expensive tickets. But if you come early in the morning – you have more chances!!!

walking in history. Everything was beautifull and well kept, you smell history in every step you take.
The only note is that you don't get to see it all.

So much to see.. One of the most beautiful museum in the world. We spent 3 hours there while our guide said that the time to see everything is 8 months!!!! Well worth the time spend there. Amazing the fact that you are facing original paintings from great masters where in most musea you are presented with copies for security reasons. To be accompanied by a guide allows you to go directly to the treasures of the museum. The final impression, one needs to go back.Laurent

Russia's Louve. While on a Princess Baltic cruise we took a tour of the Hermitage and found it to be absolutely fantastic. The building structures are enough to make the visit worth while but add the magnificent works of art and it becomes tremendous. The Hermitage is not to be missed when in St. Petersburg. It is wise to use a tour guide to point out the highlights of the Hermitage unless you have the 8-10 hours to wander through on your own. With our guide we were able to get an excellent overall experience in about three hours.

every visit can only be a snap shot. what can you say, properly the best museum in the world, they say if you looked at every item for 30 seconds it would take seven years to see it all! A da Vinci here a Monet there and all in rooms so fantastic they rate a museum of there own. Be prepared to wait an hour to get in unless you can get on a pre arranged tour that gets in before its usual opening time

Hermitage Museum Winter Palace. This was an amazing experience , We just happened to be visiting the day after the "White Nights celebration / Graduation time " many crowds and I was a bit dissappointed at how many people were in this venue. It seems like it would be better for everyone if they took these art works and divided them up to serve 8 other buildings ... It was a shame we couldn't stay longer but we had to keep moving. As we were a group thats the rule Keep it moving.But it is a wonderful Treasure check to see what is the busy season and perhaps plan accordingly, we were with SPB and I am so glad we chose them. Very Knowledgable attentive tour guides, small groups are a must 12-14 in our group 2 days in St Petersburg is the minimum.BUT I wish I had more time, SPB took care of everything regarding VISAS. We are from USA and were a little nervous about Visas in Russia (Cruise ship sent a memo out saying you cannot tour Russia w/o visas but all went as planned SPB took care of 2 day visa w/ our tours and I had no surprises. Hermitage is an excellent tour just a bit crowded but unavoidable we had a wonderful time! Thanks Svetlana and Vika!

Worth seeing. This was brilliant, well worth the visit. Be sure to go early to avoid the crowds. There are so many treasures that should be shown for all the world to see, then when you have finished, it is nice to go out into the square and see some of the other buildings surrounding the Hermitage.
Hermitage. So much to see, so little time! Good to use a guide for the most important items--a stupendous collection!

Disappointing but not. We really like Impressionist art and that is what we wanted to see. Unfortunately, they have recently moved that part of the collection to a nearby off site location, hence our disappointment.It is beautiful, extravegant but beautiful. We thought we had planned our time adequately but hadn't. We planned .5 day here since we don't like crowds and aren't musuem freaks. Wish we would have had more time.

A wonder of the world. From the outside the buildings are gorgeous ------ and just as fascinating inside. One could spend an entire day here. The crowds are a bit daunting, but I understand as it is a Must See.

You either needs several visits/ years or be focused on what to see in less!. We were luckily with a tour guide who had early enterance before the public are allowed in but even so it was very busy with lots of similarly entitled tours. Use their website to try to plan your trip and be prepared for lots of walking between the Winter palace and Museum buildings - all inside but lengthy! The Jordan staircase is an impressive first entrance. Our guide was excellent - took us to all the principal rooms - Gold Room, Throne Room, 1812 portrait Room, tsar nicholas' study, malachite room and many more art and artefact rooms. The choice quite literally is endless. It is very well kept inside and every room is on an unbelieveable scale that makes Europe's palaces pale! If there was a rating of 10 stars this would get it in my book

Worth the line outside the museum.. Amazing!!! Everything is so hard to describe. Even if you can't make it for a tour or for a long time you should still go. I went with my group without a tour but I had Russian speakers on my group. I would recommend watching the movie Russian Ark before visiting it. This gave me a special appreciation for this place.The queue on a Sunday morning was about 40 minutes outside. Counting that we got there 20 minutes prior to opening. A bit disorganized outside with two lines for the same end.Tickets online can be significantly more expensive (almost double), in the official English website, specially if they are showing you USD. But go, even if you pay premium, just go.

Again Fabulous. This was my favourite as it was so large and everything was fantastically laid out the rooms were so big we even seen a couple on there wedding day getting photographed like the other places we seen everything was so opulent again it must be a place you must see
Very busy, but worth it. Very busy, but worth braving the crowds for the incredible interiors and wonderful works of art. The gold room and main Stair case in particular are awe inspiring

Group tour guide, a plus. Excellent, excellent, excellent! There is so much to see that it pays to have a guide to direct you to the main exhibits. If you are in a group, you certainly get it faster. Go early in the morning too and plan on spending at least a day.

Hermitage. Another msut see site in St. Petersburg. You can spend 2 hours or 2 days. Most interesting was all the paintings that were of "unknown province". A beautiful building on the outside. Can use some upkeep on the inside.

Amazing. There is not much I can say about this place that has not already been said. From the minute you walk up you will be amazing by the grandiose building. Inside is even more spectacular. An absolute MUST when visitng St. Petersburg

An amazing treasure trove. Absolutely jam packed with stunning artefacts. Book a tour and get in for the early opening admission at 8:30am or stand in the miles long queue for hours to get in at 10:30am.

The Hermitage & Winter Palace- have a guide and arrive early!. Although we arrived early, there was still a crowd of people. I was thankful that we had a guide that could point out our personal points of interest. The building itself is stunning. The treasures inside were displayed to show off their beauty to full advantage. My only regret was that I would have liked a bit more time to roam through the rooms.

Not enough time to see everything. We spent about 2 hours here as part of our private tour of St Petersburg, but not nearly enough. Everything was amazing, the rooms, the grandeur, the art, the history. It was an amazing experience.
Take Two Days. Take two different tours from two companies with differing approaches. You'll be amazed how much more there is to this incredible place.

Phantastic. The architecture is wonderful, unbelievable big, you don´t understand it. Inside lovely rooms, phantastic. Pictures, sculptures from everywhere.
Not nice had been the queue before entering the eremitage. We waited 1 hour and that was less. When we looked back we saw a very long queue, people waited 2 hours.

Must See. IF you go to St. Petersburg, you must visit this museum as it has very beautiful pieces.
We went on the free day but the line was so long, so go and pay to to avoid the long line in summer time.

Busy, Busy, Busy!!. We visited the Hermitage on a Sunday with SPB tours , when unfortunately there were more than five cruise ships in port. When we arrived at the Hermitage it was packed and we had to wait to go in. Once inside, the Hermitage is a beautiful museum with lots to see and lots of beautiful rooms. It was very busy, but we had an amazing guide who made sure we saw everything of significant interest . You would need more than a day to see it all, a huge building with many interesting and wonderful exhibits. A must visit place!
Great. Great places and great objects.These categorized masterpieces gather together to make a world history.that was amazing

Must see. If you can go early and beat at least some of the crowds, you cant miss this place. The building alone is a work of an art. In terms of collections, i highly recommend the impressionists, across the square. Matisses, Picassos, Renoirs by the dozens...

Buy tickets online!!!! Arrive early!!!. This is my favorite museum in the world, but if you are going during peak tourist season, I cannot stress enough how important it is to plan ahead. Ideally, you will buy your tickets online and arrive roughly 30-45 minutes before opening to exchange them for paper tickets and get in line. Make sure you get in the line for ticketed patrons. This will at least get you inside ahead of the giant tour groups. From there, it's on you to stay ahead of them. They travel in massive packs and huddle in front of the most famous paintings, making for a miserable experience if you are there to see the Da Vinci. The audio tour for the Winter Palace is recommended. The Hermitage has a mobile app that allows you to download an audio tour for $$. Just know that it is a) different from the audio tour you rent in the lobby, b) at the time we visited, it was full of errors. The tracks did not match up exhibits. Therefore, at this time, I recommend that you rent the audio tour inside. Again, just get there as early as possible in order to have the best experience.

THE HERMITAGE...a fantastic museum and a must see in SPb. The Hermitage is one of the most beautiful museums I've visited and I've travelled the world. It's got a wide range of classic masters work and the book shop is full of lovely prints to buy too, at reasonable prices. A MUST TO SEE IN ST. PETERSBURG.

Must visit museum. The world famous Hermitage museum definitely lives up to its reputation. Not only do they have a huge selection of great art but the building itself is great and fill of historical significant. I do recommend being a guide and paying to get in bypassing the usual line. The regular line is very long. We just focused on some of the most significant pieces and that took 3 hours. They moved all the modern art to a separate building that you have to buy a separate ticket. I liked the modern wrong a lot as it's much less crowded.
Not to be missed!. This museum lives up to its reputation, and like most of Russia, is completely unique. The crowds do pack in, which makes it hard at times.

A jewel in luxurious palace but insanely crowded. You need to book tickets In advance from Internet www.hermitagemuseum.orgBecause the queue is insane!!The voucher is exchanged inside. It saved is at least two hours.The collections are marvelous and the palace is luxurious. I was with my 10 year old soon and we stayed four hours wich is a short time but enough for him.

Gorgeous floors and ceilings. After trekking around so many cathedrals etc in Russia it is lovely to go into this building. It is full of art and relics but that is not what I like most. All the floors are parquet flooring and each room is different. They are beautifully preserved (so no heels allowed) and the ceilings also are gorgeous pastel colours. It is a huge place so allow half a day.

MUST!. This is a MUST while visiting St. Petersburg!Beware of the super immense lines to buy entrance tickets. I recommend buying them over the internet; however, it is very disorganized in the entrance, that no o e knew which line i was supposed to be in.

Use the app to personalize your visit. Visit the website to personalize, chart your visit based on art work you'd like to view first-hand. The site will direct you where, which building which is very helpful. Buy your tickets online so you can by-pass the huge lines outside. No water allowed, but there are cloak rooms for bags.It'd be helpful and more peaceful to chart your visit really early or mid-late afternoon to avoid the tour groups - or just go to different rooms other than the ones advertising prime exhibits. The guides tend to hit the same ones each round. I found the crowds to be pushy so I went on other floors.

Hermitage Gold Room Collection is Amazing. Not much of an art enthusiast, yet you cannot help but be amazed at the talent and quality of art from the masters at the Hermitage. Works of Leonardo De Vinci are here as well as artifacts from assorted cultures. The Gold Room is worth the price of admission. The tour is guided and secure. The artifacts are purely as ornate as you might imagine. It has been shared that some of the finest work from 700AD cannot be replicated with today's best jewelers, etc. How the details on a set of ear rings could possibly have been made to such an intricate way, without tools or lenses is just impossible to comprehend. The relics alone are astonishing. There is an additional diplomatic collection worthy of a peek. The Hermitage is a busy yet expansive museum. The gold room made it an amazing day. Tip-buy your tickets on line and get the voucher. It is an easy exchange without waiting in line and very well worth your time.

Exactly what you expect it to be. All the glamour of Europe in one place, its what you can imagine it to be. The rooms are spectacular, the decorated ceiling especially. The second floor is by far the best, the first floor is a little simple and disappointing.

Wow!. If you like to visit museums, write this one in your bucket list...its a must.....baroque style castle with two Da Vinci's and Raphael's to make it more attractive.....a great collection of bases.....
Great!. Everyone, who visits St. Petersburg, have to visit this museum. This is a former winter palace for Thar's family.

the best. the nicest museum I had seen in 80 countries so farlovely place you will love it all the building from outside looks normal, but inside it is a gem by itself please mark in the link below yes Was this review helpful? Yes to keep supporting this reviews

Beautiful Rooms and History. If you do not have several days to visit then I would recommend a guided tour. Go in the morning before it gets really busy with the large tours. We had a group of 4 people and explained to the tour guide what we were interested in seeing. Our tour guide Olga was great and showed us all the treasures and explained the history of the items and people. She explained how parts of the buildings were damaged during different time periods and how it was restored and who gave the different pieces of art that were on display. We were able to see what we wanted in about 3 hours and then had lunch in the Hermitage cafe. The cafe was very reasonable for lunch. They had sandwiches, salads, and ice cream. The also had veggie items available for lunch. It was worth the time to visit this site you will not be disappointed.

Awesome. We recently returned from a trip St. Petersburg and one of our stops was the Hermitage Museum. First things first, this place is huge. I mean an absolute monstrous building. Nothing the Russians did (or currently do for that matter) in that time period was done small. Be prepared to walk a lot and with a lot of other people. There are many many many works of art. I couldn't take enough pictures as we were on a guided and timed tour, and my camera is fast. I enjoyed the works of art but my only criticism is that the place is a little worn. I would expect such a place to be in better condition. Lights were missing or not working, works of art were not secure or in bad condition, and there was no climate control. The building is hot so dress accordingly. The place is phenomenal. Enjoy it.

Lots of time. This si a must in St Petersburg. Be prepared for a long line to enter. Best idea is to go with a guide who can get you straight in. To see everything you need to spend many days there probably years. Just walking in up the marble stair case takes your breath away. You are allowed to take photos but no flash. The art work collection alone takes hours to look at & admire.You have to see this place to believe it. You just stand in awe wondering what will be around the next corner.

breathtaking and comprehensive collection. In this elegantly, if overwhelmingly, assembled collection of art, i found myself warming to the da Vinci and the Rembrandt more than i have in the past. I also enjoyed the Reubens and Titians.

Obviously culturally wonderful but way too packed to really enjoy. We went with our 3 children and although the museum was well laid out and very impressive, not just in the famous artwork but the ceilings & walls paintings too.But it was so overly packed with cruise ship tourists we left after only seeing half the museum because the children were getting crushed by the crowds.
Fantastic! Very well restored. Winter Palace is on the river, a hydrofoil water taxi can take you to Peterhof Palace from the river side of the Winter Palace

There is never enough time!. This is one of the most impressive collections of artwork in the world. The winter palace is huge, not to mention all the annexes. You can literally spend a week in there. Not only is the artwork collection spectacular, but the building itself and the decoration are extraordinary. Two thumbs up!

Another must see. This is one of the best exibits of Art found anywhere. The museum is very large and expect huge crowds, but certainly worth the visit. a single visit will only allow you time to see a small portion of the exibits. It would be worth determining ahead of time the art you are interested in seeing and then plan your visit accordingly. Don't let the crowds get to you, just enjoy the collection. Q

Probably the Best Museum in the World..... The biggest museum in the world with over 3 million art pieces, its a massive 6 building display that holds some of the most valuable pieces of art in the entire World. For less than 20 USD, you have the chance of see just a glimpse of the magnitude of this museum (its almost impossible to see all of it with a couple of days).Yes, sometimes its quite crowded with lots of tours buses arriving but there is a lot to see so just be patience. If you want to avoid the queues, just get your ticket online or come here on the first Thursday of every month when the entrance its free...!!

Not enough time. We only got a taste of the Hermitage. It is so large, you have to pick and chose what to see. The collection is huge. Its hard to imagine the wealth needed to collect all those objects and paintings, as it started as the private collection of the Tsars. The Amber Room is amazing.

Jaw dropping beauty. The Hermitage is actually five buildings and it would take several days to do it justice. Our guide hit the highlights in 90 minutes and we saw quite a bit, covering four of the five buildings. The private theater inside the Hermitage was very interesting.No visit to St. Petersburg is complete without a visit to the Hermitage but your visit will be more meaningful with a guided tour.

Get a Two-Day Pass. People rave about the Hermitage, and rightly so! It was an utter treat and completely worth the 2-day pass. I can't imagine doing it in any less. This gave us a little time to enjoy a beer in the courtyard too, which felt particularly special.Whether you wish to marvel at medieval art or the golden peacock, be sure to walk through in as methodical a way as possible, or you will miss whole sections. We are really glad that we made it over to the Impressionist galleries across the square as well. Hardly anyone there and there were rooms and rooms of Van Goghs and Renoirs that we didn't even know existed! Yes, your feet get tired, so sit when you can and take in the grandeur of the gorgeous craftsmanship of the handlaid wooden mosaic floors, elaborate ceilings, and marble columns. Each room is unique and breath-taking.

Unbelievable wealth of amazing art. First ticket queue avoidance: I made two trips to the museum and had minimal queuing both times even in high season ( both afternoon visits). Buy your ticket online or from one of the automatic ticket machines on the left hand side once you are in the first courtyard. Choose your strategy: I did one trip that was more of a walk through the many galleries and the staterooms without much stopping and a second more selective visit. The Rough Guide has a whole chapter on the Hermitage and was very helpful, also make sure you pick up a floor plan as you go in. The Rembrandt and Da Vinci rooms are particularly packed but if you hang around for gaps between the tour groups you can get a good look. Personally I would not have liked to be part of a tour group (you can always eavesdrop on other people's tours). My highlights were the staterooms, and the Rembrandt gallery (rm 254) don't forget the impressionists are now across the square in the General staff building which is included in your Hermitage ticket and you MUST visit!

The highlight of any Russian Visit. On par with any European gallery or museum. Allow at least 2-3 days to tour all the exhibits. This incredible collection of master paintings and sculptures was expanded greatly by Catherine the Great who travelled Europe to bring many of the collection together. During the Siege of Leningrad(St Petersburg's name from 1917 until recently when the city reverted back to its historical title) all the art work was put into a train and sent to Siberia for safe keeping. It was returned after WWII when the Hermitage was rebuilt to its former splendor. Breathtaking to experience!

Wonderful collection. Apparently if you walk round this museum 24/7 and look at every exhibit for 30 seconds it will take you 3 years to see everything!! For this reason every tour guide takes their group to a small selection of artefacts spread about the hermitage. At the end of our tour we were told we had walked 3 miles but it was so interesting it didn't seem like that. It is always busy so an early start is recommended and best to go with a guide to make it worthwhile.

Excellent European museum. It's typically european museum. If visiting with children - you may be a little bit disappointed - it has no interactive attractions, like many American museums, and it is not as giantic as Metropolitan Museum in NY city, for instance. It's closer to the Louvre other European museums and there are a lot of rare and genuine items/ All they are very interesting but only if you are familiar with their history. So try to search the Internet about it's most famous exhibit items - and only after that get inside.

Brilliant - but book online in advance. This place really is astounding. Not only is there masses to see but the building itself is incredible. I really recommend booking in advance online through the Hermitage museum shop - it's quick and easy and all in English. Although you end up paying a little more, it saves hours of queuing time! The collections are really impressive and you should give yourself a good half a day to look round, especially as it can get quite busy - especially in the rooms that house works by the likes of Da Vinci and Rembrandt. It's also handy to bring a guide book which will give you more of an idea about what the rooms of the palace were used for - English translation at the Hermitage can sometimes be a bit hit and miss.

Amazing Riches. Prepare to spend a whole day there. Worth it. A few hints:- Beware of pickpockets. Seriously.- The lines can be long. Ordering online in advance will give you a separate booth to pick up tickets with no line- If you did not order online, don't stay in the line outside, go into the yard and buy the tix from one of the vending machines- There are actually two ticket offices open usually. The outside line is for one of them, the second line start in the yard and is much shorter- The first Monday of each month is free. The Winter Palace needs to be avoided as a plague, unless you must save $9 and are willing to stand in a two hour line (the trick with the second box office still works). However it is a perfect time to visit other free standing Hermitage properties: the XVIII century Menshikov's Palace and the Army Staff building across the squire, this is where all the Impressionists are among other things, and the space itself is amazingly well done.Have fun!

I saw my 1st Davinci. the wealth of art is astounding & overwhelming. In a perfect world you would take multiple visits to see all that this museum has to offer. I have never, seen so much gold. The art, beauty and wealth are almost beyond imagining. Not to be missed!

Amazing - wish we had allowed more time. So much as been previously written, it was an amazing experience, we didn't have enough time. Going back could be a reason to return to St Petersburg! Some tips to help: Their free maps are pretty crappy, get one from one of the vendors outside. Doing some research on the contents, and what might be interesting (or not) could be useful, there is a lot to see. Consider if you need two days to take it all in. Wear walking/comfy shoes. Pre-buy tickets to avoid terrible queues to get in.

Do it right. Don't go to hermitage without studying about it before. It's soaked in history and the museum has almost infinite works. So, study about its story, and decide which places you want to see, because it's impossible to see everything in one day. Best museum i've been.

can i give it a thousand stars?. Nothing i say will do this museum justice. we were only able to see a small fraction of it, and it was amazing. to stand in front of a Rembrandt was one of my favorite moments of my vacation. They've got old masters, modern masters, egyptian antiquities. Read up on this museum, it's a beautiful palace with an amazing collection.

Wow. If you go to St Petersburg you must visit this place. some of the best Art in the world, more Picasso's than any I would think. and the Clock near the main hall, is something else. plus great Architecture

Exceeded all expectations. I wish I had had a week alone to be at the Hermitage, because the place is beautifully set up with amazing artwork and it's HUGE! As part of a lengthy 2 day cruise excursion in St. Petersburg we were afforded 4 hours to see a tiny tiny portion of this incredible museum. It really does get absolutely packed, so be prepared to take your time (if you can) and savor every moment.

Amazing but crowded. The sheer scale of this museum cannot be appreciated until you visit it. It is huge. To attempt to gain the maximum benefit from the visit without a guide would be almost pointless - but this brings the problem of large groups following guides and virtually blocking the chance to see many exhibits.Timed visits would be one solution, but would reduce the number of visitors and probably push the price of admission up, and it must be in the interests of culture to keep the admission price within the reach of everyone.A difficult choice.However, an experience not to be missed. Highly recommended

Give yourself time. Seeing the art collection will take many hours, and you'll want to wander through the palace rooms too. (The opulence displayed helps explain why a revolution was needed.) The quality and variety of paintings and sculptures is fantastic. The Impressionists have been moved across the plaza to the General Staff building, which the tour crowds have not yet discovered, so it was calm and pleasant there compared to the hectic jostling in the Winter Palace. Very poor signage, no posted maps and staff that was exceedingly unhelpful.

You need good walking shoes and a lot of energy. It is of course a place not to miss but getting tickets as an individual , knowing where to get them is difficult. if you can not read Russian, you miss the explaination.

One of the greatest museums in the world. Located in vast, luxurious palaces on the Neva River bank, the Hermitage exhibits art and cultural artifacts from all corners of the globe. Worthwhile spending one to two days visiting the museum to be able to see a little of the millions of exhibits on show. To avoid long queues recommended to visit the Hermitage internet site and to buy a voucher online to be exchanged in the museum without waiting in a queue.

Amazing collection. This was a breathtaking day filled with a glimpse of an extraordinary world of Russia's past. amazing they kept the artworks considering the revolution and extermination of the royal line, they seem to have great pride in their history and it's just amazing. The staff that guide us during the visit were passionate about the collection and very knowledgable on the subject. A must seen for anyone visiting St Petersburg.
Great museum in great city!. Unforgettable. Need some days to look through all museum :) Really huge one with so amaizing history.
So much history!. This is another MUST SEE while in St. Petersburg. The art work and gold is beyond belief. You should make every effort to visit this site while in St. Petersburg.
Fantastic.. One of the most amazing places I have ever been. The scale and grandeur is as almost sickening. Definitely a top place to visit in any trip to St. Petersburg.
A fantastic museum. We were on a guided tour and were hurried through but as a visitor attraction this is a wonderful building with some superb exhibits and you could spend all day there
River Cruise through Russia. Excellent collection of Russia History Only problem was tours through the museum were very unorganized.

St Petersburg's gem. So much to see!! My main recommendation is go with a tour with a specified time as then you are guaranteed to get into the museum without a long wait. Even people we knew who had tickets, and were with tours, were asked to wait outside for an hour or more to get in. The Gold room is great with its collection of Faberge jewelry, and numerous other valuable collections. On the down side our guide to the gold room spoke no English, so we had to have everything translated, which made the tour cumbersome. The guards also objected if you wandered to far from your designated group. We arrived early so got to see some rooms in relative privacy, but after noon the place filled up and especially in the Da Vinci and Rembrandt Rooms were stuffed with people.Set your expectation that you will not see it all (that would take years) and enjoy what you do see.

Necessary visit in St. Petersburg. I spent about 4 hours inside and barely scratched the surface. Our tour guide said if we looked at everything for a minute each, it would take over 15 years to see all possible exhibits. Being able to see art displayed on massive palace walls was incredible. The room that has walls entirely full of portraits of military leaders really left an impression on me. The silver room of the Winter Palace was quite striking. There is so much detailing on the walls, the floors and the ceilings in almost every room; it was sometimes more beautiful than the art displays.I highly recommend getting a tour that will come before the museum is open to the public, especially if you're looking to see popular things like the Rembrandts. The crowds are massive, but there is air conditioning here and there. Having a knowledgeable tour guide just makes the experience richer, we got so many details about Russian history that were never taught in my schools. The peacock clock alone is worth a visit here.

They really ought to recruit some staff that have an interest in art. There are some terrific pieces the their collection, it's a good idea to find out what is going to be on display when you visit. The building is impressive, but looks like some maintenance concerns are waiting for funding.
Disappointing. The Impressionists have been moved, which is disappointing. The crowds are excessive. Nice art but difficult to get around.

Magnificent building! A beauty!. We visited as a group and everyone was even more impressed when we stepped inside. It was like a step back into a brief history of important era of Russian Royals' History. I took countless numbers of photos of the features, painting, and statues. We had to queue to get in and we waited for about 15 minutes outside before we could get in. Fortunately it was not too bad because the weather was lovely and there was a gentle sea breeze. It was lovely.Must see!

"Truly a highlight of a visit to Russia". I had always heard about "The Hermitage" as worthy of most people's Bucket List. This is how I would begin to describe it. Being from the United States, we have "The Hermitage", which is our seventh president Andrew Jackson's home and plantation in Nashville, Tennessee. It is a nice thing to see. I was never sure that I would make it to Russia to see "The Hermitage", but in fact, I did make it there, and can say if you do have the opportunity to go to Russia, you must go to see "The Hermitage". The art is the essence of this simply beautiful place, but what I did not expect to see and to fully enjoy was the architecture and the details of this magnificent structure. Every where you look, besides the art is the art and design of unbelievable quality and craftsmanship in this home for some of the world's most greatest pieces of work by gifted and talented artists. To be able to catch a glimpse, even for those short moments, and to be able to capture that for yourself, well, that is what travel is all about. Take the opportunity to enrich your life by a visit, and you will have your own memories to take home with you. It was all like a wonderful dream as I write this, but yes it was for real.

Art and History. When inside the Hermitage, it's easy to forget about the political strife that exists in "real" time. This museum is filled with amazing works of art, and the building itself is an historical wonder. I recommend allowing at least a full day to take in the experience ... you'll want time to wander the galleries as well exploring the history of the building and architecture.

An incredible museum . What makes this so special is that it was the original winter palace and was turned into a museum by Catherine the great. So not only are their works of art but also furniture and vases and a very neat peacock clock. The riches here are amazing. One needs more than one visit here.

Impressive collection. Hermitage was promoted by Soviets and now Russia as the best world collection of Arts.It is a huge palace with a large art collection, but extremely poor "navigation" system. Place is very crowded, go there with a lot of patience.Very poor graphics, very angry and useless babushkas in place of curators. Even if you're fluent in Russian, it's hard to navigate. Narrated tour in the Gold chamber, you can not go alone to see it, is very interesting.Well worth seeing the collection and the Palace.

Fabulous place, ridiculous crowds.. In some ways the Hermitage lived up to its reputation but the crowds were ridiculous. There were numerous cruise ships in port and all the groups shuffled through, trying to get a glimpse of the Leonardos etc. The building itself is wonderful but I'm afraid I did not really get a good feel for the art because of the congestion.Because of visa requirements, you have to take an organized tour unless you want the hassle of applying for a Russian visa.
One of worlds best. A delightful adventure awaits inside. Incredible artistic beauty in every direction. The collections are amazing. Few places, maybe none can compare. Don't miss this gem.
Must visit when in St Petersburg!. Must visit when in St Petersburg. Get there early to avoid the crowds and the audio tour is recommended.
Wonderful building. This building is beautiful you cant take it all in and I would love to go again.I took over 300 pictures

Vast. Well worth going. Look for the electronic ticket machines on your way in as this saves so much time. You can only buy full price tickets from these machines but you can use cash or card. There were two sets of queues. each has a lane to buy and a lane for prepaid tickets. Use the one on the left hand side as people don't realise it is there and we got straight in! We didn't bother with a guide but would recommend one as they're only 100rb and the signage in English is poor.

Spectacular Palace Museum. This is a spectacular site and hear about how crowded it is during peak season. So we went there before peak season to enjoy the art work. It was really spectacular as mention by some friends who have been there and thru article thaT i had read about this place. I would say it much nicer than Louvre. This is a must for any art lover. Best to visit in lean season to enjoy the art display.

Opulence on the grandest scale. This is a massive museum comprising several buildings and the crowds and queues can be wearying and frustrating. It is certainly worth visiting and the glitz and glamour will almost blow you away when you think of the costs involved. Far too much to see in a day so I would recommend doing this as part of a guided St Petersburg tour. It will save queueing and waiting to get in but won't necessarily save you from the crowds.
Favorite Place. I'm so glad we went with a tour other than the ship tour. Our group was small and our tour guide got us in without having to wait in the long line.

Could Spend Years here seeing it all!. Our tour guide gave us the highlights of this museum. Amazing collections rivaling any other museum in the world. Used SBP tours and we entered earlier than the general public throughout a side door. The lines were very long as viewed from the windows. Careful with your belongings due to pick pockets. Our group had no troubles. Used the pouch around my neck that was RDIF protected and kept it under my shirt. Enjoy!

Incredible. What more can you say? It's The Hermitage! I was blown away by the magnitude of this place. It would take a week to navigate. Also amazing is what all you find there. Examples of Russian history and architecture for one. Mounds of world history artifacts and ancient art for another. It's a treasure trove of anything that's ever existed throughout history. I would recommend coming as part of a tour so it can be explained to you. Tours also enter more easily and quickly and earlier. This place got CROWDED - like Vatican crowded - in a hurry. There are few exits, so plan carefully. Bo do be sure to go here. I wish I'd had a couple days to spend. I had a couple hours.

Be prepared and good walking shoes and patience!!. It's massive, be prepared, wear good shoes and be prepared for crowds and long queues. Get tickets from the Electronic Ticket machines out the front and get there early. It's rammed in June so just be mentally prepared as it's fantastic, but very tiring with lots of walking!!
Stupendous displays. This is well worth a visit with beautiful rooms each more spectacular than the last. The queues outside testified to its popularity, go with a guide who will get you in early.

So much to see.... The rooms/halls and exhibits are breathtaking but be prepared to queue.The pea-clock (A golden clock fashioned as a peacock) is awesome and just one of the many treasures to discover.

Guided tour. We booked a grand tour of St. Petersburg With alla tours. This is planned over 2 days and essential when visiting. The venues of interest are extremely busy with masses of tourists, but our guide got us to all the museums and palaces for a booked time slot which seems to control the crowds. The local guides are very proficient in getting small groups to the items of interest quickly and spotting gaps between groups to get us up close to allow photographs. I did find the hermitage crowded, and overwhelming with so much to take in even the architecture and decor was stunning. I am of the opinion that the crowds were part of the experience as I do feel that it is unlikely to be less crowded at any given time. It is simply not somewhere you can go for an individual wander on your own, there is not a lot of information on any of the items, so a local guide is essential.
Hermitage. Probably the best museum I have ever been in so dazzling wonderful treasures nothing to dislike again excellent guide and driver

Biggest museum ever visited by me. The rooms will blow you away as will the art and architecture. It is entirely too big to do in one day if you want to linger at any of the exhibits. I moseyed quickly, got lost several times and enjoyed myself greatly
Amazing!!!. It would take several days to actually properly see everything within here. We didn't plan properly and were disappointed that we weren't able to completely see it.
Too crowded to fully appreciate. We waited in line over an hour to get in the door. It was very unpleasant and spoiled the experience.
Tour of the Hermitage. Magnificent restoration when one considers the damage of WW 2. Lots of tourists there, so sometimes it's hard to get close to well known exhibits.

Great once you get in!. The procedures for getting into this place are terrible. There is a system, but it looks like a complete scrum with thousands all trying to get in at the same time. The "security" checks are both irritating and completely ineffective. Having said that, once you're finally inside, the place is absolutely brilliant - filled with the most spectacular of treasures - art, gold, costume, furniture, decoration, reflecting the opulence of the Romanov dynasty right up to the time when the Revolution tipped them all out. For groups, the guards/ curators are very aggressive about trying to get you to stick together & to move along, when you'd really like to take more time. The place gets absolutely packed with people, which spoiled the experience for us. There is just so much to see! Some colleagues of ours went earlier in the morning as part of a special "private viewing" tour, which sounded much better (but cost more!). You can also visit the museum's out-of-town storage facility (again on private viewing). In summary - totally amazing, not to be missed, but do be prepared for the place to be VERY busy.

A disappointment.. The palace and the museum were a disappointment to me, due to the crowds and how difficult it was to access some of the art, principally in the old part. However, I greatly enjoyed the new wing across the square, which was quiet and has some masterpieces of 20thc art. I might go back in a quieter month...

Very good. There are only a few toilets at the entrance, so you have to go back to the beginning every time you need one. The App is not really useful. The rooms are impressive and also the view of the river.

Amazing. We had a whole day tour in the Hermitage as I wanted especially to see as much of the art as possible. In reality even with the time allowed we were still only able to skim the surface of this fascinating palace. If there is anything in particular you wish to see you need to be precise as the building is rambling and disjointed so it is difficult to retrace your steps. There are star pieces of art but there are countless other paintings which were also wonderful and it was depressing to flash past wonderful paintings so that we could be shown the specials. Besides the paintings there are wonderful artefacts and the building itself is a star.

Also great for the non art lover. Even if you are nog the biggest art lover, it is well worth to visit the Hermitage. The building itself is stunning, both outside and inside. The ceilings, the floors, the rooms, just beautiful.It is possible to buy tickets in advance so you don't have to wait in line. Very convenient

One of the great museums of the world. Superb collection. Don't expect to see it all. Plan your visit. I went twice. First visit was a guided morning visit. The crowds were horrendous!! Had had thought I would stay on after the tour but couldn't stand the crowds any longer.Came back the next day, Wednesday at 6pm. The Hermitage is open till 9pm on a Wednesday. It was a different story altogether. Only took a few minutes to buy a ticket. The crowds had disappeared & I spent the next few hours viewing masterpiece after masterpiece. Often I was the only one in front. The previous day I could barely see Rembrandt's Prodigal Son because of the crowds. I had it to myself for a few minutes on Wednesday night. The absolute highlight of the visit was seeing the Peacock Clock in operation. It is wound once a week at 7pm on a Wednesday night. Again there was only a small group there. Don't miss the the Impressionist Collection in the building opposite the main museum. Superb collection. My tip would be to go to the Impressionist museum in the morning. Buy a ticket ticket that covers both museums. Que to buy tickets is much smaller there. See the Impressionist exhibition. Have a lunch break then go over to the main gallery later in the afternoon. Make it a Wednesday if possible.
Fabulous. What a fabulous place!! Except for the poorly managed entry, the rest of the experience was simply superb. Everything about it is grand.

Another beautiful palace. If you go here, don't just look at the paintings and sculptures, make sure you look up at the ceiling, down at the floors and all of the beautiful carved wooden doors. This place is wonderful. Don't miss it while you are in Russia.
DON'T MISS THIS GEM!. Have traveled everywhere in Europe and this was the finest museum we have ever visited. Rivals the Louvre and Chicago Art Institute.

Most Historic Site in All of Russia. Besides being the seat of the Romanov's power in St. Petersburg and housing one of the greatest art collections in the world, the Winter Palace is where the Bolsheviks drove out the corrupt and ineffective provisional of government led by Alexander Kerensky and brought the true revolutionary change desired by the Russian people. So, whether you're a backward looking monarchist, forward looking Marxist, or just an art and history lover, the State Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace has something to interest you.

Hermitage Museum. When I was begun to visit there first of all I said ' Wooooww ' !!! Because It has so extensive works of art in it. Everyone has to be here and see them. Thee are hundreds and hundreds of magnificient works of art. It was so good . And I think here is the 2nd place of including the different works of art in the world.
Must see. Really one of the worlds best collection and museum. Can buy ticket at the entrance from machines, cost 600 RUB, line goes fast, we've been waiting only 15 minutes.

One of the best museums in the world. One of the best museums in the worldThe Palace is absolutely fabulous, the architecture and the luxury of the interior are worthy of any KingThe wing of the Impressionists is truly fantastic, but the real treasure of this museum is undoubtedly the building itself. There are no words to describe it.No doubt a place not to be missed when visiting St Petersburg

Far Exceeded My Expectations. Do yourself a huge favor- hire a private guide and go early or late in the day during high season. Or wait until winter , who knows it may be less crowded. Do some homework before your first trip and learn about Catherine, Alexander, and Nicholas. If possible attend lectures on pre revolution Russia to make your visit more meaningful. Have a plan to see your own highlights and don't feel bad when you " only" cover a few of the thousand plus rooms. I enjoyed every bit of my time there and it truly helped that our guide knew her way around the gathering crowds. I felt rather smug when we were leaving the Hermitage around 12:30 pm as the mass of humanity kept growing and growing. Don't talk to the street vendors as everything you could want is for sale at multiple sites within the museum. Have fun, don't be a statistic and wear a money belt or be sure to keep your valuables well secured. Pick pockets are active even though the staff will tell you otherwise. We spoke with a lady that had been picked as she had neglected to zip her purse for a moment. The thieves are good at taking from " easy prey", you can avoid the hassle of police reports, etc. leave your backpacks or check them as they are not allowed. No flash photography ever. I chose to take my small compact camera and was glad I did as my large digital with zoom lenses would have been cumbersome with the crowds.

If only we could have seen it all. We visited in July and there is no A/C in the building...like many in the area. That was the only downside. From Rembrandt to Monet and Egyptian artifacts this place is full of amazement. My husband knocked the velvet rope down guarding the Rembrandt and he was yelled at in Russian (I assume she was saying put the rope back...but I can't be certain) a wonderful memory to laugh at now :)

Impressive but toooo crowded. Don't let anyone tell you that there are fast lanes to get in, they are totally wrong!We went on a Sunday May 31st and when we arrived with our group at 9:45, the entire area was jam-packed. I was impressed with architecture and the art but with the huge crowds it was very disappointing. Our tour was 2 hours and sadly we really didn't see anything. You really need to spend a couple of days.

The top of the list for St. Petersburg. You can not prepare yourself for the beauty of this palace museum, not just the thousands of artifacts in it's collection, but the architecture of the building. Everywhere you look, you see something carved or painted elaborately. Yes it is crowded, but we saw as much as time allowed. It is someplace that has been on my bucket list for a long time, and now checked off. it is not so much the contents as it was the building its self for me. Enjoy!
Amazing place but sardines packed. An amazing and must see place, but it was just too crowded for us. Line up everywhere and packed with people everywhere.

Incredible place. If you have to a palace that's so intact and well preserved then it is the Hermitage. every room is a masterpiece on its own. And then of course the objects inside. It has two of the oil paintings of Leornado Da Vinci. And then of course each room has its own them. The porcelain room is something you could never imagine and then the 17 tonne vase that was placed before the room was built around it.You will need at least two days just to browse the whole thing

You have to go!. The entrance queues are long, but if you're smart you can bypass them....use the ticket machines out front, if not on a tour.Entrance is a little chaotic but once inside... the place just astounds! Many of the rooms are sooooo lavish you have to see to believe. There are a number of rooms that, although ornate don't hold your attention ( well mine anyway) so much, and there are many more rooms filled with pieces of art ... that are fabulous. The art is sectioned into rooms of Dutch, French, Russian, etc, etc and are well laid out.The room layout is a bit confusing but each room is numbered so you get to understand the guide map soon enough.All in all well worth the visit... and I want to go again... it'll take a full day to get around everything (which I didn't have last time).

One of worlds top museum. You Could spend days in this Building and not see everything a lot of the tours are fast tracked to see the main exhibits but it is well worth spending a full day here as some of the Romanov exhibits are exquisite.
NO A/C. Quite surprising that there is no air conditioning int he Hermitage. My husband thinks the real paintings are somewhere else! LOL
One of the finest art collections in the world. One of the finest art collections in the world located in a splendid palace. A must see for anyone interested in art or visiting St. Petersburg.

One of the top Three Museums in the world - yet you need time and pation for it. Well this place as Louvre and British Mus. is a greatest Humankind Museums so if you like those kind of things and you have enough time (for a short visit just to look a day and for a serious one you need at least three days) this is a place to visit. There are some tips - in case you have you guided tour it may save you plenty of time, yet you will not see things otside of major tourist trucks which are not a good way to see Ermitaz! So get in with the group and be on your own inside.This is a great place if you like Art, History and would like to see the City from the other perspective - the way Tsars did so in 19th. Great place!

Gigantic and amazing!. I double whether one will ever have enough time to really appreciate this huge museum. From the apartments in the Winter Palace to all the galleries, housing paintings and so much more. It is really something that everyone should see during their life time!

stunning. first of all we suggest to buy the ticket on line (on the russian website cos the english version costs much more9 if u cant manage, do as we did yesterday: buy it at the machines near the entrance on the right, you'll avoid a huuuge queue. what can we say about the inside? it's stunning, fantastic, whatever speechless words is well used...you definitely have to visit it
Worth seeing. This palace is unlike anything you have ever seen. It has so much history, it's hard to take it all in. I would definitely recommend this to anyone.

Incredible building. Catherine the Great wanted for Russia to be accepted by the European royalty as a cultured nation, so she started buying art collections. She and her successors succeeded in assembling an incredible collection of art. When it was housed in her palace, that was icing on the cake because the palace is an masterpiece of art in itself.The Hermitage's art collection is formidable, and extensive. I don't know if I found it to be on par with the Lorvre or National Gallery of Art because it seemed to be so eclectic and didn't seem to hold together. Certainly, there were many wonderful pieces, but there were also many just so-so pieces as well. But, when taken together with the palace in which they are located, then the museum as a whole takes on an entirely new persona. With the building included, this is one of the world's greats.This museum is a must see.

Second only to the Louvre.. Amazing art treasures. Second only to the Louvre. Super duper crowded. Holland America Cruise Lines offers exclusive tours after hours. Unfortunately, they are too short and you are expected to stay with your guide for security reasons. We took one such tour and were whirled through a 90-minute visit (although advertised as three hours) and saw a fraction of the works. However, it seems that we are at least able to avoid the crowds and actually saw some of the highlights, albeit briefly, which was not the case with day time visitors. Such a shame!
Magnificent. One of the wolrd's most reknown museums and with a reason. Can't be missed. It's full of glorious masterpieces of different eras and styles. Jump the queue and book online

A Visit of Opulance. We were on a cruise and St Peterbugh was on the list. A coach trip took us to the museum and we were guided around the common route. It should be noted that immigration procedures apply for travel in Russia. In other words you cannot walk around on your own unless you have a visa before you leave UK. However, the museum is a well worth a visit but you need a few days to walk around the opulence and take it all in. A lift is available as stairs are in abundance but not much good if you are in a wheelchair. The coach also takes you to a souvenir shop of their choice. I would recommend a visit to the museum and if time allows to the Faberge museum. Dollars or Euros are accept but at their rate of exchange, also we were warned to be aware of pickpockets.

Keeps getting better. seems like the organizers are better prepared for the large groups, of course the art collection (Degas, Rosseau, DaVinci, Rembrandt, Van Gogh, Matisse, Pissarro, name it) and seen the way of life of the Tzar is impressive

Very crowded in June. Don't go during White Nights! SOOOO crowded. Waited in line starting one hour before opening and stayed in line for 2 hours. Then, crowds, crowds, crowds, inching along, trying to see everything.Didn't like that a huge block of displays have been removed for a tour gig.

Must see on your visit to Moscow. When visiting Moscow these two are the "must see" museums. The guided tour takes you around all the areas so you can see the main items BUT it's not enough time. To see everything you would need to go back again and again. Words can not put into place the treasures inside these museums.

A must see.. Not even sure why I review this. It is what everyone says it is...the must see place of the St. Petersburg and one of the top spots to see in the world. 3 hours isn't enough. Although, 3 days probably wouldn't do it either.
Spectacular!. One of the truly great collections of the world. And now the Impressionists are in a separate building, reducing the crowding and making it easier to truly study the masterpieces.

Would be much better if not so crowded.. We visited on Sunday 21st June with SPB Tours. Although we had an excellent tour guide the visit was somewhat marred by the almost overwhelming number of people allowed in to this place at one time. We believe the number were swelled by the fact that the Hermitage is closed on Mondays so more people tend to go on the day before (Sunday). This is an amazing place which would take at least 2 days to do it justice so the few hours that we spent there were inevitably somewhat rushed. Nevertheless it gave us a taste of what this fabulous museum has to offer and we would love to return at a quieter time.

Impressive Collection. The Hermitage boasts an impressive collective of art that can be appreciated by most. We went with a tour group, and although we spent a few hours, it felt as though we barely saw a fraction of the art. I don't have much art history knowledge, but I still was able to appreciate the collection. The exterior of the building is impressive also. I would recommend visiting while in St Petersburg!

So big, You can get lost !!. The Hermitage is the 2nd largest museum in the world after the louvre in France. It is located in the palace square within the winter palace. The museum has a distinctive light green and yellow (that used to be gold) facade. You can have a free ticket if you are a student (with a students card). The Hermitage has different types of art, from Russian, French, German to Egyptian, Arabic and Asian artefacts. I don't even know how Russia could manage to get all these artefacts from different countries. The Hermitage is a must visit. I thought it would take 3 hours to visit the whole museum. it took me 5 hours and I didn't finish it.

Amazing, endless, breathtaking. We only had a few hours and didn't even scratch the surface. Whole galleries dedicated to individual old masters. We ended up walking and taking it in without a plan, because there are no weak spots, no let downs and no dissappointments.Huge corridors of display rooms, themed rooms from the Palace. The clocks, the clocks, and all working.Dont' miss this, don't skimp on time, but if you are limited on time, go anyway. Please

An amazing experience. I visited the Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace in June 2015, as is was included in a tour package, and was hesitant at first to go to yet another museum - but what a pleasant experience. I assume it was linked to the rich knowledge of the tour guide, but all in all it was a wonderful experience. The art section was the higlight for me - especially the dutch artists. If you go in a group, ask that the group go early (very early - just as the place opens) - because then you will be able to move around without so many additional tourists. If you go on your own, be there when they open for individuals. I suggest that you study the floor plan and exhibition sections before the time and decide what is your interest. It is too much to take in all of it! If you are an art lover - you will enjoy this special place!

Great palace to visit. Certainly one of the best museums and palaces in the world.Unfortunately they have not organized the entrance system good enough. People do have to suffer to get in for no reason. Worth to see.

super big museum. if you are so in to art and beautiful buildings, you can spend days in this museum. this Palace is so big with lot of art stuff in it. you have to spend at least 2-3 days to see all of it.

Come for the art, stay for the architecture!. No other museum in the world that houses a roomful of Rembrandts (no really!) could be accused of upstaging the art it contains. The Hermitage has world-class art, yes, but for me the main attraction is wandering around, turning a corner and entering a hall covered in gold or climbing a staircase literally made for royal feet. The interior decoration is simply stunning. The crowds can detract from the experience so try to come off peak. The tour groups can be 60-80 string and completely overwhelm your viewing experience. Also, though this is no knock on the museum, selfies have ruined my enjoyment of the art since no one appreciates the art but simply seeks to document the fact that they were someplace famous

One of the world's outstanding museums. We were lucky enough to get on an evening tour via Holland America. One visit or ten will never be enough to do this amazing place justice, as the palace itself is almost as breathtaking as the collection. Our group was the only one on site that might and this made a huge difference as we were better able to take in the art without crowds and this allowed us to appreciate the magnificent building and surroundings. In my experience it is rare to be permitted to get so close to masterpieces and to be allowed take photos.I could spend months in the Hermitage and never get bored - especially since they have expanded into Ministry of Defense buildings on the other side of the square to show more of their collection. Our guide was superb and this excursion was worth every penny.
Too much art to see in one day!. The Hermitage is a treasure that you could spend days, weeks, years exploring. The art is outstanding!
Hermitage. We had an extraordinary 20 year old guide provided by Russart Travel in San Francisco. Our visit included the Swan Lake Ballet in the magnificent Hermitage Theatre.

exquisit art collection from the best of western cultur !. Hermitage is very impressive and charming ! hosting one of the world best collection of western painting and the winter palace athmosphere impresses by letting visitors dreaming of russian great past splendours of the tsars of mother Russia ! very different from present rule ! the place is a must visit frequently to discover ancient Russia charme ! amazing painting collection !

Not to be missed.. The Hermitage cannot really be adequately described by me. It is phenomenal. We read about it and its collections, and saw The Russian Ark film before going, but it was more spectacular than I can describe.
History. We had a great visit here and saw many interesting things. It is such a huge place and full of information.
a must. Just amazingly huge. Probably the best museum in the world with Le Louvre. The rooms look similar after some time but are all so different. Huge pieces of collection.

A must see for everybody in St.Petersburg. I visited the Hermitage on the first Thursday of June, which usually would be a VERY bad idea as the first Thursday of each month is free to visitors, meaning it can be extremely busy! Luckily I came with a tour group, so we were granted early access into the museum. By the time our group left, the museum had been open to public for about 1/2 hour and it was already very busy. Despite not being knowledgable about art, I really enjoyed making my way through the museum and looking at the wide range of artworks on display. What I was even more intrigued by was the grandeur of the palace/museum. Every time my tour group entered a new room, a collection of "ooh"s and "ahh"s ensued. This is a must see for everybody who visits St. Petersburg! Some tips: It can become very hot and stuffy inside, so make sure you wear layers. They do not allow bottled water/drinks into the museum. Photography is allowed without flash. Someone in our group was pick pocketed in the Hermitage, despite only being inside during public hours for 1/2 hour. Don't leave anything in pockets, even the front pocket.

Must see for any true Art Lover!. Just got back from visiting St Petersburg and the Hermitage, cannot begin to say what a experience it it. We took two 8 hour days and still only covered the first two floors. Did not have the chance to see the third floor or the theater. I can say, I was really blown away by the beautiful art we did see. The interiors were just incredible.

One of the World's Greatest Museums. The Hermitage lived up to its reviews. I had only half a day and must return to St. Petersburg to see all its treasures. Of course, I am not alone in my views and the crowds make passage slow. My tour guide recommended late September - early October as the time when the crowds are smallest.

One of the Top Art Museums in the World. Fabulous building with fabulous art. Beautiful collections of European art, with some of the most important Rembrandts, Grecos, Cannaletos, and even a Leonardo da Vinci! The imperial rooms and artifacts are very impressive. It takes a whole day to visit. Only gripe: most signage is in Russian.

Beautiful plce amacing history ----- current situation makes it less appealing. We toured the Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace and it was sooo beautiful. They inside and outside was something you only see once. There is a lot of walking and no or very little sitting space so as I use a cane I can say it was a little difficult to do the whole tour but I did it. I would also say I did this tour before there was the situation or that I was aware of the situation where the gays in Russia and particularly St. Petersburg were being persecuted and in somecases physical abused and hurt. I am no gay but I do not think anyone should be treated that way for any reason. I am not sure I would visit Russia again under the situations now .

Bustling with Huge Crowds. This is the 'Must See' Museum. I must say however that it was a bit too crowded for me so I knocked off a star. It is recommended you buy your ticket in advance, but I was unsure as to what day I wanted to go so I stood in line for almost two hours. After the two hours I was already knocked out so I grabbed a lunch at Café Max inside and a coffee (which was the BEST coffee ever) and got my wits about me. As you know, I purchase all 'Audio Tours' and I did for this as well. At first I downloaded the Hermitage Ap Tour and then realized my phone battery would be dead before the ap tour ended so I waited in line to get the Museum's Audio Tour. That fiasco was tiring too. Instead of getting mad I decided I would listen to the phone ap tour when I got home (I have yet to do that).It is an amazing museum until you have to use the toilet. Then good luck finding one. Its the crowds that make it so impossible. I was there at opening and it was still a mess. I felt like I was at an amusement park and not a museum.So I have ranted about things you may think are nonsense, but I want you to consider all of this so you can better prepare. That's what reviews are for, right?The actual museum and its offerings are amazing. Yes, despite what I have written you really have to figure out how to enjoy it because it is a must in your list of 'Things to Do'.

Magnificent Collection of Beautifully Preserved Artifacts. We were stunned by the phenomenal collection on display at the Hermitage - some of the greatest masters works are here and one afternoon could never be enough to see it all. If you are a museum and art lover, allow yourself a full day to enjoy this impressive collection.
Hermitage. WOW, awesome, some of the best portraits and scenery paintings here. Plan to spend the whole day. Rest, Check out the czar carriages.

It is a treasury of arts, and one day won't even cover half of it. The whole tzars palace dedicated solely for collecting pieces of art - that should tell you a lot. The collection of this museum can easily take on Louvre or the British Museum. Not to mention, that since it was originally a palace (and several other estates of great Russian nobles), you can not only enjoy the art collection, but take a tour back into the history and walk the halls just as russian emperors once did. Totally worth a visit! Tip: since it is such a titan of a tourist attraction, it is crowded AT ALL TIMES. Another tip: the museum is close to several other major attractions (as in: the biggest Cathedral in St Petersburg and Kunstkamera- the very first museum in Russia / not for the faint of heart).

Ridiculously huge. Before going there I knew it’s bug but this place is just ridiculously huge. The Egyptian and Roman expositions got my attention. I’m not so much into paintings but anyone will enjoy full size paints of famous artists and a lot of weapons for small and big kids. Buy a ticket in advance and leave the heavy clothes on the entrance.

Ugh - Rowdy Crowds, Tired Docents, Poor Lighting. Been here four times and while the collection and the history are truly remarkable -- the Hermitage needs TLC. And crowd control. Signage is falling down or missing, the building clearly shows its age. Big tour groups (with selfie sticks) fight and shove for viewing space. The entrance prices are not cheap but the upkeep does not reveal investment. The docents were struggling to keep tour groups from touching Rembrandts and unable to keep up with the sheer bulk of humanity. An amazing, must-see for many -- go if you must-- but suggest late Wednesday when the crowds are smaller.
As you would expect. yes it is amazing and a must see, but you need a lot of time to see it properly. I was really lucky when I went there, nobody was in front of me to buy the tickets

Well, it's not the Louvre...but impressive nevertheless.. The collections are grand; you truly get a sense of the wealth the imperial power had. The only thing that was bothersome was the loads of cruise ship tourists, packing every room; made it difficult to move from room to room, especially when only one of the double-doors to various chambers are open.

Wear a pair of Comfortable shoes. Go there early in the morning, and prepare to spend the whole day there. Also, the impressionists , modernists paintings were move to a new building across the square, and it requires a separate ticket.
