Plan more visits than just one. Sure the main building Winter Palace was an experience, we had our plan before visit otherwise you can get lost. I like the state room's interiors, furniture (library!), flamish paintings. I would also recommend also the new part of Hermitage where in the old building the new part has been settled - more space and light, Xenya Nikolskaya exhbition "Cairo's forgotten architecture", French impressionists. Surprisingly bad was catering. Just fast food and only cash payments.
Greatest Museum. We have been to art museums all over the world. This is the Best. Every room is awe inspiring. Words cannot express the beauty here.

Wear good shoes. The sculptures were my favorites and the Dutch paintings. There is actually a painting with a dog pooping! So earthy. If my hotel hadn't been to miserable, I would surely see this museum again.

Amazing. To make it short = Amazing!!It is unbelievable how beautiful the museum is and with all the different art it is breathtaking! I have never seen anything close to this.Good to know is that it is better to buy tickets in the ticket kiosks outside the Hermitage instead of buying them online. We bought them online, had to que to get in snd once in had to que at two diffrrent desks before we got the tickets.Also good to know is that you are not allowed to bring your coat inside, but there are free guarded cloak rooms.We went through at a pretty rapid pace and then you can manage it using half a day but it is really a lot to take in.Recommend to be there 20 min before opening hours to be in front of the que...

St Petersburg is the best!. St Petersburg is a great place - safe - with numerous things to see and do. The Hermitage and Winter Palace were first on the list and the place does not disappoint. And if you go early, you beat the queues. Plenty of photo opportunities so don't forget the camera. Just an amazing place.
Tkae enough time to visit this place. One day is not enough to see all the marvellous paintings and rooms at this Museum. There is so much to see. Absolutely worth visiting.

Hermitage. You really need a guide to get you through the crowds & to lead you to the best parts. There are FIVE buildings of 3-4 stories so it's a MUST to have a good guide like DenRus to get you through the best parts in a day!
Hermitage Museum and St. Petersburg. Have visited here 2 times, and there is always fascinating and wonderful things to see. St. Petersburg is a wonderful city.

A place for art lovers. After 1 hour queue, we finally made it inside. It was huge with 4 different areas to visit. We have only 6 hrs in Saint Petersburg in total, so we were able to spent only 2 hrs there. It was a great collection of art from Germany, Netherland, acient Roman and even Asia...I'll surely be back and experience it again one day. Entrance fee is free for students. Minus points: museum workers there don't speak much English, and I'd say they aren't that friendly as well.

Breathtaking - One of the World's Best. Make it a priority! The art is wonderful, of course, and the experience is heightened by the unparalleled grandeur of the building. I think I enjoyed wandering around, especially by the grand staircase, even more than seeing the exhibits. The atmosphere takes your breath away.Take advantage of special exhibits and the restricted rooms - an extra fee - if available. You won't be disappointed.One of the most orderly museums on the continent, once you get out of the entry hall. On the downside, security is very tight. There is an x-ray baggage check, and some prohibition on photos and even taking notes in restricted rooms. Some other English speaking folks got into an argument with a guard - and didn't win. The cafe food (only food available) is ordinary.Only a very, very small percentage of artifacts and art is actually displayed in the museum; most of it is stored away behind hidden doors. In that respect, this is a typical Russian machine that controls everything, including access.{ September 2012 visit - one of the highlights of my life! }

Wow. An amazing afternoon in the hermitage. The entire building and collection has a 'wow' factor. Having been to some museums and the armoury in Moscow we were not focusing on the artwork as much. It was the palace itself that stole the show for us. The queue for entry can be confusing, I'm fairly sure we skipped it accidentally. To save time buy your tickets at the ticket machines by the first gate. Be prepared for a lot of walking. It would be very useful to buy the audio guide or get a guided tour when inside. We used the audio guide and found it useful. As in most museums you have to check your coats and backpacks. Also no bottles of juice allowed through security. Enjoy!

lots to see. This place is amazing and there is so much to see, be prepared to walk for most of the day in here as it is so big. This place is a must see if you visit this fantastic city.We went on the first Thursday of the month when it was free entry ,we had a long queue to negotiate but it was well worth the wait.I would say that this place is around ten times the size of any museum that i have been to before.

A must visit in St Petersburg. The museum is vast and you need to spend a half day at least to really appreciate all there is to offer. You get a real taste of the Tsar's wealth and lifestyle. No wonder there was a revolution! There was a new exhibition area which has just opened but is not yet finished. It includes My favourite art i.e. Impressionist painting. It is directly nopposite the Palace and is wellworth visiting.

Like nothing I have ever seen before. I went to this palace two days ago with my friends, we loved it so much. I never would've imagined such a beautiful palace and wanted one very badly myself. It is the biggest museum in Russia with 3 million artifacts in it, and if you watch each artifact for one minute it will take you 11 years to go through each and everyone of it. The museum is very interesting in it's collection and historic artifacts that we either made for or gifted to Russian Royal Families.
Art Overload. Great Art and a lot of it. Beware of pickpockets during their busy times. I would suggest keeping your valuable at hotel safe and only bring the necessities.

A grand collection of Decorative Stone Artifacts, Paintings and Sculptures. They say it would take about 8 years to explore the whole place if you only spend 2 seconds per artifact!!The Jasper stone vases and artifacts are mesmerizing with its beautiful colors and textures, the Rembrandts, Da Vinci etc tell a story of the evolution of the paintings influenced by the Church, religion, political situation and the artist's genius!Highly recommend having a knowledgable guide to enjoy the place or you would end up with disappointment and a complete lack of appreciation for the place...

The best Museum in the World (shortly after Louvre). The Louvre may have a more impressive collection of paintings, but it is not even close to the beauty of buildings and interior in the Hermitage. The Hermitage also has a better, more balanced collection. Like the Louvre, do not think you can see half of this museum in less than 3 hours. Just when you think you have seen the most splendid halls and rooms, there will be more and more. I was here 21 years ago, much has chhanged for the better since then. The division of arts into countries and periods is also well done.
Too many things too little time. Beautiful place and hundreds of rooms to visit! There is everything - from paintings to letters to sculptures and clothing! Must visit!

Always perfect. Hermitage is the place to visit. In the summer month is it really overcouded, try doing there in Wnter of Autumn. And do buy a ticket via internet before you go, it might save you up to 2 hours of waiting
great, of course. It is one of the highlights of a visit to Saint Petersburg. It is obviously worth spending at least 2 hours there because there is a lot to see.
Beautiful. Go to the Hermitage and expect a lot. You will see even more, bacause after the Hermitage you saw it all

One if the best art collections in the world. Beautiful ceilings, floors and art by DaVinci, Van Gogh, Monet, Rembrandt, Picasso and many , many more. It's less crowded on the 2nd floor but here there's even more masterpieces. If you like art, this is a must see

One of the best museums in the world. Hermitage Museum does not require a review - it is one of the largest collections of true masterpieces in the world. If you visited St.Petersburg and did not enter this museum, you have not seen this city. I suggest joining a small tour group of 12-16 people with exclusive access to the doors, otherwise you can waste a lot of precious time standing in line. The museum is always crowded since it is the number one landmark of the city.

Beautiful!. Be sure to have at least a full day to spend here! Wonderful collections!Have in mind if you are with a toddler or a teenager there are not many places for rest except the cafes on the first floor.

Amazing museum!. There is enough to see for weeks in here. It has amazing displays of artwork and antiquities. It was by far the busiest place we visited, and you are only supposed to stay for a couple hours, so you don't really get a chance to appreciate the amazing views.

Magnificent!. The Hermitage/Winter Palace is a must see when visiting St Petersburg. It is impressive from the outside, but the interior is overwhelmingly beautiful. Be warned that there are long line ups to get in, unless you are with a guide. And once inside, there are crowds. But it is well worth all the inconvenience It's quite amazing to see how the royalty of the time lived in such opulence.There are also concerts and exhibitions held in the Winter Palace that you should check out. And keep your eyes open for one of the many museum cats that may be lurking about - a symbol of the city! Also - its a good idea to do some background reading about the history of the site before going!!

St. Peterburg - Don't miss the Hermitage. Although the Hermitage was an absolute zoo with wall to wall people and no space to really wander - it was worth the visit. Walking along like a herd of cattle in a straight line, you can see the magnificent artwork in each of the rooms. However, venture too far off and your tour group or family will be washed away along with the people. Good luck finding them as this museum is massive. Be sure to keep little ones close by. Every room has a silent and stern faced looking Russian lady making sure no one touches anything. We accidentally (on purpose) touched the curtains to look out the window and a silent alarm rang. The stern faced lady still didn't say anything but we knew we should quickly move along. If you go with a tour group you won't have much time as they do herd you along. I recommend going on your own so you can take your time. If you have kids (depending on their ages) let them wander and set a time and place to return. This way everyone gets a chance to see and read whatever they want. Do some pre-reading and you'll really appreciate all the beautiful art inside this museum.

The Hermitage. When I visited there was snow on the ground. It was so nice to be able to leave my thick coat, hat, scarf, and gloves in one of the many cloakrooms. Words can not express the beauty to be found inside this palace. Many artists including Rubens and Michelangelo are exhibited in the beautiful rooms. The throne room was exquisite. I just wished I had had more time to explore this wondrous palace. The Hermitage is definitely a must for any visitor to St Petersburg, but I suggest you allow plenty of time.

A ...box of treasures!. I won't bother you with trivial things such as the collections and the interior decoration which are admittedly stunning but I will rather give you helpful guidelines.One cannot see all of it in one visit.You take the museum plan and decide what interests you to see first.Then you start erasing on the plan the rooms you visited.Of course there is everywhere stuff who can help you by showing you the direction.Even so to to find the various levels is rather complicated and you cannot exit and re enter with the same ticket.The ticket fee is not considerable and if you desire to see the Golden Rooms (scythian treasure) or the Diamond Rooms (gifts to the Tzars) you should pay an additional fee of 300 rubles and have a guided tour of one hour on a specific time each day.Now they have moved some collections to the General Staff Building opposite the palace ( such as French painting of the 19th and 20th century, gifts to the Tzars etc.) I was there for the whole day. Better to go during winter time it is less crowded.Try not to go with a group you will see less than you expect. Enjoy it!

A magnificent palace!. The Hermitage Museum was a magnificent palace and today it is regarded as one of the most important museums in the world. The story begins with the museum work of art collections, which were privately purchased by the Russian Empress Catherine II. The Winter Palace, since its completion (1762 to 1904), was used as the official winter residence by Russian emperors. About the Hermitage collection, you can write a lot. It is necessary to include in the museum visit masterpieces such as "Benois Madonna" by Leonardo da Vinci, "Judith" by Giorgione, "St. Sebastian" by Titian, "Lute Player" by Caravaggio, "The Return of the Prodigal Son" by Rembrandt, "Lady in Blue" by Gainsborough. I would also recommend not to miss out the world's richest collection of Scythian gold.

Absolutely Opulent and Decadent. Does size matter ? According to the State Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace the answer is Yes. This historical palace turned museum, is astounding in size with an almost uncomprehending collection of significant Russian and European artwork, furniture, fashion and structures. Its absolutely incredible and incredibly easy to get lost in its many grand rooms! The throne rooms are spectacular with dance floors with the most stunning ceilings and gold furnishings! As someone who is extremely fascinated and interested in Russian Tsars and the Romanov family, this place was just a magical world of knowledge. I would go again and not rush it next time!

A must-visit, of course. Just great - wonderful art collections from all over the world, amazing surroundings, fabulous architecture, history and just beauty combined. The tickets cost 400 rubles for foreigners, but only 50 rubles less if you're Russian, not big of a difference, to be honest.You can skip the queue if you get the tickets from the machines that stand right by the entrance gates. I opted for the queue because I wanted to save the 50 rubles, doh. You also need to pay extra 200 (which I did) for photography.

The Ultimate Museum. This palace and collections are truly amazing. This walk through history is not only beautiful, but it is so vast that you will never see everything in one visit. You could spend weeks here and never see it all. The amount of wealth the Tsar's and Tsarina's had is mind boggling. I feel lucky that they found such pleasure in collecting because through their collections we get to see the beauty of the past. I just loved St. Petersburg and you can't visit St. Petersburg without going to the Hermitage.

Nice collection of arts and artefacts. It was a nice museum. Though they are pretty boring for me personally but I liked the Israeli mosaic work display and couple of old banners, guns in the Guards museum were all also cool.

A walk through history. This is amongst the finest museums I have ever visited. The collection is vast and several visits are required to even begin to comprehend its scale and grandeur. The collection includes works by Titian, Rapheal, Leonardo, Michelangelo and Filippo Lippi to name only a few. My favourite is Veronese's "Adoration of the Magi". The collection spans the centuries with fine collections of Impressionist, Fauvist and European avant garden too.Th building itself Is a beautiful worl of art with columns of malachite, wooden floors of exceptional quality and some fantastic furniture.Can't wait to go back

Beautiful. There is so much to this place. Not only the historical aspect of the building itself, but the collection is so vast and varied. The building itself is as stunning as the art inside - the architectural details and decor are beautiful. Worth a few hours in the afternoon, and the app is great too!

Summer Holiday in St. Pete. This is a must see in St. Pete. The historical collections and works of art are truly amazing. Plan to spend at least a couple of days to really get the most out of these museums.

Highlight of the trip!. The Hermitage did not disappoint!A fantastic experience - allow as much time as possible to visit for the day. We comfortably spent 7 hours inside, and still didn't manage to see all the collections. Be sure to prioritise the Palace interiors - truly fantastic decor, needs to be seen to be believed. Plenty of English signs, too, in these rooms. Try and follow the map closely to make sure you see each of the rooms in this wing of the palace.A map is your best friend in this place. It's worth sitting down the night before and ticking off a few of your must-sees - for me, Rembrandt's 'Old Man in Red' was a real highlight, but overlooked in the short map/guide provided by the museum. Students get in free, but I would have happily paid the full adult fee to see this fantastic palace. The extra photography fee is also well-worth it - some reviewers have complained about poor lighting, but on a clear and fantastically sunny day in March, we had no problem with glare on the paintings.Top tips: Don't bother bringing in bottles of water - these were taken away at the security entrance. Water, soft drinks, snacks and a small selection of sandwiches are available in the cafe, and we were also able to bring in our own food.The impressionist and post-impressionist works are no longer on show here as of December, although the Picassos are still housed on the top floor. Had we known this before our visit, we would have planned a trip to the gallery in which they are now housed too, but even this couldn't detract from a very special day.

A world famous museum gives a disappointment. Set in one of the most stunning palaces in the world, I was disappointed about a few things in it. First of all you have to pay for every single compartment in the museum separately, and the sum of 1400 rubles is not cheap by Russian standards. The gallery section is certainly rich, but anywhere near the Tretyakov Gallery in Moscow, and certainly does not compare to other world class museums like Louvre, Riksmuseum or Prado. A compartment of the museum you pay for without knowing what it is, only because you are mislead by the grand name of Hermitage. This section is called the "staff building"... don't bother paying to see it as it is virtually empty. The famous Diamond Room and Gold Room are the worst disappointments. You pay separately to see any one of them, then you find out you cannot stroll around a look at your leisure... you are driven around in timed groups with a guide who explains only certain pieces of the exhibits, the whole tour takes 40 minutes max, then you are chased out of the room by the guards once the guide is finished. you are not allowed to stand and look at anything on your own!!the worst surprise was when I doscovered that the famous collection of the Tzar's Faberge Easter Eggs if not in Hermitage.. actually not in St. Petersburg altogether!! They are in Moscow in the Kremlin in something called the Diamond fund!!

Historic excurssion. Photo is for additional cost. There is a difrent entrance fee for foreigners and russians. Excellent, historic place, its takes one week to see them all. Reserve some week for State Hermitage Museum.
WOW.... Incredible experience from walking up the magnificent stairs/hallway leading to the museum - definately the best museum in St Petersburg.

An Absolute Must Do!. The Hermitage has to be seen to be believed. It is so very opulent that it gives you an idea of what life was like in the time of the Tsars. Apparently, it has the largest collection of paintings in the world. The staircases, the paintings, the sculptures, the chandeliers, the beautiful furniture - it is absolutely fantastic. We visited with a tour company (SPB) and so we did not have to stand in the long lines to get into the building - a real plus.One of the best buildings I have ever been in.
You need more than 3 hrs. This is a very special place. Again, fabulous restoration. Don't forget to go across the street to the art museum - lovely collection of impressionists.
wow. must go. Too much to see in 1 day though. What a wonderful building with wonderful contents. You will forget you are in Russia!

Number One Place to Visit. All visitors should come here to just gasp at the sheer opulence of this place and to wonder about the vast wealth neede to build it! It has to be one of the top palaces in the world and gives you a glimpse of life in the time of the Tsars of Russia?

Majestic Palace of art exhibitions. First visited in Oct 2012. The Hermitage Museum was one of the best museums in the world! It has over 300 halls of portraits, paintings, and water-colours. The fully-decorated interior views of the chandeliers and stairs provide us with Medieval-Middle Age kind of impression! Simply the fabulous museum by the Neva River!
Amazing.. Has to be seen to be appreciated. What history. Amazing collection of art. And the architecture and sheer size of the building is spectacular. St Petersburg's premier attraction.
an experience mandatory in Sint Petersburg. Fantastic collections that can take easily more that a day to see. Also the building itself, with nicely restorated ballrooms is impressive

Wow. We loved the Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace. So many wonderful and beautiful things to see..the impressive staircase, paintings..we were lucky to have been there for a night performance in the square....

Must see and one of the Big Four museums of the world. The Hermitage Museum is an absolute must if you are in St Petersburg.Make sure you buy your tickets online. You will find lengthy queues anytime. We were there on a weekday in February (winter) and the queue was still long. If you buy your tickets online you get to skirt the crowd for a fast-track entry - saved us half hour easy.The museum is huge and actually comprises six buildings all relatively close together on the Nevsky River embankment. The main building is the Winter Palace. As a former palace, it has many rooms and is perfect for use as a museum. The building is well-maintained and the palace rooms themselves are worth the visit. The museum hosts an extensive array of antiquities, including a great Eqyptian display. There is also a fantastic amount of artwork, with a nice display for the impressionist fans out there, including Renoir, Pissarro and Sisley. There's also plenty of Russian works to admire.This museum deserves it's place as one of the world's big four museums, amongst the Louvre, British Museum and the Metropolitan Museum in New York.Don't worry about a guide unless you really want in depth history of a smaller number of pieces. Displays are well-labelled and there is just so much to see a guide might inform you, but will slow you down as well. Be prepared for a long day or multiple visits.Visited February 2013.

150 metres long - 1,500 rooms - 117 staircases. Was once yellow, then dull red, now pastel green.. There is a movie called 'Russian Arc.' It was made in the Hermitage Palace in one day - showing the palace history. In one scene you see Peter, then Catherine, then a ball, etc. Try and catch it.I loved the entrance staircase (Jordan) and the 80 meter long straight one. The room containing paintings and the malachite huge urns is probably the best in the palace.But my favorite room was the Concert Hall, with it crystal chandeliers, that wonderful parquetry floor and with those statues surrounding the room about 5 metres off the ground. Quite different.I have never been a lover of Modern Art,' paintings, but on the 2nd floor overlooking the Square there are several rooms full of them. Their vibrant color just blew me away.Brian, from Perth. W. Australia.
Thoroughly enjoyed this museam and palace. By and large, I am not a museum goer. This was a fantastic place. Done very well. Very interesting. Would return again.

Spend at least a whole day!. Wow, what can I say about the Hermitage? The collection is massive and impressive. The building is magnificent. You need to spend a full day there. I have read bad reviews about queues and weather.. I went on a March Wednesday in the morning and did not queue much at all.I had planned to spend a full day inside but even then did not think I'd go through it without toilet breaks! I had a quick lunch at a cafe. The toilets are not lcated around the museum so you would need to make your way to the entrance (this is also the case with the Russian Museum). The Hermitage is not always the easiest to navigate (the path in the Prado in Madrid, while may not have been as big, seemed to effortlessly guide the visitor through the galleries all the way to the exit!). I did both the special guided tours of the Diamond and Gold room. Personally I enjoyed the Diamond to much more as it covers most of the things in the gold plus more. The gold room is a shorter tour and suits lovers of Persian/Asian relics as it contains diplomatic gifts from Iran etc. You need to purchase photography passes separately and even then some galleries so not allow photography. There is no photography in the diamond and gold rooms at all.The gift shops inside the Hermitage are a bit lacklustre. Given the attraction it is, they could really do something more with that offering/revenue stream.
Probably the most beautiful palace in Europe. Breathtaking luxury and unique interiors of this historic place make it a must-see. Better come in the morning to have a chance to visit treasure house.

Takes time to fet into. It takes time to get inside. If you buy tickets online it will save you time - better do that - when we came the line was frightening. Difficult to naivgate inside as it is huge - so you better get prepared and decide in advance what you would like to see. Trying to see everything may cause mental disease :)

Wow!. It's hard to believe the scale of this museum until you've visited it. We loved the state rooms and the art exhibitions. We couldn't see everything in our visit but we'd love to visit again just to take in a bit more. Some of the exhibitions have been moved to the General Staff Building and this is worth a visit if you like more modern art and architecture.

Part of trip to St Petersburg. These 2 places are magnificent. We visited the Hermitage museum after it had closed as part of a tour, it was wonderful. We had no queues to worry about and a guide who was passionate about the place. The artwork is fab and even if you're not an art fan you can't help but be impressed. After our tour we had a concert in the hallway, not to be missed. The Winter Palace another great place to visit. We did have a fairly long wait to get in here but well worth it. While we were waiting a band struck up which was lovely and they were very entertaining, a great way to pass the time.

Overwhelming. We have visited twice, both with guides. So busy and you only have a glimpse of the artwork, there is just so much to view.This is a must on your itinery just to tick the box. When you leave into the square there is a small restaurant to the left, just down some steps and worth a break. .

A museum that evokes mystery and intrigue. In the public mind, the the image of the Winter Palace (now a part of the Hermitage complex) is indelibly linked with the tragic fate of the last Tsar of Imperial Russia. In the Soviet era, it also became an icon of the Revolution, first through an Eisenstein film. The Hermitage possibly displays less than 10% of its treasures, and although that is richer than most museums, what lies hidden gives rise to mysteries and conspiracy theories, all of which adds to the abiding charm of the Hermitage.You will hear whispers that if all their paintings are displayed, it will be by far the richest in the world -- Dutch and Flemish baroque masters, Italian Renaissance, Impressionists...Even some of the rooms themselves, especially the Malachite Room, Throne Room and Guard Room are visual treats. The Malachite Room has an added charm of transience, because of just that hint that it may be decaying. Overall, the impression is that of grand, decadent opulence of a bygone era.Perhaps its history is intertwined with the host city, whose name changed from St Petersburg to Petrograd to Leningrad back to the original.
vast na glorious. A museum worth visiting. Endless corridors of the winter palace filled with world's art legacy. Worth waiting in a line. Worth spending more than a short trip.

The building is as interesting as the art. This is one of those museums where I spent more time examining/taking pictures of the architecture than the actual works of art the building was designed to house. It is a Baroque masterpiece and highly worth seeing just for the stunning arched ceilings. The audio tour, though expensive, is worthwhile for its explanations of many of the most interesting rooms. However, the Hermitage also has an app with good information. You have to pay extra in the app for certain audio segments, however. High points include the Rafael Loggias and the Pavilion Room. Come early, even in the off-season, and buy tickets ahead of time. Otherwise, you will wait in a mammoth line to get in the front door.

Incredible. There is so much to see at the Hermitage Museum! Some highlights are the peacock clock (a video shows you how the parts move on the hour), and the Leonardo Da Vinci Madonna and Prodigal Son paintings. We had a private guide and went in the winter, so there were no lines or crowds.
A must to see. But a day is too short for a detailed excursion. Plan to be early to avoid long waiting on popular days / season.

Picasso's paintings . The museum opens at 10.30 am. We went there 10.15 and there was already a long queue. We waited about 30 mins before we got in. Every months first thursday is free admission so there will be lots of people...
Full package. This museum needs many days to see its true beauty but in my short visit i found i quit fantastic ... Different objects from different cultures ...

WOW. The hermitage is truly amazing its not just the biggest art collection in the world its also the palace itself rooms made of different colors of marble that just keeps going i have seen at least 20 colors of marble just in the first 20 "rooms"

A must if you're planning to go to SP. A big museum with lots of pieces about art and history. I really love the armoury and the Egyptian part. If you have an international student card you'll get a discount.
Essential. Wonderful building, interiorly and exteriorly. The treasures within add to the wonders of this vast place. Be sure to allow plenty of time!

Beautiful rooms, so many paintings and urns.. Not the usual review I suppose. I really wanted to experience the palace & it's interiors and it was all breathtaking. However, we weren't there as long as most people who have posted reviews. I'm afraid we aren't massive gallery or museum visitors so we walked round fairly quickly, about an hour and a half. I found myself staring up at the ceilings and admiring the staircases more than anything. It was nice to see famous paintings by old masters close up & see the quality. We arrived early Saturday afternoon in February and went straight to the ticket machine for foreign visitors. £4 each plus a bit extra to take photos, what value. We then joined a queue and got shouted at by a Russian gentleman, (get used to that), who was pointing out that they were Russians queuing for their cheaper tickets and we could go straight in. You are then ordered to the cloakrooms to put your coats in. Even this is impressive with room for about 5000. You pick an archway, a lady whisks your coat away and gives you a token. They work so hard. Next through a bit of security, show your ticket and you're in.

NOT to be missed. One of the world's greatest museums - a jaw dropping collection in a stunning former palace. I went with Alla Tours on this visit and had an excellent visit during a slower time of day.

Mind blowing. The Hermitage is above words , it is hard believe that it was not all lost when the revolution occurred , I gather that what is on display in the 1300 rooms leave 85% still in store, Catherine the Great bought 300 items a day whilst Empress, the Gold Room is amazing with gold diamonds crowns , orbs , so much you can not express. The Peacock Clock is beyond any words and bearing in mind it's age and lack of care for many years it blows you away , must go , at least for two days .

Wonderful.. Just what you would expect from a world class palace turned museum. Just like the Louvre in Paris, you must set aside at least a half a day for this. There is much ground to cover and if you wish to get to some tof the exterior buildings, you will need more time than that. There are masterpieces everywhere. Do not miss the clock room...truly unique.

No words to describe....must see. Be prepared to be awed! Get a guided tour, make sure you have a good camera and plan to spend at least 4 hours walking. Don't be worried about the walking...you won't even know you're there that long. There are so many beautiful rooms. It's overwhelming. I wished we could've spent the whole day there. It's easy to get lost so from your tour because there are so many people, so stay close to your group.

On a par with the Louvre. The variability of the collection is good. I enjoyed seeing some old favourites, like Rembrandt's Return of the Prodigal Son. However, I was disappointed Michelangelo's Kneeling Boy was missing.

Splendid!. A must-see when you're in St. Petersburg. There's so much to see, so it's better to set aside enough time in your itinerary. Splendid rooms and awesome collection that will leave you impressed! Would definitely love to come back again!

Amazing!. Set aside a good amount of time for this. 4hrs at the minimum if you plan to be quick. There is so much to see. Entry is really affordable and there are some real gems to see inside. Not to mention the state rooms themselves!At the moment, all the Impressionist and Post-Impressionist work is over the square in the General Staff Gallery. So head over there once you're done for more great art!

Must see. Perhaps the top attraction in St. Petersburg! If you are limited on time, stay on the main floor and do the circle. If you are from the West, you will see that the Russians had impeccable taste & great attention to detail. True royal blood!

The best museum in the world. I could literally write all day about this place but i'll stick to the specifics. Its about 500 rubles to get in and you have to buy an extra 250 ruble ticket for your camera although nobody asked us for this or checked if we had one. There is a free cloakroom to leave your coats and bags and plenty toilets although they are really smelly. The gift shops are AMAZING although not cheap, some of the jewellery they sell is beautiful. You can get audio guides and free site maps and there is a cafe on sight although it only really sells sandwiches, cakes and drinks and the sandwiches were awful, the cakes were gorgeous though!

The must see sight in St Petersburg. The rooms are fantastic and seem to really depict what life would have been like for the Emperors down the years.The art is fantastic, going in February meant that we could see all the artwork we wanted without any queues at all.The only disappointment is that most of the impressionist painters have been moved to a different museum.

the best museum. Gorgeous museum , art museum has so many types of art from around the world . The building itself is very beautiful and impressive . The rooms are amazing every wall art in itself . Russia's history that is reflected in the art museum . Catherine the Great left a huge mark on the world in the purchase of her art .
The best museum in Russia. You could spend a week there there is heaps to see worth. If you visit St. Petersburg You must visit hermitage

Best Museum in the World.. We have been to many museums around the world. This one is the best. Get an audio guide, do a bit of research before. The palace rooms, the art work, etc all amazing. Even my kids liked like. We zipped through in 4 hours but for art lovers..you need much longer if not a few days. We got overloaded. Also NOTE THE IMPRESSIONISTS have been moved across the street ....you have to go there too!
Incredible.. Wow. This museum is really, really impressive. Tips: Get a guided tour. We had a guide, and I think that is a smart move since there is to many things to see and read...
must to visit when in SP. historical museum must to take a tour with guide expect whole day very cheap , level of metropolitan

Russia's answer to Versailles interior grandeur and art work!. This is a not to-be-missed, breath-taking attraction in downtown St. Petersburg. Plan on spending a day or more here. And, take your camera, iPad or smart phone because pictures are allowed. If you have only one day, try to go on a Wednesday when there are extended exhibition hours. No matter when you go, be prepared to navigate around and through large crowds because this is the very popular Russian State Museum. In my review of itthe Peterhof Palace, I advertently confused this palace with it (which is a World Heritage site which has unbelievable gardens with topiary and fountains, but is not even close to comparable inside). There are 100,000's of art objects contained within the walls of the majestic Winter Palace as well as other connected buildings. Among them are literally hundreds of sculptures by famous sculptors such as Rodin as well as thousands of paintings by recognizable artists.. Again, this is a not-to-be-missed attraction at an inexpensive ticketed price.

Hermitage. This is a must do in St Petersburg, and allow plenty of time. The art collection is wold class and very diverse. The building itself is a treasure, and the wooden floors are incredibly beautiful.There is inside a delightful small ballet theatre which is one of the best in Russia.

A Must Visit.. From the outside the Winter Palace and Hermitage is stunning.The grandeur of the buildings is absolutely striking when I stood back to take it all in. Then my actual visit inside the Hermitage -WOW. You need time and a good pair of legs and take your camera! Words here nor photos cannot do my experience justice! I think I could walk around the venue for days and not see the same thing twice. I was very organized and knew exactly what I wanted to see, had it out on my map but it still took me several hours to complete. You cannot do the entire place in one day, you'll need a break. There's just too much so I will definitely do another visit when I next return St Petersburg!!
Hermitage Museum .............a walk through history!!. A fabulous museum!!! As you walk about you can actually feel the Romanov presence ......... a must for ever visitor to St Petersburg!!

Very interesting- allow full day & bring your lunch!. This is one of Europe's best art collections. The collections from early Russian history, including artefacts from the Steppe, including from the Mongolian and Golden Hordes, are extremely interesting and could not be viewed anywhere else in the world. The collection of Mediaeval armour is modest but very good, with some very interesting and early items.You will need a full day, so you will need to eat lunch. The restaurant doesn't seem to have changed since the Soviet Era and I suspect that some of the sandwiches may be Soviet veterans too. Bring your own packed lunch!

A "must see" place in the city. The Hermitage is a well known and most popular museum in St.-Petersburg. The are lot's to seein it. This is my favourite museum for foreign arts in the city. Just one advice,- please come before12:00, of you'll need to spend time in a queue. And, when you'll get inside, take a look from thewindows. Views are very beautiful. Unfortunately, Impressionists collection has been removed toGeneral stuff building, on the other side of Palace square. So, you'll need to get off and, crossthe square, and visit another building to see Renoir, Gauguin, Van Gogh, etc. Combined ticketsare available at cash offices.
Best of the best in Europe.. Fantastic collections under same roof, it needs a week at least to watch everything.. Highly recommended!
may be the best art museum in the world. I can compare the Hermitage with the Louvre, the Uffizi Gallery, the Vatican Museums and many others. To my mind The Hermitage is the best
Impressionism. Now full collection of impressionists in other building. You need across the palace square to see masterpiece of impressionists!
Don't miss a chance to visit. One of the greatest museum of the world . Please check the map and plan your visit. One day is not enough for all

Hermitage. The wonderful works of art exhibited in the Hermitage deserve not just one day, but two days - even two days may not be enough to see everything. The Museum and Winter Palace are just so extensive / enormous you can easily get lost, but never get bored.

So much to see, I was overwhelmed by art. It's so big and just as an example, I was checked as coat 1170s meaning 1200 others were there. Busy at the entrance but not once inside. Easy to get lost, so much to see. The architecture itself was as amazing as the artwork inside.

Great cultural experience. It was a revealing experience, but do it with the audio guide :)
I heard a guide teling the group that if you spend 1 minute to watch each museum artifact, you need 7 years to see them all.
How cool is that?

Stunning. We visited during our Baltic Cruise. The day we visited the museum was only open to tour groups which was nice. Truly beautiful building and artwork. Beware of people selling souvenirs out front. Visit the shop inside or go to a reputable store in the city.

Superb Hermitage. A unique momument not only as a historical palace but as one the world's great museums. It would take years to see all it has to offer but is totally unmissable. Try and plan what you want to see in advance - for example the impressionist sections get very crowded. Best to go outside the main tourist season especially when there are cruise ships in port (10)fanatasic - and you can take photos!!!!

Do research beforehand to find out where you want to go. I'm not really an art person but was very interested in seeing the Winter Palace.Once inside, it was very hard to tell the what was the Winter Palace and what was the Hermitage. I'm not really sure if I ever figured it out, and left frustrated in about 1/2 hour.And good luck trying to find someone to help you.The place is huge, crowded and confusing. Do some solid research beforehand to make sure you know where you're going in order to maximize your experience.
Winter visit to Hermitage. The winter is the best time of the year to visit Hermitage, there are less tourists so you can easily walk around without having a large crowd

HUGE first walk through for.... First walk through just for the building spaces. THEN decide what art period or region to focus on. You just can't do it all! Wonderful palaces connected together and housing magnificent artworks.

unbelievable. Huge incredible place with a lovely location in the heart of the city. it does cost quite a lot to enter so its better to reserve the whole day for this. They say that if you only spend a minute looking at one piece of art in there. It will take you 11 years to see everything!

Perfect for art lovers!. Everybody should see this museum. There are so many examples of Russian art at the same time you can see art works from Europe like Da vinci's portrait & art works from all over the world.

A unique Experience!. This is such an amazing place that nobody should miss if they are visiting St Petersburg. I've been there twice and each time was a unique experience. If you fancy art collection of different ages and cultures, history, gold architecture then this is the place to go. If you go take into account to plan a 3 hours visiting, more you will feel tired.

Go early and often. Magnificent but don't try and do it in a day. The two day pass is fabulous value and there are mini tours of The Gold room and the Treasure room that should be considered. Definitely wear flats.

Grand Voyage Through History and Art. It goes without saying that not to visit the Hermitage, being in St. Petersburg, is a crime! Stunning collection gathered there will appeal to both lovers of history and art of different ages and cultures - on three floors there are thematic expositions. ADVICE: If you want to see everything, at least with half an eye, you need to come in the morning and be ready to spend almost the entire day here. But it really worth doing!

Defiantly visit !!!! . Really if u in peterberg u have to visit, it's amazing n crazy pretty n that's the real wow inside n how old queens n kings leave the old time there n the massive contty of gold n art n both mix together I was just amazed of winter palace plus knowing lil of history after, thanks for all worker there it's big job they do

Definitely a must go museum. I cant imagine a petersburg tour without visiting this museum. If you are a student, there is discount. We visited it in JAnuary.It was not very crowded so we could really spend more time there. People working there are quite old but they know ENglish and can answer your questions. They are really knowledgeable and helpful. It seems that they take care of their culture. But the brochures in the museum are not that informative because they do not give any information about the things in the museum. So i suggest having a guide book that tells the must see artifacta and things in the museum. You need at least 3 hours in the museum .

WOW!!!. The museus itself gets 10 out of 5. Only the Louvre is like it. It is one of the most impressive buildings I have ever seen. You see so so many things from some of the most famous paintings in the world to items and rooms the Russian Royal Family used to use. Absolutely recomend it. Our guide was excellent snd could answer ecery question. The reason I am giving it 4 stars is because of the poor management. There is only one toilet at the entrance. No other toilet during the 4.5 hour walking tour. Also the museum is TOO hot in the summer. We did not pay the fee to take pictures but even if we did it would be impossible as there was so many people and the group was moving too fast to manage to see the Hermitage in 4.5 hours. Be very carwful with your posessions as the place is full of thievesm It id better to leave expensive stuff in the bus.

Once isn't enough. I had the chance to visit the Hermitage few times and still it's not enough. Never try to see all at once - it's too big, too great to be in hurry there. The most impressive part of the museum are the Tsars chambers, real spirit of great Russian Tsardom, which give you unforgettable memories. Then upstairs - French, Netherlands and other well-known paintings to see not only in a book. Tip: buy the ticket in advance or come there before the museum opens :) anyway it's totally worth even to wait in a queue.
Magnificent and historical ground.. History has been made her. Tsar family has been walking the same stairs. Books, novels and much more springs out of this place!

An amazing treasure. There are no words to describe the splendor of the architecture or the collections. If one buys the ticket online, one can skip the lines and go directly to the Kasse. Plus the online ticket is good for the day at other Hermitage locations, e.g., the General Staff Building where the Impressionsist and later items are on display.
Awesome!. Take a guided tour as it's just too huge to get around on your own. There's so much to see and the location is fab. Try to get there early as the groups get there early in the day.

MUCH MUCH to see. Our family visited the Hermitage on a recent trip to St Petersburg. The collection of art housed at this museum is amazing. There is so much to see that it is overwhelming. The architecture of the building (winter palace) is worthy of hours of consideration & admiration. The works of art seem to be countless. The old masters, Faberge, Dutch, Spanish, French, modern art, sculpture...it has it all. I highly recommend a visit to the Hermitage, but be prepared to be overwhelmed! We went in the summer, and it was crowded. The line to the restroom was long. The organization of tour guides was commendable. If you want to leisurely enjoy the museum, a tour is not for you as you are whisked through each area pretty quickly.

Opulent World Class Museum. This museum is an ornate majestic showcase for one of the best art collections in the world. The grand entrance staircase itself is a work of art. It was interesting to see all the art students working to create a copy of the art master's works. Even the basement is filled with sculptures and art/history treasures. Each of the rooms has its unique style and even the hallways are lavish. There is a large gift shop on premises. I went on a cruise ship and so my tour guide was with SPB tours who did an excellent job.

Excelent. This is a MUSEUM.
I think 2 days are not enough to see everythying.
Saint Petersbug main atractions are worth a long visit.
This is probaly the city that has everything in the way that you will never forget.

One of the best museums in the world !. This is one of the best museums i ever was. Its located in a "winter palace" which is a HUGE building, so a full day is defiantly not enough to see even 25% of all that it has to offer..I have spent only two days (not in a raw) there, the first day i took a guided tour for two separate collections (diamond room & gold room) - every one is a 1-1.5 hours tour with an English guide and both are fascinating (!) You have to purchase a separate ticket to any of those two collection rooms. (If you only want to choose one i recommend the diamond room) rest of the day just had time to cover 10% of the 1st floor...The 2nd visit, was only for the "museum" i managed to see most of the 2nd and 3rd floors.To sum, this is a must museum to every art lover. if you can try to do it twice (or more) but its better not in consecutive days since it is very tiring.. (you walk miles inside)

Beautiful Museum with so much history. On a two day tour of St. Petersburg, the Hermitage was our first stop. Mind you we were on a cruise and among a hoard of other tour groups. Our guide was great and showed us the highlights of the museum. In some rooms, it got very crowded and pushy. But definitely worth the visit. The detail and ornateness is overwhelming. I wonder if they have a private night tour; I would definitely pay for that just to have the place to ourselves in sense. The large crowds took away from the art and made it so that we were not able to fully view and enjoy certain rooms.

a must. This museum is the Louvre of St. Petersburg. There is an incredible collection of art, and I particularly liked the wide collection of Andre Derain and similar artists. They had a great sample of Picasso's blue period, and the museum itself was very well decorated without being over the top. Easily a 2-3 hour endeavor, the plaza outside is a beautiful area. There was even a light show one night I was there.

One ofe the best museums. One of the most interesting places in the city. You need a week or even more to see everything you want, and each time you come you will find something new. The only problem about it is that there are lots of tourists there.But it's worth of visiting.
Superb. A truly superb museum. The detail and the architecture of the museum are alone worth seeing. The exhibits are fantastic.

What everyone comes for. You won't be surprised to read that this is pretty much the number 1 thing that comes to everyone's mind when they think of St Petersburg! And that perception is very much justified - you can get lost here for hours and hours but I'd say it's more impressive as a historical sight where Tsars used to live rather than as a museum, despite its enormous collection.

Solo in the rooms of the Golden Horde. One way to avoid the long lines and crowded rooms, is to not go when everyone else does.No to July and August. When I traveled in mid-Sept. I did not wait 10 minutes to buy my ticket, and then the museum was only a bit more crowded than I liked. One problems with any museum is trying to see everything, now that you are there. Not a bad idea to research what they have and compare it to what you really want to see, and even then your list will still be overly ambitious. Also this museum is tricky to navigate, the numbers are not sequential, many rooms and areas and passageways are closed. The palace itself is beautiful and worth appreciating on its own and when I visited, the temporary exhibition was a lot of incredible costumes from the 19th cen.for skinny women who wore size 2 shoes.When I tried to buy a ticket for the Gold Room ( actually refers to the Mongols, or Golden Horde ) I was told that the last English tour had already departed and I could not join a tour in another language. I objected loudly and demanded to speak with someone in charge, who told me the same thing. I continued to object, until, surprise, surprise, she relented ( not good naturedly) and told the ticket seller to sell me the ticket. She told me to hurry, as a group had just departed. I did hurry, but could not find the group, and so had to tour the Golden Horde exhibition all on my own with no crowds, no blah blah talking from a guide, and no rushing. How lucky can you get?
The Winter Palace. An incredible experience. I found myself looking at the internal architecture and forgetting there was priceless art and artifacts being exhibited in the room.

Large museum with art and many other things. This is the "must" place to visit when in St Petersburg. The building is very large, which is typical for Russia. Here you can admire fine art as well as other items which illustrate the history of Russia.

another great palace. another building from the early years but has remained as a symbol of how the czars lived in the past and how much wealth they had, inside again russian arts and crafts but its the building itself which grabs you as you walk from room to room

A stunning place!. There is a lot to see so make sure you have comfortable shoes. The place is beautiful. From furniture to the art work. I generally dont like getting guides as that gives me more freedom to walk around at my own pace ( which is fairly fast) but for anyone who is ok with that i highly suggest you do it. Just to look at the place is stunning but when you know the history of some of their art your experience becomes way richer.

Impressive. This has to be the most amazing gallery on the planet. We only spent 3 hours there, but you could spend weeks, the place is huge. The building itself is just stunning, the history within the walls is incredible. Take a tour guide with you, as there is so much to learn and read about, you couldn't do it on your own.
Wow!. The museum is very nice - Very rich in artwork - paintings, sculptures, ceramics with gold...in all 6 facets of the rooms...Beware, it might several days to visit it entirely.

Hermitage and winter palace. We visited in December and the Hermitage and winter palace looked magical in the snow. The buildings are lit up beautifully in the evening and over the fesive period they had a magnificent free lighting show on to the buildings and the colours, graphics and music were just magical. You could spend hours in the Heritage and thats exactly what we would recommend you do, they have an incredible range of displays and for me this is one of the best museums that i have ever visited. This is a must see site when visiting St Petersburg
Can't miss this when in Piter. This is a must see and recommend you visit it with a guide, don't go for it alone. It will be worth every penny!

World class museum.. One of the most somptuous and opulent museum I ever seen.If you visit the city, you definitely must visit Ermitage Museum.The collection of pieces of arts is outstanding... The size of the museum is huge, the richness of the place is priceless and we fall in love with the beauty of the place!Enjoy it.

Unbelievable architecture with a great collection of antiquities. Now, I visit a lot of museums. In fact, I am somewhat of a connoisseur, and I was completely blown away by the Hermitage. There are a myriad of things to look at for history buffs, from the Tsar's silver collection to Egyptian and Roman antiquities.The interiors of the palace are just as imposing and impressive as the outside, and I would definitely recommend paying a visit to the Hall of Mirrors, which is a copy of that in the Palace of Versailles. The other big attraction is the peacock clock, which is an automaton which crows on the hour every hour, and is spectacular to behold.What is most breath-taking about the museum, however, is its HUGE art collection, including a large collection of Van Dyke pieces.In my opinion, this is simply the best museum in the world, but do put aside a day to get around it all, as there's so much to see and do. Definitely worth a visit!

hermitage visit. The Hermitage is huge and beautiful, if you like arts or museums, this is the place to go. But if you wanna appreciate it for real, its good to have someone to guide you or go more than one time.

Amazing!. The Hermitage is incredible, the size and variety of the different rooms vast. You walk from one beautiful room into yet another even more beautiful room. The size of the place has to seen to be believed. Also the collection of art work is incredible, some of the best artists in the world have pieces hanging here.Beware though that the queues can be VERY long. It opens at 10.30am. I arrived at 10.15am and had to stand in a queue for two hours in the freezing cold to get in and once in I queued for another 40 minutes to put my coat in the cloak room. I would recommend arriving very early and getting your ticket online beforehand, unless you're a student and want the free ticket, then you have to get it at the ticket office.

I found it to be one of the best museums in the world . The sheer size of this museum left me stumped. One day is not enough to see the exhibits. I must have visited this museum a hundred times in the one year that I stayed in St. Petersburg and it never got old.
My favorite - the Van Dyke art collection.

Too large to take in at one visit, but dont miss it!. We visited this with a private guide and we were so glad we did. We had 4 hours set aside for this experience and it was not enough. We saw some of the major exhibits and thankfully our guide was able to tell us the story behind each of them. One of the most amazing places set over 4 interconnected palaces facing the River Neva on one side and the large square on the other. Don't miss this!

I love the Hermitage. I really do love the Hermitage. We went twice in one trip! Although we had to wait outside in the freezing cold for about 40 minutes (cloak room was full...), it was worth the cold toes. The collection located across the plaza at the State Building is also fantastic!

Best museum in the world!. We visited the State Hermitage Museum twice on our trip to St Petersburg.As we were there during the Russian January holidays (1 - 10 January) there were long queues in front of the building. But don't just join the queue. Go through the gates to the courtyard of the building. Here you will find ticket machines (on the left and right side) to buy your entrance tickets (400 rubble per person and 200 rubble for making pictures. The machine also gives change). With these tickets you can walk up straight to the front door. The people in the queue are waiting to get inside and buy a ticket at the counter of the museum.The first Thursday of every month is a free entrance day. The queues are long. The museum opens at 10.30 am.please note that there are 2 queues - one on the left side and one on the right side. For some reason, most people choose the left one, but the one on the right is much shorter. Go there!The museum itself is fantastic! I can't describe the beauty and grandness of the rooms. The art is from all over the world, from Da Vinci to Rembrandt, from statues to Egyptian mummies. You need to visit this museum once in your life!

Fantastic. There are so many things to see here that it would take days just to get a real taste of the treasures in this museum. From paintings, to vases and statues, there are many wonderful things to see. Even the building itself is opulent beyond words.

Amazing. The Hermitage can't be adequately described in words. It must be seen to be experienced. The magnificence of the Winter Palace and the art collection are overwhelming. Our tour for 4 people was excellent. Since our tickets were purchased days earlier, we were able to enter the Hermitage before other tours and the general public. The early entry provided us with a less crowded and less hurried view of the palace. We were consistently ahead of the large tour groups traveling en masse allowing us to have a close-up and more personal visit. Visitors need to allow at least 3 hours to see everything. To ensure that you have a more pleasant experience, I highly recommend arranging for a small group tour that provides tickets and an early entry. A guide is invaluable. Standing in long lines to purchase tickets and wandering the Hermitage on your own might prove less interesting since you may not understand what you are seeing.

An overwhelming experience. The Hermitage Museum offers to its visitors not only uncountable paintings, art and historical exhibits, but also the glamour of the buildings themselves - comprising of former palaces. We visited the museum on a Wednesday around lunch time and avoided big queues for tickets and in the cloakroom. We will surely visit again once in St Petersburg as the collections are so many its impossible to see everything in 1 or 2 visits.
Awesome. So Big , so much History inside , Magnificient! One day is not enough to see everything, we loose the sense of time in there.

Amazing and overwhelming. Going early 30th of december was probably a good idea. In the main season I believe you can stand in line for two hours and then be packed into an overcrowded museum. We however had zero queue and there were maybe a couple of hundred visitors there with us. It's huge - think Louvre - and you can't possibly see everything in one day. Lots and lots of magnificent paintings, tapestries, and palace halls. After two hours I couldn't take any more in, buy a two-day ticket online!

Museum. We enjoyed the Hermitage Museum. We made the mistake of trying to queue up and buy tickets the day before. After 1 1/2 hours in -10 degrees we nearly died. Either go to the machines in the courtyard to buy tickets or book on line and print out your voucher. Take this voucher to the small box office inside the gate and exchange for tickets. Then take the tickets and get in the tickets only queue. This could save you an hour in the cold! Get there before it opens, say 1/2 hour.

Fabulous. Fabulous place although queuing for the cloakroom to give your jacket in takes a bit of time. Beautiful rooms and loads to see. Make sure you get there early (for the doors opening if you can) as there are no real queues to get in then, if you get there any later prepare to wait for a while.

Poorly Organised. What can I say about the Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace? Not a lot because out of the 4 years of trying to visit, we have only succeeded once - last year. This year, to improve our chances, my wife who is Russian, bought Internet tickets so as to avoid the very lengthy queues (as it advises on its own website). You have to exchange the Internet tickets for 'real' tickets on the first floor of the museum. Seems straightforward enough but the 'officials' on the doors will not let you in; insisting that you queue with everyone else!! You pay a premium for the Internet tickets for absolutely no benefit. Now, as an Englishman, I am more than prepared to queue but not when a premium has been paid to avoid that privilege!!! Needless to say, I was not prepared to queue for at least 2 hours in temperatures below freezing. The museum really needs to get its act together regarding ticket sales and queues - very poor experience for three of our four attempts. Last year was great - took the English tour with our own guide but the brilliance of that experience has been totally wiped out by everything else we've been subjected to!!
Blast from the past. Amazing palacecarries almost all Russian History...with all the paintings, stories and everything!its a MUST see, but its not small... it needs at least 5 hours to cover all...

worthful place to stay half day or more. It's one of the must go places in St Petersburg.There is ferry (fast) toward city center to continue your trip in 30 minutes (comparing with the buses can take >1 hr).

Amazing Hermitage!. We took a special insider tour, we were allowed into the museum an hour before the doors were open to the public. This was a guided tour. What a huge difference it makes! We were able to see all the impressive paintings, jewels, dresses, the famous click, appreciate the beautiful palace without any crowds!! No jostlings.Everything viewed closely with ample time and space to visualize and appreciate Hermitage. It is one of the most beautiful and aesthetically pleasing museum we've seen. Also they have the most beautiful gift shops for Things made in St Petersburg( Amber, matroishka dolls).After the museum tour, we had a special tour of the storage place for the Hermitage. It houses the tent given by the Sultan of Turkey, furnitures used by the Tsars, Carraiges. It also included a lunch in the cafeteria( food was very simple). Highly recommended and not to be missed. A must see in St Petersburg.

Breathtaking. I can't find the right words to describe this place, but it's definitely worth visiting. It's amazing! The royal chambers, their domestic appliances and clothes, along with hundreds of pictures and statues and many other fascinating things...ahh i will go to St P only to visit this Palace again!

Simply more than Awesome. It is one of the beautiful place i have ever visited in my life. Its soon beautiful that it can't be defined in words. The best thing about the palace i loved is the way with which it has been maintained. Everytime when i will go to Russia i wanna go there everytime. I got the ticket for just 200 russian rubles. It is worth watching to see such such a beautiful place at so much low price. Not only one thing, but everything you see in the palace is so beautiful, nicely crafted and maintained in an awesome way. It even shows how much rich heritage of the russia is worth watching. Its soon big that i can bet on it, every person who will go there will take rest in between for ample of time. Must Visit. Keep It up RUSSIA..!!!

Mindblowing. The sheer scale of these museums is utterly staggering. I was told that there are ten kilometres of corridors and rooms to walk through. For £4 you can't find anything better! Every item is fascinating but to see 16 Picasos in one room was unbelievable.
A must see! . Go here! See it! Experience it! The place is huge! The stairs are incredible, and the big rooms gives you a feeling of being at a royal ball! Take a dance in the halls!

So much to see. The place has definitely got lots of impressive works and if that is not anything then the whole palace in itself is nothing less of an artwork. The ornate ceilings and walls make it equally exciting walking down the halls as much as seeing the displays. The organization skill of the whole place is not that interesting though. Make sure you have ample time on your hand for this place.

Winter palace is correct. We visited the Hermitage on a cold December day. The museum was interesting and the structure was worth the time to explore. Very confusing layout which requires some assistance, the staff were very helpful to English speaking people.

Winter palace. Perfect. Just perfect and beautiful. A must-see. First, you want to buy tickets in terminals outside- than u just go inside -the line outside is to buy tickets in tickets office(400RUR). Second, u need a guide and not an audio. The audio guide u buy for 450RuR does not contain all the info and mine just died- I did not even finished 1st floor!!! If you were unlucky and bought it(and left ur id or deposit of 2000RUR as deposit) and took exit different from the one you enteted- u ll have to go back and ask to let you in without ticket to get your money or id back because audio guides' desks are situated after you scan your ticket- so just exit same where u entered. I spent 4 hours- I hardly finished 1 floor.

Great Museum and history combined. We only had fthree hours in this amazing museum. We could have spent three days there !Some of the finest Russian and International Art including Da Vinci Raphael Rembrant Picasso Gaugin etc Excellent Egypian and Greek section where we saw the Elgin Marbles.It is rather overwhelming and not easy to find your own way around....better to get a guide although The Lonely Planet descriptions are reasonable.
Good but not Amazing. The museum is a summary of Russian and European Cultures. But comparing to Peterhof, it is just a museum. Items shown there are beautiful but not really well organized.

Amazing . Visit here and you will be amazed. This is a massive museum full of incredible at in the most spectacular of settings. Plan your visit though to ensure you have time to see the rooms you are most interested in. Places to eat inside are quite limited.
Museum in museum. Cannot compete to Berlin or London. Very nice atmosphere, building itself. Italian art hall is lovely.
You need minimum two full days!. This is one of the best cultural, artistic and historical institutions in the world! Make sure you explore enough Russian section. Do not rush, endulge yourself.
amazing museum. A bit chaotic inside but it is really worth to pay for the entrance ticket. Make sure about the closing days because we almost missed it because it was closed for two days.
You will need a day for each. So much to see and you will need to leave plenty of time for both. There is soo much to see if you want to do them justice, leave a day for each

Incredible. The heart of Saint Petersburg, incredible and full of life. DEfinitely worth the visit, but don't be fool, yo uwill never visit entirely in one time so select different ailes you want to visit and leave the others for an other visit in St. Pete, it worthes it :)
Endless feast of art!. How can one describe such wealth of art collection and palace. The first place to spend 2-3 days in St Pete.

Some Paintings "Entered" the museum!. IT was stunning, and disturbing. Many paintings appear to have been confiscated during and after WWII. They "entered" versus were purchased or donated. The upstairs has master paintings hanging on the walls with string! The downstairs is grand. The coat check ladies are controlling and appear to enjoy their small dose of power over the masses. It can take 45 minutes to hang and to retrieve your coat.

Almost four hours at The Herm. It took us ages to find the way in. There's no sign on the main square outside about how to get in! If you're going there - go through the arch into the Winter Palace (the big green building). Once inside it is pretty daunting to know what to do.. We didn't have a guide, but decided to buy an audio guide, which turned out to be of limited use.. There weren't all that many pictures we wanted to look at that had an audio guide symbol next to it, and in the area with all the made up palace rooms there wasn't any. We had a sort of tick box list of things we wanted to see, and we managed to find them all. The great thing is, unlike other big museums I've visited, there aren't huge crowds of people everywhere, and you can get really close to the exhibits. Loads of Picasso. Didn't see any Chagall though! There are also brilliant views from the museum over the river. A must see in St Petersburg.

The Winter Palace the best of the best. I am from Ecuador and I visited The winter Palace with my fiancé. I would highly recommend to go there. You should spend list 5 hours to visit very quick most of the interesting things, but if yiu have time please spend a list one day. Do not miss the gold room and the room of the "Queen".

Breathtaking.... By far one of if not the most impressive collection of art in the world. A must see when in St. Petersburg. To think of all of the artistic genius gathered under one roof is simply incomprehensible. A true treasure in the city.
Magnificent. Unbelievable--you will be inspired to love art again. You must give yourself a long time there. It is really a treasure.

Worth the whole trip!. First let me say I was not a normal visitor to the Hermitage- I was a guest of the museum in a program for art professionals for a two week program- so I was there daily for 2 weeks and saw more that I can remotely convey here.The main striking theme- The Royal Russians where the original "shopaholics" with a huge bank account and amazing taste.The building is a prime example of Russian Royal taste- a bit over the top- If you can, be waiting at the door when it opens- before the tour buses arrive and know if you go in summer it can get HOT- really HOT and a/c is uncommon (even in the museum- and the crowds can make this worse)While most visit on tour buses I was fortunate enough to spend full days inside the guts of the museum touring the backstock of the shopping sprees attending lecture classes held by world class curators. (Worth noting the worlds largest Rembrandt print collection resides here- most of it not on display- all the art and artifacts art like this).Normal tourist and guests alike will be dazzled by the amazing highlights Rembrandt's Return of the Prodigal Son, Matisse's Drummer Boy, Picasso's Absinthe Drinker - (note there are unpleasant acquisition stories on many of the works show- ie stolen from Russian Jews) - but the art remains and is worth the effort- all the effort it will take to see through the crowds-While I loved the museum I found the 'outside' experience a bit of extra work- Unless you stay and eat at expensive (for Russians prohibitive unless mobbed up) places- the quality of food for the average person is about as far from French or Italian as possible- lots of soup in the staff kitchens (The average wage of a curator is well under 20K a year- these people speak no less than 4 languages, often 7 or 8 and spend their lives dedicated to art). - and desserts which are perfect looking and empty of all flavor (really odd). Queuing at bodega for a few choices of food is common still- and outside cultural spots and places catering to tourist don't expect to always find English.

Splendid Museum. I visited the Hermitage State Museum on an afternnon excursion off the CMV cruise ship Marco Polo. You will probably have two guides - both of whom may be Russian but they speak English very well. The Museum Rooms are splendid. There are good clean toilets available near where you are asked to leave heavy coats. You will probably be supplied with radio receivers and earphones to pick up your guide's commentary.
You'll need at least two days here. I took the guided tour and was so interested that I went back two days later to explore on my own. This is a must see, worth every moment.

Awesomely impressive. Totally mind blowing. We have history in uk but this is something else. History. Culture. Pride. Visited St Petersburg on a cruise and did 2 full days of very well organised trips. We spent a few hours and saw only a fraction. One of a very few places I would revisit.

Fabulous. I have been to the Hermitage a few times. Each time there seems to be something I have missed from a previous trip!! This is another MUST SEE while in St Petersburg. I spent about 7 hours there on my first trip with a Russian Friend. She was from Moscow and had never been there either. The 7 hours is not enough time. If you can, plan to spend the better part of 2 days here!!

Amazing visit with Olga. Actually entering and touring the Hermitage was an amazing visit into history. Like many sights of great expectation, the Hermitage was bigger than life and awesome. Our guide, Olga, made certain we saw the top priority paintings and artwork as we toured this site for one day only. Over three million items displayed in what is actually six historic buildings makes for a formidable viewing challenge. Suggest doing your homework first and zeroing in on the specifics of what you'd like to see to make a more meaningful visit and prevent the feeling of overload from being bombarded by so many artifacts. Also, I found reading narratives about Catherine the Great helped with sorting the timeline and allowed me a better grasp of magnitude of the exhibit.
Hermitage Museum. Amazing place 100% must see attraction spent 6 1/2 hours there and it was not enough. Outstanding art and so mutch more one of the best in the world

excellent museum. one of the best museum i've ever visited. actually i have visited it like 10-12 times and i was never bored. fantastic beautiful palace interiors, great collection of fine arts, dishes, emperors' china, abundance of gold and luxury, clockwork peacock. once u enter-breathe normally)) dont miss also gold and diamond chambers though for additional price. the mueseum is expensive now but its the best way to spend this money.

Fabulous. These are magic places. Wished we had much more time - so much to see. All the superlatives can't do them justice. Nothing prepares one for the reality of actually seeing the outside of the palaces and their magnificent interiors and treasures.

Incredible beauty. I have travelled around the world a few times, have seen palaces, museums and other beautiful places in different parts of the world but visiting the Winter Palace was an unforgettable experience that I recommend to the world traveller, it is a must See. There are no words to explain the beauty of this place. Unlike other palaces this one looks untouched by time.

Stunning Art Works. If you are in St Petersburg you must visit the Winter Palace. You will be gobsmacked by the amount of treasure and some of the finest art works in the world. It is a busy place and all tourists will get to this destination so go early and allow some hours here. We had a personal guide who was a charming young lady, very well educated and cultured, who guided us around for a small fee. Worth it as these people know what to see and what the history is and believe me...there is amazing history. The Russian people have so much to show us and this is a great place to start.

Hermitage Museum. My tour of the Hermitage with Albina was unforgettable. We went there for two days in a row. Albina made sure I saw all the galleries and she was there for guidance and companionship but also gave me time to look at the paintings of the masters and appreciate them in my own time.
