Make sure your video is working and you have plenty of film on your camera chip as you allowed ((surprisingly enough) to take pictures throughout the museamWonderful, wonderful experience just would have liked a bit longer.This tour was part of our Russian waterway trip which started in Moscow and finished in St Petersburg. I would highly recommend it
3 hrs inside doesn't even cover it. it's fabulous. it's big. you need days to see it all. great art collection inside, recommend it to everyone

Amazing. The Grand staircase will wow you, the Rembrant hall will humble you, and the Monet and Picasso rooms will impress. Easily the best attraction in St. Petersburg. Make sure you take 2 days if you are a huge art fan, if not, 1 day should do the trick. The halls with the Raphael and Michalangelo pieces are great.

Beat the queue with the ticket machine. As you go in the gates to the Hermitage, at your right inside the courtyard are two ticket machines that look like ATMs. We arrived at 10.30 (opening time) and there was already quite a queue waiting to buy tickets at the ticket office, but only a couple of people waiting at the machines. We just bought out tickets there, bypassed the queue, and basically walked straight in without waiting. Obviously the collection is amazing, bloody hard to navigate the place but don't miss the top floor where the impressionists etc are - some great stuff.
Hermitage. Went there on the tour. Great tour, great place. Hermitage is as big as Louvre is, but less crowded. Unfortunately, my vacation was too short to see everything out there...
A must see. A must see! The art collection is incredible with some of the great masters of all time and the buildings itself are magnificent. Buy the ticket online and avoid the long line to get in.

Disappointing Compared to Its Reputation. The reputation of The Hermitage far exceeds what one is able to see as a tourist on a normal visit. The museum suffers from 80 years of neglect under the communist regimes - no A/C, no elevators, not all rooms have been restored, only a minimal of the paintings and sculpture are on display, no silver/gold/artifacts on display to the public, and the number of people allowed to visit each day make it impossible to get close to anything. (We paid 2x the admission price to get special admission to an evening tour to avoid the massive crowds.) Due to the crowds and lack of benches/seats, this tour was exhausting in addition to disappointing. Certainly what is on display is fabulous, but on the whole I was disappouinted. I suggest you buy an expensive book of photos of the art and artifacts which you will enjoy much more than this tour! Our tickets were US$120 each for an evening tour ($240 total) - you can buy a great book for $75 and enjoy it much more!

it's the uncomparable. I've been to Louvre, British Museum, Metropolitan in NYC but nothing can be compared to Hermitage. Regarding the curation in the museum, I think Louvre is better. However, the Hermitage brings an overwhelming museum because of the palace itself. Every room is worth being visited. It's incredible to how rich the emperor and empress were in the 18th, 19th century.And to my surprise, it's free, even for those who hold a student card from other countries.

Far to busy and noisy. Obviously we loved the collection and the rooms, but the number of guests, especially the groups with the arrogant tour guides made the whole experince terrible. I think they should limit the number of guests at a certain time, otherwise nobody can enjoy the museum. Also at certain areas it would be wise to create one-way traffic, so it would me more of a culture experience to see the paintings and sculptures or beautiful rooms.

Joy and Feast for art and culture lovers. One of the best art and culture museum I have visited.It may be the largest and oldest museum in the world dating back to 1764.There are nearly 3 millions items.It consits of 6 historic buildings which also includes the winter palace of Czars(Russian Emperors).Along with paintings and sculptures there are Egyptian antiquities,Classical antiquites,Pre historic art, Jewelley and decorative art, Italian Renaissance, Italian and Spanish fine art, Knight's hall, Dutch Golden age and Flemish Baroque, German,British,Swiss and French fine art, Russian art, Neo classical, Impressionist and Post Impressionist art etc.It was a amazing and the most fantastic art museum I have ever visited.
Hermitage Museum. You can get lost inside The Hermitage Museum; no pun intended! The wide variety of art display would make you want to spend days there.

Collection amazing, crowds awful. Buy a ticket online in advance and jump the queues, which were horrendous in July. One local described it as 'Massacre of the Innocent Tourists'. The setting is simply spectacular and the art collection extraordinary: a visit is essential but they need to do something about crowd control and preferably not allow people to use baby buggies as battering rams. We got a two day ticket and carefully worked out which areas to focus on in an attempt to make it manageable. Quiet contemplation of a brilliant piece of art is impossible because of the crowd numbers, so clearly July and August are times to avoid if possible. The large tour groups barge through on their tight schedule and you wonder if any of them see or enjoy much. All that said, many of the collections are superb and worth the jostling and frustration, and the building itself is impressive. It's still possible to appreciate a piece of magnificent art despite fellow visitors wanting to photograph it and/or be photographed beside it, although this takes some patience! The place is wonderful but the visitor experience could have been a lot more wonderful.
Hermitage Museum. Beautiful grounds, Museum Grand. Learned much about the historical background. Loved architectural details.
Hermitage Museum. Well worth the visit but far too much to see in the time allowed. You really need a good two days for the museum alone.

A Must See. The architectural design of these buildings are unbelievable. Photographs do no justice to the scale and detailing. A must see especially if you are interested in interior design. Only drawback is that if you want to see the diamond room, it is a separate ticket and difficult to get. So, try to purchase prior to visiting museum.
it is a must in S. Petersburg. While visiting S. Petersburg you have to go there even for few hours tour. If you are not fun of collections of everything just go and visit palace interiors.

Unmissable. The collections here are fantastic - we spent most of two days here! There are state rooms, fantastic art collections and huge numbers of artefacts. The first day there was no queue and we bought tickets at the ticket machine just through the arches and walked straight in. The second day the queues were huge. Be careful to know where the queue is going before you stand in it. We initially joined one outside the arches that just led to the collection point for the Internet tickets...on further inspection there were several other queues! In general it seems quicker to just use the machines if you just want general admission - and it is cheaper than internet tickets. You can't buy tickets for the diamond gallery or the gold room from these machines or in advance. There is a tour of these once a day in English - a tour is compulsory to visit these rooms. You can queue up to the main kiosk in the very long queue, but we got there at 1030 and would not have got in in time for the 12pm tour. If you go into the area under the arches, on the right hand side there is a door marked tours and group tickets. Go in there up the stairs and to the right and there is another door marked 'museum tours'. You can book on a tour there for the diamond or gold rooms, or a general museum tour. If you take the chit to the kiosk at the top of the stairs you can exchange it for a tour and a general museum ticket. If you have your ticket before you reach the museum entrance, there is no queue and you can just go straight in. The diamond room is fabulous - it contains lots of jewel-encrusted treasures belonging to the Romanovs, including some Fabergé and so is well worth it.
Crowded and hot on a cool day.. The building is something to see as are the artworks but it is very crowded and hot. Wear something cool.
Excellent museum!!. Worth the visit!!! a great museum!!! you need more than 2 days to visit all!!! cant miss it!! its impressive....

If you only see one thing in St. Petersburg, this is a MUST!. Amazing palace rooms and antiquities, impressive collection of art and artifacts from around the world. I would say it might even rival the Louvre (seriously)!

Buy Tickets in Advance - and Arm Yourself with Knowledge, Citizen!. If you learn nothing else from this review, learn this: go to the Hermitage website in advance and buy your tickets there. You'll get a voucher to print off that will double as a "get out of lines, free!" card. Enter via the big, central arches in the middle of the side that faces the big Palace Square.Read about the museum in advance. Know which sections you want to visit. If you want to do the whole thing, then plan to sit early and sit often to pace yourself.Get the guide at the information section before you go through security. I don't care what other information you have with you, GET THE MUSEUM GUIDE. DO IT. I'll wait right here while you go get that guide. You got it? Good. Let me see it. OK, you got it, now we can go in. The guide not only has the most up-to-date information published, it'll also make it easy for the museum staff to redirect you to where you need to go to see what you want to see, seeing as how the museum will rearrange exhibits every now and then...This is a HUGE museum and every tour group in St. Petersburg WILL hit it. My wife and I went straight for the ancient artifacts section and we practically had run of the place for an hour. We loved the ancient stuff and Golden Horde-era exhibits and then we skipped past the 19th century to go to the moderns section. That took three hours, total, and we only saw a third of the museum. A day and a half to *see* everything, and a week to take it all in, if you want to.The architecture of the place is also quite stunning. If you don't like art museums, this place is going to kill you dead. If you *like* art museums, this is mandatory viewing.

Amazing!. We spend there 3 hours and havent seen more than 15%.. so, we have to go there again. There was no problem to buy ticket, we spend with this action no more than 10minutes. Just get ready for crowd of people there and hot air in some rooms.

Fantastic!. Do yourself a favor and hire a guide. Ask your hotel and I am sure they could recommend one. The museum is so large and there is so much to see that you really need someone familiar with the museum, Russian history and they can create an itinerary to suit your interests.

WOW. What an amazing structure. Filled with treasures from everywhere. From DaVinci, to Rafael, to Michelangelo, Rembrandt etc. This place is full of little gems in every room right down to the floors which are just astonishingly well done.If you go visit St Petersburg and don't see the Hermitage than you didn't visit St Petersburg.
russian history. amazing collections-- awesome art and sculptures-- truly unique

Suggest a Saturday afternoon/night visit plus Sunday morning to avoid crowds. We pre purchased two day tickets on the Hermitage website (about a $5 premium each) and started our visit at 6pm on a Saturday- we literally walked right in with zero queue and probably didn't need to purchase ahead. By that late in the evening the crowds were really disappearing, especially in the last hour up til the late 9pm closing on Saturdays. We went back first thing Sunday morning and queued at the gate about 30 min before opening, though the line for ppl who already had tickets was nearly empty and we could have walked right in had we arrived right at opening time.We are casual art goers and walked the entire second floor (the biggest one) in just under 3 hours- you can do this if you are not stopping to closely examine every piece, of course, but we weren't running through it, either. Our main objective was to see all the rooms, which are staggering in and of themselves. The next morning we strolled the entire ground floor and top floor in about 2.5 hours, this time stopping a bit more often in some places because we love antiquities. By the way, they have a great collection of Greek art and the stuff from Siberia is fascinating. Very well preserved textiles from 2500 years ago, just amazing.

3,000,000 exhibits at this Palace Museum.. Spend a few hours, at least 4, to see this spectacular museum. Best if you join a guided toor with an english speaking guide. It's a history lesson, but very enjoyable.
A must see. Crowded almost every day, but a spectacular place to see.
Huge and impressive. Great works of art although it needs at least a day and a half to really see most of it.

Disappointing!. My review deals mainly with the condition of the Museum. The millions of precious, precious paintings and artwork are exposed to filtered sunlight that is streaming from the glass windows. They are not as well preserved as The Louvre in Paris! I asked the guide why and she said there is no money. Maybe that's why they charge $5.00 to take pictures inside. But don't even bother because your pictures will not come out right because of sunspot! The Museum smelled dank, musty like a wet rag and very hot! I developed a severe cough after our visit. I recommend you buy the book and not go on this tour. My shipmates went on the boat tour instead and they said it was more enjoyable than visiting museums!

A MUST-VISIT venue in St.Petersburg !. It was said that to complete the entire art exhibits in the Hermitage, you need at least 3 months !While you may not have that much time or enthusiastically inclined, I would recommend to go early and spend a full day at The Herimtage...Even the non-artistically inclined will marvel at the stupendous range of art pieces, sculptures,...from famous artists. An IBM designed system may help to explain the artwork..I would not recommend bringing hyper-active kids along as it's likely to result in "glossing" over the art display and ruin appreciation of the treasures.Do check out the opening hours as they closes early on eve of Victory Day (9 May). The queue can be and is long. So go early , soak in the art and culture :)

Whatever time you have for this, it will not be enough!. Whatever you expect, this will be better than that! The building(s) are amazing even without the art, but the art is the best in the world. And, if you have a tour guide who can tell stories about how the combinations came to pass (as we did) your experience will be hard to beat!

who needs a review!. this is the most unbelievable over the top place I have ever seen, you MUST see it, the gold, gold gold, the pictures, the rooms, the colors, I can easily understand why the Russian revolution occurred.. this museum is unbelievable.
stunning!!. No words can really express the beauty of this place

A Must-See. Plan what you want to see as this palace is enormous. It is also very crowded in some parts and there are many large guided groups that are difficult to get past. A visit can be trying for your nerves but it is definitely worth it.We were prepared to stand in line for a long time but when we got into the court yard there was a booth immedtiately to your left where you could buy tickets (only cash) and it took us about 10 minutes as there were just two people in front of us. You can only buy 4 tickets at a time at this booth but they bought 4x4 tickets (to sell outside or for their own use?). After having bought our tickets we could just sail past the long line to the ticket office. This way of getting tickets seems to be a new thing as there were very few people trying this but don't hesitate to try it - there are instructions in English as well as Russian.We started with French 20th century art where you can find a lot of paintings that have not been shown in other parts of Europe as there is some controversy about the ownership of many of the paintings. Great paintings if you like Matisse, Cezanne, Gaugain, Renoir etc. We then had lunch in a noisy café in the palace and then we took on "the rest". It is difficult to find your way around so make sure you get a map when you get inside. We spent an entire day in the palace and still there is lots left to see for us.

A Museum in a Palace!. The Hermitage Museum in St. Petersburg, actually occupies several buildings, but Catherine the Great used the Winter Palace to house her art collection. Additional pieces of art were added including pieces from van Gogh, Cezanne, Picasso, da Vinci and pieces from many of the great art masters of the world. I roamed primarily on one floor of the Winter Palace, and I only saw some of the art in some of the rooms as I wandered through ballrooms and up and down royal staircases. If you are an art lover, and appreciate architecture, you will need several days to really appreciate a small piece of what is there. (It is recommended to spend weeks/months to begin to appreciated what is housed here). In the few hours that I had allowed, it barely gave me a snapshot of what this incredible museum held. One word to the wise... go as early as possible, the lines to get in begin early, and the crowds increase throughout the day. Consider an organized tour because they are allowed early entrance (prior to public hours) into the Hermitage which is definitely worth it to avoid the later crowds.
Major Museum on par with Louve, MMA. Very large as are most major museums- similar to MMA (NYC) - give it ample time if you are going to bother with major museums.

Amazing but decide what you want to see. Our family loves art but we don't enjoy the older,darker medieval and Renaissance styles. Once we got to the Van Goghs, Cezannes and impressionists we wished we had saved more time for those. The collection is fabulous but by that time we were getting tired. Just so much to see! If your time is limited, plan ahead!
Hermitage. Went thru @ 25 rooms in @ 2 hrs, incredible beauty, only scratched the surface, want to go back!!

Wonderful building. The Hermitage is definitely one of the best museums in the world and it is an unbelievably large and beautiful building. The reason I only gave it four stars is because of the contents. Don't get me wrong, the contents are fantastic but I expected more Russian material and more material from the time of the Tzars and fewer paintings. It is probably my own fault for not researching it more so I'll blame myself for being a little disappointed. The other thing I did not expect was the displays of other nation's material. I found the exhibits in the Kremlin Armory in Moscow more to my liking. That said, the Hermitage is definitely a Must See. If you haven't bought your tickets on-line make sure you get there early because the lines to get in are huge. We arrived at 0930 and were about 50th in the queue for the gate opening at 1000. Once inside you queue again for the ticket office to open at 1030 but our wait was nothing compared to those who were later. It is not open on Monday.

Do this if nothing else while you are in Saint Petersburg. This is the MUST DO of a trip to Saint Petersburg. This is the art collection in Russia. Over 3 million pieces. If you can arrange it, also do the Storage Tour. I think this is the only museum that allows tours of their storage area. It was amazing.

One of the Best Palace Museums Ever. Undeniably, the Hermitage is one of the most spectacular palace museums in the world. Its collection of art is extraordinarily rich and it is curated expertly and creatively. The parquet inlaid design floors are a work of art in themselves. This is a must see.

Extensive!!. This is good value for money. There is so much to see. A whole room of Rubens, one of Van Dyck etc. The state rooms are fantastic. If you plan to go give yourself the full day, you will need it - and buy your ticket on line. It will save you a long wait to purchase it.

Fairytale setting for Works of Art.. I strongly recommend a "pilgrimage" to the Hermitage with flat shoes and a good, knowledgeable guide. We spent four hours with a group & did not manage to see specific items of interest to us.A remarkable collection.The peacock gold clock in working order is only visible on the DVD. Amazing craftsmanship & engineering.The visa application in the UK is very unwieldy & soul destroying-takes three or four hours to complete.
hermitage. this place was amazing...definitely worth the visit and would like to return

Hermitage, beautiful but overwhelming. What I enjoyed most about this tour was the French Impressionism and Da Vinci paintings. Our Tour took over three hours to go through the museum and that was too long! I enjoy art, but it was overwhelming. We had a tour guide and I think that would be best. There are so many amazing things to do in this city, that in my opinion you don't need two days to go through it, as mentioned in other comments.
Heritage and Art. You must take your time and plan to walk a lot. It is inspiring to see so much treasure in one place.
Excellent tour. The Hermitage museam was a dazzling display of paintings and sculptures from the Masters. We spent several hours there but only scratched the surface.

Fantastic building irrespective of the contents. The scale and opulence of the building. The enterance staircase was breathtaking. The decoration of the walls, floors and ceiling were the equal of the vast collection of well known artits such as Picasso.

One of the Most Beautiful Palaces. This was a great experience. Some of the oldest and finest works of art and wonderful exhibitions of the rooms from Czars. But get your tickets in advace on line or wait over an hour in line to buy your tickets there.

Sumptious!. Buying you two day ticket in advance- on line is a must as the queues are phenomonal.
You need two days as there is a wealth of art and opulence to see.

Beautiful and filled with history. We loved everything about this beautiful place. We did have trouble hearing our guide and some rooms were very crowded. I would recommend seeing this site over two days, especially if you are a senior citizen.

Must-see. I have wanted to see the Hermitage for 20 years and it did not fail to exceed my impossibly high hopes. Give yourself at least 2 days to see the museum and palace (and even that will be at a brisk walk).

You will never have enough time here. the collection (what we saw of it) was breathtaking. We focused on painting from the Renaissance to the 20th Century and while we did not have time to linger - I was struck by the diversity of the collection despite many familiar painters. The palaces that make up the Hermitage are worthy of a visit beyond the beautiful art work. Thank you to Julia from Ulko Tours for guiding us so expertly through this collection.

Splendid and huge---wear good shoes. We spent several hours here, admiring the Da Vinci, Rembrandt, Asian art and Impressionist collections. I will say that this museum takes a second seat to the Met in NY, the British Museum and the Louvre, but I liked it better than the Uffizzi Galleries in Florence. Hire a guide who can get you in early in the morning before the place opens, and then enjoy. This is well woth it, but beware--no Faberge eggs are here anymore. We were told that they are in Moscow.

Just Go. We hired a guide (http://rusincotravel.com) because the Hermitage was one of the reasons we went through the hassle of getting a VISA. The guide is worth the money. The guides get early access so instead of waiting in line for an hour, we were in before 10:30. We were far ahead of the tour busses and a few minutes before the cruise tours. In other words, for about 30 minutes we had the museum to ourselves. The grand staircase, empty. The Russian portrait hall, wide open. The first state rooms, all mine to photograph with only the guard in the room. Things began filling up quickly but not for what seemed a long time. Later we hit the Peacock clock at the time the "Master" was winding it. The private guides were all chatting so the word got out about what seemed to be an unadvertised winding. Our guide was as excited as we were to see it. The museum is a great sense of pride for Russians and our guide loved telling the stories of the palace as well interpreting the artwork. We ate the baguette ham sandwiches in the cafe for lunch which were okay. We stayed six hours.
Great. I liked everything about this and it was a once in a lifetime experience!
Amazing Place. It has so many rooms it is hard to see everything. You would need a few weeks to see all the pieces. Make sure to have a guide!

Avoid the queues. Absolutely stunning building, and wonderful treasures inside. Queues are horrendous in peak season, so try and visit in off-peak, though I suspect it is rarely quiet! Do your homework and ascertain which treasures you want to see, visiting those first, before tackling the more general areas. If you order/purchase additional tickets for the Diamond room or Gold room, make sure that is what you receive BEFORE you turn up!

Among the Best in the World. The museum, a collection of several lavishly appointed and decorated buildings on the shores of the Neva River, is a stunning combination of architectural detail and artistic contributions. The collection of Dutch painters (Rembrandt, Steen, and others) is extensive, but the collection ranges from antiquities (Egypt) to contemporary, with numerous Picassos. While better collections of art may be found in the Louvre, Prado or Metropolitan Museum of Art, it is the luxurious setting in which the art is displayed that makes this one of the top world venues for the lover of art. Certainly, no true afficionado can claim having visited the best art museums without having spent some time in the Hermitage/Winter Palace.
The Second greatest museum in the World. great museum and excellent collection of classic to modern art, can't be missed

Impressive, gorgeous palace. The palace itself is quite impressive and the art inside is fenomenal. Definitely the most complete museum of its kind in the world! However, lines can be very long and the place gets crowded. Avoid peak months and get a guide beforehand.
fantastic museum. Lovely museum, not too crowded, and it has a great bookshop, and cafe too.

The site is massive with so much to enjoy for a very reasonable price. Remember that you need 3 to 5 hours to see all. The dislike are the tour groups who like a huge block takes so much space. The museum around the world just keep some hours just for solo visitors...so we would not feel push around all the time

The best collection in the world. This collection is superb with every conceivable great artist represented plus other historical materials and archeology. The only way to navigate your way amongst the 3 million plus works is by booking a guide. You beat all the queues and see the best of the best.

Way too hot and crowded!. We had great weather in St Petersburg. However inside the museum, it was really hot and way too crowded. So we "blew" through in one hour seeing some the the Hermitages "greatest hits".

Words cannot describe how amazing the Hermitage is. I visited the Hermitage last week with a tour guide. Spent about 2 hrs inside. I've been to the Louvre, Vatican city, Versailles and I must say this is one of the most spectacular and beautiful places I've ever seen. Never have I seen so much gold that my eyes hurt. I wish I could spend more time at the Hermitage and St Petersburg in general. My recommendation would be just go and see and experience it for yourself! It is definitely one of those things you have to do before you die!

A Must See. Plan to spend the day, be awed over and over again, be overwhelmed, and still only see a portion of what is available. Book tickets ahead of time on line for shorter lines and quicker entrance into the museum.

Superb colection of art. First impresion is that Russia at the time was extremly welthy. There are colection from all over the world of world best art. It is hugie. It is important to be well prepared, specialy if you dont have einough time.

Amazing!. What a privilege to see the vast collections. What we were not happy with was because we were on our own, we had to wait in long lines to enter, whereas groups went in as they arrived. This we felt was not fair, because you wasted valuable energy standing in line, and by the time you enter you are already a bit tired.

A Must/Prepare/Two Days. This is the core of any Saint Petersburg visit. The building itself has grand statues all around the building. This immense collection of art is housed in the former palace. The artwork here will exhaust you. There is too much for one day unless you know exactly what you want. The guided tours seem to skip many rooms and hit only the highlights. There is simply not enough time for one day. Prepare for your visit. There are Ipad applications to getting a book or checking the website. Get acquainted with floor plan and works that interest you. Then plan a time schedule. This is very important because you will need breaks. Standing in a museum and processing all this information and art wears you down. Don't make it a marathon. Don't do two days straight. Have an excursion day or relaxing picnic then middle day and let your mind rest. Tickets can be bought for two days via the internet. Buying via the internet is recommended or use a tour where the tickets and lines are specific to you. Tickets can be bought with or without camera usage. Most paintings allow photos without flash. There are some exhibits that prohibit flash.There is a cafe on the bottom floor of the museum that serves sandwiches and drinks. In this area is also the museum stores. There is a coat check and pack storage in the entrance area. No liquids are allowed in the museum. Bring some classical music in you Iphone or Ipod and listen as you admire.Small vendors on the outside hawk souvenirs, snacks, and drinks. Admiralty was the closest Metro stop.

Stunning -- but I would recommend a guide. It really is stunning beyond words -- and far too much, really, to take in during just one day. What is most important in my view is that you hire a guide. There are two reasons: one is that they can get you quickly to the most important rooms and displays; the other is that, at least in our case, our guide purchased vouchers in advance for our day and time, avoiding the long lines that form each morning and providing us the most time to spend inside. Our guide was Irina S. with Tours By Locals -- an amazing woman who in five days in and around St. Petersburg saved us many hours of waiting in lines -- but my point here is that even for people used to traveling independently, contracting a guide in advance provides a huge advantage for the precious time you have at what is arguably one of the world's most stunning attractions.
What can anyone say.. This is Versailles combined with the Louvre. Just crazy. Get a guide. You don't want to wait in line (especially on a rainy day).
When too much art is not enough. So much good art, so little time to see it. Book ahead on the Internet to jump the notorious queues .loved the old imperial apartments.
Worth a visit. Huge place you should be selective in what you see. If you order your tickets early I bought online you can avoid that and gro right in.

Amazing. A must see. Incredible architecture and artwork. Best seen with a guide to ensure you see all of the highlights, but allow yourself plenty of time afterwards to wander around. We spent the best part of the day here. We had lunch in the cafeteria and found it to be reasonably priced.

Fabulous but overwhelming. No need for more comments on the impressive collections, but the crowds and din in the high season are really overwhelming. It is a must to buy ticket vouchers online before going. Try to find a good map and guidebook as it is Very confusing and signage is very poor to nonexistent.

Not only the contents but the building itself.. Unlike many museums the STP Hermitage is housed in a building well worth visiting in its own right. Entrance is free for students (with proof) irrespective of issuing country. Take the audio guide as this explains not only the contents but also describes many of the rooms of the palace. Without it information is very sparse and often only in Russian.
State Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace. Wonderful to walk around, but with thousands of other people, give yourself loads of time to que.

INsanely cool!. What More could you ask for, A place that is so unbelievably over the top as to leave you open mouthed, wide eyed and generally speechless then filled with some of the most iconic art ever crafted by the fair hands of people!!!!
dont forget the 3rd floor, thats where the magic happens!!!

Hermitage Museum. Free on the first Thursday of each month. Get there early to line up, if you want to see everything it will take you the greater part of a day. Extra fee for photographs, even then photography is not allowed in all rooms. On the flipside, where photography was allowed, they didn't check very thoroughly for the photo sticker (I was using my iphone and rarely got stopped)

You just have to visit it before you die. The collection is just amazing, the Flemish paintings, the Italians (for me, the Caravaggio especially), the French impressionists, it goes on and on and on. Get the ticket from the Internet first, print out your voucher and redeem it at the kiosk right after you go through the first gate. With the ticket in your hand, you can ignore the queue and go to the museum entrance straight away, this way you can get into the museum even before the booked tour groups. The museum only has air conditioners for the French impressionists collection, which is quite odd considering the old paintings from the 16th century peobably need tight temperature control more than the 19th century paintings. You are not allowed to bring water with you into the museum, so make sure you have money with you as you are very likely to consume beverages in the museum cafe. (it's not outrageously expensive though)

Best places to visit in St. Petersburg,. Fantastic historical places and art museums, but go with a good travel agency.Do not take White Nights travel agency. Try to read before you go so you can take advantage of those wonderful sites.
a disappointment. fabulous unique paintings poorly presented in small stuffy rooms with no air conditioning. jammed with hard-breathing sweaty tourists....
Excellent. Quite crowded but a world class museum. Can spend days in this place.

Incredible. I loved almost everything about the Hermitage -- the architecture, furnishings, gilded rooms, artworks, and more. The only exception were the crowds that started to develop. If possible, you will have a better experience if you book a tour, as we did, that has early entry to the museum.

Exquisite!. It was truly amazing to visit the Winter Palace residence rooms and those that are now galleries of The Hermitage. We were fortunate to have booked our tour with russiantourguide.com as we had only 6 in our group and could hear the guide's explanations. She was especially good at weaving us through th e masses to see the most important details. She also arranged to get out of the prescribed "tour bus" path to see specific paintings requested by tour mates. The quality of preservation and restoration was amazing... everything looked to be in excellent condition. I could not believe we actually walked across hand inlaid floors made of 18 different hardwoods! I am not an art historian and realize we saw only a small portion of the museum but am very happy that we visited!

Don't miss it! And go with a guide. Hermitage is amazing, a wonderful place that inspires, makes us wow, dream and... tired! It's huge! So go with a guide who understands a lot about art, then she/he would stop at the most important spots and you can cover the visit in within 2/3 hours.
Which way to look. Even if you are not a huge art enthusiast the Hermitage is a must see... combining the grandeur of a Palace with the art of some of great masters

Awe stuck and overwhelmed. The Winter Palace has recently been painted a lovely wintergreen color, and its location on the Neva River in downtown Saint Petersburg is easy to reach. We employed a private guide and she was worth every penny. We visited on a Sunday, not the best day of the week to visit because many other museums are closed and the Hermitage is crowded. Our guide zipped us in ahead of the huge crowds. The three buildings are massive, so it is really only possible to get an overall picture of the architecture and 1 or 2 collections in one day. We concentrated on the architecture and the Impressionists collections. The collections are the most in depth I have ever viewed. There are three galleries of Picassos! The scope of the art work is staggering, and the architecture grand to the point of being overwhelming. I highly recommend employing a guide. It makes your time spent much more effective and productive. This truly is a sight not to be missed!

Be prepared it is tireing. I would suggest that you plan this visit carefully noteing all your main interests,the floor plan and be aware that this place is huge.Try if possible to spend at least two days here as trying to cram it all in on one visit is near impossible.{Visit 2006}

must-go place in Russia. Winter palace is really a treasury of art and luxury. It's full of variety of art masterpiece. And winter palace itself is stunning. Prepare full day there and book ticket advance online (save you lots of ticket queuing time). Also rent an audio guide which provides you with more information and background and highlight of selected masterpiece. Last enjoy!
Must see. One of the biggest museums of the world, collection great, the interiors of the Winter Palace also. Must be seen!
The reason I went to St. Petersburg. Aways very crowded but out guide moved us in and out of key room with ease

HERMITAGE MUSEUM. We choose specific art work that we wanted to see and when we went to other levels and other wings (off from the main areas) we noticed that the crowds seem to disappear. We went after lunch and felt the lines were not that lengthly to gain entrance into the museum.
worth visting. Nice collection of various artists from various countries.

Don't miss the Hermitage!. One of the world's most remarkable art collections is housed in an ornate palace. Make sure you allow plenty of time to see the art around you. The rooms are gorgeous and the art collection is one of the best in the world. Art lovers bliss.
On Tour with Alla Tours. Like everything in the Hermitage - very big, so allow plenty of time and go in the morning for less crowds.

2&1: The palace of Russian Tsars and Museum.. Hermitage is one of the famous museum in the world. Nice to see original paintings by Rembrandt, Titian, Monet, Van Gogh, Matisse etc. also magnificent halls of the Palace such as the Throne Hall and Peter Hall. In order not to waste time in the line to the ticket-office, I bought the ticket on-line on the museum site (the price include the photography) http://www.hermitageshop.org/page.php?pagename=tickets.

Plan ahead. It is an absolutely huge place. The guide will tell you that somebody calculated that if you spend 5 seconds in front of each piece and take no breaks it will take you 9 years to see it all (19 years with breaks). So read a guide book and plan ahead what you want to see and where it is. It depends on what you like but the Impressionists, the Rembrandts, the 2 Da Vincis are a must and you will probably also enjoy the throne room and, if you like history the malachite room and the little white dining room where the Kerensky government was arrested by the Bolsheviks. Don't overdo it and you will get information overload.

i can compare it with louver in paris. every things is unique , and there is temperrary exipition hall that when i visited was the Tylos Exipition (bahrain) in this hall.you should take a guide with u our going with group faster and the guide can help u alots.

Best museum ever. Probably one the best museum i have ever been to in terms of its historic value ( it used to be the winter palace of the Tsar ) and because the amount of stuff they have in there even a week is not enough to see them all

Hermitage Museum. It is without a doubt one of the best museums I have ever seen. The art is phenomenal & you really need to spend more than a day there. We had to queue for two hours to get in and were pushed around while entering which was an unpleasant experience

Remarkable In Every Way. Truely a showcase of masterpieces. If you are in Russia, you want to see The Heritage. You will be in awe by the art yet saddened by the stories. We were able to visit in the evening when crowds were manageable as part of a tour package -- well worth the price.

Heritage Museum. Need plenty of time and get there early. Extremely well presented. Because of its size it can be a little hard to find your way around. Easy walking around city centre and river side.
Amazing...Wonderful !!!. The best atraction in St Petersburg !!! I just love this wonderful museum and its works of arts!!! One of the best collection in the world !!!
beautiful. Get there right at opening to avoid crowds. Many beautiful and unique works displayed well.

Art=Excellent, Overall Museum Experience=Pretty Awful. 1. PURCHASE YOUR TICKETS ONLINE BEFORE YOU GO TO SKIP THE MONUMENTAL LINES!Way finding and people management are, truly, a nightmare at this museum. The art is fabulous, of course, but get ready for tons and tons of tour groups clogging every doorway, stairway, corridor, shop, etc. And remember to bring your patience.We bought a two-day pass online, which made it easier to pace ourselves and reduce our frustration level.
Too much too little time.. How do you see one of the world's greatest museums in 3 hours.Elena with Alla Tours will give it a shot. We did our best. Without her we couldn't have seen all we did.
The second largest art collection of the world. What to say more about this museum that gathers the second largest art collection of the world. It has a piece of all.
Wonder of theWorld. Did not have time to see it all, but it has just opened a new exhibition of artefacts dug up in Bahrain, very interesting indeed

Overwhelming!. Apparently, you'd need at least a decade to see a snippet of each item so don't expect to be able to see everything. The building itself is enough of a treat - the art almost being a bonus.Be sure to respect their rules. When they say no flash photography - they mean it. So, if you're fond of your camera - DON'T! The people working in the each room can possibly lose their jobs if they allow a breach of the rules, so abuse of the "no flash" rule is taken VERY seriously. Just admire the art whilst in there instead. The place is huge and hectic and it's all quite an experience. We even saw Hilary Clinton!Amazing.

Spectacular!. One of the top museums in the world. Loved seeing original works of legendary artists such as DaVinci, Monet, Picasso, etc...... The detail and beauty of the palace can only truly be experienced by seeing it in person. Pictures can not do justice to the beauty of this place.

Wish we had two days and stronger legs. Amazing state rooms - more opulent than most palaces in Western Europe. The masterpieces just go on and on. We spent 9 hours there and would like to have had another day. This is not to be missed!

Beyond belief. The beauty of the workmanship was not to be believed! The amber room was extraordinary. Walls, floors and decor showed the gems and the craftmanship of a proud people. The palatial rooms and even the stables were magnificent. we felt we were part of a Russian novel.
Amazing, but get there early!. Definitely a highlight, but you really want to get there as early as you can, because it gets very crowded, at least in the summer.
maybe too many things,. The Museum is gigantic, maybe with too many things, and certainly too many people on the spot. I advice to reserve tickets on line, so to avoid the queue.

AMAZING. If you only get to visit one place in St. Petersburg, this should be the place. The Hermitage is huge, so grab a map and figure out your plan of attack. Multiple days are recommended. There are two cafés, but they're on the main floor only. If you have a partner hotel with the Hermitage or buy your ticket in advance online (can take up to three days, so do it before you leave), you can skip the long lines.
Amazing!. Make sure you pre-book your tickets on line, saves waiting in the queue. A very reasonable price for all there is to see, just magnificent!
not to be missed. spectacular. After St. Petersburg sights everything just pales. Bigger and better
Amazing!. You just cannot miss this place! Somehow it is sad - so many people suffered while some people had all the fortune and money...

Overwhelming art collection. This museum has so many pieces that only a small set can be displayed at any one time. The collection ranges from old masters (obtained by the empress Catherine) through modern art. You could get up close and personal with Degas, Egyptian mummies, and everything in between.
Pay extra for a tour of the gold and treasure rooms.
Fascinating. Incredible works of art. Get the iphone app, and the audioguide- both are well worth it

The grandeur can be believed only if you see it.... This is a place for all....laymen, travellers,children,historians,art lovers.......I doubt if anybody could be bored.....Art lovers would love it ....every generation painting and sculptors can be found here......i think you could spend days here....not to be missed on a visit to St.Pete.

Massive and beautiful - watch for pickpockets. The collections were extensive and nicely displayed and organized. I was thankful to have a guide as I only had a few hours - you could spend days here. Our guide warned us of pickpockets at this venue and sure enough- a young woman (who looked like a nicely dressed tourist) managed to unzip my purse (which I was clutching to my chest) with a device. Luckily I noticed before she had the chance to go further and she slipped instantly into the crowd when I looked her in the face.

blew me away. I thought this would be ok, but it was way more than that. Just looking at the real signatures of all the artists was cool. tip- don't go with a big tour group, it's crowded enough. If you can't go in with just a few friends, hire a private guide that knows the place. They can move you through the rooms and avoid crowds.
Outstanding. This would have to be the largest and most spectacular museum I have ever been to, definitely worth purchasing tickets online as the queues are always incredibly long.

Make Several Visits. It is the main attraction of the city and is a huge place. Buy your ticket on the Internet to avoid the long lines and go many times. You won´t be able even to scratch its surface on one or two days. Do a favor to your legs. Make several visit,as much as possible and do not stay there more than three hours each time!!!
An unbelievable venue. Everything, we could not take it all in but we got to see everything that we wanted. a once in a lifetime experience
outstanding. we saw a taste of Hermitage We toured for 2 hours .Our guide showed us some of the more famous exhibits. TJ Travel provided tour and they were amazing
Visit organised by Alla tours. In a small party great able to see and hear details,

Must see!. Like the Pushkin in Moscow, the Hermitage has an amazing collection of art seldom, if ever, seen even in photographs in the West. The Impressionist collections are especially noteworthy.
As others have written, it's dreadfully overcrowded -- if you can get a behind the scenes tour before or after hours, do it.

Awesome palace and museum. We could have spent days in this spectacular venue. I saw Versailles only a week before and the Hermitage is far superior in my estimation. It has the art gallery quality of the Louve and palace features equal or better than Versailles. We waited for 1 1/2 hours for each visit, but it was not crowded inside. My recommendation is plan your visit and buy tickets online before arriving. I would also recommend 2 visits a couple of days apart. We went for 2 hours the first day and 6 hours the next. In preparing for the second visit we used the iPad App as a guide - fantastic.
Super!. It is a must in St. Peterburg - totally worth seeing! Take minimum 4-5 hours for the place

A must see art, gold, jewelry, statues, furniture, architecture, etc.,. If you are on a tour they will hurry through to the standard admission highlights. There will be hundreds looking at them at the same time if you go during the high season. Go in the off-season and you can possibly relax. The place was very busy and it was only May.If you are on your own plan, plan, plan if there are specific things you want to see - the place is huge and a maze. I only got to spend 10 min at the Canova sculptures because I spent 30 minutes on the Roman copies of sculpture downstairs.I arrived at 9:30 they open at 10am. All the guided tours got preference to go in. I was in by 10:30 for 400r. The tickets for the Jewels Tour was sold out. Probably bought up by the tours so buy your ticket ahead of time. I did get a tour of the Gold Collection for an additional 300r and it was fabulous.The architecture ornamentation in some of the rooms are spectacular and be sure to bring a spare battery because you may need one if you plan on taking many pictures.I won't go into the collections you can see them online but buy the DVD ($10) because it is an incredible two hour excellent presention.

Amazing!!!!! Hire a private guide!!!. Loved visiting the Hermitage. Hired a private guide which was worth it. No waiting on line and able to get a wonderful tour. Irina was the best guide ever! Be ready to walk!!!!
Breath-taking. A fabulous place with fabulous things, staffed by the most miserable people I have ever come across anywhere in the world!

Breathtaking. The museum is gorgeous... the ceilings had us transfixed. The rooms , the fixtures are so beautiful. The grandeur of a royal palace really comes through. Apparently they display just 5% of the entire lot they have. 2 Vinci potraits, 26 Rembrandts!! Keep an entire day for the trip at a minimum. And go long long before the museum opens -- or u will be standing in a long q to just enter the museum. Dislike : humongous crowds!! but what do u do -- they are as much entitled to see the museum as u are...:) :)
Caution - Siberia. Be careful, don't touch anything. You may get a one way ticket to Siberia.
A day is not enough. Huge and superb, stunning art works crammed into a vast museum, 'hidden treasures' read stolen booty
Beautiful Hermitage. Incredible art collections and a beautiful interior. I cannot imagine how splendid it must have been prior to 1917.

Beautiful Hermitage and Collection. Wonderful place and art. Building was beautiful and art collection was the best we have ever seen anywhere. Crowds were not bad and our guide was wonderful I Travel SPB Agency from Saint Peterburg.

must see!!!. It is just amazing. I visited Hermitage just 2 months after the palaces of Habsburg dinasty in Vienna and I must to say that there is fantastic difference. The Habsburgs were very modes comparing to Romanovs :)
Great Place. In Russia.... seemed like nothing was made in Russia. Great collection though.

Amazing!. Having been to both The Met and Louvre, The Hermitage did not disappoint. We spent an amazing two and half hours at the museum with a tour guide. Be prepared for heavy crowds and large tour groups but worth the effort.

Great collection. Use a guide and don't go in a big group. Discuss with the guide what you're going to see and be restrictive. Otherwise it's too much. You wouldn't do the whole of the Britihs Museum plus the V&A in one day either, would you?

The details make this memorable. As you enter donning booties over your shoes is mandatory to protect the floors. Onward to grandeur.The art is impressive but a far second to the building itself. The ceilings, floors, and doors may just be the real attraction. The work of the artisans is stunning. These features are ornate and each room is different. As you walk through you will notice influence of the Sistine Chapel in one hallway. I found all I had rad about this building and city to prepare me well. The elegant French lines in architecture fill the city and are the appetizer to the visual feast of this museum.
Incredible. The most incredible art collection in Europe in the most extraordinary setting

Wonderful collection , superbly displayed. The site is the Winter Palace, scene of historic events in the history of Europe, the collection is housed in building evoking those times and events. Tastefully displayed art from various eras, one can easily spend two days or more looking through the art works, paintings, sculptures and visualise the various epochs they signify.Plenty of light, airy rooms, visitor amenities and souvenirs to be had, it is a visual treat.Some of the most famous and unique art works from the Impressionist and Post Impressionist periods all accessed thru the magnificient Ambassador Staircase and a host of stately assembly rooms, the Pavilion, Field Marshall hall, the Czarina's personal assembly rooms and more.

Allow plenty of time to visit. If you buy your ticket online you avoid the queues but pay slightly more. This was worthwhile as queues seem to move slowly. The museum is incredible, with art divided into countries. A two-day pass is available which is a good investment as otherwise it is a lot of art to try and take in in one day!
glorious. Go early in the morning for your comfort.. Camera is free, no need to take a sticker from the counter.

Awesome! Buy tickets online to avoid 2-3 hour lines. Buy your tickets at the Hermitage site to avoid the super long lines. You stop at a kiosk and then can walk right in. Wear comfortable shoes because you do a LOT of walking. Stash your water bottles, because drinks aren't allowed.

amazing. An absolute must -- even more amazing than we expected. Recommend visiting the museum with a private guided tour with Peters Walks. The museum is incredible (the art, the architecture and the people watching) and Dmitry our guide was one of the best we've had anywhere we've visited in the world. This was our favorite activity in St P and exceeded the hype.
2 Day St. Petersburg Experience. Can't possibly see all of this in a reasonable time. What we saw was spectacular.

Get ready for the maddening herds of people!. Amazing architecture and a great trip through the halls of art history.....We spent six hours touring one day and could have used another few days to see all the treasures here.

Easy way to enjoy the Museum:). Visit the Hermitage site beforehand and:1/ check the opening hours and events calendar - you may find, for example, Santiago Calatrava's exhibition (-plan your visit better-)2/ get the floor plans (-not to be lost-)3/ buy e-tickets (-not to spend hours in a queue-)4/ make a plan! (-'see them all' not a good idea-)Now choose a date and enjoy!

Beautiful. St Petersburg was one our favourite places this museum is beautifully decorated and has some beautiful paintings and sculptures. We spent hours walking through the many corridors in this beautiful palace. A must see on your visit.

The scale is unbelievable. Russia just wants to be the biggest and best. They certainly have outdone themselves with this attraction and whilst it is an amazing spectacle (for what one can cram in a few hours) there is something disturbing about how it all came to pass.

A stunning art collection marred by the uncontrolled crowds - and I was part of them!. This was our second visit to St Petersburg, the first in 1986 just after Chernobyl blew up and when the Soviet Union was hanging on under "Glasnost". Intourist controlled all foreign tourist trade and that did mean we got preferential entrance to the glorious Hermitage. Crowds were smaller and better controlled so we marvelled at the Da Vincis and later the French Impressionists without jostling or rush. Not anymore. Thousands are disgorged each day in the summer season from cruise ships and bus loads are dumped at the museums to be herded round these magnificent collections and wonderfully restored palaces which were nearly obliterated in the World War II siege. Meantime outside in the rain on the day we were there as part of a small tourist group, and by chance it was the main public holiday weekend of the year celebrating Russia Day, ordinary Russians again were queuing quietly around the block the old Winter palace occupies by the river. No change for them; a huge change for all who eventually get inside. Crush, push, shove and some masterpieces badly displayed. Go on a quiet day or after the cruise ship tours have left for the day.
Fabulous. This museum is one of the best in the world, and you need several days to see it properly. You need to download a map and plan your tours.
Outstanding Beauty. I have never seen so many excellent displays of art and decor!
BEAUTIFUL. Of course this is a must see. Gorgeous and lovely art.

You need more than a Day!!. We visited on a Saturday, a wet Saturday, it seemed that the world had tried to get into the entrance area. After negotiating the turn style we were guided up the very impressive staircase. We stood in amazement as our guide described the relevant points of interest. On entering the main part of the original palace we appeared to have much more space and were able to move freely. We were expertly guided to all the famous artists and rooms of interest in about 2 hours. It was a bit of a route march. If u have limited time then a guide is a must, if u have plenty of leisure time then you could easily spend many days in there. The rooms are warm to protect the art so dress lightly. Heavy coats, umbrellas etc have to be checked in. A must visit!!

allow plenty of time to make the visit worthwhile. can be very busy so allow sufficient time to wander at will or if you wish to see specific attractions then plan your visit in advance/allow extra time

Stunning. If you are in St. Petersburg, this is the museum that you MUST see! The artwork and architecture are remarkable.I suggest that you do some research beforehand if there is one area that you are most interested in seeing. The museum is immense! Be sure to include the winter palace in your tour--amazing to stand where the czars stood. Try to get there as the museum opens--it gets crowded very quickly. If there is any way to get there before the tour buses arrive, you will be at a great advantage.Be aware that you will have to check coats and bags, so if you want to avoid that line, travel light! no large pocketbooks or backpacks.

Visited this amazing City with the help of SPB Tours. We have just returned from a wonderful Holland America Baltic Cruise. We were a group of seven Canadians who believed that visiting St. Petersburg would be a major highlight of this trip. As a result, I looked into several tours from HAL and other companies, and, after much research, we chose SPB Tours operating out of St. Petersburg. From day one, when I first contacted them via email, I received prompt replies in impeccable English. We wanted a very small group, with a maximum of ten, which we ended up with, as we wanted to see as many sights as possible during our two days. They made it very simple to 'sign up', and they arranged our visas and the required tickets to get us through Russian Immigration Control. We were met just outside by the owner, Viktoria Rother and our lovely guide, Natalya. We had two amazing days, in spite of some high winds and rain that resulted in the cancellation (and partial refund) of the canal and hydrofoil boat rides. Natalya was extremely knowledgeable, experienced and delightful. We saw all of the highlights of St. Petersburg, including the amazing subway system and an early visit to the Hermitage, plus Peterhof and Catherine's Palace. We ate in two local restaurants, and it's true that the meat and fruit pies are absolutely delicious. I could go on and on about this tour. We all felt that it was the very best 'bang for our buck' and all ten of us were extremely satisfied. As our group organizer, I was a bit nervous about arranging all of this but it turned out to be more than worth it. A lot of other ship mates were quite disappointed with Russia and I think that was directly related to the tour they took.  On our cruise, we took a number of other tours and were very disappointed. While they were efficient, we were travelling with groups of over 30 and a lot of time was spent getting on and off buses. (The only line up we encountered was at Catherine's Palace, thanks to SPB's scheduling.). All in all, we are so glad we took this tour. I wish we had signed up for their tours in Tallinn and Helsinki. And, for those of you who might worry about missing the ship, we were back on board well before many of the 'Guaranteed' tours. These local companies cannot afford to risk missing the ship deadline, although if it were to happen, the ferry to Helsinki would have been an easy option. Thanks again to Vika and Natalya!

Winter Palace. This was difficult to do on your own as communication is a problem. It would help if they had explanations of what you were seeing in other languages. Do this with a guide we are sorry we didn't.

Unmissable. The Hermitage is un-missable for anyone who is interested in art, culture, historic buildings... The palace rooms are amazing.- so much gilding, sparkling chandeliers, patterned wood floors... but the art... What an amazing collection of paintings..., old masters and impressionists can't fail to impress. Sculptures too... You will not have enough time to see all the collections but choose what you want to see to help plan your visit. Free printed location Map/guides are available in english. Expect big queues, especially for the Rembrandt room, the Leonardo da Vinci paintings etc. If you go with an organised tour, try to pick one which starts before official opening hours. At least you will get a quicker start.
Wonderful. Nothing to dislike here - amazing collection - Too much to see in one day
The Hermitage.. The incredible size of the art collection, the beautiful building. Having been to the Prado and the Louvre, it is larger and more impressive.

The delights of the Hermitage. On our previous visit in April 2010 we visited the Hermitage four times so this trip was a reprise with favourite rooms an artefacts ear-marked. If you go anywherein St Petersburg this is the place to go. Utterly wonderful.

Okay, I'm a Snob about this. The Hermitage contains what is largely agreed to be an astounding collection of Western art. Further, the Hermitage is on everyone's 'to visit' list. This includes every tourist and every school child within eighty degrees of longitude. It is NOT air conditioned (thus likely endangering the portraiture) by decree of the Grand Poo-Bahs of Heritage and Preservation Wizardry.There is really no theme other than for the third floor concentration of impressionists.Accordingly: HOT, CROWDED, immense and offering endless portraits of meaningless, unattractive and often badly painted nobles. Fighting from within this mass are an astounding number of wonderful works. Roller skates and a self-cooling body suit are musts here. Acquisition of a 'rude tour group and student gaggle' stun ray would be desireable as well. (I wonder at the prevailing view that merely exposing fourteen - year - olds to fine art is beneficial.) Overall, an ordeal to be endured for admittedly wonderful snippets of the very best in Western art.

The Hemotage. We spent quite a few hours walking by ourselves and having the audio guide. The audio guide is very good. It is difficult to see all of the museum, it rquires several days to do that, so choose which sections you want to concentrate on. Don't miss the Leonardo de Vinchi paintings
This is a must to see.. If you must see one place in this city this is it. Spectacular, interesting. Be ready to say wow! many times. It embraces a culture and also history.
St. Petersburg, Russia. Wonderful and facinating place.....yes! A must see tour with Alla Tours and Angie as your guide. It was an amazing experience. the palaces and churches were sights to behold.
humongous, but great. give yourself ample time, like a full day...and try to avoid the tours,if it is too crowded in a room, come back to it..

Why, you must!. Simply gorgeous, end to end. To save time, use the headset and go to the rooms with narration. If you have only one day, this will be most helpful to see the main attractions. But if you can, go on two days. (We were not able to!) It is I think better than Versailles (which I have been to twice) in terms of the state rooms--everything fresh and bright to the eye. In June it was not super crowded, either. Such a special place.Order your voucher online before you go so you can avoid the wait in line. Also be sure to purchase the photo tag. You will want to photograph everything!

Amazing. None of our group is the sort that will spend hours in an art gallery.....but the Hermitage is so spectacular that we spent two afternoons here. Not just for the art, but also the state rooms (and all the other rooms) and the museum pieces. Brilliant, just brilliant. Go early or late in the day to miss the worst of the crowds.
Do not miss. It was brilliant, although there is a lot to see, and you won't see all of it in one trip.
Hermitage. It cannot be seen in a 2 hour tour; iti s too large. We felt rushed on the tour and suggest a tour highlighting a few exceptional items to view.

This has to be in the top 5 buildings/museums in the world.. The Hermitage collection of buildings and art works in St Petersburg in Russia has moved into my personal top five.That one person could inspire such building and collecting is breathtaking, despite the cost. The architecture, the gardens, the pictures, the furniture - quite overwhelming.I especially enjoyed the French impressionists and post impressionists. I just had to sit down in one room and let the Matisse works wash over me. A huge "Dancers".Taken in its social context, the Hermitage gives rise to many, many interesting questions. See what you think.Give yourself lots of time as the whole thing is huge. Good ancillary facilities cafe, shop, etc.Not friendly for wheelchairs. One of our party had a hard time with this.
Hermitage and Winter Palace. Those paintings are superb Wish we had more hours to spend!

Fabulousity at its Finest. Plan to spend an entire day at the Hermitage. The palace is breathtaking, even despite the crowds. Don't feel rushed by the onslaught of people, but take your time to capture the beauty of the place and its rich history. Bring an umbrella as the city is known for its grey skies and rain, but once inside relax and enjoy the splendor.
Gorgeous. If your are not into art it is still worth visiting. The winter palace is spectacular. The Hermitage has an amazing selection of art.

A Guide will help if you have limited time!. We were fortunate enough to have a private guide which helped with our limited time. She was able to speed us through for all the top sights - which are many. Art by top masters like Raphael, Da Vinci, and Michelangelo were amazing. Rooms were beautiful and the wood and marble flooring awesome. Definitely a must do when you are there. 3 hours minimum even with a guide.
Great Hermitage Museum Tour. Our guide was an art historian and brought "life" to the masterpieces and artists that we viewed. Time was all too short to see such a massive collection.
Magnificent. The most beautiful Palace in the world. It is truly amazing.
Just magnificent. One museum that could take years to see! We even had a night for ourselves to hear the Saint Petersburg Orchestra. Just magical!

Hermitage Museum - too much for one visit. The Hermitage was stunning in so many ways. The Impressionists were outstanding and I enjoyed seeing some Matisse and Picasso and Gaugin that I had never seen in person before. Though the museum was very crowded in some areas, I thoroughly enjoyed my visit.
Excellent. The collection in the Hermitage is huge and outstanding. You can only visit a small portion in a limited time, but it is well worth the visit.

A must see. Some tips.. The Hermitage is a must see. Tips: - Buy your tickets online as the queue is horrendous. It is slightly more expensive, but the queue does not move that quickly, and you will be out in the open most of your queueing time. We prebought our tickets - no queue. My aunt decided to go back again for a 3rd day - she got there at 10:20am (opens 10:30am) and did not make it to the front of the queue till 11am. To convert your internet voucher for tickets, go to the booth just inside the main entrance gates to the Hermitage (before the queue lines for the ticket offices) - there is a sign on it that says "Internet tickets" or something of that sort. - General tour. Useless, don't do it. Seriously. I think it would be much better to pick up an audio guide (quite good) or one of the locals offering guiding services just inside the museum. I thought the general tour would give some information about the decoration/rooms of the museum etc but the guide was really quite terrible. - Gold room tour. Very short (30min), not bad, but please be aware that the Gold Drawing Room is room 304 and not part of this tour. This is gold etc recovered from burial hordes, and diplomatic gifts given to Russia. There is only one English tour a day. - Diamond room tour. 1hr, some overlap with the Gold Room tour. There is only one English tour a day. I didn't do it, but my aunt did and said it was okay. She enjoyed doing it in addition to the Gold room tour. - To buy your English tours, you have to take your normal entrance tickets, and step in front at one of the ticket counters inside (where the people who haven't bought tickets are queuing to buy tickets) and tell them you want to buy the e.g. Gold room tour tickets. You will look rude, but this is what the information people inside tell you to do, not to join the queue. Also, we didn't experience this, but people we met said the first teller told them there were no more tickets, but then they asked again at a second ticket counter (why, I don't know) and managed to get tickets to the tour. - The cloakrooms are outside where you "enter" with your ticket into the museum. Once in, you can't come out and back in again, so make sure you have taken your guidebook etc in with you. No water/ food permitted but this seems a little hard to enforce - I think they take away obvious bottles, but my bottle of water was in my handbag, and both days it went through the scanner without any issues. - The museum is closed on Mondays, so if you buy a 2-day combination ticket and go on Sunday, the second day on your ticket is Tuesday. We didn't make it to any of the other musuems on the ticket other than the Winter Palace of Peter I (not that great an attraction). - The musuem floorplan/map handout doesn't really mention the good highlights of the collection, so I would recommend that your bring your own guidebook or pick up a copy of a Hermitage guidebook to help you along. Information ladies should be able to tell you where each highlight painting/ room is located. - The lighting of the pieces is not fantastic for viewing, unfortunately. Ah well. In my opinion, the Vatican is better than the Hermitage, but if you haven't been to the Vatican yet, the Hermitage is very good.

A must visit again (and again). The Hermitage presents the artworks in a way attracting you to appreciate, which in this aspect is over and above Louvre and British Museum. I realize afterward (by reading the Hermitage guide book) that the New Hermitage was purposely designed and built to display artworks in various size and nature. Impressive! I'm not a big fan of artwork or antique, but I'm sure I'll return if I visit st. Pete again. It's an attraction which could spend you a week.Tips: It's impossible to see the whole Hermitage in a day or two, probably you may bring back a copy of the Hermitage guidebook to continue your journey.

Taken early by spb tours with excellent guide and saw it at its best. We got in early and so were ahead of the crowds. It was quite simply stunning and we all really enjoyed out trip to The Hermitage. The state rooms were fabuous and the collection of art work is outstanding. We did buy a sandwhich in the cafe at the end which was truly dreadful. Wish we had purchased a bottle of wate when we got inside as very thirsty at end of 3.5 hours.
Art overload. Fantastic but worth deciding in advance what you want to see as trolling the corridors would take a week and then you would miss something.

buy a ticket online to skip the queue. We spent seven hours split over two days, just in the main building. I agree that it is hard to find your way, even with a map, so I'm not sure how much we missed -- certainly a lot. But what we did see: Rembrandt, Gauguin, Degas. Wow. Don't forget to look at the museum itself, and not just the "stuff" in it. We booked our two-day tickets online and skipped the very long queue.

Amazing. What an amazing place to visit!Its truly worth while seeing the grandeur of the place and the artwork that is there. You will need a minimum of half a day (rushing) but if you have time, take a day to visit this fantastic place.You can buy your ticket online which is worthwhile as the queues are horrendous. Bring your voucher to the information desk (pass the ticket booth) and the person at reception will write something on it. Then you will need to bring it to the booth to redeem your voucher. You will be told which ticket booth to go to.
Excellent but poor navigation. I loved the building but getting around without being overwhelmed by large tour parties was annoying. More navigation and signage please
The Hermitage. Certainly a beautiful place and also understandable why the revolution was such a success, What oppulence

beautiful and awe inspiring. Such beauty throughout. spent the most time in the Gold Room not by choice as it was a guided tour arranged by the museum. Did not have time to see as much as would have liked in an afternoon
Not to be missed!. An absolute must. Amazing, phantastic, exciting! Make sure to buy your tickets in asvance on the internet, otherwise wait in line for at least one hour!

Very impressive collections but take care of your belongings!. We feel this is one of the 2 must visit places in St. Petersburg. Unfortunately we were given only 2 hours here in our guided tour which everyone felt was not enough. One should have at least a complete half day here to enjoy the vast collections in this museum. The restos inside do not carry much choices and the quality of food is not that good so it is advisable to have a full meal elsewhere before enjoying the museum. Many different kinds of people visit this museum and it can be crowded at times so just like in all crowded places, take good care of your belongings when inside as we were warned that many thieves and pickpocketers make their living here.
Great collection. The museum has a great collection and you can easily spend the day there going through each rooms. However, the queue can be long so it is worthwhile to pre-book or go there early.
Stunning!. So impressed with the building, and all the exhibits inside! Wonderful entrance hall and it just keeps going!

A must see. Huge place and lots of tourists but our guide showed us the main rooms then took us to see some of the art that she liked and suggested artists that would interest us so that it didn't become an overwhelming experience.

Opulence you'll rarely find anywhere else. One word - extravagance. Each room will have you gaping in wonder at how such a style was originally demanded by the ruling class, and at how it has since been maintained. Make sure you visit the impressive modern art on the upper floor too - a great selection of Picasso, Matisse and others, which was less crowded than the throngs of visitors in the palace.TIP: buy your tickets online, print out form and take ID - just as you enter the palace gates there is a booth which will exchange your print-out for tickets. This will save you alot of time (saved us at least an hour of queuing).

Winter Palace 5, Hermitage 3. The Winter Palace is an amazing place to tour like Versailles or Catherine's Palace. The Hermitage art will disappoint those looking for real Russian art (that is in the State Russian Museum). The Hermitage is all European master art which is excellent but not Russian. Very crowded. The Gold Room, containing jewelry and personal items from the Czar's family, tour is worth the extra cost and must be prebooked.
Be Selective!!. This is a wonderful place to visit but read up on it before you go and be selective on what you want to see as there is just too much!!

DO NOT visit during Cruise Season!. This is probably one of the top museums in the world, set in the luxurious surrounding of the Palace. The colelctions are magnicient.Two big criticisms: in high cruise season, the place is over-run by masses of tour groups marching through, and you must fight to see the collections. The other complaint is that you must use a 2 day ticket on consecutive days, when you really need a day of rest in between!We would definitely not plan our next visit during the summer as this beatuiful town is over-run with tourists!
Amazing. This simply IS the most beautiful museum in the world. Sorry Louvre, but the Hermitage surpasses you.
Wonderful. Absulutely huge, but our guide showed us a good selection in all areas. Can't believe the lack of security of some of the great masterpieces!

Get ready to be amazed.. What to not like, this is one of the worlds greatest Museums it is staggering I. It's sheer size and it's contents. Just be sure you go with a tour company who can get you in before it opens to the public.

Hermitage Museum. Very interesting and breathtaking . Allow enough time to view all the public rooms. Make sure you are given the map of the buildings when you go in and have your guide mark a location on the map to meet if you get separated.

Overwhelming. So many things to see, so little time....
Whatever artefacts and artwork you manage to fit in, the rooms themselves are worth the entrace fee alone!
Hermitage. Absolutely worth the visit, but go early to avoid long lines for tickets.
Avoid the crowds. Amazing rooms and pieces, but get a local guide to show you around and avoid the crowds. Buy tickets in advance, or you'll queue for hours.

A Must See!. Two days in St. Petersburg as part of a cruise was not nearly enough, especially when you could easily spend that much time in The Hermitage alone. This attraction was amazing! I highly recommend using a skilled tour guide, which I was lucky enough to have. In the time we had, she chose various highlights to show us without making us feel rushed. The Hermitage was definitely one of the high points of the city.
