It's HUGE. Oh lord. This place is IMMENSE, yet they still only display a fraction of the art that they possess. Best to go in with a game plan, as one could spend days there. Gorgeous building. And because it's so large, it's not overly crowded. A few rooms were closed when I was there, which was unfortunate, but more than enough rooms open to keep me occupied.

Incredible Collection but Crowded. My husband and I just returned from a two week river cruise in Russia which began in St. Petersburg. We visited The Hermitage on a guided tour along with seemingly millions of other tourists. To my surprise, photography in the museum was permitted which meant that folks taking pictures pushed in front of others to get their shot, sometimes even using flash at very close range. Unfortunately, this made it difficult for anyone to really appreciate the priceless treasures we were viewing. And so, I came home thrilled to have visited such a prestigious museum but disappointed in the "teaser" half day tour and the annoying tourists who invaded my space.

Make sure you see the third floor!!. Absolutely huge and slightly over-whelming. After spending many hours wondering around the lower floors we were planning to leave when we realised we had not seen the third floor. We very nearly missed it but so glad we didn't as this was where all the 1900 painters were, it's a little tricky to find the correct stairs and a map is definitely helpful. By far the best art gallery I have visited.
Too little time!. This collection must be one of the biggest in the world but it also seems to attract the biggest crowds - more like going to a football match. So much to see - we felt a bit rushed

Time well spent!. I guessed we were quite lucky as there was no line on the day when we visited (got there at 1045am whilst it opens at 1030am) and got our tickets immediately which we reserved on the internet. We read that if you have tickets booked through the internet, you will be allowed to jump the queue to go straight to the ticket booth. I guess we did not need to use it. Amazing, starting from the Jordan Staircase, all the beautiful statesroom to the glamorous Gold and Diamond Rooms (extra ticket required) which is one of our highlights – no photos allowed – you see all the amazing jewels and precious stones and watches etc with a guide (except Farberge eggs – which are mostly in Moscow, not St Petes). Definitely try to go early and book early as places are limited and visits are by the hour. We had a fantastic guide who was very dedicated, wanting to share so much about the details of all the major pieces and we spent 1.5 hours with her. All the rooms we visited were great in architecture and art pieces and not so crowded on the day that we visited. The cafe was nothing to shout about and small too, so I can imagine that it can really be very packed during the peak months – so plan to bring a sandwich to save time and costs too (there is a Stolle pie shop at the corner of Nevsky Prospekt). I wish that they would spend more effort on the gift shop – quite a good selection of gifts and cheaper than most tourist sites gift shops (eg delicate Farberge eggs) if you have the patience to plough through the showcases. Everyone in the museum were friendly and helpful. Also, you need to get everything done before you exit through any gate/ door of any building. You will not be allowed in anymore – just one entry per ticket. We really forgot and left the main entrance, realizing that the gift shop was within the main entrance. We have to explain and I guess they figured out we could not have been cheating on the ticket when the museum was going to close in an hour. Overall, a worthwhile visit!

Amazing treasures but the tours are too long. Certainly full of art, treasures etc but it would be nice to do alone or just for a short tour. The guides seem to try to swamp with facts and after a while I switched off.
Fascinating. Huge number of high quality exhibits.Very Crowded

Lovely atttraction! One of the best in St petersburg.. You cannot miss this attraction when you go to St Pettersburg Russia!its amazing, very accessible. They gave us a weelchair for my grandad.Collection of art is spectacular.
THE place to see in St Petersburg. If for no other reason, this is the reason to see St Pete. Absolutely awsome. We were there last year and are going back with family next week.

Excellent museum but crowded and over an hour-long line to enter. The museum is very interesting if you have any interest in art. Take the audio guide to avoid getting lost in endless paintings - it explains about the most interesting ones.Be sure to buy your tickets online beforehand - we queued for 80 minutes for the tickets because we didn't do it...

Just seeing the architechture was worth the visit. The Hermitage is a wonder full of art the likes of which I have never seen before. For me it was the immense size of this complex and incredible architecture that made The Hermitage so overwhelming and exciting. It was worth the trip to St Petersburg just to see this one truly awesome museum. The incredible art collection was just the icing on the cake. I can't state strongly enough that if you loved the Louvre, the Ufizzi, the British Museum, the Metropolitan Museum of Art ...you have to see The Hermitage in St Petersberg. Too amazing for words.
Worth to see but be careful with pickpocket. Very nice and huge. Lots of things to see. Need to beware of pickpocket !!!
better to visit with a guide. the information from our guide helped us to enjoy the exhibits
Excellent. A world class museum. In top 3 of the world. Just the building took my breath away when I saw it for the first time.

Great museum. Beautiful museum with many many many fantastic rooms and works of art, definitely a must see!!
Free every first Thursday of the month.
You want to get there early as the queue can get very big.
You could spend a whole day here. Very beautiful but not enough time to really see everything.
Up there with the Louvre. Incredible building. Perhaps not as much, or as great art as the Louvre, but the building is more beautiful. A must see.

So much to see, so little time. Decide what you would like to see, otherwise you will be overwhelmed. We had a private guide who gave us advice and that helped us a lot in terms of time saved looking for the appropriate sections.

Too crowded to see, too organised to enjoy. Having looked forward to this, and having the visit as the main reason for booking a cruise visiting St Petersburg, the experience was awful. Despite going on a day when we were assured that the public would not be admitted only groups(otherwise" it would have been even more crowded"), and starting early the palace was packed. Groups from all over the world it seemed all shepherded by arm/paddle waving guides all having a strict itinerary and timetable to keep. All tourists wearing (faulty) earpieces to get the benefit(!) of the comments and explanations. Herded round to see all the "Great Treasures" with your 1 second view of the Leonardos (if you saw them at all), the "These are the Cezannes/Matisses/Gaugins come along we only have 30 seconds in this room or you wont see everything" There was nobody in the Cezanne room, a chance to see the genius of his work? No, perhaps only I in my group wanted to, the rest seemed disinterested.Up stairs, downstairs..could you go a little slower, we have someone with walking problems/unable to see clearly (Why bring them then?) Through this gallery - again, but we must now go this way to avoid the crowds, just fight your way through and don't get lost. Yes this is not just an art gallery it houses archaeological specimens too, but who is really interested in them?- you have to see the Rembrandts- well all you can see as there is another group in the way and we only have 3 minutes to do all this room and the next.Finally the only place you did not have crowds- the Gold rooms for which we paid extra, and a different guide. No you cannot just look I have memorised my speech and you have to look at things in the order I describe them. I know all 14 of you cannot see this ring at once, but you can take turns before ..now look at this one of Catherine the great 5000 brooches.I appreciate the popularity of the museum, I understand that the guides have a job to do, and I know that you have to keep to time, but both my wife and I were totally disappointed and felt the whole experience was a waste of time and money.We can see more, better, and in comfort by going online and doing the virtual tour. I felt less crowded and threatened coming out of Wembley among 80,000 than in the Hermitage. If you are an art lover/museum freak the Louvre or the British Museum show how it should be done, if you just want the "tick this place off the list of places to see" trip, then go. All in all - for me- a total disappointment
All of them. All amous artist on display and the rooms of Ermitage are fabolous as well

The most amazing museum. An absolutely huge place it is said that to look at everything it could take more than 7 years! vital to take a tour and keep hold of the map, it is easy to get lost!Visit the top floor to see incredible art collections of impressionists.Cafes on ground floor disappointing, pre packed sandwiches, paper plates etc and very busy.It would be so wrong to be in St Petersberg and not go!
Must have experience. Had a private tour at the Hermitage. Just magnificent!! The buildings and the collection are extraordinary.

An art museum and palace in one!. We had a guided tour of the Hermitage, which is so huge that it helps to focus on a few highlights (the peacock clock, Da Vinci room, for example). I was grateful to have purchased a set of postcards for the Hermitage and other sites, as I could focus more on the experience and snap a few highlights, without worrying about when crowds made a great shot challenging.

Wonderful 2-day tour. Thank you to our guide, Kira, for integrating history and daily life into our experiences so well. Hers was one of the few smiling faces we saw in St. Petersburg! It was a once-in-a-lifetime experience for us to see the palaces, cathedrals, and the Hermitage museum. Although our bus tour was large, Kira made it very enjoyable.
MUST SEE. We visited as a part of our ALLA Tour. Our guide took the 11 of us with headphones and we would not have seen anything without her!!

A Fabulous museum. Unfortunately the entrance ticket for foreign tourists costs four times as much as the fee paid by Russian citizens.But it is definitely worth it. Make sure you get there early to avoid standing in a long line, We spent a couple of hours walking around and didn’t even see half of the exhibits; it is definitely worth another visit. During winter it is a great place to get away from the cold and enjoy the artIt is on the bank of the Neva River a beautiful setting and right next to the museum is a lovely park in which to sit and have lunch.
Must-visit Museum. This museum was originally built to "copy" the "Palace of Versailles" It was spectacular. The exhibtis are amazing. If you are art lovers, you can spend days just to explore it.

Art Lovers Dream. This was an art lovers dream of a museum but even if you are not usually a lover of art museums, go here for the amazing rooms, the setting and the history. It was very busy at times and the shop and cafe were disappointing (a bit lacking in class for such a classy museum) but the experience overall was a great one and a must see in St. Petersburg.
Lives up to its impressive reputation. Ignore the crowds and enjoy the staggering collection of treasures!

Nice but crowded. As with any world class museum you'll have to fight the crowd. It's just too bad that they don't control the flow better. I understand (and can appreciate) wanting to stand for hours contemplating a work of art. . .but that kind of behavior prevents others from evening seeing the work. Come on people...show some common courtesy.
best what so ever museum. see the impressionists - and the Flamish painting as a must - but in fact all is great - sculptures, Egypt, etc...

The MUSEUM. for me better than the Louvres as art is really close to you, almost able to touch it, ( but forbidden ) really the place to go when in St Petersburg... Don't miss the Treasure rooms, and if you can the Armory ..
Fantastic Museum with an incredible depth of art. You can easily spend half a day at the Hermitage and find some of the greatest artists represented
intersting. very big need plenty of time to look around. The diamond rooms were stunning and the paintings were beautiful.

Princess cruise excursion to Hermitage museum and Winter Palace. Apparently over 6km of hallways and rooms c/b experienced according to our guide. We saw many themed rooms filled with gorgeous antiques, art work and furniture. We only had about 3 hours to spend there and took in as much as we could. Museums are not usually my cup of tea, but the incredible beauty of the Hermitage definitely held my attention. Photos were allowed in most areas. Female guards were seated in every room and were quick (almost rudely) to let you know when you were "out of line". Our Russian guide was very knowledgeable but not the most organized. Headsets were given and required because of the somewhat heavy traffic, even though we weren't there during the peak season. Walking shoes and camera are a must as there is a lot of walking, including several stairways, and many fantastic photo ops from start to fot fond of inish. Not sure about wheelchair access. If you're not capable of walking a lot, or climbing a few flights of stairs, this may not be the ideal place to visit. Otherwise, the breathtaking beauty of this tour should be seen. Fee to museum was included in total cost of the two day package tour here.

Best museum in the world. I've been there for only 4 hours and haven't seen even a 1/10 of what the museum may offer. Fantastic and fascinating rooms, carpets, paintings - all in all it makes you wanna spend there a week!!! A must see in St. Petersburg!
So much to see. take your time, soak up the architecture and design as well as the art

Treasures of the world displayed in a former palace. This was my third and best visit to the Hermitage. Why was this the best? Because we booked a guide and explained our areas of interest. We were then show magnificent works of art along with an explanation of their histories. The museum is so vast, with such varied collections that for an enjoyable visit one needs to focus. Not only is the artwork beautiful but so is the palace. I was in awe of the wealth which was needed to build all these palaces which line the waterways of St Petersburg. There are dozens. Without question, this is one of the worlds best collections. Have fun.
Once in A Lifetime Memory. The building was breathtaking; the treasures unbelievable. Oh if those walls could talk!
What a museum, amazing and huge. it is very large, the staff is surly, but we had a wonderful guide in Sergey Fedorov from "See you in St Petersburg " tours

Place a food bar in your pocket. It is tricky getting to see all the floors and locations that you want to see....we wanted to see it all and spent the whole day there and enjoyed every bit of it, but found ourselves weary near the end of the day.

State Hermitage Museum St Petersburg. We visited on the 18th May the Hermitage Museum. We booked a guide (Victoria) through TJ Travel tour Co She was very sufficient! and took as for a tour through the museumAbsolute fantastic!Our Cruise ship was 2 days in St Petersburg We took a 2 day tour, because you cannot do it on your own. Toooo much to see! We also visited Peterhof, used a hydrofoil, to spare time St Petersburg has lots of traffic!

amazing. We hired a guide upon arrival for the first couple of hours which I highly reccomend. We bought our tickets on line but it still took almost an hour to get in becuase you had to go from line to line. We spent from open to close an I could have spent longer.

Endless masterpieces. It is a must for any visit to St. Petersburg. The masterpieces in the museum are endless, one after another. One can spend the entire day or even week there. But, to be honest, it can be difficult to fully appreciate and enjoy the exhibits given the crowds. I would suggest to join a small tour group. It seems that they can schedule a time to visit the museum in advance and can enter the museum from another designated entrance. This can get around the problem of waiting with other 'walk-in' visitors in the main entrance. I am sure it will save you at least 1 hour waiting time. Also, it seems that there is no air-conditioning in the museum and it can be quite stuffy in some rooms with a lot of people. Better to have some drinking water ready and wear short-sleeves. You can also take nice pictures of the Plaza from the windows of the museum.

Very impressive collection. Very well restored with real gold. The stairway to the Winter palace was very impressive with gold and sculptures. The Hermitage houses many works of Rembrant and 2 famous works by Da Vinci. They have masterpieces by Renoir, Picasso, Rubens, and other masters. Makes the long lines worth it.

Wow. You can absolutely get lost here in the worl'd second largest gallery (The Louvre being no.1). Prebooking a voucher for tickets online can save hours queuing, but still you have to barge past some pretty unhappy locals to get your actual tickets. But it seems that is part of the "system" so don't worry. Definitely get the multi day pass, as after a couple of hours you'll be overwhelmed. It's not just the art but the rooms, the floors, the layout - it is magnificent.

Impressing Palace. Beautiful and impressing inside, in my opinion absolutely worth it to buy the ticket to see it from the inside. Do plan enough time as it is huge and closes pretty early. Negative point is that many descriptions are only in russian.

Beautiful Collection. Beautiful building with magnificent rooms, some of which will take your breath away. The rooms themselves are worth a full day visit.The collection is also stunning. Do not miss the collection of contemporary art on the upper floor...rivals other major European collections.The tour of the diamond room is only, to the best of my knowledge, each day at 12:15...plan accordingly.An extra charge of 200 roubles is assessed for taking photos...my sticker fell off my shirt early in the tour and I was never bothered when taking photos.
must see. liked the museum, didn't like the crowdsmust see the treasury
Great Place to see. Did not spend enough time. Excellent place to see.

Art, art, art. This place will take your breath away. Seriously, I became breathless when viewing the masterpieces I had only seen in books...they are all here , and I mean all. If you only have a day get a private guide who can take you to the most important rooms. Not to be missed
Hermitage. Can be overwhelming - best to reserve at least half a day and to use a guide. A personal guide will help you avoid to overcrowded ship and other tours.

Hermitage. What a treasue this place is. I wish we had more time than a few hrs. to see all the roomsWe were with a great tour guide from Finnsov Tours of Finland who lives in Russia.She actually took us to a private lunch in another room of the Hermitage facing the water for a beautiful meal after the wonderful tour of the museum.

Russian Should be Proud. I am sure there are many reviews so am not going to spend much time on this. The Hermitage is the second most important art museum in the world and an impressive piece of architecture. As an Icon and World Heritage Site it is a must to see however you may be disappointed. We where there in May but unfortunately our cruise ship arrived on the May Day weekend not a good thing. The good part is because we where on a tour we only waited half an hour ... see photo's for individual line. Basically our guide suggested it was like mid summer. The biggest piece of advice is to chose the day and time carefully! It is ashame greed takes presidents over heritage. If you could get timed tickets that meant something and perhaps charged foreign visitors a bit more and set proper capacity limits things would be much better.
Lovely, beautiful & overwhelming in size. Natayla, our tour guide, did such an amazing job of hitting the high spots and explaining the importance of the significant pieces of art.

spend two half-days and book tickets on-line!. My friend and I planned this trip for months (and you have to if you go independently - just getting the visa is a palaver!) and I booked the 2-day Hermitage ticket online. This lets you go to the front of the queue and walk right in, and you really need to save all the time you can if you want to see as much as possible. Some of the room have glass-topped table cabinets along the walls, with leather covers - be sure to lift those covers and check out the treasures within! We went in early April and the crowds weren't too bad, but just to give you an idea, the "small cloakroom" holds over 3,000 coats!
Amazng. It is hard to express the beauty of the Hermitage, the history and artwork leaves you dazed.
Unbelieveable collection. You would need a year to see the entire collection in this fantastic museum. Definitely plan for the day if you can

Amazing Hermitage. Aside from the fact that the Hermitage has one of the world's largest collection of art (they said if you spend a minute on each piece you'll need 7 years), the structure itself is a masterpiece. It is very big indeed and you will want to go as early as you can and avoid weekends in order to be able to really enjoy the place. Each room is splendid in their own sense and the amount of details on the walls and ceilings are incredible. Make sure you look up a lot as there are always intricate ornaments or tiles or paintings on the moldings and ceiling. I would even recommend bringing a small binoculars if you don't have a zoom camera just to see the details up there. Sometimes there will be large groups of tourists following guides around the place, and they always follow a certain path. A lot of times it'll be completely filled in one room and empty in the next. If you don't mind walking back and forth a little bit you might have a better chance to enjoy more in each room. The Gold Room is definitely worth a visit if you are interested in ancient and historical gems and jewelery. They only let a certain amount of people into the Gold Room each day so again, make sure you go as soon as the door opens and get your ticket.One down side for this place is there aren't a lot of chairs or benches while walking inside. So make sure you wear comfortable shoes and don't have problem walking for hours.This museum is simply incredible. It's worth the time and the crowd.

good long day. If you want to see everything in this place thoroughly you will need over 8 years :) LOL. Plan on spending all day here, wear some good support shoes. BTW, they don't allow ladies in in high pointy heels ( as it will damage the floors). you will see the world's most beautiful master pieces. This will take you a good long day to visit. You may be toooooo tired to visit and comprehend anything esle that day. there is a little cafe here, but it's a bit prices and there aren;t too many choices here. The sweets selections is impecable though:)

One of the greatest collection of art objects!. It is a fact that if you want to see every single art object in the museum just for one second, you would have to spend 8 years in here! Tician, Raphael, Rubens and Rembrandt, Matisse... you can go on and on... The only downside that there are so many people and sometimes it is really hard to have a look at some paintings..
Grateat Art Museum in the World? Maybe.... you could spend a week here but most people spend 4 hours or so. It is a palce so the rooms are a visual trat in themselves...stunning, and beyond words

What a beautiful place. We embarked on Royal Caribbean's Ship Jewel of the Seas on a fabulous Scandinavian and Russian cruise. We were in St Petersberg, Russia for 2 days and had a fabulous time, what a wonderful country. We visited The Hermitage which is in the Winter Palace. The inside of the rooms were exquisite and there were wonderful paintings and sculpures throughout. We had a great guide and she was extremely informative and made us laugh. I would recommend this shipping line and this wonderful ship too. The weather was really warm, we were expecting it to be cold but the first day we arrived it was 29 degrees, extremely unusual for this time of year. So if you ever go, check the weather forecast a couple of days before you leave or you could end up sweltering in jumpers and jeans like I did and feeling quite warm phew!

A wonderful place to see some real history!. I loved the old state rooms,i was lucky and there were not many people visiting when I went and had most of the rooms to myself! You need to allow a LOT of time to visit this fantastic building filled with old masters!

Beautiful. Don't miss.
We bought tickets online. You have to present a print-out and ID at the reception and then go to a ticket desk afterwards......
overwhelming!. we visited a whole day, but its not enough, bu' its very difficult to see whatever you want in one day...

Like seeing a picaso painting never seen before. I've been here a number of times and can't help thinking about what those communists got up too. The collection is superb, you recognise the artists but in some cases have never seen the work not even an image of it before, it's thrilling. You do need significant time for this museum, atleast one full day, preferably 2, ultimately a week, but not likely. I have not had issues with crowds, but thats a luck thing, however if you went for a tour of e.g. the gold room you do skip queues to get in. Make a stop at their shop I bought a couple of canvas prints, I wish I had bought a couple more they a lot of fun when you get home and easy to pack (unframed).

Hermitage. We only were able to spend two hours in this wonderful place, just to get a glimpse of the treasures. certainly worth a return visit perhaps when it is not so crowded. perhaps in the winter time?

Breath taking historical museum. The Hermitage Museum and Winter Palace in St Petersburg is a must see. Although it is heavily packed with tourist it is a stop that all tourist must see. One of the oldest museums in the world and by far one of the most beautiful. The colour of the building is a greenish blue trimmed with white which comes to live at night with the heavy lighting. The building sits on the Neva river . Fine interior decor depicting anything from the Russian, Italian, French, Roman, Greek, Asian, and Siberian aristocracy. The emphasis is on Peter and Catherine the Great. This magificient structure houses millions of art and artifacts including paintings, sculptures that are fascinating to view and ponder. We took 2 trips to the hermitage and still found we were rushed.Because there are so many tourist please be sure to stay with your group as it is very easy to get lost.

Truly one of the great museums of the world!. The first day we just did the French Impressionist and Post-Impressionist area on the third floor and some adjacent rooms. To be face to face with so many amazing Matisses, some of which I had never seen before, and some of which were huge as well as unbelievably beautiful, was truly an inspiration.The second day we did the Ancient World and other areas of the museum. The display is part of the charm.

If you have time to visit it all day, then its worth to see ?. Too much visitors for a one days visit . If you will stay in Petersburg longer than 3-4 days its ok but if you visit the town for 1-2 days and one day in Eremitage its too much to melt, even if you love what you see ?

Rich in historical pieces and a mind blowing maze of art.. To sum it all, it will take you 6 years to finish viewing all the collections if you were to spend 3 minutes on each piece. Some of the famous art pieces are from Michelangelo, Leonardo Da Vincci, Rembrandt and Raffaello. There are computers at the end of the gallery where you can do your research or get more information about the pieces there.

Give it an entire day... or. Avoid weekends. Closed on Mondays.If you are a student take your ID and you can obtain nice discounts to most museums.You might want to invest in a good guide book or get the audio guide available. Many items not translated.It is overwhelmingly beautiful and is a must see!
Marvelous. A truly world class museum in a beautiful setting. The buildings are a work of art in themselves. Not to be missed.

Shore Excursion tour. We enjoyed the Hermitage especially the gold room. We only had a short time to visit but luckily the crowds had subsided by late afternoon and we were able to see much of this huge Museum. We liked that much of the artwork is displayed uncovered on the palace walls.
Art lovers must go. Loved it but the tour went too fast and it was crowded, crowded. Would research better times to go

3 Hours just touched the surface. We were only able to spend 3 hours here. Just able to see the top surface of beautiful art, gorgeous rooms. Don't know how long one would need to really explore and be able to say they did all the work and exhibit justice. The long lines and crowds were a bit of a distraction. Must have been lots of cruise ships in port.
Not to be missed. Long corridors and miles of artefacts 1day not long enough.

World class museum. We went there with some friends who are not really museum fans. We were aiming at just seeing the most important parts and leave out the boring details.Well, we spent a total of 4 hours there! That's twice the amount of time I'd normally spend in the Louvre or the Prado. It's just fantastic, amazing and unbelievable!! And probably we only saw half of it?
Nice. This place is huge with tons of visitors, make sure you get a headset of have some type of headphones otherwise it is too noisy and hard to hear. Need to spend a few days vice a few hrs.
You need lots of time and good shoes. The collection is breathtaking and this is probably the mecca of art lovers
use Alla-tour as it is small and you can keep up with your guide plus we got in 1/2 hours early No jacket.. you only skim the surface. So much to see and you must keep up with the guide.
must see. not very crowded in this season a must see place inthe eveninig and also day time the museum
Very impressive. Highly recommend to get your tickets on the internet to skip the lines.
Spend lots of time here. One day is not enough. This place is huge and very impressive so spend at least 2 days here
A stunning collection of art in a spectacular setting. Room after room of paintings by famous painters, in a beautiful palace. This was the highight of a great trip.
Huge huge museum. The Hermitage is housed in 5 attached buildings starting with the Winter Palace wonderful collections of art. Viewing the Palace even without the art is well worth it

Boundless museum. It has so huge collections that you should need one month to see everything.
the ticket price is for foreigners people is 400 rubles (10 euros) but you can enter free on first thursday of the month.
Only just look at the magnificent interiors of Winter Palace well worth the ticket price.
What can I say about it? Immense.

the main attraction of St. Petersburg. The museum has more than 3 million works of art. Must see two paintings by Leonardo da Vinci Madonna Litta and Madonna Benois. In the Winter Palace should definitely visit the main staircase, Armorial Hall, Malatovuyu living room, the Military Gallery, Antechamber, Peter Hall, Nicholas Hall, the Library of Nicholas 2
Palace is awesome. The paintings etc are fantastic but the best part is the Winter Palace itself. Nice collection of French 1800 and 1900 artists.

Nice musseum. awesome collection of paintings. Need days to make a complete visit. Distribution of artists is not good. Dutch ones in best areas, but not best ones. Guards inside musseum are horrible in behaviour.

Stunning! Not to be missed. Do not miss this. It takes a good four hours to get an idea of whatbthisnplace has. Highly recommend going with a guide as otherwise it is unmanageable. Exter international offer great guides that are knowledgeable and intuitive. An absolute must see.
Fabulous. Great collection of works of art, especially main things by Matisse, Van Gogh, Picasso were fabulous.
It's Big!. Absolutely stunning collections of art that takes time to fully appreciate. I would have liked to see more of the original palace rooms though.
Hermitage Museum. What a fantastic day , lots to see at the Hermitage you definitely need 4-5 hrs and a private guide as the group guides can get too confusing
Wow!!!!!!!. One the best in the world. Two Di Vinci's, one Michalangelo, fab collection of French impressionists, and Rembrants. A beautiful building. A must see.

Miles of Art!. Take plenty of time to visit the Hermitage, and wear comfortable shoes! There is so much to see that you won't want to leave until hunger or exhaustion drives you out! The State Rooms alone are worth the entrance fee. For a small fee you can take photos without a flash, which means you can capture the things which are really special for you - I loved the collection of netsuke!

You need at least 2 days for this great museum. The tour groups are annoying, it's crowded, you will smell body odor, but this is the greatest museum I have ever been too. Rembrandt, Leonardo, Caravaggio, Matisse, Renoir, Gaugin, Van Gogh, Picasso, works from these men will be found at this amazing museum. TIP: buy your tickets in advance! We bought our tickets in advance and I knew it was well worth it when I saw the line to buy tickets.

So worth it!. It's a maze, but there are amazing things around every corner. Take some time to enjoy the architecture and decor in addition to the incredible art. They say it's the 2nd best art museum in the world.

Do you have a year to wonder around?. Stunning collection of art unsurpassed by any museum in the world. The only problem is it is gigantic. Simply impossible to take all of it in a day, week, or even a month. You MUST study in advance and learn of all available choices and then strategically go to those rooms to see the art. Any more than 2 hours will simply overload your senses and will become like that winetasting where you become unable to even discern the wines. If you are in St. Petersburg for a week, Dedicate two hours per day to see pre-selected part of this Museum. This is your best chance to get some idea of what it really is.

Make sure to come for at least 3-4 hours. It takes you several years to complete if you stand near each exibit for several seconds. That's says it all. If you come in summer queues are expected. Unless you take a general Museum tour it's worth thinking of what exactly you want to see out of the collections and look at the Museum map in advance.

What a beautiful building. The architecture is wonderful but the paint is peeling in places. The square is vast and I would imagine in summer filled with tourists and coaches ! A great place to visit, (maybe best in the Winter months)

Stunning surroundings and beautiful collection. The Hermitage museum and winter palace are a must do in St Petersburg. Richly decorated you feel like you get a taster of what the palace would have looked liked under Tsarist times.The collection of paintings is impressive and well displayed too. However, like any popular attractions as this one, be sure to arrive early and to start viewing the most popular collections first to avoid observing some of Gaugin's most beautiful work with 20 school kids and lots of tourists snapping away rather than taking in the beautiful work in front of them!
Fabulous. Beauty as far as your eyes can see. Feast for the eyes, perhaps a bit too much to take in even.

A must in St. Petersburg. Love the Hermitage! One of the best museums in the world, and I've seen plenty. It has an impressive collection and the interior is fine art in and of itself. The "newer" part of the museum isn't so nice, although but you'll find Picasso there. We used a ticket kiosk instead of standing in line. You'll have to check in your coat. There are "gift shops" throughout the museum. Pay attention to the map so you know where you've been and where you need to go. I like Ancient Near East history so I spent a lot of time in that section, but there is enough variety at the Hermitage for any fan of history and/or art.

One of the world's great museums. Everything I could write about this museum has probably already been written so I'll keep it short.if you are in St Petersburg you would be a fool to miss this... This museum contains some of the greatest works of art and treasures from around the globe and truly is one of the world's great museums. Just make sure you allow yourself enough time to explore as it is huge!
Hermitage is fantastic everyone should go. We liked everything it all so over the top so much gold
Art and History. Very many corridors, very many paintings, but the original state rooms are awesome

Fuifill my wishes. Its a comprehensive museum of different periods that took 3 hours to visit. I liked the greek and egyptian sector. There are a lot of statues and a mummy too.You better get a guide.
Impressionists anyone?. A bit rundown, massive museum...easy to get lost The reason for going to st Pete. Guigan collection best I've ever seen and I've seen them all.
a must visit. this place is amazing, don't miss seeing it. The decor is breathtaking a real eye opener for me
Simply amazing. The building itself is spectacular. So much so that it's almost hard to concentrate on the wonderful works of art!

One of the best museums in the world. I've been to a lot of museums and this one is pretty amazing ... as others have mentioned, like Versailles, the British Museum and the Louvre all rolled into one.Suggestions:If you can afford two days - buy the two day pass.Buy your ticket on the Internet in advance - it also includes the extra fee for taking photos.Get in line early (before opening time) and have the printout of your Internet ticket in-hand ... they will pull you out of line and send you to a different ticket window (or the info desk)There are two optional tours (gold room / treasure room) and maybe only one in English each day - have to be early to book these (only like 15 people on a tour)We studied the floor plan for about a half-hour to understand how to get around ... once mastered no problems ... but if you have a hard time with directions you may want to consider a guided tourOnce inside the ticketed area we were solicited twice by licensed guides - one also wanted to offer us a 4-hour 10,000 ruble city tour (ouch!) ... maybe best consulting with your hotel or on TA forums for guide arrangements if desired

St Petersburg and the Hermitage. Another reviewer said "If you visit St Petersburg, you have to visit this place." I feel even more strongly--the Hermitage alone is a sufficient draw to go to St. Petersburg. I have been to the Louvre, Prado, Musee d'Orsay, Vatican et al and the Hermitage at least equals and in some respects outshines them all. The Hermitage is just one of the many awesome sites available in St. Petersburg and the surrounding area. I was also struck by some of the "Onion domed" churches in the city and by the architecture and history of Navy Yard from the old Soviet days.If you are going on a cruise make sure they schedule at least a 2 day port stop or you will be shortchanging yourself.

Hermitage and Winter Palace. A once in a lifetime experience. We spent the whole day; first of allgoing through the palace rooms and then the section of the museum having Russian artists around the Impressionist period
Lifetime Must See. History and an incredible art collection in one place! We went back a second day before leaving the city.
Must see. If you visit St Petersburg, you have to visit this place. Very fine architecture and decorations all around this mighty palace.
Very informative. Guide was excellent. Did not have enough time to visit all the museum

Wonderful once you have survived the queues. The 19th and 20th century paintings- the State Rooms.We had pre booked tickets which is worth doing- you have to remove coats (it is warm inside) and queue to put them in the cloakroom which is free but our queuing is different to that of the Russians

astonishing, the best palace in europe. it's impossible to describe the beauty of the palace and of the art inside it. you will need a guide to understand the key things but it's worth the money. go early in the morning and visit all the italian section it's the best. also take a look to the stairs where the red guard began the insurrection. after the visit take a moment to relax on the square or along the neva

I was blown away. This was the highlight of my St. Petersburg visit. It is hard for words to describe this palace. Majestic, overwhelming, incredibly beautiful, and more. In a country with lots to impress, this was near the top. Do not miss it if you are in the area. If it is optional on your tour, go for it.
Great collection. A great collection: we spend 5 days in the museum, 4 hours each day and didn't see the whole collection! Okay bars to have a tea or coffee and a cake
The Hermitage. many many exhibits Some rooms of the Winter Palace laid out as original. route around arranged by Ikea though, hard to just see one part and stop when you want.
Must do. Why are you even in St Peters if you dont go there. Beautiful outside, impressive inside. Different collections and styles for any taste. For a very quick stroll, 3 hours min.

FANTASTIC...with a caveat!. Dear Gift Shop Clerk,It was only a $3 rip off, but I fell for it, didn't I. Yes, I'm a stupid American who can still be confused by Russian coins even after living here for several months, especially when I've been on my feet walking through a magnificent museum for seven hours. Next time I'll be sure to count my change, even when given to me by such a lovely Russian girl with a big smile. Just call me sucker, but, nonetheless, I'll be sure to pass on a warning to as many other tourists as possible.Yours truly.
Overwhelming. Breathtaking collection, breathtaking reflection of the age of empires.

SO much to marvel at.. If you go in April, the queues are minimal. I booked online but didn't really need to because the first Thursday of the month is free and the queue was tiny. My sixteen year old daughter is free anytime, so fantastic value.I don't like audio guides but this museum is one of the most confusing I have ever experienced and if you want to see the big attractions - the Leonardos, Gainsborough, the Picassos, French Impressionists, without walking many miles, it's probably a good move. We took two days and wandered the first time and were methodical the second.The museum cafes are dire. They manage to make the most delicious looking chocolate gateau and cheese and ham panini taste of absolutely nothing!
Unmissable if you enjoy painting and sculpture. You just keep going WOW. And kids under 17 and all students get free entry. Book online before going to avoid queuing.
So beautiful. I have been there many times over the years and every time I am overwhelmed by the fact that so many beautiful things have been collected to these enormous beautiful buildings.
BreathTaking. And I am not that "artsy". But combination of buildings itself and art is/must be top 3(if not top1) in the world (and I have been to places like Louvre, Versaiiles, Van Gogh, MoMa etc)

amazing!. What an incredible place. Most people will not have the time needed to really do justice to the collection. A few tips on what not to miss: the Russian collection of folk art is easy to overlook given all of the famous artwork, but it is very impressive. Also the "trophy art" that Russia took from Germany during WWII in Rooms 143-46 (which was not marked on our map of the museum) is not to be missed. I think the overall quality of the French Impressionists in this collection is better than that of the main collection. Finally, given that it is physically impossible to even walk through all of the galleries in one day, you should make sure you at least see most of the amazing rooms of the palace (these are marked on the gallery map).Also, you should make sure to get your ticket voucher ahead of time on-line. It will save you a couple-hour wait in line. Get your voucher and then show it to the guard at the front of the line. There will be a second line inside. Go to the front of this line as well and they will show you inside to ticket counter 5 where you will get your actual ticket. This sounds a bit odd, but it is definitely the way to go. Here is the link:http://www.hermitageshop.org/page.php?pagename=ticketssincerely,David C.
Good visit. Had some great well known pieces. Huge place. Lots of stairs.
Awe-inspiring!. It took us three full days to completely take in the place and really see everything there. An experience I hold truly close to my heart...
Great Museum. Too bad some of the works are actually fake...or so rumor has it

6 hours!. The Winter Palace is really interesting with the royal state rooms. I kind of wish we had rented the audioguides for this part. Do the Winter Palace section first, then you can wander at will and at great length through the Hermitage "art" part. While trying to find our way out (yep, we got lost!) we discovered really interesting things (mummies, Siberian tombs, etc) on the lowest level where there were no other tourists and they were weird and amazing things!Any student gets in for FREE which is a great savings. My 16 year old son used his Rochester High School student i.d. card (from his high school in the USA) and received the discount.I think in retrospect I would get the audioguide at least for viewing the state rooms in the winter palace.
awesome!. Just amazing! To avoid the long queue there is a cash only machine inside but note it doesn't give change.
unforgettable. What can I say you have to see it, it is undescribable

Beautiful place. We're in Saint Petersburg one week and we're guided there by Natali. I booked a tour by Mariya -lion's tour(info@visit-stpetersburg.com). We’d a walking tour and visited all famous places. incredible view opens from a colonnade of St. Isaac's Cathedral. Everything seems so small and yet grandiose....so other information's in my blog.

Great but not comparable to the Louvre. A must visit in St. Petersburg, Admiraltyskaya is the closest station. It is always very crowded so its best to but tickets online. Language is a barrier so be prepared so spend a fair amount of time figuring asking for help.What is great is that there are "friends of the hermitage" in every room - pre plan what you want to see and ask the "friends" on how to go to a room of your interest carrying a map which you can pick at the entrance.The cloak room staff is the most unhelpful in all of Russia.
the Hermitage. Unbelievable!! The art was wonderful and the palace itself even more so!
Fantastic museum. Building it self is extremly beautiful and tree floor takes at least two tree days to see something, take time and camera with You

Choose what you want to see!. We chose the art works which we wanted to see, quite close to each other. Watching the royal rooms on the middle of the visit made it more easy.If possible, by the tickets in advance, so you can avoid the queue.

Huge collection of painting. The Hermitage is a huge Museum consisting of some 5 buildings. There are over 1000 rooms and so many pieces of art that it would take forever to see them all. Therefore, I'd suggest that you decide earlier what you want to see because when you go there you might get lost. Walking for hours can become boring, so it is useful to have a guide who will let you see the most interesting areas in the shortest time.The rooms are very crowded and although I have not experienced any problem, I was repeatedly told to watch out for pickpockets.Chairs to your use to sit are not very many. Be ready to walk a lot before finding a chair. In the painting area, it is not allowed to drink.There is a "post office" inside the museum from where you can buy stamps and postcards as well as send the postcards.Student entered for free while adult have to pay some 10€.
Experience of a Lifetime. Spending time in the Hermitage should be on everyone's bucket list. One afternoon there only touched the surface. I will definately return.
Unbelievable museum/art gallary/palace. Unbelievable museum/art gallary/palace. Watch Russian Ark before you go.
Do never miss this !. this is a fantastic place, you cannot miss it and really you spend a good time there

Dont miss Hermitage. One of the best places worldwide.
Try to buy a ticket on line. You might have to wait for hours to buy a ticket.
Visit the diamond room. You have to buy a ticket in advance and wait for specific tour time but it is worth it.
wow. Take a tour guide, prepare to be mesmerized for hours. If you spend time reviewing every piece, they say it will take 7 years to finish what is the largest art museum in the world
Amazing!. It's always crowed but it's worth it!! It will be better if you have a museum guide so you can understand everything better!!

Beautiful palace and wonderfull colection. The most famous Romanoff's palace located in St Petersburg near downton ( there is a new metro station in a walking distance). One day is not enough to visit the complex of three palaces. The main ticket give access to the palace and the art collection. There are two separated expositions: russian treasure, romanoff's jewels! Etc that woth the visist. The art collection is large and include Leonardo da Vinci, Remabrandt, Rafael, a vast french, italian, european collection. One day is not enough, but I had only four hours. I took a private guide (there were a plenty of them- they will talk to you, specially in winter days because of less tourists) and in fibe hours I was able to see the most important parts and the treasury.
Outstanding. The art and museum pieces were some of the best found anywhere in the world
Gorgeous!. If you are in Saint-Petersburg you MUST visit it! One of the best museums of the world.

It lives up to its reputation. Expect to spend at least four hours here. We ordered our tickets on-line and then saw why they recommend visitors to do so [queues]. We had no guide but the Museum do at certain times and would possibly be worth it particularly if you speak English only. Otherwise the audio guide would be better than nothing if you have the time. I suggest you start with the 'Russian' rooms first. In summer I would go there early to avoid the crowds.
A must do. Put it on the bucket list - just an amazing visit - mind blowing in scale.,...give yourself a full day - take your time - cultural overload maybe but so worthwhile. Enjoy!

Incredible...what else is there to say. This is an incredible institution and unique in every sense of the word. The only thing that it is missing is a contemporary wing, which I was told is being build and the Hermitage is starting a modern collection, so that is why I went to Erarta afterwards. Either way the Hermitage deserves every great review that it gets. However, you need to spend at least a week there in order to cover everything.

A must see. To see this museum properly you would need alot longer than we had time for. I was interested in the Art and got to see what I wanted too. I found the staff very helpful as without a guide you can get lost easly. The restaurants were lacking and such a beautiful place should have a good restaurant

Overwhelming. The display of art is amazing and hence the excellent rating. Unfortunately some works are poorly lit and poorly identified. The facilities to eat are very poorl and considering that most people spend a whole day there they need to consider this. Buy a two day ticket if you can as it is good value and do it over the Internet before you travel, this means you skip the large queues by going to the information desk where one of the staff get you your tickets. The queues to get in are really long.
Fabulous beyond belief. So much to see and do - cant possibly list everthing - wear very comfortable shoes
Dont miss this. Give yourself 2 days to see this gigantic and fantastic museum, art gallery , collection of some of histories greatest moments

Superb, world-class. The crowds could be overwhelming, so aim for as early as possible before the tours and groups get in. Do not forget to pay for the camera sticker, otherwise you won't be able to photograph the rooms, which are pieces of art by themselves. It is definitely the highlight of your visit to the city, and you want to spend there as much time as possible - to see the Dutch and the Brits, the French are too kitchy, but van Dykes, Rembrandts and ter Borchs will take your breath away. A MUST!

How many years have you got?. Icons galore and an impressionist and post-impressionist wing make a first visit rich beyond compare. You would need more than a few visits to make a dent in the collection.

Size matters, but this is too much. Spent a day and half here with a private guide, back in July 2010. Got in easily, with advance tickets, but woe betide the tourist who tries to buy same-day tickets! I love art, and the Hermitage Palace is exqusite. But there is such a thing as oversized, and this is the epitome of it all. Still, worth a visit as a must-see in Petersburg. The Russian Museum is far more satisfying and is close by.

practical info. how amazing is hermitage know everybody, and hope everybody find "Peacock clock". Good to know so best time for see them is every wednesday, 1 a.m. this time to start "the clock show"I would like recommend also guided tour to Treasure Gallery. Must see! 300 RUB ticket P/P,It is ticket only to Gallery, needed also entry ticket to Hermitage (100 RUB for russian and 400 RUB for other countries citizens). Booking advance necessary!

Outstanding: Guide or Recording Essential for 1st Visit. An Outstanding & somewhat overwhelming museum. Because the Rooms have historic significance as well as the art, get a guide or recording for your 1st visit. If you try to do it only with a guidebook, you will end up seeing only 10 - 15 rooms. Get an overview first & then return.

To rival the Vatican. Incredible buildings, the rooms were lavish and the art amazing. During February the place was not very busy and it was easy to see everything we waned. Rivals the Vatican in terms of opulence and splendor.
Fasinating place. Lots of history and beautiful architecture. Not very long queues and the square is great with all the diffierent entertainment.
Huge museum. little disorientating to find your way around, ideally you need a full day to take it all in, week days are best to go to avoid queues, closed on a monday
Huge museum. Make sure you take a break because this museum is massive. Also, make sure to go in the morning to bypass the afternoon crowds.

Quality & Quantity of exhibits. The displaying of numerous exhibits was remarkable, One whole room with "Impressionist" paintings. The decor of the rooms and the stair cases, with gold leaf and natural wood trimming was outstanding,we would have liked to have spent a week in the Hermitage alone !!

If you buy a guided tour you do not have to wait in line.... With your face to the entrance on the right side there is a small building and cafe/ There you can buy the tickets to group guided tour (in Russian????). You don't have to present at the excursion. Just enter with the group, not wating in the line...It will be more expensive however.

Not to be missed at all costs. There are no words to describe this place. We took the two-days ticket and we felt that a five-days ticket would have not be enough.The collections are amazing and your main concern is not to miss out on something important. It is a defining experience. On top of it, we were there in winter, so we did not have to negotiate our personal space with the summer crowds. This made our visit especially magic. My advice is to brave the Russian winter and go there off season. You would not regret it!
Hermitage is a must to see. One of the richest Art museums in the world. The richest collection of French impressionists.
Beautiful. Hours and hours could be lost wandering about this place there is so much to see.

No words to describe. Amazing. So many excellent artworks and exhibits.
Tip : Buy your tickets online, print out the receipt and go pick up your tickets at the office. This way, need not quene too long.
Huge Collection. Awesome.. 1 day is definetely not enoug to visit, millions of pieces to see.

State Hermitage Museum. A brilliant, beautiful building, I have never been in a Museum quite like this one.  Unfortunately the one day we had to visit was not enough to explore all the museum has to offer
Enormous, filled with interesting things. Very impresive building, crying out its luxury and splendor, filled with exhibits worth seeing.
Amazing. My second trip to the wonderful city. The first time i wandered around the museum in a daze by myself. I then hired a guide on return visits and had a much better time.
Hermitage. Loved the art. Impossible to navigate without a guide
Stunning, very visitor-friendly. What is there to dislike in such a wonderful palace/art gallery/furniture display - you name it, they've got it!

Must See. The place is so overly extravagant that no wonder there was a revolution ! There are an incredible amount of treasures but sadly not well protected. The place is not climate controlled and everything is just exposed to the heat, light and moisture; especially the collection of priceless paintings. It will be a shame and a huge loss to not just Russia, but the world as well to see them deteriorate; better hurry up to see them.
a must go see. The place is massive and you could spend days there. We enjoyed a few hours wandering around. try to avoid the weekend and miss the queues
A "MUST" on trip!. Unbelievable information about Russia, the country, and people.
A mixture of Le Louvre & Versailles. The most beuatifull museum in the world. Never seen so many painting from so many know painter all before 1916. Impressive collection and the Palace is a Beauty
Great place. It is very stunning palace, you hardly find something like this anywhere else.

wonderland. If you are a history, or museum, fiend then there is no finer place to visit that this wonderful toy box filled with untold treasures, history and amazement.
Do not do the sprint tour but savor the magnificence of the art, the statues, the rooms themselves and live the drama, magnificence and splendor. I promise you will not be disappointed
Two and a half million items.. An enormous building, with so much to see. Give yourself plenty of time to view.

History, history and history!. The Winter Palace is a palace that makes you dream..... Russia is a country with so much history.... I was there when the country still was in the hands of the communists. Back then it was like stepping back in time. A lot must have changed.....

Second only to the Louvre!. It is a great museum, covering art from so many periods and with such quality that it is only beaten by the Louvre ! Many temporary exhibitions ( where pictures are not allowed ) all over the building, sometimes replacing the permanent collection. I have the impression they change the paintings from place to place overtime ( or lend without note ) , my guidebook recommended a Caravagio and a Picasso that I was not able to find :( The cafeterias are good and reasonably priced.
Just beautiful. This is in a beautiful setting, with thousands of works of art and in exquisite detail

Winter. The opposite of Stockholm: visit St. Petersburg in winter only, study Russian, get a students card and spend every free minute at the Hermitage and Marinsky theater...and, as always, fall in love
one of a kind!. must see.. allow enough time and hole for less tourists (like you) organized around.

One of the greatest museum in the world. It's all about all ways of history and art and developing of art. It's one of few places St. Petersburg is worldwide famous. You haven't been in St. Petersburg, if you haven't visited the royal Palace.

4 Hours needed. Top Floor = Musée du Louvre
Middle Floor = Château de Versailles
Bottom Floor = British Museum
4 Hours needed
Pre book tickets
Get there when it opens

Go in February to avoid the crowds!. Visit of a lifetime for art lovers. Saw many world-famous paintings. Newer paintings (including Kandinsky) poorly displayed. Coats not allowed to be worn in gallery, so make sure you have enough clothes under coat (excellent, free cloakroom). Very simple but well-priced cafe. Wear good shoes (it is HUGE). We allowed 2 days here, and still ran out of time! Do it!
February 2012. Quality of the art and palace in general are amazing. It can be a bit difficult to navigate and we lost time trying to find rooms that were temporarily closed.

A fascinating yet frustrating place. The Hermitage is an incredible place with too much to see, no matter how much time you have available. Every room has so many items of interest and the outside facade is simply breathtaking. The only problem with the exhibits is finding them! Whilst the website appears very comprehensive it doesn't tell you the main thing you want to know- where to find any particular painting/statue or whatever. The signing inside the Museum is equally confusing, we spent a considerable amount of time trying to find the way to the third floor- not easy! Despite having done a lot of research before we visited it wasn't until we had been in the museum for some time that we understood how to see the Winter Palace rooms relative to the art and other sections (they're interspersed with one another but a bit here and a bit there.) But once having found our way around (ideally the first days visit of two minimum) it was very enjoyable.

Overwhelmingly Beautiful. The Winter Palace was an opulence overdose! It's very large and oozing with luxury. If possible, it would be nice to see it in more than one visit. The rooms were ornately decorated, the art work stunning. The Treasure rooms are worth seeing, but timing is everything. I arrived too late for the Jewels, but was able to see the Gold room. It was amazing and very informative, especially because I had an English guide to explain all the details!
Mind Blowing. Absolutely stunning museum. i think you would need at least 2 days to do it all. We arrived before it opened to get in early but it was well worth queuing in -26C for 10 minutes.
What a spectacular collection. I wish I had a week to see it all. Although I was there many years ago, it seems like it was yesterday, Everyone should see it at least once.
a wonder of the world. SPent two full days here, if that gives you an idea. The art is mind boggling, the palace as well. The café is very average, too bad

Amazing building and Art Collection. The buildings are so beautiful ,they are an attraction themselves. The museum is amazing and the closest comparsion would be the Lourve in Paris.I would highly recommend having a guide. Our guide was an Art Historian and bought all the displays to life for my husband and three children under 12.
Immaculately restored. The palace has been impressively restored and will be heaven for art lovers with its exquisite, but vast, collection
Excellent. Every thing was right, especially if you like museums

Only a fool wouldn't visit the hermitage when in SPB.... The building is stunning, the artworks it contains is also stunning. Even if you're not a museum fan you really need to visit this because it's probably one of worlds most impressive art collections. It doesn't just tell you contain the history of Russia but also most of Europe.
P.S. It is free on the first Thursday of every month!

Truly Amazing!. A beuatiful building housing seemingly endless collections within the museum. The ticket office worker was a little surly (even more so that your typical Russian!), but it was well worth a visit and comes highly recommended. The European art collection was magnificent.

Impression : Love it and so interesting. It is a fantastic museum but would take months to be able to see everything properly but a minimum of 3hours for the visit is necessary and an audio guide recommended as nothing is written in any other language than russian
Must see. Unbeliveable history, art work, a visit to the Gold Room worth while at the Hermitage Museum.
Great place to vist. loved this attraction , you will never have enough time to see it all , it gives you a glimpse into regal life of the Russian nobles

Wonderful building and gallery. The building is enormous and the information leaflet is not very helpful Very easy to get lost but wonderful rooms and wonderful art. Winter is definitely a good time to go because there are no crowds.
Stunning. This is one place not to be missed, but allow enough time and if visiting in the summer be prepared for long queues - not a problem for us in Dec !
Wonderful, apart from the queuing!. Just fabulous. Shame about all the queuing though! Definitely book tickets in advance, although that might not even help!
An outstanding museum. This is one of the great museums of the world. The Amber room was fascinating.
You can't miss it. Paintings are incredible. There are Nice coffee shows inside to have a rest. Outside is great for roller skating!

Endless. I am not a museum person, but i loved the architecture, the floors, doors,windows and woodwork.We spent the better part of three hours walking through the different rooms and i am sure we saw maybe 10% of what they offer(over 1000 rooms) A must see , i wished i appreciated it more.
The most beautifully city. Beaty, variety of the restrunts, porcelain, souvenis

Too much to see, worthwhile to have a guide or advance tickets. Lines to get into the Hermitage were very long, comparable to the Louvre. It is worthwhile to go with a tour group or private guide to be able to use the group entrance, which is a significantly shorter wait and expedited entry process. This is one of the world's great museums, not to be missed. Allow yourself at least half a day. You'll be glad you gave yourself the time.
Must see. It is one of the most valuable places in Russia. Be prepared for the long queues in front of the entrance.

Impressive Collection. As one of the world's greatest collections of art, you can't skip this museum in the heart of St Petersburg. The museum and palace are so huge, a guide is suggested so you can view the highlights. With a guide we only needed a few hours to view state rooms, some of the main sights, and specific collections (the Matisse collection is impressive).
OMG unbelievable!!!. Wished I had had a week to spend there, its the Louve, Prado, National British Museum, all rolled into one.

The best royal palace I have ever seen. A part from the external beauty of this palace, wonderful rooms contain one of the biggest museums ever. Every single rooms is decorated in a different way than the previous one.

Incredible wealth & wonderful art. It is no wonder there was a revolution! Buckingham Palace fades in comparison. Go as a small group & you get to have more of a say as to which rooms to get to view. With just 4 we were able to move around quite easily. The depth of different fantastic art works is absolutely amazing; Rembrandt, Picasso to Impressionists. You could spend several days here; allow at least half a day.
A Must See. The ediface itself, of course, is not to be missed. For art lovers, the collection of expressionism contains artworks never seen before, whether in exhibits or reproductions.

Holy wow - what a place. OK. Keep in mind that this place is one of the most magnificent buildings on the planet. Book your ticket ahead if possible. Get up early. Queue early. (I only had three hours sleep and we were still up queuing an hour and a half befor opening). Don't worry - it's worth it! We booked a guide and he gave us a half day whirlwind tour through the place. He picked out the most interesting works, and guestured towards the ones we should see if we came back later.... We left for lunch and came back after for our self guided tour and a compeltely different expereince. At least e knew where we were going. The palace is so big that it's like a city. Just don't miss it... Even if you don't like looking at art - you can look at the roof/walls/floor instead and be equally as mesmerised!

Brilliant - but beware the long queues in the first week of January; book tickets online!. Absolutely brilliant collection, especially if you are into Impressionism. The interior of the Palace is as much of an attraction as their collections. The only thing I would caution is that in the first week of January, especially, lots of people are on holidays and so the queues are agonising - we stood in line for over 2 hrs at -2C... Part of the problem is that they let people in in batches, as people leave the museum, and tour groups are always given priority so when there are a lot of tour groups arriving the line doesn't move at all...really, really frustrating. You can, though, book tickets online for a little more than they cost at the ticket counter and this guarantees you immediate entry so I would definitely recommend this to everyone!

best art museum. Hermitage is one of the most famous museums and probably the best one in the world. It's unbelievably large. It's just impossible to see all its permanent collections even if you spend there several days.

The most superb museum in the world!!. I have been to this museum just twice, once in 1969, when I fell in love with it and again in 2004 when I had the opportunity to go back there. It is enchanting, and the superb architecture, porcelain, art and sculptures and ambience leave me breathless. I do not need to say any more. My memories of the malachite room from 1969 have never left me and the gold room, blue room and the overall sumptiousness of the place are no one on my list of places to go in the world. PottyaboutParis Sydney.
Huge and amazing museum. The opulence of the rooms, the history of the place and the art was incredible.
Rivals anything else in Europe. One of the most breathtakingly beautiful museums I have ever seen. The interior architecture, decor, and of course, artwork are truly a marvel.

Fabulous, but a disappointment. Since I was a teenager and saw an article in the National Geographic I wanted to see the Hermitage. The world's largest museum collection started by Catherine the Great and housed in the Winter Palaces in St. Petersburg, Russia. If you are part of a group you will probably have a different experience from mine. As a non-grouper, I found the overall experience to be a disappointment. I am not sorry that I went but it did not meet my four decades of building expectation. START with the ticket line. Huge. Unruly, confusing, people breaking in and out. At the other end of the line is a man with a cigarette dangling from his lips supervising the "ticket machine." Now the ticket machine looks like an ATM and delivers one ticket at a time but only if you enter exact amounts of rubles. It won't make change. That's why the man is there--to feed the correct bills to the machine. If you want entry that is one price; if you want to take photos, that is a separate ticket. Not cheap at R600 for entry and photos. Main cost: an hour or more standing in line on hard concrete floors outside. ENTER. Try to find a map of the complex of three adjoining buildings each with three floors. The guards and docents of course do not speak English so you can't ask directions. A labyrinth stairways and you get to guess which floor will allow access to the next building. DODGE the mobs of tour groups led by a lady with a colored flag or umbrella. A group will fill an entire corridor or exhibit space. Heaven help you if you try to break through the tour group. They will not let you through. I think that they are terrified of getting separated. Elbows can be lethal weapons when attached to the body of a small Asian lady, especially one with an umbrella. Don't expect to stand long in front of a particular painting or sculpture. You will be mowed over by the waves of contiguous tour groups.  I enjoyed the food bar and the food was pretty good. The museum shop was good too. There was a splendid exhibit on early Hittite life, completely unexpected, and there were no tour groups in this esoteric part of the museum. You cannot do justice to the collection in a day. Two would be closer if you could afford it and if you tolerate the tour groups. The palaces took 36 rounds of artillery during WW II but have been beautifully restored to a jaw-dropping opulence of gilt, mirror, parquet flooring and sumptuous color. I believe there was a lot there; I just could not see it.

A wonderful building with beautiful exhibits. Just "go with the flow" as the museum can be extremely busy @ peak holiday times. Take in the rooms & buy books etc. from the shop @ the end, extremely reasonably.
Where does one start!. Brilliant - way beyond any of my expectations - this is a MUST DO.

One of the Best Museums I've been to. I went in around 11am and stayed until around 5pm. The Palace itself is magnificent and the art work is equally impressive, it almost takes two circuits of the palace to appreciate both!

One of the leading museums in the world. This is the Louvre of Russia and must be seen. It is best seen "off season" as when we were there - there were more securitiy than visitors - we often had rooms to ourselves believe it or not - itwas like a private tour of the Hermitage. I cannot begin to describe it, less than 5% of what they own is on view, one can only imagine the rest of what they have as what is on view is breath-taking. This is a must-stop and must-see on any visit to St Petersburg.

Outstanding, Well-Maintained Museum. My husband and I visited here between Christmas and New Years. Opens at 10:30 am. We came by subway; the closest stop is about 6 blocks away. Admission was 350 rubles, an audio guide was 350 rubles, and the fee to use a camera was 300 rubles. There were also tour guides near the foyer who offered (for a fee) to give you a personal tour in your language.From the square in front, you have to go through the large center archway and walk through the courtyard to the back to enter. After paying your entrance fee, you go up a short flight of stairs and then it gets a bit confusing. In that foyer (behind you to your right) you can rent audio guides, go left and take the flight of stairs to go up to the next floor, or turn right and begin your tour on the first floor. You are required to put your coat and backpack in the cloakroom.There are "old lady guards" in every room to make sure you don't touch anything. The pieces are nicely arranged. Each piece has plenty of space so that it can be admired properly. There are some exquisite pieces in sculpture, painting and furniture, especially the huge vases and ancient urns. You can see the collection online at www.hermitagemuseum.org. The building itself has been well-maintained and is quite clean, as is the grounds.Tip: To avoid large crowds, especially if you go first thing in the morning, go to the furthest point in the museum you want to visit and work your way to the front.

Buy the 2 days ticket!. I bought my 2 days ticket online and printed my voucher at home. When I got to the Hermitage I didn't need to stay in the line, just changed my voucher for the tickets and a map. This ticket is priced in US dollars (25.95) and includes permission to take photos without flash, in the exhibitions where photos are allowed. The tip to not be bothered all the time by the museum's staff is keep the ticket in your hand while take the photos. As they charge visitors for taking pictures, we have to show that the ticket we bought give us the right to do that. This works in every museum of St. Petersburg. And other important thing: wear good shoes in late winter to walk in front of Hermitage, because the floor of the Palace Square is slippery with ice.I used a pen to mark the rooms I had visited in the museum map. It was usefull because the stairs are not continuous (you can go from first to second floor, but to go to the third floor you have to take another staircase, something like that) and as the museum is really huge, it is easy to get lost, and I didn’t have time to get lost! I stayed the first day in the main complex, from 10:30 AM to 6 PM. I ate quickly in a cafe inside the museum to have time and strength to finish this part in one day. I did it, but it was winter and the museum wasn’t crowded. I don’t know if it is possible during summer vacations.The next day I went to the Porcelain Museum on Prospekt Obukhovskoy Oborony, to the to the Winter Palace of Peter the Great, and to the Menshikov Palace. Except for the Porcelain Museum, all the others are located next to the main building. The Porcelain Museum can be reached by metro (Lomonosovskaya station). I liked the Porcelain Museum very much, the Menshikov Palace was interesting and the Peter the Great Palace was so-so.

be selective. the free plan to the complex seems to be upsidedown - staff would always turn it round when we asked for directions. It's quite hard to get your bearings. There is so much to see it's advisable to know which period/country/artists you want to see beforehand. You'll see so much else finding your way to your chosen rooms that you can easily make good use of a 2 day ticket (bought in advance online). There are 3 cafe areas close to the central staircase which helps position you on the plan and are good places to rest and meet up. Loved the old winter palace (separate entrance on the river side) with recreated rooms and Siberian exhibits, some over 2000 years old.

Mindblowing!. It is definitely one of the best museums in the world with great selections of diverse art styles, geographic locations, and historic eras. Its collection is so large (over 3,000,000 works of art) that it would take a looong time to view it in its entirety. The building is big and there are interesting things everywhere. Check the map of the museum before your visit and select the rooms/exhibitions that you definitely want to see. One full day or two visits of half a day are necessary to appreciate what you see because the experience is overwhelming!My personal favourites:On the ground-floor: antiquities from Siberia (unusual exhibits from primitive tribes, including a rock with ancient engravings)On the first floor, the impressive palace interiors (state rooms) and the beautiful Greek-Roman style sculptures.On the second floor, the French art of 19-20th century (incl. Picasso, Matisse, Gauguin, Monet etc.) and the European art of the 19-20th century (especially some paintings by Kandinsky).This museum is often compared to the Louvre in Paris due to its size and quality and even though I adore the Louvre, I preferred the Hermitage in St. Petersburg for several reasons (very good presentation, art work titles/explanations in English in most cases, the museum building itself, and representation of more contemporary art works). Make your choices and enjoy!
Excellent. It is very stunning palace. Every room is decorated differently. It is huge and magnificent! It is a must place to see and can't be missed!!!
